text: Bulbasaur resembles a small amphibian/frog, but it bears three claws on each of its feet and has no tail
name: Bulbasaur

text: It also has large, red eyes and small, sharp teeth
name: Bulbasaur

text: Its skin is a light, turquoise color with dark, green spots
name: Bulbasaur

text: It has three claws on all four of its legs
name: Bulbasaur

text: Its most notable feature, however, is the aforementioned bulb on its back, which according to its entry in the Pokédex, was planted there at birth
name: Bulbasaur

text: A Bulbasaur often rests in bright places so its bulb can absorb sunlight
name: Bulbasaur

text: It can be seen napping in bright sunlight
name: Bulbasaur

text: While it sleeps, the seed on its back catches the rays and uses the energy to grow
name: Bulbasaur

text: In the wild, Bulbasaur tend to be very rare, as they are shy creatures that prefer the company of their own kind
name: Bulbasaur

text: However, they are also generally very docile, tame, and loyal to people that they trust, and for that reason are one of the species of Pokémon available for starting trainers to choose in the region of Kanto
name: Bulbasaur

text: Each Bulbasaur has a bulb on its back that grows steadily larger as it matures
name: Bulbasaur

text: This bulb contains a seed which uses photosynthesis to supply Bulbasaur with energy
name: Bulbasaur

text: Its bulb is also used to store the energy that the seed absorbs, which can be used when it is necessary
name: Bulbasaur

text: It is assumed that when a Bulbasaur collects enough energy in its bulb, it will evolve into an Ivysaur
name: Bulbasaur

text: The plants are able to become mobile by virtue of their active hosts, allowing them to move out of shaded areas and thus benefiting them as well
name: Bulbasaur

text: Bulbasaur evolves into Ivysaur starting at level 16, and into Venusaur at level 32
name: Bulbasaur

text: Bulbasaur is a small, quadrupedal amphibian Pokémon that has blue-green skin with darker patches
name: Bulbasaur

text: It has red eyes with white pupils, pointed, ear-like structures on top of its head, and a short, blunt snout with a wide mouth
name: Bulbasaur

text: A pair of small, pointed teeth are visible in the upper jaw when its mouth is open
name: Bulbasaur

text: Each of its thick legs ends with three sharp claws
name: Bulbasaur

text: On Bulbasaur's back is a green plant bulb, which is grown from a seed planted there at birth
name: Bulbasaur

text: The bulb also conceals two slender, tentacle-like vines and provides it with energy through photosynthesis as well as from the nutrient-rich seeds contained within
name: Bulbasaur

text: As mentioned in the anime, starter Pokémon are raised by Breeders to be distributed to new Trainers
name: Bulbasaur

text: Having been domesticated from birth, Bulbasaur is regarded as both a rare and well-behaved Pokémon
name: Bulbasaur

text: It is known to be extremely loyal, even after long-term abandonment
name: Bulbasaur

text: Bulbasaur in the anime have demonstrated a nurturing instinct towards younger, weaker Pokémon, one individual even using its vines to pick up a crying Pokémon, gently rocking it back and forth through the air while singing a Bulba-by
name: Bulbasaur

text: It is found in grasslands and forests throughout the Kanto region
name: Bulbasaur

text: However, due to Bulbasaur's status as starter Pokémon, it is hard to come by in the wild and generally found under the ownership of a Trainer
name: Bulbasaur

text: It has been observed that a Bulbasaur's bulb will flash blue when it is ready to evolve
name: Bulbasaur

text: If it does not want to evolve, it struggles to resist the transformation
name: Bulbasaur

text: Many Bulbasaur gather every year in a hidden garden in Kanto to evolve into Ivysaur in a ceremony led by a Venusaur
name: Bulbasaur

text: Ivysaur's appearance is very similar to that of its pre-evolved form, Bulbasaur
name: Ivysaur

text: It still retains the turquoise skin and spots, along with its red eyes
name: Ivysaur

text: Ivysaur's top fangs are now larger and are visible outside of its mouth
name: Ivysaur

text: Also, its ears are now darkened to black in the center
name: Ivysaur

text: Carrying the weight of the bud on its back makes Ivysaur's legs stronger
name: Ivysaur

text: The most notable change is that the bulb is starting to bloom, with pink petals visible, and large leaves on the bloom bottom
name: Ivysaur

text: Ivysaur are able to naturally learn the powerful Grass-type attack Solar Beam, a move whose execution time depends largely upon the weather it takes an excruciatingly long amount of time to perform this attack in hail, rain, or a sandstorm, but nearly no time at all in bright sunlight
name: Ivysaur

text: Luckily, the latter is ​most common in the habitats of these Pokémon, as it is vital that the bulbs on their backs receive ample sunlight so that they can photosynthesize and develop
name: Ivysaur

text: As the bulbs grow larger and these Ivysaur become more powerful, they must spend increasing amounts of time in the sun in order to foster their growth
name: Ivysaur

text: When Ivysaur are preparing to evolve into Venusaur, they will spend more time sunbathing and their bulbs will begin emanating a sweet, pleasant aroma
name: Ivysaur

text: Its blossom on its back grows larger in the sunlight
name: Ivysaur

text: As the blossom grows, Ivysaur loses the ability to stand on its hind legs
name: Ivysaur

text: The blossom produces a pleasant smell when it is ready to bloom, it means Ivysaur is ready to evolve into Venusaur
name: Ivysaur

text: Ivysaur is a quadrupedal amphibian Pokémon that has blue-green skin with darker patches
name: Ivysaur

text: On top of its head are pointed ears with black insides and it has narrow red eyes
name: Ivysaur

text: Ivysaur has a short, rounded snout with a wide mouth and two pointed teeth in its upper jaw
name: Ivysaur

text: Each of its feet has three claws on them
name: Ivysaur

text: The bulb on its back has bloomed into a large pink bud
name: Ivysaur

text: A short brown trunk surrounded by leafy green fronds supports the bud
name: Ivysaur

text: The weight of the plant prevents Ivysaur from running fast and standing on its hind legs, forcing its legs to grow sturdy
name: Ivysaur

text: When its flower is ready to bloom, it gives off a distinct, sweet-smelling aroma and starts swelling
name: Ivysaur

text: Ivysaur will also start spending more time in sunlight in preparation for its upcoming evolution
name: Ivysaur

text: Exposure to sunlight adds to the strength of both Ivysaur and its plant
name: Ivysaur

text: Ivysaur are typically found in plains
name: Ivysaur

text: Venusaur is a large, amphibian-like Pokémon that is somewhat similar in appearance to its pre-evolved forms, Ivysaur and Bulbasaur
name: Venusaur

text: Its skin still retains a light turquoise color, but it no longer has the spots, and it appears more rough and scaly, with bumps here and there
name: Venusaur

text: The former bulb on its back has now fully bloomed into a gigantic flower and its ears have lightened up as well
name: Venusaur

text: Female Venusaur are slightly different because they have a seed on their back, which shows that it can give birth to a new Bulbasaur
name: Venusaur

text: Female Venusaur have bulbs sticking out of the tops of their flowers
name: Venusaur

text: Venusaur absorbs sunlight to gain energy and to feed its flower, located on its back
name: Venusaur

text: After gaining a certain amount of sunlight, the flower will release a sweet aroma said to soothe the emotions of people
name: Venusaur

text: Additionally, after a rainy day, the smell of the flower's aroma grows stronger, attracting other Pokémon
name: Venusaur

text: The power of Gigantamaxing has made Venusaur's flower bloom so large that it covers the Pokémon's body
name: Venusaur

text: The flower's petals are extremely thick and springy enough to repel halfhearted attacks
name: Venusaur

text: During battle, the Pokémon uses these petals as a shield and swings its two thick vines around to attack its target
name: Venusaur

text: The flower on the Pokémon's back spews so much pollen that it resembles a volcanic eruption
name: Venusaur

text: Inhaling the pollen can cause uncontrollable sneezing, and breathing in too much of it can even cause fainting
name: Venusaur

text: However, the pollen also stimulates plant growth
name: Venusaur

text: Places where the pollen falls are said to grow thick with large plants
name: Venusaur

text: Venusaur are powerful but relatively nonviolent Pokémon
name: Venusaur

text: Despite their menacing appearances, Venusaur are docile Pokémon, preferring to sunbathe so that the plants on their backs can photosynthesize rather than fight
name: Venusaur

text: They follow sunny patches that reach the forest floor as the sun moves across the sky
name: Venusaur

text: With enough solar energy, the flowers on their backs can release a fragrance that calms both hostile Pokémon and people alike
name: Venusaur

text: The scent also attracts a number of Bug-type Pokémon to the flowers as well to aid in their pollination during the breeding season
name: Venusaur

text: This ability allows Venusaur to serve as peacekeepers of sorts in their native forests, not only stopping fights that break out in their territories, but also defending their domains from dangers with their might if necessary
name: Venusaur

text: Female Venusaur have seeds in their flowers, which they plant into the backs of their offspring to grow into new plants
name: Venusaur

text: Their gentle dispositions but great power are what make them one of the most well-rounded Pokémon any Kantonian trainer could start their Pokémon journeys with
name: Venusaur

text: Venusaur evolves from Ivysaur at level 32
name: Venusaur

text: It can mega evolve into Mega Venusaur using the Venusaurite
name: Venusaur

text: Venusaur is a squat, quadrupedal amphibian Pokémon with bumpy, blue-green skin
name: Venusaur

text: It has small, circular red eyes and a short, blunt snout
name: Venusaur

text: Its mouth is wide with two pointed teeth in the upper jaw and four in the lower jaw
name: Venusaur

text: On top of its head are small, pointed ears with reddish pink insides
name: Venusaur

text: It has three clawed toes on each foot
name: Venusaur

text: The bud on its back has bloomed into a large pink, white-spotted flower
name: Venusaur

text: The flower is supported by a thick, brown trunk surrounded by green fronds
name: Venusaur

text: A female Venusaur has a seed in the center of its flower
name: Venusaur

text: Venusaur uses its flower to catch the sun's rays to convert them into energy, which causes the flower to become more vibrant
name: Venusaur

text: The flower releases a soothing scent that attracts Pokémon and calms emotions
name: Venusaur

text: This scent becomes stronger after a rainy day
name: Venusaur

text: In the anime, Venusaur has demonstrated the ability to manipulate nature, release several vines from its back, and lead evolution ceremonies for Bulbasaur and Ivysaur
name: Venusaur

text: This Pokémon is rarely found in the wild, but it has been known to inhabit grasslands
name: Venusaur

text: As Mega Venusaur, the flower on its back grows larger and two smaller pink flowers bloom, one on its forehead and one on its rear
name: Venusaur

text: Its legs and back have become sturdier to support the extra weight of the flower
name: Venusaur

text: Additional leaves with woody stems, which are supported by vines, are also grown around the flower
name: Venusaur

text: Mega Venusaur also develops dark markings on its forehead below the new flower on its forehead
name: Venusaur

text: As Gigantamax Venusaur, it becomes larger with its flower blooming even further, to the point of covering its body
name: Venusaur

text: These flowers have a taller bud, along with extremely thick and springy petals that are capable of shielding Gigantamax Venusaur
name: Venusaur

text: Its eyes have light green sclerae and orange irises
name: Venusaur

text: More foliage grows from under its flower, and the trunk that supports said flower becomes shorter
name: Venusaur

text: It has several light green markings located at its belly
name: Venusaur

text: Gigantamax Venusaur attacks with its thick vines, which are powerful enough to topple down a 10-story building
name: Venusaur

text: Gigantamax Venusaur's flower can spread enough pollen in a similar fashion to a volcanic eruption
name: Venusaur

text: Breathing in this pollen can cause uncontrollable sneezing, and inhaling large amounts can even cause fainting
name: Venusaur

text: However, this pollen also promotes plant growth in areas where it lands
name: Venusaur

text: Gigantamax Venusaur is the only known Pokémon capable of using the G-Max Move G-Max Vine Lash
name: Venusaur

text: Concept art of Charmander
name: Charmander

text: Charmander is a small, bipedal, dinosaur-like Pokémon
name: Charmander

text: Most of its body is colored orange, while its underbelly is a pale light-yellow color
name: Charmander

text: It has four small fingers on each hand and three claws on each foot
name: Charmander

text: Charmander, like its evolved forms, has a flame that constantly burns on the end of its tail
name: Charmander

text: However, If the flame on Charmander's tail goes out, Charmander's life will come to an end
name: Charmander

text: The power of Charmander's flame attacks can be gauged by the size of the flame on its tail
name: Charmander

text: Charmander is easily the most mild-mannered and well-behaved of its evolution line
name: Charmander

text: Its feelings and emotions can be read by the flame on the tip of its tail
name: Charmander

text: It flares up in a fury when Charmander is angry
name: Charmander

text: The flame will flicker and grow small and dim If Charmander is sick or hurt
name: Charmander

text: If it growls that means it's angry or is about to attack
name: Charmander

text: Charmander however doesn't do well with impatient people
name: Charmander

text: It doesn't appreciate being rushed, and most of the time, will not allow it
name: Charmander

text: It is a sweet Pokémon, but is feisty nonetheless
name: Charmander

text: Charmander doesn't enjoy accepting favors, because it feels it owes something in return
name: Charmander

text: It is extremely loyal to its loved ones, and knows a good thing when it sees it
name: Charmander

text: It will treat those in its life accordingly
name: Charmander

text: Charmander is rarely found in the wild since it's a First partner Pokémon
name: Charmander

text: Sometimes they gather in extremely hot areas such as active volcanoes or in craggy mountains and in caves along the coast of the Sevii Islands
name: Charmander

text: Charmander is a bipedal, reptilian Pokémon with a primarily orange body and blue eyes
name: Charmander

text: Its underside from the chest down and the soles of its feet are cream-colored
name: Charmander

text: It has two small fangs visible in its upper jaw and two smaller fangs in its lower jaw
name: Charmander

text: A fire burns at the tip of this Pokémon's slender tail and has blazed there since Charmander's birth
name: Charmander

text: The flame can be used as an indication of Charmander's health and mood, burning brightly when the Pokémon is strong, weakly when it is exhausted, wavering when it is happy, and blazing when it is enraged
name: Charmander

text: It is said that Charmander dies if its flame goes out
name: Charmander

text: However, if the Pokémon is healthy, the flame will continue to burn even if it gets a bit wet and is said to steam in the rain
name: Charmander

text: Charmander can be found in hot, mountainous areas
name: Charmander

text: However, it is found far more often in the ownership of Trainers
name: Charmander

text: As shown in Pokémon Snap, Charmander exhibits pack behavior, calling others of its species if it finds food
name: Charmander

text: Charmeleon is a small, bipedal, dinosaur-like Pokémon with an appearance similar to that of its pre-evolved form, Charmander
name: Charmeleon

text: Charmeleon differs from Charmander in that it has a much darker red skin color, a larger body structure, claws, and a horn-like protrusion on the back of its head, similar to that of an ornithopod's
name: Charmeleon

text: Its claws are razor sharp and its tail is very strong
name: Charmeleon

text: Charmeleon, like its other evolutionary forms, can naturally breathe fire
name: Charmeleon

text: Its powers, though, are much greater than Charmander's, but not as great as Charizard's
name: Charmeleon

text: Charmeleon is also much more aggressive than Charmander
name: Charmeleon

text: It is believed to have a vicious nature and will constantly seek out opponents
name: Charmeleon

text: Strong opponents excite this Pokémon, causing it to spout bluish-white flames that torch its surroundings
name: Charmeleon

text: It is a very ruthless, pitiless and zealous fighter often using its claws
name: Charmeleon

text: However, it will relax once it has won
name: Charmeleon

text: In their fervor, their tails often begin to burn a bluish-white at night, they can light up mountainsides like stars if groups of them are present
name: Charmeleon

text: Enraged Charmeleon often take out their anger on their surroundings, incinerating anything flammable around them with unrestrained Flamethrowers
name: Charmeleon

text: This stage is often likened to a human’s teenage years--moody and reckless
name: Charmeleon

text: For starting trainers, reining in disobedient Charmeleon can be extremely challenging, as well as potentially dangerous if not handled well
name: Charmeleon

text: However, with proper care and treatment, a trainer can earn a Charmeleon’s respect, and eventually its obedience as well
name: Charmeleon

text: Charmeleon, along with Charmander and Charizard, can be found in hot, rocky mountainous areas
name: Charmeleon

text: Charmeleon evolves from Charmander at level 16, and evolves into Charizard in level 36
name: Charmeleon

text: Charmeleon is a bipedal, reptilian Pokémon
name: Charmeleon

text: It has dark red scales and a cream underside from the chest down
name: Charmeleon

text: It has blue eyes and a long snout with a slightly hooked tip
name: Charmeleon

text: On the back of its head is a single horn-like protrusion
name: Charmeleon

text: It has relatively long arms with three sharp claws
name: Charmeleon

text: Its short legs have plantigrade feet with three claws and cream-colored soles
name: Charmeleon

text: The tip of its long, powerful tail has a flame burning on it
name: Charmeleon

text: The temperature rises to unbearable levels if Charmeleon swings its tail
name: Charmeleon

text: Charmeleon has a vicious nature and will constantly seek out opponents
name: Charmeleon

text: Strong opponents excite this Pokémon, causing it to spout bluish-white flames that torch its surroundings
name: Charmeleon

text: However, it will relax once it has won a battle
name: Charmeleon

text: It is rare in the wild, but it can be found in mountainous areas
name: Charmeleon

text: Concept art of Charizard for Pokémon: Twilight Wings
name: Charizard

text: Charizard is a large, dragon-like Pokémon that differs greatly from its pre-evolved form
name: Charizard

text: The red skin coloration of Charmeleon is no longer apparent, as Charizard appears to have reverted to the orange/yellow coloration of Charmander
name: Charizard

text: Two large fangs can be seen when its mouth is closed
name: Charizard

text: When its mouth is open, its lower fangs and a slender but long tongue can be seen
name: Charizard

text: The single horn that was on the back of its head is now two, one on either side
name: Charizard

text: The most notable difference between Charizard and its pre-evolved forms are the large wings that have developed on its back, which gives Charizard the capability of flying
name: Charizard

text: In Generation II, Shiny Charizard was purple with the inside of its wings being green
name: Charizard

text: In Generation III onwards, Shiny Charizard's orange skin is black while the blue of its wings is maroon
name: Charizard

text: Concept art of Mega Charizard X and Mega Charizard Y
name: Charizard

text: Charizard's Mega Evolution form using Charizardite X is different from Charizard, as it now has a black body color and blue flames from its mouth and on its tail
name: Charizard

text: While using Charizardite Y, Mega Charizard has a big horn on the top of its head and larger wings
name: Charizard

text: As Gigantamax Charizard, it becomes larger and physically fit
name: Charizard

text: The lower part of its body glows white with several yellow diamonds located on lower belly
name: Charizard

text: There are also diamonds spots located on the front legs
name: Charizard

text: The claws located on hand and feet become longer and sharp
name: Charizard

text: The feet become longer and digitigrade, retaining small glowing soles under the forefeet
name: Charizard

text: The wings are transformed into literal flame wings extending to the shoulder blade and two flames located on the horns
name: Charizard

text: The sclera of the eyes becomes yellow, the glow of a flame can be seen in the mouth and the teeth grow, with the lower front teeth and three teeth in the middle now protruding when the mouth is closed
name: Charizard

text: The flame on the tail extends out and has three red clouds surrounding it
name: Charizard

text: Gigantamax Charizard's flames increase whenever it roars
name: Charizard

text: The wings are capable of being hotter than magma which Charizard uses to burn its opponents
name: Charizard

text: As Shiny Charizard Mega Evolves into Mega Charizard X, its body becomes black and its wings become blue
name: Charizard

text: For Mega Charizard Y, its body stays orange, while it's wings appear tattered and ripped
name: Charizard

text: The fire on Charizard's tail will change to a bluish-white color if it is furious
name: Charizard

text: Given its dragon-like appearance, it is logical that Charizard is capable of learning many Dragon-type moves, such as Dragon Breath, Dragon Pulse, etc
name: Charizard

text: However, it becomes a true Dragon-type as Mega Charizard X
name: Charizard

text: Charizard are noble and will not turn the full power of their flame on opponents significantly weaker than they are
name: Charizard

text: Charizards are also known to be very eager to battle
name: Charizard

text: Charizard seeks out stronger foes and only breathes fire during battles with worthy opponents
name: Charizard

text: The fiery breath is so hot that it can turn any material to slag
name: Charizard

text: They can be very dangerous and aggressive if provoked
name: Charizard

text: But like Charmander and Charmeleon, it is friendly and affectionate with its Trainer
name: Charizard

text: Charizard only ignores its Trainer if it feels it's Trainer does not care about it
name: Charizard

text: Only a weak Charizard shows off its power, as said by Liza in Charizard's Burning Ambitions
name: Charizard

text: Charizard evolves from Charmeleon starting at level 36
name: Charizard

text: It is the final form of Charmander
name: Charizard

text: Mega Charizard X and Mega Charizard Y
name: Charizard

text: Charizard is a draconic, bipedal Pokémon
name: Charizard

text: It is primarily orange with a cream underside from the chest to the tip of its tail
name: Charizard

text: It has a long neck, small blue eyes, slightly raised nostrils, and two horn-like structures protruding from the back of its rectangular head
name: Charizard

text: There are two fangs visible in its upper jaw when its mouth is closed
name: Charizard

text: Two large wings with blue-green undersides sprout from its back, and a horn-like appendage juts out from the top of the third joint of each wing
name: Charizard

text: A single wing-finger is visible through the center of each wing membrane
name: Charizard

text: Charizard's arms are short and skinny compared to its robust belly, and each limb has three white claws
name: Charizard

text: It has stocky legs with cream-colored soles on each of its plantigrade feet
name: Charizard

text: The tip of its long, tapering tail burns with a sizable flame
name: Charizard

text: Charizard flies in search of powerful opponents to battle, and its fire will burn hotter as it gains experience
name: Charizard

text: Its fiery breath is capable of melting boulders, massive glaciers, and has been known to accidentally cause forest fires
name: Charizard

text: Though its fiery breath is hot, it never turns it on any opponent weaker than itself
name: Charizard

text: Charizard typically inhabits mountains and valleys, such as the Charicific Valley in Johto
name: Charizard

text: The anime has shown that only a weak Charizard would show off its power
name: Charizard

text: It also showed that Charizard can swim underwater, with Pokémon Origins further showing that the flame on the tip of the tail can still keep burning underwater
name: Charizard

text: The wings of Charizard can carry it to an altitude of 4,600 feet (1,400 meters)
name: Charizard

text: Charizard has two Mega Forms
name: Charizard

text: Both feature a shorter snout, white, vertical slit pupils, and a bright underside reaching the lower jaw
name: Charizard

text: As Mega Charizard X, its body and legs are more physically fit, though its arms remain thin
name: Charizard

text: Its skin turns black with a sky-blue underside and soles
name: Charizard

text: Two spikes with blue tips curve upward from the front and back of each shoulder, while the tips of its horns sharpen, turn blue, and curve slightly upward
name: Charizard

text: Its brow and claws are larger, and its eyes are now red
name: Charizard

text: It has two small, fin-like spikes under each horn and two more down its lower neck
name: Charizard

text: The finger disappears from the wing membrane, and the lower edges are divided into large, rounded points
name: Charizard

text: The third joint of each wing-arm is adorned with a claw-like spike
name: Charizard

text: Mega Charizard X breathes blue flames out the sides of its mouth, and the flame on its tail now burns blue
name: Charizard

text: It is said that its new power turns it black and creates more intense flames
name: Charizard

text: As Mega Charizard Y, it becomes sleeker in appearance but retains its normal coloration
name: Charizard

text: It has three pointed horns on the back of its head, the middle of which is longer
name: Charizard

text: Its snout has larger fangs and a ridge on the nose
name: Charizard

text: Its neck is shorter, but its torso is thinner and longer
name: Charizard

text: It features longer digitigrade feet
name: Charizard

text: Its hands are less developed, with extremely shortened fingers that are no longer separated from each other
name: Charizard

text: Small wings develop on its wrists, while the ones on its back become larger, lose the wing finger passing through their membrane and end up with ragged edges
name: Charizard

text: The back of its tail has a large spike at the base and three smaller ones near the tip, which now burns with a longer flame
name: Charizard

text: Mega Charizard Y is said to have incredible flying prowess that is greater than a jet fighter
name: Charizard

text: As Gigantamax Charizard, it becomes larger and physically fit
name: Charizard

text: The lower part of its body glows white with several yellow diamonds located on the lower belly
name: Charizard

text: There are also diamond-shaped spots located on the front legs
name: Charizard

text: The claws located on its hand and feet become longer and sharper
name: Charizard

text: The feet become longer and digitigrade, retaining small glowing soles under the forefeet
name: Charizard

text: The wings are transformed into literal flame wings extending to the shoulder blade and two flames sprout from the horns
name: Charizard

text: The colossal flamed wings were created from the energy of Gigantamaxing
name: Charizard

text: The sclera of the eyes becomes yellow
name: Charizard

text: The glow of a flame can be seen in the mouth, and the teeth grow, with the lower front teeth and three teeth in the middle now protruding when the mouth is closed
name: Charizard

text: The flame on the tail extends out and has three red clouds surrounding it, like the clouds most other Gigantamax Pokémon have
name: Charizard

text: The flames within Gigantamax Charizard burns hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit (2,000 degrees Celsius)
name: Charizard

text: When it roars, the temperature can climb to even higher lengths
name: Charizard

text: The wings are capable of being hotter than magma which Charizard uses to burn its opponents
name: Charizard

text: Gigantamax Charizard is the only known Pokémon capable of using the G-Max Move G-Max Wildfire
name: Charizard

text: Squirtle is a small, light-blue Pokémon with an appearance similar to a turtle
name: Squirtle

text: With its aerodynamic shape and grooved surface, Squirtle's shell helps it wade through the water very quickly
name: Squirtle

text: It also offers protection in battle
name: Squirtle

text: Like turtles, Squirtle has a shell that covers its body with holes that allow its limbs, tail, and head to be exposed
name: Squirtle

text: Unlike a turtle, Squirtle is ordinarily bipedal
name: Squirtle

text: Its shell is highly sturdy, so it can hide within its shell to protect itself from physical attacks
name: Squirtle

text: Squirtle is usually well behaved, yet it has an underlying rebellious streak
name: Squirtle

text: It likes to be open with only a limited number of people and won't advertise its secrets
name: Squirtle

text: It prefers to stay within a close knit group, but can still enjoy making new friends
name: Squirtle

text: Other Pokémon may regard it as difficult and hard to get along with, but only if they have previously gotten on its bad side
name: Squirtle

text: Squirtle is a small reptilian Pokémon that resembles a light-blue turtle
name: Squirtle

text: While it typically walks on its two short legs, it has been shown to run on all fours in Super Smash Bros
name: Squirtle

text: Brawl
name: Squirtle

text: It has large, purplish or reddish eyes and a slightly hooked upper lip
name: Squirtle

text: Each of its hands and feet have three pointed digits
name: Squirtle

text: The end of its long tail curls inward
name: Squirtle

text: Its body is encased by a tough shell that forms and hardens after birth
name: Squirtle

text: This shell is brown on the top, pale yellow on the bottom, and has a thick white ridge between the two halves
name: Squirtle

text: Squirtle's shell is a useful tool
name: Squirtle

text: It can withdraw into the shell for protection or to sleep
name: Squirtle

text: The grooved, rounded shape helps to reduce water resistance, allowing the Pokémon to swim at high speeds
name: Squirtle

text: Squirtle can spray foamy water from its mouth with great accuracy
name: Squirtle

text: Squirtle is scarce in the wild, although it can be found around small ponds and lakes
name: Squirtle

text: The anime has shown that it can be found living on secluded islands with other members of its evolutionary line
name: Squirtle

text: Sharpedo is a natural predator of Squirtle
name: Squirtle

text: In Generation II, Skull Bash was its signature move
name: Squirtle

text: Wartortle is a small, bipedal, turtle-like Pokémon with a similar appearance to that of its pre-evolved form, Squirtle
name: Wartortle

text: Some differences are that Wartortle have developed sharper and larger claws and teeth, and that their tails are larger and fluffier than those of Squirtle's
name: Wartortle

text: The fur on Wartortle's tail darkens with age
name: Wartortle

text: Wartortle have developed large furry ears
name: Wartortle

text: Like its pre-evolved form, it can also use its shell to protect itself
name: Wartortle

text: Its shell bears the scratches of many battles
name: Wartortle

text: They use water to cloak themselves before attacking prey and swiftly swimming after them, using their ears and tails to balance themselves
name: Wartortle

text: Wartortle pride themselves on scratched shells, as they show toughness in battle
name: Wartortle

text: Generally, it is believed that the more scratches a Wartortle gains during this stage, the stronger it will be after evolution
name: Wartortle

text: Wartortle is naturally able to shoot water from its mouth at a greater force than its pre-evolved form Squirtle
name: Wartortle

text: Wartortle evolves from Squirtle starting at level 16, and evolves into Blastoise starting at level 36
name: Wartortle

text: Wartortle is a bipedal, indigo reptilian Pokémon similar to a turtle
name: Wartortle

text: It has brown eyes, a dark blue streak on each cheek, and two sharp teeth protruding from its upper jaw
name: Wartortle

text: It has three clawed fingers and pointed toes
name: Wartortle

text: On each side of its head are feather-like ears covered in pale blue fur
name: Wartortle

text: A brown shell with a pale yellow underside encases its body
name: Wartortle

text: A thick, white rim separates the upper and lower halves of the shell
name: Wartortle

text: An older Wartortle may have scars and algae growing on its shell
name: Wartortle

text: Poking out of the bottom of the shell is a thick, wavy tail that also has light blue fur and cannot be fully withdrawn into its shell
name: Wartortle

text: Its tail fur will darken with age
name: Wartortle

text: Its tail is a popular symbol of longevity and good luck, making this Pokémon popular with the elderly
name: Wartortle

text: Because they are larger than Squirtle and have a larger shell, Wartortle have a more difficult time walking on land and keeping their balance in the water
name: Wartortle

text: To maintain balance while swimming at high speeds, Wartortle moves its furry ears and tail as both rudders and balancing rods
name: Wartortle

text: Air can be stored in its fur for extended underwater diving
name: Wartortle

text: It hides in water when hunting and emerges to surprise its prey
name: Wartortle

text: The anime has shown that Wartortle can be found living in colonies on islands, but its preferred habitat seems to be freshwater ponds and lakes
name: Wartortle

text: In Generation II, Skull Bash was its signature move
name: Wartortle

text: Blastoise are large, tortoise-like Pokémon with some features similar to those of its pre-evolved forms
name: Blastoise

text: Blastoise has a large blue body, cream-colored stomach, small fat arms and legs, and a large brown shell rimmed with white, featuring its water cannons
name: Blastoise

text: It is now noticeably bulkier than its previous evolutions
name: Blastoise

text: Like its pre-evolved forms, Blastoise has a shell which covers its entire body, which it can also be withdrawn into
name: Blastoise

text: Contrary to Squirtle and Wartortle, Blastoise has large, water cannons that are located on the top left and right sides
name: Blastoise

text: The water that comes out of the cannons is capable of punching holes through thick steel
name: Blastoise

text: Blastoise can take the role of a leader in large groups of Squirtle and Wartortle
name: Blastoise

text: Its preferred habitat seems to be freshwater ponds and lakes
name: Blastoise

text: Blastoise are watchful Pokémon
name: Blastoise

text: They dislike humans in their territory, but will not attack unless provoked
name: Blastoise

text: They tend to fight when they sense danger
name: Blastoise

text: Blastoise, like Wartortle and Squirtle, can naturally shoot water, though not from its mouth, but from its large cannons
name: Blastoise

text: These cannons allow water to be shot at much greater force, which leaves them the backing force of all water attacks
name: Blastoise

text: From the spouts on its shell, Blastoise can fire water bullets with amazing accuracy, able to hit a target more than one hundred and sixty feet away
name: Blastoise

text: Blastoise's shell has grown to match its body, and it boasts new extra-large water cannons as well
name: Blastoise

text: Gigantamax Blastoise can adapt to different situations by using different combinations of its 31 variously sized cannons
name: Blastoise

text: In battle, it doesn't bother to aim
name: Blastoise

text: Instead, it fires dynamic, powerful torrents from multiple cannons to overwhelm opponents
name: Blastoise

text: The main cannon on the center of Blastoise's shell is staggeringly powerful
name: Blastoise

text: Legend says this cannon has blasted holes into mountains
name: Blastoise

text: Gigantamax Blastoise can also move the 12 large cannons surrounding its central cannon independently, letting it orient its attacks in any direction, whether toward the ground or the sky
name: Blastoise

text: Blastoise evolves from Wartortle starting at level 36
name: Blastoise

text: Blastoise can further evolve into Mega Blastoise using the Blastoisinite
name: Blastoise

text: Blastoise is a large, bipedal turtle Pokémon
name: Blastoise

text: Its body is blue and is mostly hidden by its tough, brown shell
name: Blastoise

text: This shell has a cream-colored underside and a white ridge encircling its arms and separating the upper and lower halves
name: Blastoise

text: Two powerful water cannons reside at the top of its shell over its shoulders
name: Blastoise

text: These cannons can be extended or withdrawn
name: Blastoise

text: Blastoise's head has triangular ears that are black on the inside, small brown eyes, and a cream-colored lower jaw
name: Blastoise

text: Its arms are thick, and it has three claws on each hand
name: Blastoise

text: Its feet have three claws on the front and one on the back
name: Blastoise

text: Poking out of the bottom of its shell is a stubby tail
name: Blastoise

text: The powerful cannons on this Pokémon's back are capable of producing water blasts that can pierce steel and concrete and can be used for high-speed charges
name: Blastoise

text: Blastoise deliberately makes itself heavy to withstand these powerful blasts and to crush its opponents
name: Blastoise

text: In Generation II, Skull Bash was its signature move
name: Blastoise

text: The anime has shown that Blastoise can take the role of a leader in large groups of Squirtle and Wartortle
name: Blastoise

text: Its preferred habitat seems to be freshwater ponds and lakes
name: Blastoise

text: As Mega Blastoise, it develops two smaller shells over its arms, each with their own water cannon
name: Blastoise

text: The two cannons on its back are replaced by a single, central water cannon of greater size that can retract into its shell
name: Blastoise

text: This cannon extends forward over Mega Blastoise's head and is said to have a blast range of over 6 miles (10 kilometers)
name: Blastoise

text: 1 Small ridges develop over its now-red eyes and extend to its ears
name: Blastoise

text: The ears angle slightly backward and there is a small point on its chin
name: Blastoise

text: As Gigantamax Blastoise, it becomes larger
name: Blastoise

text: Its eyes are white with bright blue sclerae
name: Blastoise

text: Its blue arms, head and legs change to light blue, and the underside of its shell becomes dark red
name: Blastoise

text: Its shell transforms into a battleship-like formation, with 31 cannons of different sizes: sets of twin cannons emerge from hexagon and rectangle-shaped holes within the shell, and a main cannon protrudes from the center
name: Blastoise

text: Several white triangular spots are located on its tail and legs
name: Blastoise

text: Three red clouds surround the main cannon
name: Blastoise

text: Gigantamax Blastoise can adapt to any situation using various cannon combinations
name: Blastoise

text: It is not very good at precision shooting, so instead of aiming its attacks, it prefers to overwhelm its opponent by launching dynamic, powerful torrents from its cannons
name: Blastoise

text: According to one legend, its main cannon is so staggeringly powerful it can blast holes through the mountains
name: Blastoise

text: Gigantamax Blastoise can also align the 12 cannons surrounding its main cannon individually to attack in any direction
name: Blastoise

text: Gigantamax Blastoise is the only known Pokémon capable of using the G-Max Move G-Max Cannonade
name: Blastoise

text: Caterpie is a worm-like Pokémon that is mainly green in color with a tan underside
name: Caterpie

text: Just below its head are four, tiny legs that are used only for movement
name: Caterpie

text: On top of its head is a red, y-shaped antenna, which can be used to produce an odor used in self-defense, in case something tries to hurt it
name: Caterpie

text: Caterpie are known for their great appetites, usually eating many leaves before creating cocoons to evolve
name: Caterpie

text: They use self-made silk to both produce cocoons for evolution
name: Caterpie

text: As weak, soft-bodied Pokémon, Caterpie attempt to gather as much energy as possible to hasten their evolutions into Metapod, and afterwards into Butterfree
name: Caterpie

text: However, they are not completely defenseless and do have a few tricks up their sleeves
name: Caterpie

text: Firstly, the large eyes on their heads can trick and confuse predators into thinking they are dealing with much larger Pokémon
name: Caterpie

text: Secondly, the suction pads on their feet allow them to climb nearly any surface and escape from predators
name: Caterpie

text: Additionally, Caterpie can use String Shot to slow down their enemies and buy time for escape
name: Caterpie

text: Finally, the antennae on their heads release a very noxious odor when disturbed
name: Caterpie

text: These defense mechanisms allow Caterpie to thrive in their native habitats, and combined with the large clutch sizes of Butterfree, make them are one of the most common Pokémon trainers encounter in forests
name: Caterpie

text: Caterpie has the ability Shield Dust, which negates all status effects that are side effects of other moves
name: Caterpie

text: When threatened, it can release a strong odor from its antenna, which it uses to ward off predators
name: Caterpie

text: A ravenous Caterpie can quickly gobble up leaves that are much bigger than itself
name: Caterpie

text: Caterpie evolves into Metapod starting at level 7, which evolves into Butterfree starting at level 10
name: Caterpie

text: Caterpie is an insect Pokémon that resembles a green caterpillar with a yellow underside and teardrop-shaped tail
name: Caterpie

text: There are yellow ring-shaped markings down the sides of its segmented body, which resemble its eyes and are meant to scare off predators
name: Caterpie

text: Its most notable characteristic is the bright red antenna (osmeterium) on its head, which releases a stench to repel predators
name: Caterpie

text: Despite these features and its camouflage in green foliage, Caterpie is often preyed upon by Flying-type Pokémon
name: Caterpie

text: Its four tiny feet are tipped with suction cups, permitting this Pokémon to scale most surfaces with minimal effort
name: Caterpie

text: Caterpie is easy to capture and grows quickly, making it ideal for new Trainers
name: Caterpie

text: As Caterpie grow and develop over time, it will shed its skin many times before finally cocooning itself in thick silk
name: Caterpie

text: It can also spit this silk in order to entangle foes as seen in the anime
name: Caterpie

text: It has a voracious appetite, which drives it to eat a hundred leaves a day
name: Caterpie

text: It will even eat leaves bigger than itself
name: Caterpie

text: According to Pokémon Adventures, its favorite food is the Vermilion flower
name: Caterpie

text: Caterpie lives in temperate forests and jungles
name: Caterpie

text: Metapod is an insect-like Pokémon with an appearance similar to that of a green-colored chrysalis or cocoon
name: Metapod

text: Although it is covered in its hard shell, Metapod's eyes are still clearly visible and usually appear dazed, drowsy, or angry for reasons unknown
name: Metapod

text: When preparing to evolve, Caterpie spin cocoons around themselves
name: Metapod

text: These cocoons, while still vulnerable when soft, will eventually harden into iron-hard casings, triggering their evolutions into Metapod
name: Metapod

text: To avoid attacks, these Pokémon stay motionless and simply ​wait
name: Metapod

text: Metapod are remarkably patient, enduring whatever pain they must to reach their final stages
name: Metapod

text: They must remain upright while biding their time or risk spilling out their innards
name: Metapod

text: They are often regarded as nearly useless in battle, as freshly-caught Metapod are incapable of damaging foes at all (other than by using Struggle)
name: Metapod

text: Luckily, however, the Caterpie line undergoes some of the quickest evolutions known to date, and it does not take very long for Metapod to finally evolve into Butterfree
name: Metapod

text: Metapod have the ability Shed Skin which allows for a 1/3 chance that a harmful status effect will be dropped every turn
name: Metapod

text: A Metapod's exterior is regularly hardened to protect its soft and tender innards while undergoing metamorphosis to eventually become a Butterfree
name: Metapod

text: To conserve energy for this event, the Metapod barely moves
name: Metapod

text: Metapod evolves from Caterpie starting at level 7, and evolves into Butterfree starting at level 10
name: Metapod

text: Metapod is an insect Pokémon that resembles a green chrysalis
name: Metapod

text: Its body is crescent-shaped with several segments making up the lower point
name: Metapod

text: The front of Metapod's shell resembles a face with heavy-lidded eyes and a sharply pointed nose
name: Metapod

text: The back of its shell consists of several geometrically shaped portions and projections
name: Metapod

text: Metapod's soft body is protected by a hard outer shell while it undergoes metamorphosis
name: Metapod

text: While this shell is said to be as hard as steel, a sudden, powerful impact could cause its liquid innards to pop out, leaving it completely exposed
name: Metapod

text: Metapod generally remains motionless, rebuilding its cells for evolution
name: Metapod

text: If an enemy discovers Metapod, it is unable to do anything other than harden its outer shell
name: Metapod

text: Metapod lives in temperate forests and jungles
name: Metapod

text: Pikipek is a natural predator of Metapod
name: Metapod

text: Butterfree is an insect-like Pokémon appearing as a large butterfly
name: Butterfree

text: Butterfree has a large purple body with light blue limbs and a nose with very small fangs
name: Butterfree

text: Its eyes are quite large in proportion to its head and are a red color
name: Butterfree

text: Butterfree's large wings simply appear as black and white butterfly wings
name: Butterfree

text: In its Gigantamax form, Bufferfree's body has a larger frame with red glowing eyes
name: Butterfree

text: It sports a giant set of wings with glowing teal patterns on them
name: Butterfree

text: A fur-like pattern is attached to its wings and back
name: Butterfree

text: Its antennae changes from black to light green and, like other dynamaxed Pokémon, are surrounded by red clouds
name: Butterfree

text: The gender difference is the female has purple on the bottom of its wings and the male doesn't have them
name: Butterfree

text: Butterfree consume honey from flowers and are excellent at detecting sources of it
name: Butterfree

text: They can trace minutes amounts of pollen back to flower patches, where they then feast on honey and nectar
name: Butterfree

text: Using the hairs on their legs, Butterfree are also able to carry the sticky substance back to their nests
name: Butterfree

text: They often fly as far as 6 miles (10 kilometers) to find nectar in blooming flowers
name: Butterfree

text: Because of their water-resistant wings, Butterfree can often be found fluttering about in the misty upper levels of rainforests
name: Butterfree

text: However, the high moisture is not necessary for their survival they are simply highly tolerant of it, so they are also found in drier forests as well, often flying in small swarms to search out locations where honey is abundant
name: Butterfree

text: They sometimes compete with Cutiefly for territory
name: Butterfree

text: Regular Butterfree have the ability Compound Eyes which raises its accuracy rating by 30%
name: Butterfree

text: Outside of battle, Compound eyes will raise the chances of finding a Pokémon with an item if the user is in the lead slot of the party
name: Butterfree

text: Butterfree befriended within the Dream World have the Tinted Lens ability, which doubles the power of not very effective moves
name: Butterfree

text: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air
name: Butterfree

text: Its wings are very helpful in spreading the Poisonpowder and Stun Spore
name: Butterfree

text: Butterfree evolves from Metapod at level 10 and is the final evolution of Caterpie
name: Butterfree

text: Butterfree is a lepidopteran insect Pokémon which resembles a vaguely anthropomorphic butterfly with a purple body
name: Butterfree

text: Unlike true insects, it only has two body segments and four light blue legs
name: Butterfree

text: The upper pair of its legs resemble small, three-fingered hands, while the lower pair resembles long, digit-less feet
name: Butterfree

text: Butterfree has two black antennae, a light blue snout with two fangs underneath, and large, red compound eyes
name: Butterfree

text: Its two pairs of wings are white with black venation
name: Butterfree

text: Two oval scales on a female Butterfree's lower wings are black, but they are white on a male
name: Butterfree

text: The wings of Butterfree are coated with poisonous scales that easily fall off continuously as it flies
name: Butterfree

text: If inhaled, it results in several status conditions
name: Butterfree

text: It will defend Caterpie from bird Pokémon using this powder
name: Butterfree

text: This powder also repels water, enabling it to fly and gather honey even in the rain
name: Butterfree

text: Butterfree can use its sensitive antenna to detect the odors of blooming flowers six miles (ten kilometers) from its nest in search of nectar, which it carries with the hairs of its legs
name: Butterfree

text: Sometimes, it has territorial disputes with Cutiefly over fields of flowers
name: Butterfree

text: It also consumes sap from trees pierced by Heracross, as seen in the anime
name: Butterfree

text: Butterfree is found in temperate forests and jungles, but it has also been observed flying near the ocean as part of its migratory breeding pattern
name: Butterfree

text: As Gigantamax Butterfree, its wings become shades of bright and dark green with a white pattern on them
name: Butterfree

text: At the base of the wings are a fur-like circle, which attaches to Gigantamax Butterfree's back
name: Butterfree

text: Its antennae become bright green as well, and extend to the point where the tip bends, and three red clouds surround them
name: Butterfree

text: Its eyes glow bright red
name: Butterfree

text: Several green scales, created from crystallized Gigantamax energy, can be seen floating around Gigantamax Butterfree
name: Butterfree

text: These are its most effective weapons, capable of causing paralysis, poisoning, or sleep
name: Butterfree

text: Gigantamax Butterfree scatters these scales by the winds that it generates with each flap of its wings these winds are powerful enough to lift a 10-ton truck
name: Butterfree

text: Gigantamax Butterfree is the only known Pokémon capable of using the G-Max Move G-Max Befuddle
name: Butterfree

text: Weedle is a small, insect-like Pokémon appearing as a brown caterpillar with large stingers on both its rear and head
name: Weedle

text: Across Weedle's underside are small, pink nubs which it uses to move
name: Weedle

text: On its head, Weedle has two beady, black eyes above a large, pink nose
name: Weedle

text: The stingers and brightly colored bodies of these Pokémon are intended to ward off potential predators who would not enjoy a mouthful of toxins
name: Weedle

text: Weedle also have a sharp sense of smell, using their nose-like proboscises to sense which leaves are safe to consume
name: Weedle

text: Some Weedle even develop preferences for certain leaves
name: Weedle

text: They are voracious eaters, consuming their weight in leaves daily
name: Weedle

text: Weedle has the ability Shield Dust, which will block any side effect caused by an opposing attack
name: Weedle

text: Weedle's sense of smell is excellent
name: Weedle

text: With its large red nose, it can sniff out the leaves it likes best
name: Weedle

text: Eating leaves helps it prepare for evolution
name: Weedle

text: Weedle has a large stinger on its head
name: Weedle

text: This stinger, according to the Pokédex, measures around two inches and is very toxic
name: Weedle

text: Furthermore, the Pokédex states that Weedle is brightly colored, so as to ward off any and all potential predators
name: Weedle

text: Weedle evolves into Kakuna once it reaches level 7, which can then further evolve at level 10 into Beedrill
name: Weedle

text: Weedle is a larval insect Pokémon with a segmented body ranging in color from yellow to reddish-brown
name: Weedle

text: Each segment of its body is a sphere
name: Weedle

text: It has a bulbous red nose, two small, black eyes on its face and two spherical feet on each body segment
name: Weedle

text: The combination of red and yellow in its color scheme creates a bright warning to predators that it is poisonous
name: Weedle

text: Weedle has a conical, two-inch (five centimeter) venomous stinger on its head and a barbed one on its tail
name: Weedle

text: Weedle can retaliate against attackers and those who step on it with its strong toxin
name: Weedle

text: It can distinguish its favorite kinds of leaves using its acute sense of smell
name: Weedle

text: As a young Bug-type Pokémon, its daily appetite for leaves matches its weight
name: Weedle

text: Weedle can be found in temperate forests and usually hides in grass, bushes, and under the leaves it eats
name: Weedle

text: Kakuna is an insect-like Pokémon with an appearance similar to that of a yellow chrysalis
name: Kakuna

text: As a chrysalis, the interior of Kakuna's very hard shell is unseen, with no limbs or other features being shown
name: Kakuna

text: Only Kakuna's eyes, jet black in color, are visible on the shell, which are somewhat large in proportion to its body
name: Kakuna

text: In Pokémon Red and Blue Versions, Kakuna had arm-like limbs, which were never seen afterwards
name: Kakuna

text: Weedle seek out trees, branches or piles of leaves to hide in when they evolve into Kakuna, their ability to move becomes severely restricted, and they can only inch about very slowly
name: Kakuna

text: They can sometimes be seen hanging from tree branches on strands of silk in large numbers
name: Kakuna

text: Kakuna can only learn Harden naturally
name: Kakuna

text: When provoked, though, they can also extend poison barbs from their tips slightly to defend themselves
name: Kakuna

text: These Pokémon try to conserve as much energy as possible for evolution, however, so they will only exert energy to unsheathe their barbs when absolutely necessary
name: Kakuna

text: Their hard cocoons protect the soft bodies within, which essentially liquify as they reconfigure themselves for evolution
name: Kakuna

text: This process, a fervor of activity that contrasts their immobility, causes their internal body temperatures to rise drastically, so much so that the shells of Kakuna nearing evolution feel uncomfortably hot to the touch
name: Kakuna

text: Their bodies only continue to heat up as they draw closer to their final transformations
name: Kakuna

text: As Kakuna are inside of a shell, they have little or no movement and almost no offensive capabilities
name: Kakuna

text: As a defensive measure, they can harden their shells against an attacker and may even be able to use Poison Sting
name: Kakuna

text: Kakuna evolves from Weedle as of level 7 and evolves into Beedrill at level 10
name: Kakuna

text: Kakuna is a yellow, insect cocoon-like Pokémon
name: Kakuna

text: Kakuna has a dome-shaped head and black, triangular eyes with glowing white pupils
name: Kakuna

text: It has two scythe-like arms in the middle of its body
name: Kakuna

text: When it comes close to evolving, its body gives off heat that makes it warm to the touch
name: Kakuna

text: Kakuna remains virtually immobile and waits for evolution, often hanging from tree branches by long strands of silk
name: Kakuna

text: When attacked, however, it can extend its poison barbs
name: Kakuna

text: Kakuna nests in temperate forests and misty wooded areas
name: Kakuna

text: Occasionally, it will also nest at the mouth of tunnels and caves, as seen in Pokémon Snap
name: Kakuna

text: Beedrill is an insect-like Pokémon with the appearance of a very large wasp
name: Beedrill

text: However, unlike a wasp, Beedrill only has four limbs, with the front-most limbs featuring two large, lance-like stingers
name: Beedrill

text: A third stinger is located on its rear end
name: Beedrill

text: The shiny version of a Beedrill is a light green color with blue eyes instead of red
name: Beedrill

text: A Mega evolved Beedrill's antennae now resemble the letter 'T', and its eyes become longer and sleeker
name: Beedrill

text: It gains a third pair of wings with black markings on top
name: Beedrill

text: Its stingers now resemble javelins now, and its only 2 legs were also turned into conical stingers with the same pattern as its abdomen
name: Beedrill

text: A similar structure joins its head and thorax and its third stinger has turned pale yellow
name: Beedrill

text: Beedrill is extremely territorial and will attack anyone who gets too close to their hive
name: Beedrill

text: They are aggressive Pokémon and collectively attack the people around them
name: Beedrill

text: As seen in Challenge of the Samurai, they are also concerned with the welfare of their previous forms
name: Beedrill

text: Beedrill are also vital to the ecosystems of Kantonian and Johtonian forests, helping prevent populations of Pokémon such as Paras and Pidgey from growing uncontrollably
name: Beedrill

text: Trainers traveling in Beedrill territory are strongly advised to bring along Pokémon that can handle Beedrill and their attacks, such as Twineedle and Poison Jab, as well as to bring along a number Pecha Berries and Antidotes
name: Beedrill

text: Beedrill has the ability Swarm, which increases any Bug-type attacks by 1
name: Beedrill

text: 5 if the user's HP drops below 1/3 its max amount
name: Beedrill

text: Its hidden ability, Sniper, makes critical hits dealt by it stronger
name: Beedrill

text: According to the Pokédex, Beedrill can fly at great speeds and can attack in swarms
name: Beedrill

text: Additionally, its three stingers all secrete a toxic poison, with the stinger on its rear being the most venomous
name: Beedrill

text: Mega Beedril's arms secrete fast acting poison, used to immobilize foes, then finishes them off with its long acting poison from its abdomen
name: Beedrill

text: Beedrill is the final evolution of Weedle and evolves from Kakuna at level 10
name: Beedrill

text: Beedrill gains a Mega Evolution in Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire
name: Beedrill

text: Beedrill is an insect Pokémon which mostly resembles a bipedal, yellow wasp however, it only has four legs instead of six and lacks pigment pits
name: Beedrill

text: Beedrill's head is round with a slightly pointed mouth large, red eyes and black antennae with a sharp bend in the middle
name: Beedrill

text: Its forelegs are tipped with long, conical stingers
name: Beedrill

text: It stands on its other two legs, which are long, segmented, and insectoid in shape
name: Beedrill

text: Beedrill has two pairs of rounded, veined wings, and another stinger on its yellow-and-black striped abdomen
name: Beedrill

text: The abdomen stinger contains Beedrill's most potent poison
name: Beedrill

text: Beedrill is highly territorial and unlike real bees, Beedrill live in colonies rather than true hives, and they work together to solve basic problems regarding food, territory and reproduction (behavior more similar to that of wasps than of bees)
name: Beedrill

text: As seen in the anime, Beedrill seems to be especially concerned with the welfare of Weedle and Kakuna and it will respond aggressively to those that disturb them
name: Beedrill

text: Disturbing one Beedrill will cause the whole colony to attack
name: Beedrill

text: It flies at high speed and attacks using the large venomous stingers on its forelegs and abdomen
name: Beedrill

text: It will then take the victims of its attacks back to its nest for food

text: Pidgey resembles a small, plump-bodied bird
name: Pidgey

text: It is brown in color, with a cream-colored throat and belly
name: Pidgey

text: The tips of its wings share the same color
name: Pidgey

text: Both its feet and beak are a pinkish-gray color
name: Pidgey

text: Its plumage is fairly nondescript, particularly compared to its evolutions, Pidgeotto and Pidgeot
name: Pidgey

text: It has black markings around its eyes and a small crest of brown and cream feathers above its eyes
name: Pidgey

text: It resembles other small flying-type Pokémon, such as Starly, Taillow, and Spearow
name: Pidgey

text: However, due to the fact that this Pokémon tend to be unique to a region, with the exception of Spearow, it is likely that they are a result of convergent evolution
name: Pidgey

text: Pidgey are very docile Pokémon that prefer to avoid confrontation with other Pokémon and humans altogether, hiding in tall grass to prevent themselves from being seen
name: Pidgey

text: If cornered, though, they will attempt to escape by using Sand Attack to blind foes or Whirlwind to blow them away and buy themselves time to fly away
name: Pidgey

text: When hunting, however, Pidgey often use these attacks to stir up their surroundings, exposing vulnerable insects for them to chase down
name: Pidgey

text: These Pokémon have extremely keen senses of direction
name: Pidgey

text: They can always find their way back to their nests regardless of how far they have flown
name: Pidgey

text: Because of this, Pidgey were commonly used to send messages in the Kanto and Johto regions (much like the Wingull of Hoenn), at least until the advent of e-mail
name: Pidgey

text: Many Pidgey have grown accustomed to and now dwell in urban areas due to this practice, flying to forests and fields only to hunt for food before returning to their nests in cities
name: Pidgey

text: Some people still train Pidgey to deliver messages as a way of preserving tradition
name: Pidgey

text: When on the ground, Pidgey flaps its wings to kick up sand and dust that blinds its opponents
name: Pidgey

text: It has an excellent sense of direction and homing instincts
name: Pidgey

text: It can locate its nest even when far removed from familiar surroundings
name: Pidgey

text: These skills enable it to be easily trained to deliver messages
name: Pidgey

text: Pidgey are shown to be prey for Pokémon such as Meowth
name: Pidgey

text: Their eggs are often the victim of hungry Ekans
name: Pidgey

text: Pidgey evolves into Pidgeotto starting at level 18, and from Pidgeotto, evolves into Pidgeot starting at level 36
name: Pidgey

text: Pidgey is a small, plump-bodied avian Pokémon
name: Pidgey

text: On top of its head is a short crest of three tufts
name: Pidgey

text: The center crest feathers are brown and the outer two tufts are cream-colored

name: Pidgey

text: Angular black marking extend from behind its eyes and continue down its cheeks
name: Pidgey

text: It has a short, stubby beak and feet with two toes in front and one in back
name: Pidgey

text: Both its beak and feet are a grayish-pink
name: Pidgey

name: Pidgey

name: Pidgey

text: It can travel straight back to its nest regardless of how far away they might have flown

text: Pidgeotto resembles a small hawk and is brightly colored with red and yellow feathers

text: Pidgeotto is known to be carnivorous as they are shown to prey on several Pokémon such as Exeggcute, Caterpie, and Magikarp

name: Pidgeotto

name: Pidgeotto

text: In Generation III, Feather Dance was its signature move

text: Pidgeot resembles a large, feathery bird with huge wings

name: Pidgeot

text: Many trainers are drawn to Pidgeot because of its lovely feathers

text: The beautiful colors of its crest are particularly striking

text: It is easily confused with Pidgeotto because the only difference without a relative size comparison is that Pigeot's tail and crest coloring switch from those of Pidgeotto's

text: Pidgeot is even more dangerous than its previous evolutionary stage
name: Pidgeot

text: This is because it is bulkier and more aggressive than Pidgeotto, enabling it to catch much bigger prey

text: A favorite target is Magikarp, which Pidgeot can spot from a great distance
name: Pidgeot

text: Trainers should be very careful when approaching this Pokémon in the wild
name: Pidgeot

text: While still territorial, they no longer attack others for simply entering their turfs rather, they wait and use their keen eyesight to watch from far away, seeing whether their intruders have ill intentions
name: Pidgeot

text: If they are not endangering the Pokémon or their offspring, they will leave them be

text: However, they will defeat potential threats without hesitation using their powerful chest muscles to whip up windstorms strong enough to bend tall trees
name: Pidgeot

text: When approached, Pidgeot will spread out their wings to intimidate foes

text: If the tactic fails, they will quickly resort to flapping their wings to create powerful gusts before attacking with their talons
name: Pidgeot

text: The beautiful, glossy feathers on their heads are symbols of speed in popular culture

text: 2mph)
