text: Rattata is rat-like, with large incisors, a slight hump on its back towards the rear, a slightly pudgy belly, and a whisker on both sides
name: Rattata

text: Female Rattata have shorter whiskers than the males
name: Rattata

text: The fur of a normal variant is purple, with a white or cream colored underside: the fur of an Alolan variant is black with dark cram underside
name: Rattata

text: Rattata have red eyes, with no obvious pupils
name: Rattata

text: The tail is long, and curled slightly at the tip
name: Rattata

text: Rattata have three-toed paws, which are the same color as its underbelly
name: Rattata

text: Rattata that live in the Alola region have black fur instead of the usual purple
name: Rattata

text: Their undersides are now a darker beige color and their fur is much scruffier, leaving their whiskers as tufts that resemble a moustache
name: Rattata

text: The inside of their ears is also a dark blue color
name: Rattata

text: Rattata's teeth grow very quickly and they can survive almost anywhere
name: Rattata

text: It's happy to nest just about anywhere
name: Rattata

text: They also utilize their teeth so they can use attacks such as Super Fang and Bite
name: Rattata

text: Rattata is always on the alert
name: Rattata

text: Even while asleep, Rattata constantly moves its ears to listen around
name: Rattata

text: Alolan Rattata are very aware of their surroundings, even changing the way they act in order to evade Yungoos
name: Rattata

text: They are nocturnal and form big nests with an Alolan Raticate leader
name: Rattata

text: They are known to sneak into people's homes and steal food, fresh or spoiled, while returning the food to their dens where it is either stored or given to the Raticate leader of the den
name: Rattata

text: Rattata evolves into Raticate starting at level 20
name: Rattata

text: Rattata is a small, quadrupedal rodent Pokémon
name: Rattata

text: It has purple fur with a cream-colored face, paws, and underbelly
name: Rattata

text: It has narrow eyes containing white sclera and pupil with red irises, rounded ears with cream-colored insides, and a single whisker on each cheek
name: Rattata

text: Its long tail is tightly curled at the end
name: Rattata

text: Its most notable feature is its large teeth
name: Rattata

text: Like most rodents, its teeth grow continuously throughout its life and must be worn down by gnawing
name: Rattata

text: A female Rattata will have shorter whiskers and lighter fur
name: Rattata

text: Rattata can live wherever it can find food, which it searches for most of the day
name: Rattata

text: Thanks to its sharp fangs, it is able to chew on nearly anything
name: Rattata

text: When it is threatened, Rattata can deliver a powerful bite
name: Rattata

text: Prior to Generation IV, Hyper Fang and Super Fang were its signature moves
name: Rattata

text: Rattata constantly keep their ears up and will immediately scurry away from the slightest sound
name: Rattata

text: Furret is the natural predator of Rattata
name: Rattata

text: Its hardiness lets it live in many environments, although it mainly lives on plains and savannas
name: Rattata

text: Because it reproduces so quickly, a pair of Rattata can quickly colonize an area
name: Rattata

text: Rattata are non-native to Alola and arrived in cargo ships
name: Rattata

text: The Rattata population in Alola was booming until Yungoos was imported as a control measure
name: Rattata

text: In order to avoid these new predators, Rattata altered its habits
name: Rattata

text: It moved to more urban areas, became nocturnal, and formed large nests led by Raticate
name: Rattata

text: 1 Alolan Rattata searches out fresh food by smell and ignore anything spoiled
name: Rattata

text: It has even been known to sneak into people's homes to find food
name: Rattata

text: It has dark gray fur and grayish-purple ear insides
name: Rattata

text: There are two tufts of fur on each ear and near the tip of its tail
name: Rattata

text: Its long, thin whiskers are replaced by shorter, thicker tufts of fur as well
name: Rattata

text: The line where its cream underbelly meets its gray fur is ragged instead of smooth
name: Rattata

text: This variant of Rattata is the shortest Dark-type
name: Rattata

text: Compared to Rattata, Raticate is far more of a predator, and the majority of its features are adapted for this purpose
name: Raticate

text: Its most notable feature are its large teeth like most rodents, Raticate's teeth grow continuously throughout its life, and must be constantly worn down by gnawing
name: Raticate

text: It is also known that Raticate's fangs are tough enough to break through concrete
name: Raticate

text: It has long whiskers and a long tail
name: Raticate

text: Raticate looks like a pudgy rat, just like Rattata
name: Raticate

text: Raticate tends to stand on its hind legs, as opposed to its pre-evolution
name: Raticate

text: Raticate in Alola have grown black fur to help camouflage themselves due to their nocturnal nature
name: Raticate

text: They now sport a pair of squinted eyes with red irises and a face with large cream-colored cheeks that have four whiskers below them and two pairs of whiskers sprouting out
name: Raticate

text: A patch on their stomach as well as the inside of their ears is a brown
name: Raticate

text: Raticate remain just as much a nuisance to homeowners, only more aggressive
name: Raticate

text: Luckily, however, they also live in smaller groups, as large groups Rattata generally split into groups of 8 to 10 or so upon evolution
name: Raticate

text: If a Raticate feels threatened, it will stand on its hind legs and let out a shrill shriek, calling its groupmates to join and defend it
name: Raticate

text: The best way to defend against Raticate in the home is to prevent Rattata from invading in the first place before they evolve
name: Raticate

text: Alternatively, Persian and Purugly can also deal with Raticate
name: Raticate

text: An Alolan Raticate will exert control over a group of Alolan Rattata that it will send out to search for food
name: Raticate

text: Since these Pokémon are primarily urban, they can find calorie-dense foods much more easily additionally, since these bosses rarely leave their nests, they do not have to burn much energy on hunting or moving
name: Raticate

text: Alolan Raticate can afford to be very picky about their food because they obtain so much of it, stockpiling the bulk of what their underlings bring in their nests
name: Raticate

text: They have highly developed taste buds that help them discern the freshest items
name: Raticate

text: Ironically, this makes them useful to restaurant chefs, who often employ them in places where their cousins would be seen as pests
name: Raticate

text: Alolan Raticate are fiercely territorial against others of their kind, engaging in 'turf wars' where Alolan Rattata groups fight one another for control
name: Raticate

text: Only when all of its underlings have fallen will an Alolan Raticate emerge to fight on its own
name: Raticate

text: Their webbed feet
name: Raticate

text: a trait they share with their mainland relatives, enable them to swim from island to island with surprising ease
name: Raticate

text: To compensate for its steadily growing teeth, Raticate gnaws on hard things such as buildings, even being able to topple them down when doing so
name: Raticate

text: Also, its webbed feet allow it to swim well when it hunts
name: Raticate

text: Alolan Raticate live in dens created by Alolan Rattata
name: Raticate

text: They order Rattata to collect food for it, which is stockpiled in the dens
name: Raticate

text: Despite the Rattata's tendency to steal any food, fresh or spoiled, Raticate prefers to eat only the best of the Rattata's stolen goods, usually eating nutrient foods such as Berries
name: Raticate

text: Raticate evolves from Rattata starting at level 20
name: Raticate

text: Raticate is a large, rodent-like Pokémon
name: Raticate

text: Although it is often depicted on its hind legs, it is a quadruped
name: Raticate

text: It is primarily tawny-colored with a cream underside
name: Raticate

text: It has narrow black eyes, ears with ragged edges and dark insides, and large incisors that grow constantly
name: Raticate

text: There are three whiskers on each side of its face, which it uses to maintain balance
name: Raticate

text: It has short arms with three-fingered hands and webbed feet with three toes
name: Raticate

text: The webbing on its feet allows it to swim
name: Raticate

text: Its tail is long and scaly
name: Raticate

text: A female will have shorter whiskers and lighter fur
name: Raticate

text: If attacked, Raticate stands up on its hind legs, bares its fangs and shrieks in an intimidating manner at its enemy
name: Raticate

text: It is willing to take on larger foes if provoked enough
name: Raticate

text: Its teeth are strong enough to gnaw through steel and their constant growth means it often needs to gnaw on something, like rocks and logs
name: Raticate

text: It may even chew on the walls of houses, and is capable of chewing through cinderblocks and toppling concrete buildings
name: Raticate

text: Prior to Generation IV, Hyper Fang and Super Fang were its signature moves
name: Raticate

text: This Pokémon typically lives in plains and savannas
name: Raticate

text: In Alola, Raticate has become heavier and darker due to its urban environment and higher calorie diet
name: Raticate

text: 1 Its fur is mostly black with a brown, leaf-shaped patch on its belly and brown inside its ears
name: Raticate

text: Its hands, feet, cheeks, and tail are a whitish-cream color, and its hands are much smaller
name: Raticate

text: It has large, puffy cheeks with four whiskers under its chin and two sprouting sideways from the top of each cheek
name: Raticate

text: Its large incisors are still visible, but its eyes are now red
name: Raticate

text: This variant uses its nest as a food stockpile, and generally prefers to have the Alolan Rattata it commands to go out and forage for food while it remains in its nest and eats
name: Raticate

text: It is selective in what it eats, however, only eating fresh, high-quality foods, such as fruits
name: Raticate

text: Rumor has it that a certain high-class restaurant even exploits this selectivity, bringing Raticate along to buy ingredients and letting it taste test new dishes
name: Raticate

text: Spearow are an avian species of Pokémon characterized by its short stature, brown body, and pale red wings
name: Spearow

text: Its underbelly is beige while possessing a dark brown plumage on its head
name: Spearow

text: Spearow's rear is black and its tail feathers are a shade of brown
name: Spearow

text: Like all birds, it is equipped with talons used for manipulating objects or self-defense
name: Spearow

text: Spearow prey on insects, and sometimes Sunkern, in grassy areas by flushing them out with their stubby wings, and plucking at them with their beaks
name: Spearow

text: Spearow are very territorial, constantly buzzing about and calling with a loud cry that can be heard from half a mile away
name: Spearow

text: This cry serves to scare away predators and to keep in touch with other Spearow, though the latter is reserved as an alarm to its kind
name: Spearow

text: They are noted for being frail, for which they make up for with their Mirror Move ability
name: Spearow

text: Eggs laid by Spearow are known to be prey for hungry Ekans, which are known to be able to swallow them whole
name: Spearow

text: Spearow evolves into Fearow at level 20
name: Spearow

text: Spearow is an avian Pokémon that is very small
name: Spearow

text: It has rough, brown plumage on its head and three brown tail feathers
name: Spearow

text: It has narrow, dark brown eyes with white pupils and a short, hooked beak that is light pink
name: Spearow

text: The feathers covering its wings are pinkish-red with lighter tips, and it has a beige underside with two thin, horizontal stripes
name: Spearow

text: Its light pink feet have two toes in front and one in the back
name: Spearow

text: Black feathers cover its back
name: Spearow

text: Although inept at other aspects of its flying, such as height and distance, Spearow is still capable of flying quickly to protect its territory
name: Spearow

text: However, it must flap its wings at high speeds to stay aloft
name: Spearow

text: Spearow's loud shrieks can be heard over half a mile (one kilometer) away, and are used to warn other of its kind of danger
name: Spearow

text: In the anime, Spearow is revealed to see in black and white and will chase its foes in a large flock
name: Spearow

text: Spearow are found naturally in open habitats with warmer climates, mainly desolate wastelands and fields, where it hunts for insects
name: Spearow

text: Ekans is a natural predator of Spearow
name: Spearow

text: Fearow is a large, mostly brown bird Pokémon with a vulturine neck and broad, powerful wings
name: Fearow

text: It has a large wingspan, an elongated neck, and a thin, long beak: all characteristics being a radical departure from its short-winged, stubby-beaked, pre-evolved form, Spearow
name: Fearow

text: Like Spearow, Fearow are very territorial luckily for travelers, though, they prefer to keep to themselves, only attacking those who draw too near to their nests or young
name: Fearow

text: They use their narrow beaks to dig through soil or reach below the water to catch prey if needed
name: Fearow

text: Because they are known to attack Pokémon often viewed as “cute” and “popular”, such as Pichu, Fearow are often maligned in popular culture as wicked, heartless fighters
name: Fearow

text: However, anyone who has ever raised a Fearow know that while wary and sometimes aggressive to strangers, they can also be very loyal and protective Pokémon archaeologists have found carvings of them protecting people in Johto
name: Fearow

text: Fearow uses its great wings to catch air currents and effortlessly glide over large distances for as long as a day without having to land or rest
name: Fearow

text: It flies high into the sky, and swoops down at its prey
name: Fearow

text: By using a combination of its neck and beak, it has a long reach, allowing it to pluck bugs from the ground or easily pluck prey from soil or water as it swoops down
name: Fearow

text: If it senses danger, it avoids it if possible
name: Fearow

text: Fearow evolves from Spearow at level 20
name: Fearow

text: Fearow is a large, mostly brown avian Pokémon with a vulturine neck and broad, powerful wings
name: Fearow

text: It has a long, pointed, pink beak and a decorative red coxcomb on top of its head
name: Fearow

text: Its narrow eyes have very small pupils and do not appear to have colored irises
name: Fearow

text: It has shaggy, feathers at the base of its neck and covering the upper portion of its wings
name: Fearow

text: These feathers are cream-colored, as are the tips of its flight feathers
name: Fearow

text: Its sharp-clawed talons are pink, with three toes pointing forward and one pointing backward
name: Fearow

text: Fearow has been around mostly unchanged for many years, as a Pokémon resembling it has been seen on ancient murals
name: Fearow

text: Its large wings and stamina allow it to fly for an entire day without landing
name: Fearow

text: Its long neck and beak allow it to pluck prey from both land and water, and it has even been known to steal from unwary humans
name: Fearow

text: It will shoot upward, and then dive down to catch prey
name: Fearow

text: It will also catch tiny insects that hide underground and circle the ocean for fish
name: Fearow

text: Fearow are found naturally in open habitats with warmer climates, mainly wastelands and desolate fields
name: Fearow

text: Ekans is a snake-like Pokémon with purple and yellow coloring
name: Ekans

text: Its underside leading to its tail is yellow, and it has a yellow rattle at the tip of its tail
name: Ekans

text: Ekans have large, yellow eyes with slit, reptilian pupils
name: Ekans

text: Across its neck is a large, yellow band
name: Ekans

text: Ekans, like real snakes, have the ability to unhinge their jaws
name: Ekans

text: Ekans also share other characteristics with snakes, such as using its tongue to test the air for the presence of prey and shedding its skin
name: Ekans

text: An Ekans will lose its rattle once it evolves into Arbok
name: Ekans

text: Ekans often live in tall grassy areas where they slither with great stealth
name: Ekans

text: Ekans is also known to prey on Pokémon such as Pidgey, Spearow, and their eggs
name: Ekans

text: Though often associated as a land Pokémon, they are capable of swimming long distances
name: Ekans

text: When threatened in the wild, it will rattle its tail, flick its tongue to get its surroundings, and might use the move Glare to scare the opponent and have a possible getaway
name: Ekans

text: Ekans evolves into Arbok at level 22
name: Ekans

text: Ekans is a purple, serpentine Pokémon
name: Ekans

text: Its eyes, underbelly, the thick stripe around its neck, and rattle are yellow
name: Ekans

text: Ekans has three pairs of black lines encircling its body, as well as another line that connects to each slit-pupiled eye and curves toward its nose
name: Ekans

text: Its large mouth has a round, pink tongue and no visible teeth
name: Ekans

text: While painful, a newborn Ekans's bite is not venomous
name: Ekans

text: This Pokémon grows longer with age
name: Ekans

text: Ekans lives in grassy savannas and plains, where it moves stealthily through grass
name: Ekans

text: It can also be found in forests and desolate wastelands, where it preys on Eggs from Pidgey and Spearow nests, but will strike other prey from behind
name: Ekans

text: By flicking its tongue out, it is able to detect danger and the scent of prey
name: Ekans

text: Its jaw can detach to swallow large prey, but such a meal can make Ekans too heavy to move or become stuck and cause it to faint
name: Ekans

text: It wraps itself around tree branches at night to rest
name: Ekans

text: If not in a tree, it will coil itself up—a position in which it can defend itself from all directions
name: Ekans

text: In the second movie, it is revealed to possess some swimming abilities
name: Ekans

text: In Generation I, Glare was its signature move
name: Ekans

text: Arbok bears a resemblance to a cobra, with the majority of its body being purple
name: Arbok

text: Arbok has a hood much like a cobra, though it has never been shown to be able to retract it
name: Arbok

text: There is a red, black and yellow pattern on their hood that looks somewhat like an angry face to intimidate other Pokémon
name: Arbok

text: It is known that there are six different patterns on Arbok, each one appearing in a different generation
name: Arbok

text: This Pokémon is extremely territorial
name: Arbok

text: Arbok are known to be vengeful and are absolutely ruthless in pursuing anyone or thing that angers them
name: Arbok

text: They are also known to hunt smaller Pokémon like Woopers and are capable of slithering to higher places such as trees to do so
name: Arbok

text: Arbok has the abilities Intimidate and Shed Skin along with the hidden ability Unnerve
name: Arbok

text: Intimidate lowers the opponent's attack stat when the player enters battle while Shed Skin cures Arbok from status ailments at the end of a turn with a 30% chance
name: Arbok

text: Unnerve prevents the opponent from eating its berry
name: Arbok

text: A powerful constrictor, Arbok can crush a steel barrel in its mighty coils
name: Arbok

text: Arbok is the evolved form of Ekans, as of level 22
name: Arbok

text: Arbok is a serpentine Pokémon that resembles a cobra
name: Arbok

text: It has narrow eyes and several sharp teeth
name: Arbok

text: Just below its head is a large hood with a face-like pattern
name: Arbok

text: This pattern has over 20 possible variations
name: Arbok

text: The pattern typically has two red and yellow eyespots outlined in black, a wide black streak resembling an upturned mouth, and a black V-shaped stripe above the eyespots
name: Arbok

text: Arbok is capable of crushing opponents by coiling its body around them and squeezing them tightly
name: Arbok

text: It can even flatten steel oil drums
name: Arbok

text: If it encounters an enemy, it raises its head, mimics, and stuns the opponent using the frightening pattern on its body
name: Arbok

text: It can also make eerie sounds by expelling air from its mouth
name: Arbok

text: It has been stated that if any part of Arbok's body except for the head is cut off, it can regrow the rest of its body again in a matter of a few weeks
name: Arbok

text: It also has the ability to detect vibrations as shown in the anime
name: Arbok

text: Arbok has been known to be capable of spending long periods underwater and surviving in aquatic environments
name: Arbok

text: One particular Arbok could change its pattern at any time to increase power to different stats and get invulnerability to status conditions, if the pattern is uncovered
name: Arbok

text: Arbok is territorial
name: Arbok

text: It lashes out at intruders with long fangs tipped with deadly venom
name: Arbok

text: Vengeful in nature, it will not give up a chase once it targets its prey or an opponent, no matter how far
name: Arbok

text: It makes its home in grassy savannas and plains, but it can also be found in forests and desolate wastelands alongside its pre-evolved form Ekans
name: Arbok

text: In the wild, it hunts smaller Pokémon such as Wooper, and also preys on Pidgey and Spearow Eggs
name: Arbok

text: When hunting, it uses the pattern on its hood to immobilize prey, then it begins constricting them, and it finally poisons the target to finish them off and eat them
name: Arbok

text: In Generation I, Glare was its signature move
name: Arbok

text: Pikachu are small, and cute mouse-like Pokémon
name: Pikachu

text: They are almost completely covered by yellow fur
name: Pikachu

text: They have long yellow ears that are tipped with black
name: Pikachu

text: A Pikachu's back has two brown stripes, and its large tail is notable for being shaped like a lightning bolt, yet its brown tip is almost always forgotten
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu have short arms with five tiny fingers on forehands and three sharp fingers on their hind legs
name: Pikachu

text: On its cheeks are two circle-shaped red pouches used for storing electricity
name: Pikachu

text: They turn yellow and spark with electricity when it's about to use an Electric attack, such as Thunderbolt
name: Pikachu

text: It has also been known to generate small surges of electrical energy in anger or for protection, like in the anime
name: Pikachu

text: A female Pikachu looks almost exactly the same as a male, with the exception of her tail, which is rounded at the end and has an inward dent, giving it the appearance of a heart
name: Pikachu

text: However, in earlier anime episodes, and in the games prior to Generation IV, female and male Pikachu look identical
name: Pikachu

text: As Gigantamax Pikachu, it becomes larger and chubbier (similar to its Generation 1 design)
name: Pikachu

text: Its tail becomes longer and stores all of the electricity it generates, causing it to glow a bright yellow and enabling it to become as powerful as a Iightning strike
name: Pikachu

text: Its power is equal to that a power plant however, it is difficult to use it in peoples' homes since Pikachu can only remain in its Gigantamax form for a short time
name: Pikachu

text: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity can cause lightning storms
name: Pikachu

text: A Shiny Pikachu is slightly orange
name: Pikachu

text: In A Plethora of Pikachu!, according to Pikala, the fur from Pikachu in the Kanto region sparkles in sunlight, while the Pikachu from Alola fur is silky smooth and shines in sunlight
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu are usually friendly creatures that love to be cuddled
name: Pikachu

text: They love having their tails rubbed, especially at the base they also like being stroked
name: Pikachu

text: However, if threatened or angered, this Pokémon can be quite aggressive
name: Pikachu

text: If someone pulls or steps on its tail, it is most likely it will bite or shock anyone in the area, including the one who pulled its tail
name: Pikachu

text: However, in the anime and in the wild of the Kanto region they live in big groups deep in forests and are wary of humans
name: Pikachu

text: In Kanto according to Ash in PJ035, Pikachu also greet one another by shocking them and sometimes they'll gather up in big groups to search for Thunderstones so they can evolve
name: Pikachu

text: The Pikachu that live in the Pikachu Valley in Alola in the anime, greet each other by sniffing one another and rubbing their tails together
name: Pikachu

text: Also, they can start duels with one another by sending electric signals and the winner is decided when the opponent's tail is bitten
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu's special ability is Static, which can cause paralysis in battle if hit by a physical move
name: Pikachu

text: In Pokémon Black and White's Dream World, the Trainer receives a Pikachu with the Lightning Rod ability
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu are capable of learning Volt Tackle, a powerful Electric-type physical move exclusive to the Pikachu family of Pokémon
name: Pikachu

text: Partner Pikachu is also capable to learning special moves: Zippy Zap, Floaty Fall, Splishy Splash, and the Partner Power, Pika Papow
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu is one of the few Pokémon in Sun and Moon which have a special Z-Move dedicated to them
name: Pikachu

text: The Z-Move Catastropika is Pikachu's signature move
name: Pikachu

text: The move is activated by the Z-Crystal, Pikanium Z
name: Pikachu

text: Its base is Volt Tackle
name: Pikachu

text: Catastropika can be learned only by a Pikachu with Volt Tackle, and becomes unusable if Volt Tackle is forgotten or if the Pikachu evolves into Raichu
name: Pikachu

text: The Z-Move 10,000,000 Volt Thunderbolt is Ash Pikachu's signature move
name: Pikachu

text: The move is activated by the Z-Crystal, Pikashunium Z
name: Pikachu

text: Its base is Thunderbolt
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu, being an Electric-type, is capable of using the Z-Crystal, Electrium Z, to use the Z Move Gigavolt Havoc
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu is one of the 32 Pokémon in Sword and Shield that can Gigantamax by having a special member from it species or, with The Isle of Armor Expansion Pass, using Max Soup on a Pikachu
name: Pikachu

text: Gigantamax Pikachu is the only known Pokémon capable of using the G-Max Move, G-Max Volt Crash
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu evolves into a Raichu by using a Thunder Stone
name: Pikachu

text: It evolves from Pichu when its happiness is maxed with the trainer in game
name: Pikachu

text: It will evolve into Alolan Raichu if using a Thunder Stone in the Alola region
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu is a short, chubby rodent Pokémon
name: Pikachu

text: It is covered in yellow fur with two horizontal brown stripes on its back
name: Pikachu

text: It has a small mouth, long, pointed ears with black tips, and brown eyes
name: Pikachu

text: Each cheek is a red circle that contains a pouch for electricity storage
name: Pikachu

text: It has short forearms with five fingers on each paw, and its feet each have three toes
name: Pikachu

text: At the base of its lightning bolt-shaped tail is a patch of brown fur
name: Pikachu

text: A female will have a V-shaped notch at the end of its tail, which looks like the top of a heart
name: Pikachu

text: It is classified as a quadruped, but it has been known to stand and walk on its hind legs
name: Pikachu

text: The anime has shown that wild Pikachu live in groups in forested areas
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu communicate amongst themselves using squeaks and tail-shaking as friendly gestures
name: Pikachu

text: In the anime, Alolan Pikachu are known to greet each other by sniffing one another and rubbing their tails together
name: Pikachu

text: Electricity can be used to receive and send messages with each other, as well as other Electric Pokémon species
name: Pikachu

text: It raises its tail to check its surroundings and is occasionally struck by lightning in this position
name: Pikachu

text: When groups grow, they can inadvertently cause lightning storms
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu forage for Berries, which it roasts with electricity to make them tender enough to eat
name: Pikachu

text: A sure sign that Pikachu inhabits a location is patches of burnt grass
name: Pikachu

text: It has been observed eating and sometimes destroying telephone poles, wires, and other electronic equipment
name: Pikachu

text: By occasion, it can get unintentionally swallowed by Cramorant
name: Pikachu

text: While startled, it looks for ways to escape from the latter
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu charges itself while sleeping overnight, though stress and a lack of sleep can affect this
name: Pikachu

text: It is able to release electric discharges of varying intensity
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu has been known to build up energy in its glands, which it will need to discharge to avoid complications
name: Pikachu

text: It is also able to release energy through its tail, which acts as a grounding rod, as well as recharging fellow Pikachu with electric shocks
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu has three alternate forms: the first one, Cosplay Pikachu, appeared exclusively in Pokémon Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire
name: Pikachu

text: It is always female, has a black heart-shaped spot at the end of its tail, and can be dressed in any of five outfits corresponding to the five Contest conditions
name: Pikachu

text: The second form is Pikachu in a cap, which debuted as an event-exclusive Pokémon in Generation VII
name: Pikachu

text: It is always male and has eight variants, each wearing one of Ash's hats from the anime
name: Pikachu

text: In addition to these two forms, many other Pikachu variants have appeared in various media
name: Pikachu

text: The last, the partner Pikachu, is the Pokémon the player starts with in Pokémon: Let's Go, Pikachu!
name: Pikachu

text: This Pikachu can be either gender, has higher base stats, and has access to moves that normal Pikachu do not
name: Pikachu

text: As Gigantamax Pikachu, it becomes larger and chubbier
name: Pikachu

text: Its tail becomes longer and becomes capable of storing all of the electricity it generates, causing it to glow a bright yellow and enabling it to become as powerful as a lightning strike
name: Pikachu

text: Three red clouds float around the tail
name: Pikachu

text: Its power is equal to that of a power plant however, it is difficult to use it in peoples' homes since Pikachu can only remain in its Gigantamax form for a short time
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu and its evolutionary relatives are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Volt Tackle
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu is the only known Pokémon capable of using the Z-Move Catastropika
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu is also the only known Pokémon capable of using the Light Ball item
name: Pikachu

text: Pikachu in a cap is the only known Pokémon capable of using the Z-Move 10,000,000 Volt Thunderbolt
name: Pikachu

text: The partner Pikachu is the only known Pokémon capable of learning the moves Zippy Zap, Floaty Fall, and Splishy Splash, as well as the partner power Pika Papow
name: Pikachu

text: Gigantamax Pikachu is the only known Pokémon capable of using the G-Max Move G-Max Volt Crash
name: Pikachu

text: Raichu is a rodent-like Pokémon, similar to its previous evolution forms
name: Raichu

text: Unlike Pichu or Pikachu, which both have yellow fur, Raichu has orange fur with two strips ofbrown fur on its back
name: Raichu

text: It has long ears and feet, but has little stubby arms with no noticeable fingers
name: Raichu

text: Additionally, its electrical sacs are yellow, unlike its previous form's red coloring
name: Raichu

text: It has a plump white belly, the tips of its arms and toes are brown
name: Raichu

text: The soles of its feet are tan-colored and the paw pads on the undersides are yellowish orange
name: Raichu

text: Raichu also have a long, thin, black tail that ends in a large lightning bolt shape
name: Raichu

text: Alolan Raichu slightly resembles an Audino
name: Raichu

text: Its tail is now in an oval shape that allows Raichu to stand on it as if it is actually surfing
name: Raichu

text: Alolan Raichu also now has bright blue eyes, darker skin tone, white hands and feet, and yellow ears pointing upwards
name: Raichu

text: Male Kantonian Raichu have tips on their lightning bolt tails while females have flat ends on them
name: Raichu

text: Unlike their Kantonian counterparts, Alolan Raichu do not sport any visual differences between males and females
name: Raichu

text: Raichu is more confident, faithful and powerful than Pikachu, which makes them rivals, but sometimes it is just as friendly and cute
name: Raichu

text: However, if it stores too much electricity in its body, it can become extremely short-tempered and aggressive
name: Raichu

text: Yet, some of them are timid and will run away from people
name: Raichu

text: Usually, Alolan Raichu are often more playful than their normal counterparts
name: Raichu

text: They use their surfboard-like tails to ride waves and to float in mid-air
name: Raichu

text: When their cheeks are rubbed, they emit both electricity and a sweet-smelling aroma
name: Raichu

text: Locals of the Alola region often states that Raichu got this change from eating lots of fluffy pancakes, which are a common delicacy in the Alola region
name: Raichu

text: Raichu can generate electricity through its cheeks and electrocute its opponents
name: Raichu

text: The highest amount of electricity it can discharge to take down its foes are 100,000 volts
name: Raichu

text: When or not in battle a Raichu can use its long tail to grab and restrain opponents or hold and carry things seen in PJ018 and PJ036
name: Raichu

text: Its tail can also serve as a ground to protect itself from high voltage power
name: Raichu

text: Being part-Psychic-type, Alolan Raichu can also learn Psychic apart from learning Electric type moves
name: Raichu

text: It can discharge star-shaped thunderbolts
name: Raichu

text: Able to control psychic powers, Alolan Raichu gathers psykenosis into its tail and uses it to ride around
name: Raichu

text: When you scrub its cheek pouches, they emit very sweet aroma
name: Raichu

text: Raichu is the evolved form of Pikachu, and the final evolutionary form of Pichu
name: Raichu

text: Pikachu can evolve into either form of Raichu by the use of a Thunder Stone, but will only evolve into Alolan Raichu in Sun and Moon (and Ultra Sun and Ultra Moon unless it is evolved in Ultra Space)
name: Raichu

text: Before the release of Pokemon Bank for Sun and Moon, the normal form could not be obtained in either games without trading
name: Raichu

text: Raichu is a bipedal, rodent-like Pokémon
name: Raichu

text: Raichu is covered in dark orange fur with a white belly
name: Raichu

text: Its bifurcated ears are brown on the outside, yellow on the insides, and end in a distinctive curl
name: Raichu

text: There is a circular yellow marking on each cheek where its electric sacs are, and it has a triangular, dark brown nose
name: Raichu

text: Its arms and feet have patches of brown fur at the end, and the soles of its long feet are tan with a circular orange pad in the center
name: Raichu

text: On its back are two horizontal brown stripes
name: Raichu

text: Its long, thin tail has a lightning bolt-shaped end
name: Raichu

text: This lightning bolt is chipped on females
name: Raichu

text: Raichu exudes a weak electrical charge from all its body and glows slightly in the dark
name: Raichu

text: Raichu's tail is used to gather electricity from the atmosphere, or it can be planted in the ground to search for electricity
name: Raichu

text: It also protects Raichu from its own high voltage power
name: Raichu

text: Raichu can store over 100,000 volts of electricity, enough to knock out a Copperajah
name: Raichu

text: If Raichu's sacs are fully charged, its ears will stand straight up and its muscles become stimulated
name: Raichu

text: However, it will become aggressive if it has stored too much electricity and stress
name: Raichu

text: To keep from reaching this state, it discharges electricity through its tail into the ground
name: Raichu

text: This leads to scorched patches near its nest
name: Raichu

text: Being the result of evolution via Evolution stone, Raichu is rarely found in the wild, though they can be found in forests and woodlands
name: Raichu

text: The main reason Raichu is rarely seen in the wild is because people prefer the look it had as Pikachu
name: Raichu

text: In Alola, Raichu has lighter coloring and more rounded features
name: Raichu

text: Its eyes are blue with yellow half-circles along the bottom
name: Raichu

text: It has large yellow ears with an inner spiral toward the base and brown on the inside
name: Raichu

text: These ears are thicker and less pointed than a standard Raichu's ear
name: Raichu

text: In addition to its white belly, Alolan Raichu has white markings on its paws with bright yellow lines between its digits
name: Raichu

text: The stripes on its back have also turned white, and there is a small, white circular marking on each heel
name: Raichu

text: The lightning bolt-shaped tip of its tail has rounded edges
name: Raichu

text: By collecting its psychic power in its tail, it is able to ride it like a surfboard and float in the air
name: Raichu

text: While its cheek sacs are still used to store electricity, rubbing them releases a sweet aroma while also getting a light shock
name: Raichu

text: This is also thought to be connected to its Psychic abilities
name: Raichu

text: Alolan Raichu's origins were initially a mystery at the time
name: Raichu

text: The people of Alola suggested it ate too many sweet and fluffy pancakes,1 especially those made with a secret Alolan recipe
name: Raichu

text: However, researchers believe the change is related to Alolan Raichu's diet in general
name: Raichu

text: It is also believed the weather and climate of the Alola region played a role in the transformation
name: Raichu

text: Alolan Raichu is capable of unleashing star-shaped thunderbolts
name: Raichu

text: It is also known by the name hodad
name: Raichu

text: Raichu and its pre-evolved forms are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Volt Tackle
name: Raichu

text: Alolan Raichu is the only known Pokémon capable of using the Z-Move Stoked Sparksurfer
name: Raichu

text: Sandshrew has a white belly and a yellow back
name: Sandshrew

text: Its back resembles bricked pavement or walls
name: Sandshrew

text: It has a short tail, four short legs and a small head
name: Sandshrew

text: Sandshrew resembles an armadillo, and can curl into a very tight ball which is about the size of a basketball
name: Sandshrew

text: Alolan Sandshrew, having fled the desert due to frequent eruptions, has adapted to the cold climate of the snowy mountains
name: Sandshrew

text: This Sandshrew has a white belly and an ice blue back
name: Sandshrew

text: Its back resembles bricked pavement or walls albeit colored ice blue
name: Sandshrew

text: It has a short tail, four short legs and a small head
name: Sandshrew

text: The majority of its ice blue body is clad in steel-hard ice armor, also sporting the ice brick pattern
name: Sandshrew

text: Most Sandshrew are timid and they usually run away by digging holes
name: Sandshrew

text: Despite this nature, they can become braver and more courageous once they're trained by skilled trainers
name: Sandshrew

text: When their skin becomes wrinkled due to moisture, they head to volcanic areas and dry themselves out through laying on a spot with lots of geothermal heat
name: Sandshrew

text: They are implied to eat bug types
name: Sandshrew

text: When some Sandshrew first arrived at the islands of Alola, they tried to scrape out niches in lowland desert areas
name: Sandshrew

text: However, such places were plagued with frequent volcanic activity in Alola's past, making them unsuitable for most forms of life
name: Sandshrew

text: Though Sandshrew are somewhat accustomed to geothermic activity, the frequency of such disturbances was so great that were forced to flee to higher ground
name: Sandshrew

text: Today, Alolan Sandshrew inhabit snowy mountains
name: Sandshrew

text: Their skin has grown thicker and steel-like to help insulate them from the cold additionally, they are also covered in thin layers of ice
name: Sandshrew

text: Though this gives them great defensive capabilities, it also hinder their flexibility
name: Sandshrew

text: Consequently, Alolan Sandshew cannot curl up into balls like their mainland relatives
name: Sandshrew

text: To move, Alolan Sandshrew slide across slick ice on their bellies like curling stones
name: Sandshrew

text: A popular competition in Alolan festivals, in fact, is Sandshrew sliding, where contestants try to slide their Pokémon as far down the ice as possible
name: Sandshrew

text: Alolan Sandshrew also have developed claws that help them cling onto ice without slipping
name: Sandshrew

text: When attacked, they will hold tight to the slippery ground in order to keep their soft undersides safe from predators
name: Sandshrew

text: This compact form also keeps them low to the ground and prevents them from being blown about during powerful blizzards
name: Sandshrew

text: Thier diet is left unspecified
name: Sandshrew

text: Sandshrew, when in danger, can curl into a ball to defend itself
name: Sandshrew

text: They can also claw away sharp rock that impede their digging
name: Sandshrew

text: Alolan Sandshrew lack flexibility and cannot curl into a ball but have an excelling natural defense which makes up for this
name: Sandshrew

text: They also have natural maneuverability on ice
name: Sandshrew

text: Sandshrew evolves into Sandslash once it reaches level 22
name: Sandshrew

text: Alolan Sandshrew evolves into Alolan Sandslash when exposed to an Ice Stone
name: Sandshrew

text: Sandshrew is a bipedal pholidote Pokémon, but runs on all fours in the anime
name: Sandshrew

text: Its brick-patterned yellow hide is dry, tough, blends in with desert sand, and protects its soft white underbelly and muzzle
name: Sandshrew

text: Sandshrew has blue, almond-shaped eyes, a pointed snout, and triangular ears with white insides
name: Sandshrew

text: Its tail is thick and conical
name: Sandshrew

text: It has two long claws on each foot and three sharp claws on its forepaws, which are used to burrow
name: Sandshrew

text: Sandshrew spends much of its time hidden underground in deep burrows
name: Sandshrew

text: It only emerges to lunge and drag in passing Bug-type Pokémon
name: Sandshrew

text: Sandshrew can quickly curl into a tight ball to protect itself from great falls and opponents, but may also throw sand at attackers
name: Sandshrew

text: While its body can efficiently absorb water to facilitate life in the desert, Sandshrew has been found in caves as well
name: Sandshrew

text: It also lives deep underground in nests it has created from digging tunnels
name: Sandshrew

text: Should hard rocks get in the way of digging, Sandshrew will use its sharp claws to remove them before continuing to dig
name: Sandshrew

text: If it is too wet, its skin becomes wrinkly
name: Sandshrew

text: It dries itself out by using the geothermal heat near a volcano
name: Sandshrew

text: In the Alola region, Sandshrew migrated to snowy mountains due to the volcanic activity near the desert areas
name: Sandshrew

text: Its body is a light, icy blue, with a cream-colored belly and muzzle
name: Sandshrew

text: This results in Sandshrew developing a body of ice that is as hard as steel
name: Sandshrew

text: Thicker plates form a dome around its head and its ears resemble an igloo's entrances
name: Sandshrew

text: In adapting to this cold climate, its body became larger and heavier with a shell of ice covering its hide
name: Sandshrew

text: This steel-like covering grants it extra defense from predators like Sneasel, but it is unable to curl into a ball like its desert counterpart
name: Sandshrew

text: It can burrow itself in the snow to avoid being blown away by blizzards
name: Sandshrew

text: Predators, such as Weavile, exploit of its soft underbelly
name: Sandshrew

text: Alolan Sandshrew's claws allow it to move without slipping on icy surfaces, but it slides on its stomach when it needs to move quickly
name: Sandshrew

text: Sandslash is a tall, yellow, mammalian porcupine-like creature with brown quills on its back
name: Sandslash

text: It has two very long claws on each hand used for digging and battling
name: Sandslash

text: Sandslash can curl up to a small size just like its pre-evolved form Sandshrew, but it is of a much larger stature, which enhances its defense
name: Sandslash

text: Alolan Sandslash keeps the traits of its Alolan pre-evolution
name: Sandslash

text: It is a tall, ice blue mammalian porcupine-like creature with steel-hard, ice blue crystals on its back
name: Sandslash

text: It has two very long claws on each hand used for digging paths in the snow
name: Sandslash

text: The weight of the ice makes it slower than regular Sandslash
name: Sandslash

text: Sandslash is a resilient creature that lives in desert areas, particularly areas close to dry forests
name: Sandslash

text: It is commonly seen either climbing up trees or digging into the dusty ground, both activities which it is suited for thanks to its claws
name: Sandslash

text: However, though its claws are strong, they are not indestructible they occasionally snap when Sandslash digs at an incredibly fast pace
name: Sandslash

text: The claws will have started to grow back by the next day, though
name: Sandslash

text: The most notable behavior that Sandslash performs to cope with its environment is its method of curling up its body to become in essence a ball covered with large spikes, much like the hedgehog, armadillo, or pangolin
name: Sandslash

text: Sandslash rolls up so that the spikes shade its inner body from the sun and therefore prevent heatstroke that can result from the scorching heat that accompanies daytime in the desert
name: Sandslash

text: Sandslash is a fully-armed predator when dealing with other Pokémon in the desert areas that form its natural environment
name: Sandslash

text: When attacked, Sandslash rolls up into its spherical guise and its spikes arrange to form its defense, after which the Pokémon will either roll away to escape or roll towards the opponent to attack
name: Sandslash

text: When trying to flee in this manner, Sandslash exerts specific force on the ground to kick up small-but-blinding dust clouds in its wake, hoping to discourage other Pokémon from following it
name: Sandslash

text: When attacking in this manner, though, Sandslash proves itself adept at making the opponent flinch with the spikes of its rolling body just before uncoiling itself and hacking with its claws
name: Sandslash

text: It prefers attacking from higher elevations when targeting prey
name: Sandslash

text: It uses large, hooked claws to cut a path through deep snow as it runs
name: Sandslash

text: On snowy mountains, this Sandslash is faster than any other Pokémon
name: Sandslash

text: Many people climb snowy mountains, hoping to see the icy spikes of these Pokémon glistening in the light of dawn
name: Sandslash

text: Sandslash evolves from Sandshrew at level 22, and Alolan Sandslash evolves from Alolan Sandshrew when an Ice Stone is used on it
name: Sandslash

text: Sandslash is a bipedal, ground-dwelling pholidote Pokémon
name: Sandslash

text: Although Sandslash is usually bipedal, it can run on all fours
name: Sandslash

text: Most of its underside is light yellow with a white underbelly
name: Sandslash

text: It has a narrow muzzle, almond-shaped blue eyes, and a thick tail
name: Sandslash

text: Its back is mostly covered in sharp, brown quills formed from its tough, dry hide
name: Sandslash

text: It has two large claws on its paws and feet
name: Sandslash

text: These claws are its primary weapons and are used for slashing, but can also be used for burrowing
name: Sandslash

text: Its claws and spikes can both break off and are shed regularly, but grow back quickly
name: Sandslash

text: Sandslash's broken parts can be used as carving plows for tilling farm fields
name: Sandslash

text: The claws can become smoother if it lives in drier areas
name: Sandslash

text: It can curl into a large ball, which allows it to roll to attack or escape, protect itself from heatstroke, and guard its belly
name: Sandslash

text: Sandslash is also adept at climbing trees and is prone to ambush its enemies from above
name: Sandslash

text: It also climbs trees to slash Berries to feed the Sandshrew waiting bellow
name: Sandslash

text: Sandslash can mostly be found in deserts
name: Sandslash

text: In the Alola region, Sandslash has an icy blue hide and steel quills covered in ice
name: Sandslash

text: These quills stand taller than a regular Sandslash's quills and resemble icicles
name: Sandslash

text: This Pokémon uses its hide for camouflage in the snow while leaving only its spines exposed
name: Sandslash

text: Unlike its Kantonian variant, the thick hide and icy spines completely prevent Alolan Sandslash from curling up into a ball
name: Sandslash

text: Its body emits cold air, which sharpens its quills
name: Sandslash

text: Its forepaws are larger than its counterpart, and its claws are longer, thinner, and hooked at the tips
name: Sandslash

text: Formerly used for climbing trees, they now allow it to scale icebergs
name: Sandslash

text: Despite the weight of its ice-covered body, Alolan Sandslash is able to move swiftly by carving a path in the snow with its claws
name: Sandslash

text: It can move faster than any Pokémon while in the snowy mountains
name: Sandslash

text: This Pokémon tends to live in the deeper parts of snowy mountains, where climbing is forbidden
name: Sandslash

text: However, the sprays of snow it kicks up are popular shots for photographers
name: Sandslash

text: 1 People also climb up the mountains it lives in, in order to see Sandslash's icy spikes sparkle during the light of dawn
name: Sandslash

text: Nidoran♀ is a small, rabbit-shaped Pokémon with large whiskers and front teeth
name: Nidoran♀

text: It is said to resemble Nidoran♂, but is lavender-bluish and has a much smaller horn on her head
name: Nidoran♀

text: She has darker spots on her body
name: Nidoran♀

text: These small Pokémon are extremely timid and docile
name: Nidoran♀

text: Nidoran♀ are easily spooked, and it is not at all difficult to accidentally be scratched by a fleeing individual
name: Nidoran♀

text: If cornered, however, Nidoran♀ will defend themselves with their horns
name: Nidoran♀

text: It is rare to find a lone Nidoran♀, as they are very social Pokémon that are almost never seen without elder Nidorina and Nidoqueen, or at the very least sibling Nidoran♂, accompanying them
name: Nidoran♀

text: In fact, the vast majority of documented cases of Nidoran♀ poisonings have been attributed to skittish and scared wild individuals attacking out of sheer terror after having been separated from their families
name: Nidoran♀

text: Females have more sensitive nostrils and whiskers than males they are quicker to detect predators because of this and will stay downwind when they sense one
name: Nidoran♀

text: She has the ability Poison Point that allows a 30% chance of the foe being poisoned if hit by a direct attack
name: Nidoran♀

text: Nidoran♀ evolves into Nidorina at level 17
name: Nidoran♀

text: In Generation I, Nidoran♀ evolves into Nidorina at level 16
name: Nidoran♀

text: Nidorina evolves into Nidoqueen by use of a Moon Stone
name: Nidoran♀

text: Nidoran♀ is a small, quadrupedal, mammalian Pokémon
name: Nidoran♀

text: It has large, spiny ears oversized front teeth red eyes and a pair of whiskers on each cheek
name: Nidoran♀

text: It is light blue with several darker blue spots
name: Nidoran♀

text: There are two white claws on each of its paws
name: Nidoran♀

text: Its back is covered with small toxic spines, and it has a small forehead horn
name: Nidoran♀

text: The poisons secreted by the spines and horn are extremely potent, and even a scratch from its horn or a drop of poison from its barbs can be deadly
name: Nidoran♀

text: However, this docile Pokémon only uses its poison when it feels threatened
name: Nidoran♀

text: Nidoran♀is more sensitive to smell than Nidoran♂
name: Nidoran♀

text: It can use its whiskers to check the wind while either searching for berries or to avoid predators
name: Nidoran♀

text: Nidoran♀ can use its incisor teeth for crushing the berries it forages for
name: Nidoran♀

text: Nidoran♀ lives in open spaces, such as savannas and plains
name: Nidoran♀

text: Nidoran♀ is a female-only species
name: Nidoran♀

text: Nidorina is a rodent-like Pokémon with big ears, reminiscent of a rabbit
name: Nidorina

text: She has blue skin, with darker spots around the body
name: Nidorina

text: Her male counterpart is Nidorino
name: Nidorina

text: She has horns on her back
name: Nidorina

text: Like Nidoran♀, Nidorina tend to avoid confrontation but are fiercely defensive of their young
name: Nidorina

text: Like the rest of their relatives, they lives in burrows in open plains with their large family groups
name: Nidorina

text: These Pokémon are very affectionate with those in their tightly bonded family groups, and can easily become nervous or even upset when separated from them
name: Nidorina

text: When threatened, they will band together and screech loudly to bewilder predators with ultrasonic waves
name: Nidorina

text: To feed their young, they first chew food before spitting it out for their children to eat
name: Nidorina

text: Nidorina has the abilities Poison Point and Rivalry along with the hidden ability Hustle
name: Nidorina

text: Poison Point has a 30% chance of poisoning the opponent's Pokémon when it hits Nidorina with a Physical move while Rivalry deals more damage to the opponent when she is an opposite gender
name: Nidorina

text: Hustle lowers Nidorina's accuracy, but raises attack
name: Nidorina

text: Nidorina is the evolved form of a Nidoran♀ as of level 16
name: Nidorina

text: Nidorina evolves into Nidoqueen by use of a Moon Stone
name: Nidorina

text: Nidorina is a quadrupedal, sky-blue mammalian Pokémon with dark-blue patches
name: Nidorina

text: It has red eyes, large, spiny ears, and has two pointed teeth protruding from its upper jaw
name: Nidorina

text: It possesses large poison spikes, which it retracts whenever it is with a group, feeding its children, or while resting in its burrow
name: Nidorina

text: Its paws have three claws each, and it is able to stand on its hind legs
name: Nidorina

text: The hind legs are longer and thicker than its forelegs
name: Nidorina

text: It has a stubby tail
name: Nidorina

text: Nidorina is a female-only species
name: Nidorina

text: Nidorina is a gentle Pokémon, and it is known to be a caring mother that chews food for its young
name: Nidorina

text: It seems to display close family bonds with others of its kind, and becomes nervous when separated
name: Nidorina

text: Nidorina prefers not to fight since its horn grows slowly, but if forced or enraged, it prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting
name: Nidorina

text: Nidorina prefers to chew its food into a paste before spitting it out and feeding its children
name: Nidorina

text: It also emits ultrasonic cries to befuddle foes
name: Nidorina

text: Nidorina live in burrows at hot savannas and plains
name: Nidorina

text: Nidoqueen is a large Pokémon, with features resembling a rhino, mouse, and reptile
name: Nidoqueen

text: It is largely blue in color
name: Nidoqueen

text: Nidoqueen has large round ears and two small horns in the center of its head
name: Nidoqueen

text: Its jaw is cream colored
name: Nidoqueen

text: Nidoqueen also has short legs and arms with white claws (two on its feet and three on each paw) and a large bulky tail
name: Nidoqueen

text: Nidoqueen also has a couple of armor-like scales on its body
name: Nidoqueen

text: Alongside the jaw, other parts include two armored lumps on Nidoqueen's upper chest and a segmented piece on the abdomen
name: Nidoqueen

text: Nidoqueen is a large, powerful, bipedal Pokémon
name: Nidoqueen

text: They have thick yellow armor plates all over them
name: Nidoqueen

text: Its horn is smaller than Nidoking's, but is still strong and produces large quantities of concentrated venom
name: Nidoqueen

text: Nidoqueen can use powerful moves such as Body Slam to paralyze foes and then finish them off with Mega Punch or Iron Tail
name: Nidoqueen

text: They lead Nidoran families alongside Nidoking
name: Nidoqueen

text: These Pokémon are famously motherly, willing to defend their young with their lives
name: Nidoqueen

text: These Pokémon will block the entrances to their burrows using their bodies, with their venomous spines facing outwards, in order to defend their young
name: Nidoqueen

text: Nidoqueen are also known to set off earth-shaking tremors to scare potential attackers from their burrows
name: Nidoqueen

text: Younger Nidoran♀ and Nidorina look up to Nidoqueen—it is not uncommon for wandering Nidorina to end up lost in the mountains while searching for Moon Stones to evolve like their mothers
name: Nidoqueen

text: Nidoqueen placate crying offspring by placing them between the spines on their backs these spines never secrete venom while the young are nearby
name: Nidoqueen

text: Nidoqueen can have either the ability Poison Point where a foe has 30% chance of being poisoned or Rivalry where if the foe is the same gender Nidoqueen's attack will be higher
name: Nidoqueen

text: Nidoqueen is the evolved form of a Nidorina by use of a Moon Stone, and is the final form of a Nidoran♀
name: Nidoqueen

text: Nidoqueen is a large, bipedal blue mammalian Pokémon with distinct reptilian features
name: Nidoqueen

text: Its body is encased with extremely hard scales that serve as excellent protection from any attack and stand up when Nidoqueen is excited or provoked
name: Nidoqueen

text: It has a blunt snout, narrow brown eyes, and large ears with brown insides
name: Nidoqueen

text: There is a small horn on its forehead, a single spine on each ear, and a line of toxic spikes running down the length of its back
name: Nidoqueen

text: Each hand has three short claws and each foot was two claws
name: Nidoqueen

text: Its lower jaw, the front of its abdomen, and two plates on its chest are cream-colored
name: Nidoqueen

text: It has a thick, powerful tail
name: Nidoqueen

text: Nidoqueen is a female-only species
name: Nidoqueen

text: Nidoqueen can be quite fierce and is very protective of its young
name: Nidoqueen

text: This Pokémon is at its strongest when it is defending its young, and it will try to seal the entrance to its burrow to protect them
name: Nidoqueen

text: It also places it young on its gaps between its gap spikes which never relate poison when the children are placed on it
name: Nidoqueen

text: Nidoqueen is more adaptive at being defensive than offensive
name: Nidoqueen

text: Nidoqueen's scales like armor allow it to defend its children from any attack
name: Nidoqueen

text: When in contact with foes, it can poison them with the spikes from its back or cause small tremors by slamming the ground
name: Nidoqueen

text: It is also adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles and it uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves
name: Nidoqueen

text: Being the result of an evolution via Evolution stone, Nidoqueen is rarely found in the wild, though they can be found in savannas and plains
name: Nidoqueen

text: Nidoran♂ is a small, rabbit-based Pokémon with large ears, whiskers and front teeth
name: Nidoran♂

text: They are covered with spines, primarily on their back, which can release potent poisons if Nidoran♂ is threatened
name: Nidoran♂

text: Nidoran♂ have a larger forehead horn than their female counterparts, Nidoran♀
name: Nidoran♂

text: He has darker spots all over his body
name: Nidoran♂

text: Like females, however, males are shy and try to avoid fights, only using their venom to defend themselves as necessary when confronted
name: Nidoran♂

text: However, they will risk their lives to defend females that they are enamored with
name: Nidoran♂

text: Nidoran♂ are herbivores and consume plants as their main source of food, and can even devour toxic ones without any ill effects some scientists even believe that Nidoran♂ gather their poison from such plants
name: Nidoran♂

text: His large horns can secrete a powerful venom, unlike his female counterpart, the size of the horns is indicative of the strength of the venom
name: Nidoran♂

text: He also has unique muscles around its ears, which permit them to be moved in any direction
name: Nidoran♂

text: Nidoran♂ evolves into a Nidorino at level 16
name: Nidoran♂

text: Nidorino evolves into Nidoking, by use of a Moon Stone
name: Nidoran♂

text: Nidoran♂ is a small, quadrupedal, mammalian Pokémon
name: Nidoran♂

text: It is pinkish purple with darker patches
name: Nidoran♂

text: It has large, spiny ears with teal insides, oversized front teeth, and red eyes
name: Nidoran♂

text: Its back is covered with three lines of large spines that can release potent poisons if threatened
name: Nidoran♂

text: The center line of spines is taller than the other two
name: Nidoran♂

text: The size of the long, pointed horn on its forehead is indicative of the strength of its venom
name: Nidoran♂

text: Nidoran♂ is a male-only species
name: Nidoran♂

text: Nidoran♂ constantly listens for the sounds of approaching enemies with its large ears
name: Nidoran♂

text: Said ears have unique muscles that allow them to be moved in any direction, and even the slightest sound does not escape Nidoran♂'s notice
name: Nidoran♂

text: In order to listen to distant locations, it flaps its ears like wings
name: Nidoran♂

text: When angry, it extends its toxic spikes and charges, stabbing with its horn to inject poison
name: Nidoran♂

text: Nidoran♂ is brave, and will risk its own life to protect Nidoran♀
name: Nidoran♂

text: Nidoran♂ lives in open spaces, such as savannas and plains
name: Nidoran♂

text: Nidorino is a rabbit-like Pokémon, just like his previous evolution, though he acquires a more rugged look
name: Nidorino

text: Sharp teeth protrude from his upper jaw and his spikes have grown larger
name: Nidorino

text: He is a red-purple color with slightly darker spots
name: Nidorino

text: He has very large ears
name: Nidorino

text: Nidorino are extremely aggressive Pokémon that are quick to Anger like Mankey
name: Nidorino

text: One he detects an enemy, all his spikes will bristle up at once and will go all out to challenge the foe(which may explain its other abilities)
name: Nidorino

text: These Pokémon generally spend the day scouting and searching for food, returning to their burrows only at night to rest
name: Nidorino

text: They bring back resources to share with the rest of their families
name: Nidorino

text: However, even the slightest noise will awaken sleeping Nidorino, thanks to their highly sensitive ears
name: Nidorino

text: They will not hesitate to locate the source of a foreign sound and attack it with their horns, especially if the threat appears to be endangering their young
name: Nidorino

text: The entire Nido family are known for their venomous spines
name: Nidorino

text: Nidorino's are no exception
name: Nidorino

text: His poison is more potent than his previous evolution, and the horn it is secreted from (which explains its Poison Point ability ) is harder than a diamond
name: Nidorino

text: His ears are used to checks its surroundings
name: Nidorino

text: Nidorino evolves into Nidoking, by use of a Moon Stone
name: Nidorino

text: Nidorino is the evolved form of Nidoran♂ as of level 16
name: Nidorino

text: Nidorino is a light-purple, quadrupedal mammalian Pokémon
name: Nidorino

text: It has several darker purple patches across its body
name: Nidorino

text: It has large, spiny ears with teal insides, narrow black eyes, and a long snout with two pointed teeth protruding from the upper jaw
name: Nidorino

text: Nidorino has a ridge of toxic spines on its back and a long pointed horn on its forehead
name: Nidorino

text: The horn is harder than a diamond and capable of secreting poison on impact
name: Nidorino

text: The more adrenaline Nidorino has in its body, the more potent the poison is
name: Nidorino

text: Its short legs have three claws on each foot
name: Nidorino

text: Nidorino is a male-only species
name: Nidorino

text: Nidorino is independent, nervous, and fierce, and it is often described as violent and easily angered
name: Nidorino

text: It uses its ears to check its surroundings
name: Nidorino

text: If it senses a hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once, and it challenges the foe with all its might
name: Nidorino

text: Nidorino's harder-than-diamond horn can destroy diamonds, and it uses that horn to destroy boulders in its search for Moon Stones
name: Nidorino

text: Nidorino live in hot savannas and plains
name: Nidorino

text: Nidoking is a large purple Pokémon with a very large horn and large ears
name: Nidoking

text: Hehas a large bulky tail and he has one-toed feet and three-fingered hands
name: Nidoking

text: Nidoking attacks his foes by sweeping his large and bulky tail, his horn also contains venom
name: Nidoking

text: In Nidoran families, Nidoking assume the roles of protectors and hunters, patrolling in search of food to bring back to their burrows for their mates and offspring
name: Nidoking

text: An enraged Nidoking is particularly dangerous, as it will go on a rampage that can only be stopped either by defeating the Pokémon—a difficult task that only a few Pokémon can accomplish—or by being calmed down by its partner Nidoqueen
name: Nidoking

text: Threatening their families is one of the most common triggers for such attacks
name: Nidoking

text: Luckily, their rarity in the wild in combination with their tendency to stay away from human settlements makes berserk Nidoking a very rare, albeit still very dangerous, problem in most metropolitan areas
name: Nidoking

text: His abilities are Poison Point which may poison the foe 30% of the time when your Pokémon attacks him with a Physical kind of move
name: Nidoking

text: He can also have the ability Rivalry, which increases Nidoking's Attack stat by 50% when fighting against Pokémon of the same gender, but halves him when fighting against Pokémon of the Opposite Gender
name: Nidoking

text: In Pokémon Black and White, Nidoking has an additional Special Ability, through the Dream World Sheer Force
name: Nidoking

text: This ability states that Moves with a secondary effect (Status, Lowering opponent's stats) are increased in power by 33% but lose their secondary effect (i
name: Nidoking

text: e
name: Nidoking

text: Flamethrower would not cause burn)
name: Nidoking

text: Nidoking is the evolved form of Nidorino by use of a Moon Stone
name: Nidoking

name: Nidoking

text: It has narrow eyes, large, spiny ears, fur-like tufts on its cheeks, and a short snout filled with pointed teeth

text: There is a long, venomous horn on its forehead and a ridge of spines down its back
name: Nidoking

text: Gray plates cover its chest and belly, and there is a gray, rounded spine on each elbow
name: Nidoking

text: Each hand has three claws, while each foot has only a single hoof-like nail
name: Nidoking

text: It has a long, powerful tail
name: Nidoking

text: Nidoking is a male-only species
name: Nidoking

text: It is said that Nidoking's tail is capable of toppling a metal transmission tower
name: Nidoking

text: Nidoking uses this tail to smash, constrict, or break the bones of its prey and enemies
name: Nidoking

text: The tail can also be swung to create distance between it and its foes before Nidoking charges
name: Nidoking

text: Its steel-like hide adds to its powerful, rampaging charges
name: Nidoking

text: Nidoking's horn is powerful enough to crush diamonds
name: Nidoking

text: Nidoking is known to be very proud of its own strength
name: Nidoking

text: When Nidoking goes on a rampage, it becomes impossible to control
name: Nidoking

text: Only a Nidoqueen that it has lived with for a long time can calm it down from its rampages
name: Nidoking

text: As shown in the manga, Nidoking has strong acid within its claws

text: Being the result of evolution via an Evolution stone, Nidoking is rarely found in the wild, though they can be found in savannas and plains
name: Nidoking

text: Clefairy is a small, round, pink, star-shaped Pokémon
name: Clefairy

text: Its hands have two white claws and a thumb
name: Clefairy

text: Its ears are short and pointy with dark tips
name: Clefairy

text: It has a long, curled tail and swirly hair and pink cheeks
name: Clefairy

text: On its back, it has small wings
name: Clefairy

text: Clefairy can have the ability Magic Guard or Cute Charm
name: Clefairy

text: Cute Charm allows Clefairy to have a 30% chance to infatuate the foe if the foe is the opposite gender and a physical attack hits Clefairy
name: Clefairy

text: Magic Guard allows Clefairy to only get damage by attacks
name: Clefairy

text: Clefairy can jump very high, as seen in the anime, and can hear very well
name: Clefairy

text: This is often the reason why they are hard to find
name: Clefairy

text: Clefairy collects moonlight in its wings and uses it to fly
name: Clefairy

text: Clefairy is very timid and rarely appears in front of humans
name: Clefairy

text: But it is very clever, and there are awareness among social and religious groups
name: Clefairy

text: Clefairy is a nocturnal Pokémon and will come out during the full moon to dance
name: Clefairy

text: Clefairy evolves into Clefable when a Moon Stone is used on it
name: Clefairy

text: Cleffa evolves into Clefairy when it levels up with high friendship
name: Clefairy

text: Clefairy is a bipedal, pink Pokémon with a chubby, vaguely star-shaped body
name: Clefairy

text: A small, pointed tooth protrudes from the upper left corner of its mouth
name: Clefairy

text: It has wrinkles beside its black, oval eyes, a single dark pink oval marking on each cheek, and large, pointed ears with brown tips
name: Clefairy

text: A tuft of fur curls over its forehead, much like its large, upward-curling tail
name: Clefairy

text: Each stocky arm has two small claws and a thumb on each hand and both feet have a single toenail
name: Clefairy

text: There is a pair of tiny, butterfly-shaped wings on its back
name: Clefairy

text: Though incapable of flight, Clefairy's wings can store moonlight and allow it to float
name: Clefairy

text: Clefairy is very shy and rarely shows itself to humans
name: Clefairy

text: On the rare occasions it does come down from its mountain home, it can be seen dancing under the light of the full moon
name: Clefairy

text: The area surrounding their dance in enveloped in a magnetic field
name: Clefairy

text: Once the sun starts to rise, it returns home where it sleeps nestled with other Clefairy
name: Clefairy

text: The anime has shown that Clefairy is actually an extraterrestrial Pokémon
name: Clefairy

text: Clefable resembles a larger Clefairy, with bigger ears and tail, larger wings, and no claws on its hands
name: Clefable

text: Clefable is shyer than Clefairy
name: Clefable

text: Due to its highly sensitive hearing, it will avoid noisy areas
name: Clefable

text: On moonlit nights, they can rarely be seen walking towards secluded, deserted lakes they are said to gaze at the moon in longing to return home, straining their ears to hear the voices of their brethren on its surface
name: Clefable

text: It is said seeing a pair of them is a sign of a happy marriage
name: Clefable

text: Clefable has the abilities Cute Charm and Magic Guard along with the hidden ability Unaware
name: Clefable

text: Cute Charm provides a 30% chance that the opponent's Pokémon will become infatuated when they hit Clefable with a physical move
name: Clefable

text: On the other hand, Magic Guard ensures that Clefable is not affected by moves that attack its Status
name: Clefable

text: Unaware ignores the stat changes for a Pokémon
name: Clefable

text: Clefable is the final evolution of Cleffa
name: Clefable

text: Clefable evolves from Clefairy with the use of a Moon Stone
name: Clefable

text: Clefable is a tall, pink Pokémon with a vaguely star-shaped body
name: Clefable

text: It has long, pointed ears with dark brown tips and black, oval eyes with wrinkles on either side
name: Clefable

text: A curled lock of fur hangs over its forehead, much like its long, tightly curled tail
name: Clefable

text: On its back is a pair of dark pink wings each wing has three points
name: Clefable

text: Its hands have three fingers each, and its feet have two clawed toes and dark pink soles
name: Clefable

text: Clefable is a timid creature that flees when it senses people approaching and is one of the world's rarest Pokémon
name: Clefable

text: Its sensitive ears can distinctly hear a pin drop from half a mile away
name: Clefable

text: Because of its acute hearing, it prefers to live in quiet, mountainous areas of which it is protective
name: Clefable

text: It has also been seen at deserted lakes during a full moon
name: Clefable

text: Using a bouncy gait, it is able to walk on water and sometimes appears to be flying using its small wings
name: Clefable

text: The anime has shown that Clefable is actually an extraterrestrial Pokémon
name: Clefable

text: According to one tradition, seeing a pair of Clefable ensure a happy marriage
name: Clefable

text: Some scientists believe that Clefable stares intently at the moon because it is homesick
name: Clefable

text: There is a legend to this as well, which tells of how it listens for the voices of its kin on the moon during clear and quiet nights
name: Clefable

text: Vulpix are fox-like Pokémon with reddish-brown fur
name: Vulpix

text: Vulpix's most distinctive feature is its six orange tails that are curled at the tips
name: Vulpix

text: According to the Pokédex, when it is born, Vulpix possesses one snow white tail that eventually splits into many tails as it grows older
name: Vulpix

text: On the top of its head, Vulpix has a tuft of bright orange fur that curls into three rolls at the top and falls over its forehead at the bottom
name: Vulpix

text: Its underbelly is cream-colored and slightly plump
name: Vulpix

text: Additionally, a shiny Vulpix has a golden color scheme as opposed to its original red-brown
name: Vulpix

text: Also, Vulpix do not have any differences in appearance between genders
name: Vulpix

text: Alolan Vulpix, having moved to the snowy mountains to avoid other Pokémon habitats, has adapted to the cold climate
name: Vulpix

text: It is a fox-like Pokémon with snow white fur and ice blue paws
name: Vulpix

text: Alolan Vulpix's most distinctive feature is its snow white body and its six ice blue tails which are connected by a tuft of snow white fur
name: Vulpix

text: On the top of its head, Alolan Vulpix has a tuft of snow white fur which curls back and falls over its forehead at the bottom
name: Vulpix

text: A shiny Alolan Vulpix's color scheme is more inclined to purple instead of blue
name: Vulpix

text: Vulpix are very intelligent
name: Vulpix

text: When they face a stronger enemy, they'll distract the enemy by feigning injuryand then escape
name: Vulpix

text: Vulpix is capable of manipulating fire to such precision as to create floating wisps of flame
name: Vulpix

text: These wisps are sometimes mistaken for ghosts by humans, but Vulpix uses them to assist in catching prey
name: Vulpix

text: When the temperature outside increases, it will expel flames from its mouth to prevent its body from overheating
name: Vulpix

text: Alolan Vulpix, which live on cold mountains, usually form a group varying from 2-5 members, helping and living with one another
name: Vulpix

text: They can be found in small packs, called skulks, that are led and protected by Ninetales
name: Vulpix

text: Alolan Vulpix is believed to have arrived in the region at the same time as humans but moved to the snow-capped mountain to avoid other Pokémon
name: Vulpix

text: Alolan Vulpix can expel breath as cold as -58°F (-50°C), which is capable of freezing anything as a means to protect themselves from enemies
name: Vulpix

text: While they are not suited to warmer environments, their tails can produce ice to lower the surrounding temperature if needed
name: Vulpix

text: An old, local name for this Pokémon is Keokeo, referring to their white pelt
name: Vulpix

text: Weavile is a natural predator of Alolan Vulpix
name: Vulpix

text: Vulpix have a flame inside their body that never goes out
name: Vulpix

text: Alolan Vulpix, however, can freeze anything with its breath of −58°F and do not fare well in the heat
name: Vulpix

text: Vulpix evolves into Ninetales by use of a Fire Stone, while Alolan Vulpix evolves with an Ice Stone
name: Vulpix

text: Vulpix is a small, quadrupedal, canine Pokémon
name: Vulpix

text: It has a red-brown pelt with a cream-colored underbelly
name: Vulpix

text: It has brown eyes, large, pointed ears with dark brown insides, and a triangular dark brown nose

text: Its paws are slightly darker than the rest of its pelt and have light brown paw pads

text: On top of its head are three curled locks of orange fur with bangs, and it has orange tails with curled tips
name: Vulpix

text: It is most commonly seen with six tails
name: Vulpix

text: However, Vulpix is born with only a single, white tail that splits as Vulpix grows

text: The tails grow hot as it approaches evolution
name: Vulpix

text: Vulpix is capable of manipulating fire to such precision as to create floating wisps of flame

text: These wisps are sometimes mistaken for ghosts by humans, but Vulpix uses them to assist in catching prey

text: Inside its body is a flame that never goes out
