text: When the temperature outside increases, it will expel flames from its mouth to prevent its body from overheating
name: Vulpix

text: Vulpix is known to feign injury to escape from opponents too powerful for it to defeat
name: Vulpix

text: Vulpix can be found most commonly in grassy plains
name: Vulpix

text: In the Alola region, Vulpix has adapted to snowy mountain peaks and developed a snowy white pelt
name: Vulpix

text: It has pale blue paws, blue eyes, and dark blue insides its ears
name: Vulpix

text: Its snout is more pronounced and pointed than that of non-Alolan Vulpix
name: Vulpix

text: The locks of hair on its head and its six tails are curlier and have a wispy appearance
name: Vulpix

text: Alolan Vulpix is believed to have arrived in the region at the same time as humans but moved to the snow-capped mountain to avoid other Pokémon
name: Vulpix

text: It can be found in small packs, called skulks, that are led and protected by Ninetales
name: Vulpix

text: Alolan Vulpix can expel breath as cold as -58°F (-50°C), which is capable of freezing anything
name: Vulpix

text: While it is not suited to warmer environments, its tail can produce ice to lower the surrounding temperature if needed

text: An old, local name for this Pokémon is Keokeo, referring to its white pelt

text: Ninetales is a fox-like Pokémon that possesses nine tails, hence its name
name: Ninetales

text: Resembling the nine-tailed kitsune fox of Japanese folklore, they are mainly covered in sleek, luxurious golden-white fur, while the tips of their nine tails are orange
name: Ninetales

text: On top of their head is a large tuft of hair, similar to its pre-evolved form though much more unruly and spiky
name: Ninetales

text: It has sinister red eyes which give it the ability to psychically control the minds of people andPokémon
name: Ninetales

text: Its ears are pointed and distinctly fox-like, and it has slender legs with three-toed paws and no visible claws
name: Ninetales

text: The shiny version of Ninetales has silver-gray fur instead of its usual light cream fur, and its tails are tipped in blue
name: Ninetales

text: Alolan Ninetales keeps the traits of Alolan Vulpix
name: Ninetales

text: It is a fox-like Pokémon that possesses nine tails, hence its name
name: Ninetales

text: It is covered in ice blue fur with snow white legs
name: Ninetales

text: On top of its head is a large tuft of hair, similar to its pre-evolved form
name: Ninetales

text: This tuft does not curl backwards and instead shrinks backwards into two snow white ribbons of hair
name: Ninetales

text: It possesses two tufts like this (which shrink into only one ribbon) on both sides of its ears
name: Ninetales

text: Its nine tails are ice blue and also shrink into one snow white ribbon each
name: Ninetales

text: Unlike regular Ninetales, these tails form a circle behind the Pokémon
name: Ninetales

text: It has majestic blue eyes not unlike those of its pre-evolution
name: Ninetales

text: Its ears are pointed and distinctly fox-like, and it has slender legs with three-toed paws and no visible claws
name: Ninetales

text: Ninetales have high intelligence and strong obsession
name: Ninetales

text: They can live for a thousand years when they use the power of their tails
name: Ninetales

text: They never let go of their vendetta against ones they have a grudge on, including the person's descendants
name: Ninetales

text: Alolan Ninetales are very gentle, and they will help people who are in danger
name: Ninetales

text: Nonetheless, they won't show mercy to anyone who intrudes their territory
name: Ninetales

text: It will punish any threat to its pack of Vulpix
name: Ninetales

text: Ninetales' tails contain different mysterious powers
name: Ninetales

text: They can control wisps and flames through mystical forces, as well as hypnotizing victims and prey through flickering flames emitted from their mouths
name: Ninetales

text: They can even release odd beams from their red eyes to manipulate a person's heart and mind at their own whims
name: Ninetales

text: Alolan Ninetales can produce multipurpose ice crystals from its fur, which it can use for both offense and defense
name: Ninetales

text: The ice crystals can act as a shield or form balls that can be fired like bullets with enough force to shatter rock
name: Ninetales

text: Ninetales is the evolved form of Vulpix, who evolves by the use of a Fire Stone, while Alolan Ninetales is evolved with an Ice Stone
name: Ninetales

text: Ninetales is a quadrupedal canine Pokémon covered in thick, luxurious golden-white fur
name: Ninetales

text: It has a small mane of thicker fur around its neck and a long, fluffy crest atop its head
name: Ninetales

text: It has slender legs with three-toed paws and nine, long tails with pale orange tips
name: Ninetales

text: It has red eyes, pointed ears, and a triangular black nose
name: Ninetales

text: While intelligent enough to easily understand human speech, Ninetales is a very vengeful Pokémon that has been known to curse those who mistreat it
name: Ninetales

text: It can live for 1,000 years due to the energy within its nine tails, each of which is said to have a different mystical power
name: Ninetales

text: Flames spewed from its mouth can hypnotize an opponent and its gleaming red eyes that are said to give it the ability to control minds
name: Ninetales

text: The anime has shown that it can swim
name: Ninetales

text: Being the result of an evolution via Evolution stone, Ninetales is rarely found in the wild, though they can be found in grasslands
name: Ninetales

text: In the Alola region, Ninetales has a different appearance
name: Ninetales

text: Its coat is pale blue, and its fur is more flowing and wispier
name: Ninetales

text: The tips of its tails and crest, as well as the lower halves of its legs, are white
name: Ninetales

text: The crest on its head is longer and its nine tails are less distinct from each other
name: Ninetales

text: Additionally, it has larger eyes, which are blue, and small tufts of fur in front of its ears
name: Ninetales

text: Alolan Ninetales lives on Alola's snow-capped Mount Lanakila, which is considered by some to be holy ground
name: Ninetales

text: As such, it is revered as a sacred messenger or deity
name: Ninetales

text: Alolan Ninetales has a gentle temperament and is known to aid lost humans in distress, though this is primarily done to keep them out of its territory
name: Ninetales

text: It will punish any threat to its pack of Vulpix
name: Ninetales

text: It can produce ice crystals from its fur, which it can use for both offense and defense
name: Ninetales

text: The ice crystals can act as a shield or form balls that can be fired like bullets with enough force to shatter rock
name: Ninetales

text: Jigglypuff is a small round pink Pokémon with a tuft of curly fur on its head
name: Jigglypuff

text: It has short, digitless limbs, pointy catlike ears, and large blue eyes
name: Jigglypuff

text: Jigglypuff can lull people and Pokémon to sleep using its voice
name: Jigglypuff

text: Jigglypuff has very stretchy skin and will inflate itself if it gets angry
name: Jigglypuff

text: In the anime, it has been shown to draw on people's faces after they have fallen asleep
name: Jigglypuff

text: However, most Jigglypuff are not accustomed to Pokémon with abilities like Insomnia, which prevent drowsiness
name: Jigglypuff

text: They will sing endlessly to try to put such Pokémon to sleep, putting themselves in danger of asphyxiation
name: Jigglypuff

text: Luckily, this behavior is generally a one-time mistake, and a Jigglypuff will quickly learn its lesson
name: Jigglypuff

text: Recently, it was discovered that different populations of Jigglypuff utilize different methods of singing, ranging from lilting melodies to near-shouts
name: Jigglypuff

text: Jigglypuff is the evolved form of Igglybuff
name: Jigglypuff

text: It also evolves into Wigglytuff by use of a Moon Stone
name: Jigglypuff

text: Jigglypuff is a pink Pokémon with a spherical body
name: Jigglypuff

text: It has pointed ears with black insides and large, blue eyes
name: Jigglypuff

text: It has small, stubby arms and slightly longer feet
name: Jigglypuff

text: On top of its head is a curled tuft of fur
name: Jigglypuff

text: Its body is filled with air and, as seen in Pokémon Stadium, Jigglypuff can deflate until it is flat
name: Jigglypuff

text: It is able to float by drawing extra air into its body, as demonstrated in Super Smash Bros
name: Jigglypuff

text: Jigglypuff can use its eyes to mesmerize opponents
name: Jigglypuff

text: It has a large lung capacity, exceeding most other Pokémon
name: Jigglypuff

text: Once it has an opponent's attention, Jigglypuff will inflate its lungs and begin to sing a soothing and mysterious lullaby
name: Jigglypuff

text: This melody can cause anyone who listens to become sleepy
name: Jigglypuff

text: If the opponent resists falling asleep, Jigglypuff will endanger its own life by continuing to sing until it runs out of air
name: Jigglypuff

text: It will continue to sing until the opponent is asleep
name: Jigglypuff

text: It is able to adjust the wavelength of its voice to match the brain waves of someone in a deep sleep
name: Jigglypuff

text: This helps ensure drowsiness in its opponents
name: Jigglypuff

text: Its vocal range exceeds 12 octaves, but its skill depends on the individual
name: Jigglypuff

text: Its song varies by region, and in some areas, it sounds like shouting
name: Jigglypuff

text: Jigglypuff can mostly be found in lush green plains and grassy meadows
name: Jigglypuff

text: Wigglytuff resembles a larger Jigglypuff
name: Wigglytuff

text: It is pink and oval-shaped with a white stomach and short, digitless limbs
name: Wigglytuff

text: Its eyes are the same as its pre-evolution
name: Wigglytuff

text: It has a tuft on its head and long, rabbit-like ears
name: Wigglytuff

text: Wigglytuff can inflate its soft body, just like its pre-evolution
name: Wigglytuff

text: Wigglytuff are very gentle creatures that detest fighting
name: Wigglytuff

text: Even when they clash with one another, they only compete by inhaling air to see whose size increases the most
name: Wigglytuff

text: It sheds its fine fur when the season changes
name: Wigglytuff

text: The fur is gathered and spun into a luxurious yarn
name: Wigglytuff

text: Sleeping next to a one is said to be an amazing experience, and a few quirky luxury hotels tote Wigglytuff “sleeping buddies” for extra charge—a practice that benefits both person and Pokémon, as Wigglytuff love the company of people
name: Wigglytuff

text: They grow steadily to enormous sizes to scare off foes the largest purportedly could grow to 20 times its resting size, though this specimen was never proven to exist
name: Wigglytuff

text: Once inflated, Wigglytuff can float and bounce around lightly like balloons
name: Wigglytuff

text: They compete with one another to see who can become the largest
name: Wigglytuff

text: Their large eyes are always covered with a thin layer of tears that wash away any particles that fall onto their delicate surfaces
name: Wigglytuff

text: Wigglytuff is the evolved form of Jigglypuff by the use of a Moon Stone
name: Wigglytuff

text: Wigglytuff is the final form of Igglybuff
name: Wigglytuff

text: Wigglytuff is a balloon-like Pokémon with leporine features, a bean-shaped body and stubby arms and legs
name: Wigglytuff

text: There is a fluffy, curled tuft of fur on its head, which is described as perfectly heavenly
name: Wigglytuff

text: It has long, rabbit-like ears with black insides and slightly lighter color at the tips
name: Wigglytuff

text: Its large, blue eyes are covered in a layer of tears that quickly washes away any debris
name: Wigglytuff

text: It is covered in pink fur with a white belly
name: Wigglytuff

text: This fine layer of fur is so soft that those who touch it, including other Wigglytuff, will not want to stop
name: Wigglytuff

text: As a result, Wigglytuff is a highly sought after Pokémon because of its bouncy body and fur
name: Wigglytuff

text: It sheds seasonally, and people gather the fur to spin into yarn
name: Wigglytuff

text: It is proud of its fine and delicate fur
name: Wigglytuff

text: Its body is soft and rubbery, allowing it to inflate by inhaling
name: Wigglytuff

text: Wigglytuff can inflate itself up to 20 times larger
name: Wigglytuff

text: It has no limits to how far it can inflate
name: Wigglytuff

text: While it is inflated, it is able to move by bouncing or floating
name: Wigglytuff

text: It competes with other Wigglytuff to see which one can inflate itself the most
name: Wigglytuff

text: Should it be caught in a bad mood, Wigglytuff will inflate itself to an enormous size in order to scare away its opponent
name: Wigglytuff

text: Being the result of an evolution via Evolution stone, Wigglytuff is rarely found in the wild, though they can be found in vivid green plains and grassy fields
name: Wigglytuff

text: Zubat resembles a blue bat
name: Zubat

text: It has a short, round body, purple wings, and slim legs missing feet
name: Zubat

text: Zubat has no eyes, so it uses sound waves (echolocation) to navigate, like a real bat does
name: Zubat

text: Strangely, it can use the move Mean Look, despite not having any eyes
name: Zubat

text: Zubat has the ability Inner Focus and the hidden ability Infiltrator
name: Zubat

text: Inner Focus prevents Zubat from flinching
name: Zubat

text: Infiltrator prevents the effects of Reflect, Magic Coat, and Light Screen from working
name: Zubat

text: Male Zubat have bigger fangs than the females
name: Zubat

text: Zubat evolves into Golbat at level 22, which evolves into Crobat via max Happiness
name: Zubat

text: Zubat is a blue, chiropteran Pokémon
name: Zubat

text: While it lacks eyes, it has pointed ears with purple insides and a mouth with two sharp teeth on each jaw
name: Zubat

text: A male will have larger fangs than a female
name: Zubat

text: It has purple wing membranes supported by two, elongated fingers, and two long, thin tails
name: Zubat

text: Zubat lives in abundance in dark caves, although it has also been known to dwell in forests and under the eaves of old buildings
name: Zubat

text: Due to its habitat, Zubat has evolved to have neither eyes nor nostrils
name: Zubat

text: It instead navigates through dark environments and tight caves with echolocation, emitting ultrasonic cries to detect targets and obstacles
name: Zubat

text: The frequency of these cries can vary slightly between Zubat colonies
name: Zubat

text: As demonstrated in the anime, it will leave its abode at night with a mass of other Zubat in order to seek prey
name: Zubat

text: Zubat is nocturnal, and sleeps hanging upside down during the daytime, avoiding sunlight at all costs
name: Zubat

text: Daylight causes Zubat to become unhealthy, and prolonged exposure can even burn its skin
name: Zubat

text: However, captured and trained Zubat have been recorded as being much more tenacious in the daytime, even when directly exposed to sunbeams
name: Zubat

text: While sleeping, or in colder conditions, Zubat gathers with others of its kind for warmth
name: Zubat

text: Golbat is a large, blue bat with super long wings
name: Golbat

text: Unlike its pre-evolved form, named Zubat, Golbat has eyes
name: Golbat

text: It also has two long, skinny feet
name: Golbat

text: The most distinct feature of Golbat is its large mouth with four teeth
name: Golbat

text: A female Golbat has smaller teeth than those of a male's
name: Golbat

text: Like Zubat, Golbat are found in caves and dark areas worldwide
name: Golbat

text: Unlike Zubat, however, Golbat are hematophagous, consuming the blood of Pokémon and humans alike
name: Golbat

text: They use their sharp fangs to puncture the skins of victims
name: Golbat

text: Their saliva contains a substance that poisons and immobilizes prey, allowing them to drink blood at their leisure
name: Golbat

text: Golbat can drink up to 10 ounces of blood in one sitting, possibly fatal for smaller victims
name: Golbat

text: After doing so, however, their flight often becomes clumsy and erratic due to their heavy weights after large meals they may become so heavy that they fall to the ground (and become easy prey themselves)
name: Golbat

text: Luckily, this feasting keeps them satisfied for a while they only search for food during moonless nights when darkness conceals them
name: Golbat

text: Recently, it has been discovered that Golbat broods will share blood with one another during times of scarcity however, selfish Golbat that do not share blood when asked will find that other brood members will refuse to share with them in the future
name: Golbat

text: Their fangs are hollow and consequently fragile
name: Golbat

text: Notably, Golbat avoid light, metal (perhaps due to their poison being ineffective against Steel-types), and oddly enough, Durin Berries
name: Golbat

text: While no one is quite sure why, Golbat tend to steer clear of them despite experiencing no ill effects upon consuming them
name: Golbat

text: Surprisingly, Golbat are quite adroit on their oddly-shaped feet, which are adapted to create silent footsteps as they sneak up behind sleeping prey
name: Golbat

text: All Golbat have the ability Inner Focus
name: Golbat

text: Inner Focus allows Golbat to never flinch
name: Golbat

text: Golbat can easily suck blood with its sharp fangs
name: Golbat

text: Blood seems to be Golbat's only food source
name: Golbat

text: Golbat evolves from Zubat at level 22, and evolves into Crobat with max Happiness
name: Golbat

text: Golbat is a large, blue, chiropteran Pokémon with purple wing membranes
name: Golbat

text: It has small eyes with slit-like pupils, along with tiny triangular ears with purple insides, and a massive mouth with two fangs in each jaw
name: Golbat

text: The fangs are smaller on a female Golbat
name: Golbat

text: While its mouth seems to be otherwise empty, Golbat occasionally displays a long, purple tongue
name: Golbat

text: It has short legs with long, tiny feet
name: Golbat

text: Despite this, Golbat can walk skillfully on the ground
name: Golbat

text: Golbat's fangs have hollow tubes (similar to straws) specialized for sucking blood
name: Golbat

text: While they are strong enough to pierce thick hide, they are also unexpectedly fragile
name: Golbat

text: There are some Golbat that have missing fangs as a result of their hunger-fueled attempt to try drinking blood from Steel-type Pokémon
name: Golbat

text: Golbat feeds on the blood of both Pokémon and humans and is capable of drinking over 10 ounces (300 milliliters) of blood in one sitting
name: Golbat

text: It is gluttonous, and drinks so much blood that its blood type will change to that of its victim following a feed
name: Golbat

text: It occasionally gorges itself to the extent that it becomes too heavy to fly, leaving itself vulnerable in turn
name: Golbat

text: However, it is also willing to share gathered blood with other members of its kind that are hungry
name: Golbat

text: Golbat is nocturnal and can be found quite easily in caves
name: Golbat

text: Oddish looks like a small animated plant
name: Oddish

text: Its body is blue, with two small feet and red eyes
name: Oddish

text: On top of its head grows a large clump of five long green leaves
name: Oddish

text: Oddish is a nocturnal Pokémon, using moonlight rather than the sun's rays for photosynthesis
name: Oddish

text: During the day, Oddish avoids the sun's heat and brightness by burying itself into the earth, leaving only the leaves on top of its head visible above ground
name: Oddish

text: This way, it disguises itself as a plant, misdirecting its carnivorous diurnal predators
name: Oddish

text: While buried, Oddish nourishes itself by absorbing nutrients from the soil using its feet, which are said to temporarily change into a root-like structure for this purpose
name: Oddish

text: If anyone pulls at Oddish's leaves and tries to uproot it while it is buried underground, Oddish will react by shrieking in a horrible voice
name: Oddish

text: Once nightfall comes, exposure to moonlight causes Oddish to become much more active
name: Oddish

text: It extracts itself from the ground, and its extremities change back into the shape of legs
name: Oddish

text: It then proceeds to bathe itself in the moonlight and grow, as well as wander around scattering its seeds
name: Oddish

text: With the coming of dawn, the cycle repeats
name: Oddish

text: Oddish evolves into Gloom at Level 21
name: Oddish

text: Oddish is a Pokémon that resembles a blue plant bulb or a root vegetable
name: Oddish

text: It has a round body, beady red eyes, a small mouth, and ovoid feet
name: Oddish

text: Five large, green leaves sprout from its head
name: Oddish

text: As demonstrated in the anime, these leaves are prehensile and can be used to scale vertical surfaces and catch light objects
name: Oddish

text: Known by the scientific name Oddium Wanderus, Oddish lives in grasslands
name: Oddish

text: A nocturnal Pokémon, Oddish buries its sensitive body in the ground during the day to avoid the sun and fool predators
name: Oddish

text: If its leaves are pulled in this state, it will respond by shrieking horribly
name: Oddish

text: It starts to move when its leaves begin absorbing moonlight, which it uses to grow
name: Oddish

text: Oddish will wander up to 1,000 feet (300 meters) during the night to scatter its seeds and find a nutrient-rich patch of soil in which to plant itself
name: Oddish

text: The more fertile the earth, the glossier its leaves will be
name: Oddish

text: It is thought that its feet become like tree roots while planted
name: Oddish

text: In Generation I, Petal Dance was its signature move
name: Oddish

text: Gloom has a very wide mouth that is nearly always agape, with something that appears to be drool leaking
name: Gloom

text: The flower on its head is large with four petals
name: Gloom

text: Gloom also has some leaves sticking out of its sides
name: Gloom

text: Female Gloom have just one petal in the flower on its head, while the male have four
name: Gloom

text: The drool of Gloom is very powerful it can be smelt from miles away
name: Gloom

text: Around 1 in 1000 people like to smell its drool, however
name: Gloom

text: Gloom is the evolved form of Oddish, as of level 21
name: Gloom

text: Gloom evolves into Vileplume by use of a Leaf Stone
name: Gloom

text: Gloom can also evolve into Bellossom by use of a Sun Stone
name: Gloom

text: Gloom is a blue, bipedal Rafflesia-like Pokémon with rudimentary hands and feet
name: Gloom

text: On its head is a flower with spherical petals surrounded by four reddish-brown leaves
name: Gloom

text: The petals are a dark reddish-brown and have white spots
name: Gloom

text: A female displays a single large spot on each petal, while a male will have many smaller spots
name: Gloom

text: Gloom's eyes are wide and often appear closed and its lips are thin and purple
name: Gloom

text: Gloom trickles sticky nectar from its mouth with the appearance and consistency of drool
name: Gloom

text: This can be used as a fertilizer for plants
name: Gloom

text: Both this nectar and the flower on Gloom's head release a foul odor strong enough to induce fainting in humans over a mile (1
name: Gloom

text: 6 kilometers) away
name: Gloom

text: However, it can also attract prey, and even a very small number of humans find it pleasing
name: Gloom

text: This odor is a key ingredient for some perfume production
name: Gloom

text: When it is in danger, the odor worsens, but it will not emit its odor if it feels safe
name: Gloom

text: Gloom lives in grassy plains
name: Gloom

text: In Generation I, Petal Dance was its signature move
name: Gloom

text: Vileplume is purple in color with red eyes and four short limbs
name: Vileplume

text: There is also a rafflesia on its head, which is a type of flower known to have a putrid smell
name: Vileplume

text: Female Vileplumes have larger and fewer spots on their petals
name: Vileplume

text: The smell of the flowers attracts prey when they draw close, Vileplume flap their petals, cloaking themselves and their targets in toxic pollen that quickly immobilizes victims
name: Vileplume

text: Even as they walk, Vileplume scatter pollen out of their blooms, turning the surrounding air a sickly yellow
name: Vileplume

text: This pollen can cause poisoning and paralysis in large amounts, but can also trigger massive allergy attacks in even trace amounts
name: Vileplume

text: Like Oddish and Gloom, Vileplume may hide partially buried in the soil, only exposing their flowers for unwary prey to investigate
name: Vileplume

text: Because of this, it is inadvisable to approach large flowers in swamps or jungles, as they may actually be Vileplume in disguise waiting for an opportunity to scatter pollen
name: Vileplume

text: Vileplume are known for their large flower
name: Vileplume

text: The flower releases a large amount of pollen in the air when it is flapped
name: Vileplume

text: The flapping of the flower can be very loud at times
name: Vileplume

text: Vileplume is one of two evolved forms of Gloom, the other being Bellossom
name: Vileplume

text: Gloom evolves into a Vileplume with the use of a Leaf Stone
name: Vileplume

text: Vileplume is an indigo, bipedal Rafflesia-like Pokémon with rudimentary hands and feet
name: Vileplume

text: It has beady red eyes and a small mouth, and its head and torso are a single joined segment
name: Vileplume

text: On its head is a massive red flower with five bulky petals and an orange-brown center
name: Vileplume

text: Vileplume's flower is said to have the largest petals in the world and is almost too heavy for the Pokémon itself to support
name: Vileplume

text: The rounded petals of the flower are red and covered with white spots
name: Vileplume

text: A female Vileplume has fewer, but larger, spots on its petals
name: Vileplume

text: Vileplume can shake, flap, or burst its petals into bloom with a bang in order to release clouds of pollen
name: Vileplume

text: This pollen is yellow and highly allergenic to humans, and toxic to other Pokémon Vileplume uses it to paralyze its prey before devouring it
name: Vileplume

text: The larger the Vileplume's petals are, the more potent the toxin on its pollen is
name: Vileplume

text: Vileplume's behavior of flapping its petals also makes very loud noises
name: Vileplume

text: In Generation I, Petal Dance was its signature move
name: Vileplume

text: Being the result of an evolution via Evolution stone, Vileplume is rarely found in the wild, though they can be found in grassy plains
name: Vileplume

text: It is often mistaken for local flowers in the wild
name: Vileplume

text: Paras resembles a cross between a cicada nymph and a crab
name: Paras

text: It has an orange shell-like exterior
name: Paras

text: Its two front legs are very large, allowing Paras to grip on to prey and its environment
name: Paras

text: The most distinct feature are the two mushrooms on its back
name: Paras

text: It also has very large eyes on the top of its head
name: Paras

text: Paras are covered in fungal spores upon birth, specifically that of a variety known as tochukaso
name: Paras

text: As a Paras grows, so do the mushrooms on its back, which are not present at birth and do not emerge until later in development
name: Paras

text: Paras feed by burrowing and sucking nutrients out of tree roots in turn, the mushrooms drain nutrients out of their host Paras's bodies
name: Paras

text: Paras must feed ravenously as a result
name: Paras

text: Recent discoveries have shown that the mushrooms also control part of their hosts’ brains, and in fact are the ones that signal for Paras to burrow for roots
name: Paras

text: Paras can be found in damp, dark areas where fungi thrive sunlight and dryness can damage their bodies
name: Paras

text: Paras can have the ability Effect Spore or Dry Skin
name: Paras

text: Effect Spore makes the foe paralyzed, asleep or poisoned 30% of the time whenever the foe hits Paras with a physical move
name: Paras

text: Dry Skin causes Paras to recover HP when it is raining and lose HP when it is sunny
name: Paras

text: The mushrooms on Paras' back have a mutualism with each other
name: Paras

text: The mushrooms get energy from Paras, while Paras gets to create spores
name: Paras

text: Paras evolves into Parasect once it reaches level 24
name: Paras

text: Paras is an orange, insectoid Pokémon that resembles the nymph stage of a cicada
name: Paras

text: Its ovoid body is segmented, and it has three pairs of legs
name: Paras

text: The foremost pair of legs is the largest and has sharp claws at the tips
name: Paras

text: There are five specks on its forehead and three teeth on either side of its mouth
name: Paras

text: It has circular eyes with large pseudopupils
name: Paras

text: Red-and-yellow mushrooms known as tochukaso grow on this Pokémon's back
name: Paras

text: The mushrooms can be removed at any time and grow from spores that are doused on this Pokémon's back at birth by the mushroom on its mother's back
name: Paras

text: Tochukaso are parasitic in nature, drawing their nutrients from the host Paras's body in order to grow and exerting some command over the Pokémon's actions
name: Paras

text: For example, Paras drains nutrients from tree roots due to commands from the mushrooms
name: Paras

text: The mushrooms are also popular among collectors and have medicinal uses, usually involving extended life
name: Paras

text: Prior to Generation III, Spore was its signature move
name: Paras

text: The anime has shown that Paras can often be found in caves
name: Paras

text: However, it can also thrive in damp forests
name: Paras

text: In the Alola region, the mushrooms on its back do not grow well
name: Paras

text: This is thought to be from a lack of moisture or nutrients
name: Paras

text: Parasect, like its pre-evolution Paras, is a crab-like Pokémon
name: Parasect

text: Parasect has a large red-orange-spotted mushroom on its back and six legs
name: Parasect

text: Parasect's two front legs are larger than its other four, which are used for gripping its prey
name: Parasect

text: It has been shown in Pokédex entries that Parasect gather in groups to feed off of the nutrients from trees (mostly the bark and roots)
name: Parasect

text: their fungi entirely overtake their bodies and minds
name: Parasect

text: Parasect dwell in damp places due to their fungi's own preferences for moisture (they often compete with Shiinotic for land)
name: Parasect

text: They are highly aggressive
name: Parasect

text: Throughout their lives, the mushrooms continues to drain their hosts until there is nothing left
name: Parasect

text: At that point, they scatter spores over their hosts’ eggs to restart the cycle
name: Parasect

text: If a Parasect's mushroom is entirely removed, the Pokémon enters a comatose state indefinitely
name: Parasect

text: Parasect can have two of the following abilities, either Effect Spore or Dry Skin
name: Parasect

text: Effect Spore allows Parasect to have a 10% chance to paralyze, burn or poison a foe
name: Parasect

text: Dry Skin allows Parasect to recover HP when it is raining and lose HP when it is sunny
name: Parasect

text: Parasect is the evolved form of Paras as of level 24
name: Parasect

text: Parasect is an orange, insectoid Pokémon that has been completely overtaken by the parasitic mushroom on its back
name: Parasect

text: It has a small head with pure white eyes and a segmented body that is mostly hidden by the mushroom
name: Parasect

text: It has three pairs of legs with the foremost pair forming large pincers
name: Parasect

text: The fungus growing on its back has a large red cap with yellow spots throughout
name: Parasect

text: The insect has been drained of nutrients and is now under the control of the fully-grown tochukaso
name: Parasect

text: Removing the mushroom will cause Parasect to stop moving
name: Parasect

text: It can thrive in dark forests with a suitable amount of humidity for growing fungi
name: Parasect

text: Swarms of this Pokémon have been known to infest trees
name: Parasect

text: The swarm will drain the tree of nutrients until it dies and will then move on to a new tree
name: Parasect

text: It has been known to fight with Shiinotic over territory
name: Parasect

text: Prior to Generation III, Spore was its signature move
name: Parasect

text: Venonat is covered in large, purple fur
name: Venonat

text: The feet of Venonat are brown and are about half as long as Venonat itself with its hands being the same color but a third of the size
name: Venonat

text: Venonat have two white antennae that stick out of their head
name: Venonat

text: The most notable feature of Venonat is their large, red eyes
name: Venonat

text: It also has a small nose just under its eyes
name: Venonat

text: Venonat can have the ability Compoundeyes or the ability Tinted Lens
name: Venonat

text: Compoundeyes increases Venonat's accuracy by 30%
name: Venonat

text: Tinted Lens increases the power of not-very-effective moves by 1
name: Venonat

text: 5x
name: Venonat

text: Venonat's eyes are very accurate: they enable Venonat to easily catch extremely small prey
name: Venonat

text: Conway has a Venonat in the episode Camping It Up
name: Venonat

text: Venonat evolves into Venomoth at level 31
name: Venonat

text: Venonat is an insect Pokémon with a spherical body covered in purple fur
name: Venonat

text: The fur releases a toxic liquid and it spreads when shaken violently off their bodies
name: Venonat

text: A pink pincer-like mouth with two teeth, stubby forepaws, and a pair of two-toed feet are visible through its fur
name: Venonat

text: Its limbs are light tan
name: Venonat

text: There is also a pair of white antennae sprouting from the top of its head
name: Venonat

text: However, the most prominent feature on its face are its large, red compound eyes
name: Venonat

text: Venonat's highly developed eyes act as radar units and can shoot powerful beams
name: Venonat

text: Venonat can be found in dense temperate forests, where it will sleep in the hole of a tree until nightfall
name: Venonat

text: It sleeps throughout the day because the small insects it feeds on appear only at night
name: Venonat

text: Both Venonat and its prey are attracted to bright lights
name: Venonat

text: Venomoth is a purple moth Pokémon
name: Venomoth

text: The eyes of Venomoth are black and much smaller than its pre-evolved form
name: Venomoth

text: Venomoth has two white fangs protruding from its mouthpart
name: Venomoth

text: Venomoth has a head, thorax, and abdomen, unlike some other Bug Pokémon
name: Venomoth

text: The wings of Venomoth are larger than its body, with the top sections of its wings being much larger than the bottoms
name: Venomoth

text: Its shiny incarnation has a pale blue wing coloration on its head and upper body, whereas its lower body (abdomen) and legs are a light brown
name: Venomoth

text: Venomoth can have the ability Shield Dust or the ability Tinted Lens
name: Venomoth

text: Shield Dust negates all side effects of attacks
name: Venomoth

text: Tinted Lens increases non-effective moves by 1
name: Venomoth

text: 5x
name: Venomoth

text: Venomoth's wings are covered with scales
name: Venomoth

text: The scales are poisonous and are released when Venomoth flaps its wings
name: Venomoth

text: Venomoth is the evolved form of Venonat as of level 31
name: Venomoth

text: Venomoth is a lepidopteran insect Pokémon whose body is varying shades of purple
name: Venomoth

text: Its head and thorax are both light purple, and it has bulbous, round, light blue eyes, a small mandible, and a three-point crest on its head
name: Venomoth

text: Tucked close to its thorax are three pairs of tiny, whitish legs
name: Venomoth

text: Its abdomen is paler with several black, zigzagging stripes encircling it
name: Venomoth

text: It has two pairs of pale purple moth-like wings with thin black venation
name: Venomoth

text: Venomoth's wings are covered in dust-like scales that vary in color depending on their toxic capability
name: Venomoth

text: Dark scales are poisonous, while lighter scales can cause paralysis
name: Venomoth

text: These scales are released when Venomoth flutters its wings and leak out poison once they make contact with the skin
name: Venomoth

text: Venomoth lives in dense temperate forests with thick undergrowth and little light
name: Venomoth

text: As a nocturnal Pokémon, Venomoth comes out at night to hunt for its favorite prey
name: Venomoth

text: It prefers to feed on insects that gather around light sources, and Venomoth is attracted to bright lights itself
name: Venomoth

text: As stated in Pokémon Adventures, Venomoth has a short lifespan
name: Venomoth

text: Diglett are small, brown moles with two small eyes and a large pink/red nose
name: Diglett

text: Since part of its body is underground, whether or not Diglett has feet, tail(s), etc
name: Diglett

text: is unknown
name: Diglett

text: However, in Pokémon Mystery Dungeon Red Rescue Team and Blue Rescue Team, the rescued Diglett (after Skarmory kidnapped him) claimed to say his feet were getting cold (Which thereafter caused an awkward moment of silence)
name: Diglett

text: Alolan Diglett has three pieces of blonde hair that are on top of its head
name: Diglett

text: Their hair are actually steel whiskers that result from being exposed to high iron content
name: Diglett

text: Diglett live only a few feet underground, and feed on plant roots
name: Diglett

text: They burrow through the ground at a shallow depth, leaving raised earth in their wake, perfect for planting crops
name: Diglett

text: Diglett are frequently kept on farms for this reason
name: Diglett

text: Diglett have very thin skin, and thus if a Diglett is exposed to light its blood will heat up, causing it to grow weak
name: Diglett

text: This weakness to heat causes Diglett to prefer dark places, sticking their heads up only when the sun is not bright
name: Diglett

text: Otherwise, they pop up in caves
name: Diglett

text: Diglett make their homes in tunnels and caves under the earth, most of which are made by burrowing Onix
name: Diglett

text: Alolan Diglett always feel the need to dig through volcanic rocks, making them much stronger than their other regional counterparts
name: Diglett

text: Their head whiskers change shape depending on their mood
name: Diglett

text: Diglett are proficient diggers and can Dig quickly
name: Diglett

text: Alolan Diglett can dig through hard volcanic rocks with their sheer strength
name: Diglett

text: They can communicate with the steel whiskers on their heads
name: Diglett

text: Diglett evolves into Dugtrio once it reaches level 26
name: Diglett

text: Diglett is a tiny, brown Pokémon that seems to be perpetually buried within the earth, leaving only its head visible
name: Diglett

text: Its small stature makes it both the lightest and shortest Ground-type
name: Diglett

text: It has beady black eyes and a large, round, pink nose
name: Diglett

text: A Diglett in Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Red Rescue Team and Blue Rescue Team mentions that it has feet, though their size and appearance are unknown
name: Diglett

text: It spends much of its time underground and has very thin skin
name: Diglett

text: If Diglett is exposed to sunlight, its blood will heat up and cause it to grow weak
name: Diglett

text: Diglett lives in tunnels and caves under the earth, where it feeds on tree roots and vegetables
name: Diglett

text: It also sometimes lives in burrows near forests and has even been shown to live inside of trees
name: Diglett

text: Diglett digs regularly through the earth at a shallow depth, leaving perfectly tilled soil in its wake
name: Diglett

text: Some farmers welcome Diglett because it tills their fields and its droppings enrich the soil, but others consider it a pest for eating their vegetables
name: Diglett

text: In Generation II, Fissure was its signature move
name: Diglett

text: Druddigon is a natural predator of Diglett
name: Diglett

text: In Alola, Diglett has developed three fine gold whiskers on its head from living in soil with high iron content
name: Diglett

text: These whiskers function as sensors and allow it to monitor its surroundings without coming above ground, though it will still occasionally poke its head out to monitor its surroundings
name: Diglett

text: The whiskers can also be used for communication, wobbling around to relay mood or emotion
name: Diglett

text: They stand straight up for anger, swing around for happiness, and droop for sadness
name: Diglett

text: 1 Needing to be able to dig through Alola's volcanic rock, Alolan Diglett is notably stronger than its non-Alolan counterparts
name: Diglett

text: However, they are still very small, tying with Klefki and Meltan as the shortest Steel-type
name: Diglett

text: Despite Diglett having a strong resemblance to Wiglett from the Paldea region, the two Pokémon species are not biologically related, having entirely separate diets and habitats
name: Diglett

text: 2 Their resemblance to each other is said to be a coincidental result of the convergent evolution of adaptations to their respective environments
name: Diglett

text: Dugtrio resembles a congregated trio of Diglett
name: Dugtrio

text: Although they look the same, the heights are varied
name: Dugtrio

text: The middle body is the tallest, the left body is the 2nd tallest, and the right body is the shortest
name: Dugtrio

text: The holes that Dugtrio make are bigger due to the increase in size during its evolution
name: Dugtrio

text: It's brown and it looks similar to a mole, but with a large, pink nose
name: Dugtrio

text: The Alolan form of Dugtrio has developed golden magnetic hair
name: Dugtrio

text: The middle body has the longest and curliest hair, while the left body has shorter blond hair and the right body has the shortest and straightest hair
name: Dugtrio

text: They also have slightly darker body fur
name: Dugtrio

text: Like Diglett, Dugtrio loathe sunlight
name: Dugtrio

text: Nonetheless, Dugtrio are more aggressive than Diglett, and they'll try all kinds of methods to attack its enemy or opponents who are digging holes underground from all directions
name: Dugtrio

text: Druddigon is a known predator of it
name: Dugtrio

text: Regardless, Dugtrio are very friendly with humans
name: Dugtrio

text: Kanto Dugtrio help people with agriculture while the Alolan Dugtrio are worship as the Goddess of The Land
name: Dugtrio

text: Dugtrio are capable of burrowing over 60 MPH
name: Dugtrio

text: This strength to do so sometimes triggers earthquakes or tremors
name: Dugtrio

text: Alolan Dugtrio have hair that will keep growing
name: Dugtrio

text: This hair is actually thin yet heavy stands of steel,and can be used to detect nearby seismic activity
name: Dugtrio

text: Dugtrio live underground in caves
name: Dugtrio

text: PK004: Pikachu's Rescue Adventure, shows they live in hollow trees as well
name: Dugtrio

text: Dugtrio is the evolved form of Diglett as of level 26
name: Dugtrio

text: Dugtrio is a set of Diglett triplets sharing a single body
name: Dugtrio

text: Each head has brown skin, black eyes, and a large, round, pink nose
name: Dugtrio

text: Dugtrio's three heads think the same thoughts and act cooperatively, though on rare occasions may fight over which head gets to eat first
name: Dugtrio

text: In order to make burrowing easier, each head will bob up and down to loosen the soil
name: Dugtrio

text: Dugtrio can tunnel under the earth at 60 mph (100 km/h) to a depth of 60 miles (100 kilometers), triggering tremors and earthquakes
name: Dugtrio

text: It is capable of burrowing endlessly
name: Dugtrio

text: Dugtrio lives in tunnels and caves under the earth
name: Dugtrio

text: As shown in the anime, it sometimes lives in hollow trees in forests
name: Dugtrio

text: It maintains the soil and plants trees to revitalize wooded areas
name: Dugtrio

text: Druddigon is a natural predator of Dugtrio
name: Dugtrio

text: In Generation II, Fissure was its signature move
name: Dugtrio

text: Alolan Dugtrio is nearly identical to its counterpart, except each head has a mop of golden hair formed from modified whiskers
name: Dugtrio

text: The left head has a bob-cut, the right head has curly shoulder-length hair, and the last one has flowing hair that touches the ground behind it
name: Dugtrio

text: This hair is made out of thin, yet heavy strands of steel and it grows slowly and continuously throughout Alolan Dugtrio's life
name: Dugtrio

text: 1 The hairs act as sensors that can detect vibrations from long distances underground
name: Dugtrio

text: The Alolan Dugtrio is regarded as a feminine deity of the earth and taking its hairs is thought to bring bad luck
name: Dugtrio

text: Wugtrio was once considered a regional variant of Dugtrio, but has since been reclassified as a completely separate species
name: Dugtrio

text: Meowth is a small, bipedal, feline Pokémon
name: Meowth

text: It has two cream whiskers on each side of its oval-shaped face and two hairs sticking up on either side of the golden coin-like gem on its forehead
name: Meowth

text: Meowth also has a curled tail
name: Meowth

text: Meowth's tail and feet are cream-colored like the rest of it, but they are brown at the end
name: Meowth

text: It has small paw pads on the undersides of its heels and toes
name: Meowth

text: It is much like a Maneki Neko, a toy of Japanese descent known for bobbing its arm and hand up and down
name: Meowth

text: Alolan Meowth is a light blue-gray with smaller, half-open eyes
name: Meowth

text: It was bred by royalty in the past
name: Meowth

text: They are very spoiled, selfish and arrogant, which makes them popular
name: Meowth

text: Galarian Meowth is a grayish-brown color with thicker fur and a grinning mouth with sharp teeth
name: Meowth

text: It travelled with Vikings in ancient times, which caused its fur to harden into iron
name: Meowth

text: It battles by extending its claws like daggers
name: Meowth

text: Gigantamax Meowth is a distorted version of its original form
name: Meowth

text: Its body becomes extremely long, its eyes turn yellow without pupils and its coin gains a kanji for big on it
name: Meowth

text: Meowth usually preys on other weaker Pokémon, showing that it is carnivorous
name: Meowth

text: However, it sometimes takes in fruits, so it is more accurate to call it an omnivore
name: Meowth

text: Meowth is largely nocturnal and often prowls the streets looking for loose change, as it is attracted to bright shiny objects for some unexplained reason
name: Meowth

text: It always cleans its face to prevent its forehead coin from getting dirtied
name: Meowth

text: It is common to witness Meowth ferociously disputing with Murkrow, which is also known for being equally obsessed with glowing things
name: Meowth

text: Although it can be easily drawn by coins and may befriend people that offers them, its fickleness cannot guarantee such friendships will last when it is feeling good, it will be willing to share a look of its hoarded treasures to its Trainer
name: Meowth

text: Meowth are common Pokémon roaming and dwelling in cities and towns
name: Meowth

text: Some reside at forests or near beaches
name: Meowth

text: Most are ubiquitous in Kanto and Johto, but uncommon in Sinnoh
name: Meowth

text: Alolan Meowth is extremely cunning, capricious and proud, and will become very aggressive when someone dirties its coin or hurts its self-esteem
name: Meowth

text: It is also extremely picky about food due to its kind having dwelt with royalties for centuries
name: Meowth

text: Nonetheless, it is popular among Trainers who prefer giving more attention to others than themselves
name: Meowth

text: It usually repeatedly targets its foes' blind spots during battles
name: Meowth

text: Alolan Meowth were not originated from Alola but instead being an imported species for the royalties
name: Meowth

text: The collapse of dynasties have caused them to become more and more commonplace around Alola
name: Meowth

text: Its Galarian Form is a warrior, often showing off the dark coin on its head to others
name: Meowth

text: The darker and harder its coin, the more respect it can earn from its kind
name: Meowth

text: It doesn't get along with its Kantonian variant
name: Meowth

text: These Meowth spent much of their lives aboard ships, helping their trainers plunder defenseless villages near beaches and rivers
name: Meowth

text: When these raiders returned to their northern homes, they shared some of their stolen riches with their Pokémon
name: Meowth

text: Meowth are known for their razor sharp claws that can ruthlessly scratch their foes and inflict numerous scars
name: Meowth

text: They can effortlessly retract said claws to stealthily sneak away
name: Meowth

text: In the anime, Team Rocket's Meowth is capable of human speech (a skill he learned while living on the street of Hollywood to impress a female Meowth named Meowzie)
name: Meowth

text: Meowth evolves into Persian at level 28
name: Meowth

text: Alolan Meowth evolves into Alola Persian with max happiness
name: Meowth

text: Galarian Meowth evolves into Perrserker at level 28
name: Meowth

text: Meowth is a small, feline Pokémon with cream-colored fur that turns brown at the tips of its hind paws and tail
name: Meowth

text: Its ovoid head features four prominent whiskers, wide eyes with slit pupils, two pointed teeth in the upper jaw, and a gold koban coin embedded in its forehead
name: Meowth

text: Its ears are black with brown interiors and are flanked with an additional pair of long whiskers
name: Meowth

text: Meowth is a quadruped with the ability to walk on its hind legs while the games always depict Meowth on two legs, the anime states that Meowth normally walks on all fours
name: Meowth

text: It can freely manipulate its claws, retracting them when it wants to move silently
name: Meowth

text: The tip of its tail curls tightly
name: Meowth

text: Meowth is attracted to round and shiny objects and has the unique ability to produce coins using Pay Day, which was also its signature move from Generation II to VI
name: Meowth

text: Being nocturnal, it is known to wander about city streets at night and pick up anything that sparkles, including loose change
name: Meowth

text: Upon finding a sparkling object, its eyes will glitter and the coin on its forehead will shine brightly
name: Meowth

text: It shares this intrigue with Murkrow, with whom it often fights with for objects and prey
name: Meowth

text: Meowth is a playful but fickle Pokémon with the capacity for human-like intelligence, with at least one member of the species teaching itself how to speak
name: Meowth

text: Meowth tends to live in urban areas
name: Meowth

text: In Alola, Meowth has a slightly different look
name: Meowth

text: Alolan Meowth's fur is a light blue-gray color
name: Meowth

text: Instead of brown markings, the tip of its tail, whiskers, digits, and the insides of its ears a whitish-gray
name: Meowth

text: Alolan Meowth's whiskers have a slight curve compared to regular Meowth's straighter whiskers, and it has silvery eyes
name: Meowth

text: Meowth was introduced to Alola as a gift to royalty
name: Meowth

text: 1 The luxurious royal lifestyle soon led to Meowth diverging from its origins and becoming the selfish, prideful, and cunning Alolan Meowth
name: Meowth

text: Alolan Meowth will turn hysterical if its coin or pride are besmirched
name: Meowth

text: When the monarchy fell, the rare Alolan Meowth went feral and eventually grew as common in Alola as anywhere else
name: Meowth

text: Galarian Meowth has a shaggy, greyish-brown coat resembling a beard, as well as yellow eyes and a toothy grin
name: Meowth

text: Its coin is now black and extremely hard, with the darkest and hardest coins being especially valued and respected among the species
name: Meowth

text: Galarian Meowth's body has partially turned to iron as a result of many years of living with a race of savage seafarers
name: Meowth

text: As a result of many battles, Galarian Meowth develops the ability to evolve into Perrserker, instead of Persian
name: Meowth

text: Kantonian Meowth and Galarian Meowth don't get along
name: Meowth

text: Some Kantonian Meowth are capable of Gigantamaxing
name: Meowth

text: As Gigantamax Meowth, it has become larger and longer in size
name: Meowth

text: The body extends from the lower half to the shoulder, while the gold coin gains a symbol
name: Meowth

text: Meowth's eyes change to a glowing gold color
name: Meowth

text: The tail grows long as well, with the end of it tips extending
name: Meowth

text: The tail gets even larger and bumpy when it uses an attack
name: Meowth

text: Three red clouds surround it below the shoulders
name: Meowth

text: The giant coin on Gigantamax Meowth's head emits a lot of Gigantamax power that surrounds the area with a golden gleam
name: Meowth

text: Its desire for shiny objects increases to the point where it will cause damage to skyscraper windows and exterior walls for the sake of sharpening its claws
name: Meowth

text: 2 The symbol on Gigantamax Meowth's gold coin is believed to be the key to unlocking the secrets of Dynamax
name: Meowth

text: Gigantamax Meowth is the only known Pokémon capable of using the G-Max Move G-Max Gold Rush
name: Meowth

text: Persian resembles a large cat
name: Persian

text: Its fur is beige in color, and it has a curly tail
name: Persian

text: There is also a small, red gem on its forehead, which is said to give the Pokémon power
name: Persian

text: The Persian is named after the Persian breed of cat, although it resembles a cougar, with a yellowish white fur color
name: Persian

text: It may possibly be an albino cougar
name: Persian

text: Another possibility is that it is based on a Siamese cat, a breed of cat which, much like Persian, has a beige coloring and black ears and medium-sized whiskers
name: Persian

text: Persian's Alolan form generally resembles its normal one, albeit colored light blue gray
name: Persian

text: However its most noticeable distinction is its comically oversized spherical head, disproportionately large compared to its slimmer body
name: Persian

text: The gem on its head is now blue, and it has narrow, half-closed eyes and large rounded ears
name: Persian

text: This Pokémon, while very beautiful and elegant is not the best pet, especially for new trainers
name: Persian

text: The reason for this is that Persian are known to have unpredictable temperaments and are apt to turn vicious in the blink of an eye, one moment it might be contentedly purring and rubbing its head against its trainer's hand while it is being petted, the next it could unsheath its claws and scratch the hand that was petting it
name: Persian

text: Its tail raising straight is a sign of it being ready to pounce and attack
name: Persian

text: The Alolan form of this Pokémon is even more difficult to look after, since it was spoiled by the royal families in ancient Alola and thus has made them much more disobedient towards Trainers
name: Persian

text: Despite this, it could be a strong battler in battles but not without applying underhanded tactics such as blindsiding and sucker punching, and will hostilely torment its fallen foes, though it sometimes gets defeated by opponents' counterattacks because of underestimation
name: Persian

text: Some Persian have the ability Limber while others have Technician
name: Persian

text: Limber prevents Persian from being paralyzed
name: Persian

text: Technician powers up non-effective moves
name: Persian

text: Persian will have the Dreamworld ability Unnerve which will prevent its opponent from consuming its berry
name: Persian

text: As for the Alolan varient, it has Fur Coat, Technician Rattled
name: Persian

text: Persian are usually commonly spotted at roads near cities and towns
name: Persian

text: Wild Persian are harder and rarer to be sighted
name: Persian

text: Persian is the evolved form of Meowth, as of level 28, while for Alolan Form, with max Friendship
name: Persian

text: Persian is a large, quadrupedal, feline Pokémon
name: Persian

text: Its fur is pale tan with the exception of its black-rimmed ears
name: Persian

text: It has a short muzzle with a small, black nose, red eyes with slit pupils, rounded ears, a pair of pointed teeth in its upper jaw, and three whiskers on either side of its face
name: Persian

text: Its thick whiskers are very sensitive to changes in air movements, enabling it to detect its prey by movement alone
name: Persian

text: In the center of its forehead is a red jewel
name: Persian

text: Its long tail has a distinctive curl at the end
name: Persian

text: Persian communicates with body language and holds its tail upright to signal its intention to pounce
name: Persian

text: It has long legs and three-toed paws with retractable claws
name: Persian

text: Persian's lithe muscles also enable it to walk without making a sound
name: Persian

text: Persian normally lives in towns and cities
name: Persian

text: Although popular for its elegance, it is extremely difficult to raise as a pet due to its fickle and temperamental personality
name: Persian

text: It will scratch anyone, including its Trainer, with little or no provocation, and has been observed ripping its prey apart for no discernible reason
name: Persian

text: However, when Persian is yanked by its whiskers, it becomes temporarily docile for unknown reasons
name: Persian

text: It is popular among rich people and is targeted by hunters for its jewel
name: Persian

text: Its relationship with Perrserker is one of mutual disdain, as Persian's refined and elegant personality clashes with Perrserker's barbaric nature
name: Persian

text: In Generations II and III, Pay Day was its signature move
name: Persian

text: Alolan Persian has a body that is similar to its regular counterpart, but it has blue-gray fur
name: Persian

text: Its face has a different shape, being larger and more rounded with noticeable jowls
name: Persian

text: This distinctive face, along with its high-class softer-than-velvet fur coat, is admired by the people of Alola
name: Persian

text: Its eyes are usually in a half-closed state, and instead of a red forehead jewel, it has a blue jewel
name: Persian

text: The jewel, though different in appearance, is made of mostly the same material the one on a regular Persian
name: Persian

text: In behavior, it is described as highly intelligent and having an even higher opinion of itself
name: Persian

text: It prefers to use underhanded tactics in battle, but its haughty personality causes it to underestimate opponents
name: Persian

text: Psyduck is a medium-sized, yellow platypus-like or duck-like Pokémon
name: Psyduck

text: Only the feet and bill are tan
name: Psyduck

text: The other body parts are all yellow
name: Psyduck

text: Psyduck has three black hairs on top of its head, and its hands are always on its head due to its constant headache
name: Psyduck

text: Psyduck always hold their heads due to the fact that they have a near-constant headache
name: Psyduck

text: This makes them seem like they are unintelligent, when in fact they are quite clever and wily
name: Psyduck

text: Psyduck suffers from a constant headache
name: Psyduck

text: From time to time, its headache causes it psychic abilities to increase tenfold, but it always forgets when this happens
name: Psyduck

text: Psyduck evolves into Golduck at level 33
name: Psyduck

text: Psyduck is a yellow Pokémon resembling a duck or a bipedal platypus
name: Psyduck

text: On top of its head are three thick strands of black hair, and it has a wide, flat cream-colored beak
name: Psyduck

text: Psyduck's eyes seem vacant and have tiny pupils
name: Psyduck

text: Its legs and tail are stubby, and it has cream-colored webbed feet
name: Psyduck

text: There are three claws on each of its hands
name: Psyduck

text: Psyduck is constantly stunned by its headache and is unable to think very clearly
name: Psyduck

text: It usually stands immobile, trying to calm its headache
name: Psyduck

text: However, when its headache becomes too severe, Psyduck releases tension in the form of strong psychic powers
name: Psyduck

text: The use of these powers produces brain waves identical to those seen in sleepers, and the Pokémon is unable to recall these episodes
name: Psyduck

text: Psyduck lives in freshwater lakes and small ponds, but can be seen in rivers in tropical areas as shown in Pokémon Snap
name: Psyduck

text: Golduck is a blue-colored duck Pokémon
name: Golduck

text: Its hands and feet are now webbed, which result in Golduck's superior swimming skills
name: Golduck

text: Golduck has red eyes and a red gem on its head
name: Golduck

text: Its head has four spikes on top
name: Golduck

text: It has a long tail and its hands and feet have three long claws
name: Golduck

text: Using their webbed limbs, they can easily outspeed even the fastest human swimmers, and as such can make quick work of agile fish they may even use their psychic abilities to disorient and disable their prey before catching them
name: Golduck

text: Surprisingly, Golduck rely heavily on their tails for swimming strength, stamina and maneuverability in addition to their limbs
name: Golduck

text: Golduck can swim for two days straight without rest
name: Golduck

text: They can often be seen gliding agilely through the water at dusk in slower rivers (though they have no trouble with currents)
name: Golduck

text: Most scientists believe that Golduck, with their duck-like appearances and crepuscular natures, are the inspiration behind the mythical kappa, a common myth in regions like Kanto and Johto in these regions, they were thought to punish those who polluted their rivers by pulling them beneath the waters
name: Golduck

text: Golduck can use psychic powers
name: Golduck

text: When they are used, the gem on its head will glow, which nearly drove it to extinction
name: Golduck

text: It is also a strong swimmer
name: Golduck

text: The manga shows that via Telepathy, it can give its Trainer and allies knowledge
name: Golduck

text: It is most likely a fish eater, but eats its food on land as opposed to in the water
name: Golduck

text: Golduck evolves from Psyduck at level 33
name: Golduck

text: Golduck is a blue, bipedal, duck, or platypus-like Pokémon
name: Golduck

text: It has red eyes, a cream-colored beak, a red gem in the center of its forehead, and four spikes on the back of its head
name: Golduck

text: Its hands and feet all have three clawed digits with cream-colored webbing in-between
name: Golduck

text: Its body is especially adapted to have a hydrodynamic shape, and it has a long tail that it uses as a rudder to steer
name: Golduck

text: Golduck is sometimes mistaken for the Japanese monster, and physical inspiration for Golduck, the Kappa due to its general humanoid shape, beak, and webbed hands and feet
name: Golduck

text: Golduck is a fast swimmer, being capable of out-swimming even the most athletic of humans because of its webbed appendages
name: Golduck

text: Even rough seas do not hamper this Pokémon's swimming abilities, and it will sometimes rescue people from shipwrecks
name: Golduck

text: The gem on its forehead glows when it uses its psychic powers, and occasionally when it swims at full speed
name: Golduck

text: In the past, this Pokémon was overhunted due to the belief that the gem granted people supernatural powers
name: Golduck

text: As seen in the manga, Golduck has the ability to give knowledge to its Trainer and fellow Pokémon through telepathy
name: Golduck

text: Golduck can typically be seen swimming in lakes, where it hunts fish
name: Golduck

text: The prey is disabled, captured, and then brought to shore for consumption
name: Golduck

text: Old tales claim Golduck punish those who defile their rivers by dragging them in and taking them away
name: Golduck

text: Mankey is a small, monkey-like Pokémon
name: Mankey

text: They are a mostly tan in color, with a round body, long limbs and a tail
name: Mankey

text: They have a pig nose due to it being the Pig Monkey species
name: Mankey

text: Mankey are also renowned for their pointy ears and medium length fur
name: Mankey

text: They have triangular eyes with red irises this clearly represents the anger this Pokémon is known for
name: Mankey

text: Mankey are known for their incredibly short tempers
name: Mankey

text: Even the slightest provocation can send them into fits of rage
name: Mankey

text: Their bodies shudder uncontrollably and their nostrils flare up right before they strike
name: Mankey

text: Then, they launch relentless flurries of attacks at their foes before they even get a chance to retaliate or escape
name: Mankey

text: Despite their temperaments, Mankey are very social Pokémon that live in groups in the treetops
name: Mankey

text: If one Mankey is angered, the entire colony will attack
name: Mankey

text: In their huge frenzies, they are unable to tell friend from foe and may even attack one another, becoming even angrier
name: Mankey

text: They are very agile creatures, able to swing in the trees to chase foes
name: Mankey

text: If they lose track of their colonies, they will be infuriated by their own loneliness and attack everything they see
name: Mankey

text: They may pass out from their tantrums, but be so angry in their dreams that they reawaken, and then become further enraged by the interruption
name: Mankey

text: Notably, they enjoy bananas, Chesto Berries, and chestnuts, but their inability to peel the latter greatly enrages them
name: Mankey

text: In Alola, it is said that Mankey live a long time because they never hold in their anger
name: Mankey

text: However, despite this they are actually quite playful creatures
name: Mankey

text: Mankey can have the abilities Vital Spirit or Anger Point
name: Mankey

text: Vital Spirit allows Mankey to be immune to sleeping
name: Mankey

text: Anger Point raises Mankey's Attack when it is hit by a critical hit
name: Mankey

text: Mankey are very easy to anger
name: Mankey

text: Mankey evolves into Primeape at level 28
name: Mankey

text: Mankey is a simian Pokémon, similar to a New World monkey
name: Mankey

text: It is bipedal and has a round body covered in whitish, shaggy fur
name: Mankey

text: Its nose is similar to a pig's snout, and it has narrow, red eyes and triangular ears with brown insides
name: Mankey

text: Mankey's three-fingered hands, two-toed feet, and the tip of its curved, prehensile tail are brown
name: Mankey

text: Along with Stufful, it is the smallest known Fighting-type Pokémon
name: Mankey

text: Mankey specializes in physical fighting and is very aggressive and short-tempered
name: Mankey

text: When angry, it begins shaking and its breathing turns rough
name: Mankey

text: Its rage peaks quickly, preventing its victim from being able to flee
name: Mankey

text: It will rampage until it falls asleep, but its anger remains in its dreams
name: Mankey

text: This causes it to wake up and become furious all over again
name: Mankey

text: However, this constant release of stress grants it a long life
name: Mankey

text: Mankey can be found in the mountains, where it lives in treetop colonies
name: Mankey

text: If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason
name: Mankey

text: If it loses sight of its colony or if it is left alone to rage, its loneliness causes it to become infuriated
name: Mankey

text: According to the Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Red Rescue Team and Blue Rescue Team games, Mankey's preferred food is chestnuts
name: Mankey

text: However, Mankey usually lacks the dexterity to peel them
name: Mankey

text: It becomes agitated and rage after attempting to peel a chestnut's spiky shell
name: Mankey

text: Additionally, it also appears to be fond of bananas in the anime
name: Mankey

text: Primeape is a bipedal, simian Pokémon with a round body covered in whitish, shaggy fur
name: Primeape

text: There is usually a throbbing vein on the left side of its forehead, and it has triangular ears with pink insides, narrow eyes with tiny pupils, and a pink, snout-like nose
name: Primeape

text: Its arms and legs are brown and have metal shackles on the wrists and ankles
name: Primeape

text: This is probably indicative of a method of training with weights
name: Primeape

text: The hands have no visible fingers, instead resembling mittens or boxing gloves, and the feet have two toes
name: Primeape

text: Primeape is easily angered even the slightest glance of eye contact will make it furious
name: Primeape

text: When Primeape is furious, its blood circulation is boosted
name: Primeape

text: This makes its muscles stronger, but at the cost of some of its intelligence
name: Primeape

text: However, it has sturdy vessels in its brain that help keep it healthy
name: Primeape

text: It will chase anyone who upsets it and will not stop until it has caught its quarry
name: Primeape

text: Even if it is awoken from sleep, it will groggily chase whatever woke it
name: Primeape

text: They can be found in forests or mountains in Kanto and Sinnoh
name: Primeape

text: Primeape like to eat bananas and other fruits
name: Primeape

text: Primeape are easier to anger than its pre-evolved form
name: Primeape

text: When it attacks, it uses strong punches and kicks
name: Primeape

text: Primeape is the evolved form of Mankey as of level 28
name: Primeape

text: It evolves into Annihilape after using Rage Fist 20 times
name: Primeape

text: Primeape is a bipedal, simian Pokémon with a round body covered in light beige, shaggy fur
name: Primeape

text: There is usually a throbbing vein on the left side of its forehead, and it has triangular ears with pink insides, narrow eyes with tiny pupils, and a pink, snout-like nose
name: Primeape

text: Its arms and legs are brown and have metal shackles on the wrists and ankles
name: Primeape

text: This is probably indicative of a method of training with weights
name: Primeape

text: The hands have no visible fingers, instead resembling mittens or boxing gloves, and the feet have two toes
name: Primeape

text: Primeape is easily angered even the slightest glance of eye contact will make it furious
name: Primeape

text: When it becomes enraged, its blood circulation is boosted
name: Primeape

text: This makes its muscles stronger, but at the cost of some of its intelligence
name: Primeape

text: It has sturdy vessels in its brain that keep it healthy despite its constant anger
name: Primeape

text: It will chase anyone who upsets it and will not stop until it has caught up to its target
name: Primeape

text: Even if it is awoken from sleep, it will groggily chase whatever woke it
name: Primeape

text: In some cases, it has been known to become so angry that it dies, though it is said to look peaceful in death
name: Primeape

text: In the anime, it has shown some fondness for bananas
name: Primeape

text: Primeape can be found on mountains
name: Primeape

text: Primeape and its evolved form, Annihilape, are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Rage Fist
name: Primeape

text: Growlithe is a puppy like Pokémon
name: Growlithe

text: It has bright orange fur with black stripes
name: Growlithe

text: Its belly, tail, and fluff on top of its head are a cream color
name: Growlithe

text: There are no gender differences
name: Growlithe

text: Its Hisuian form has dark orange fur
name: Growlithe

text: The tuft on Hisuian Growlithe's head grows into curls long enough to cover its eyes
name: Growlithe

text: It has a small horn on top of its head
name: Growlithe

text: The igneous rock components in its fur are believed to be the result of volcanic activity in its habitat
name: Growlithe

text: Growlithe are naturally loyal, obedient and protective to their Trainers, and will fearlessly confront any formidable opponents
name: Growlithe

text: Nonetheless, if one is improperly trained, it often bites without warning or unprovoked
name: Growlithe

text: They can also be territorial, easily attacking ones that they deem as invaders to their turfs
name: Growlithe

text: Hisuian Growlithe have lived apart from humans for a long time, thus they are unused to being around people
name: Growlithe

text: They are highly vigilant and tend to be seen watching over their territory in pairs
name: Growlithe

text: They are known to live near volcanoes
name: Growlithe

text: Growlithe have a keen sense of smell, allowing them to never forget what they have smelt
name: Growlithe

text: Growlithe evolves into Arcanine by use of a Fire Stone
name: Growlithe

text: Growlithe is a quadrupedal canine Pokémon
name: Growlithe

text: It has orange fur with black stripes along its back and legs
name: Growlithe

text: The fur on its muzzle, chest, belly, and tail is beige, as is an additional tuft of fur on top of its head
name: Growlithe

text: Growlithe's coat is noticeably longer on its chest and tail
name: Growlithe

text: It has gray eyes, a black nose, and large, round and triangular ears with beige interiors
name: Growlithe

text: Its forepaws have two visible claws, while its hind paws have three toes each
name: Growlithe

text: Each paw has a brown pad
name: Growlithe

text: Growlithe is a friendly and loyal Pokémon that will fearlessly defend its Trainer and territory from harm, even against larger, stronger enemies
name: Growlithe

text: In particular, it has been known to fight with Rockruff over territory
name: Growlithe

text: It will fiercely bark at, bite, and chase away any perceived threat
name: Growlithe

text: Otherwise, this obedient Pokémon will wait motionlessly until given an order
name: Growlithe

text: It has a long history with people, as its bones have been found in Stone Age ruins
name: Growlithe

text: In the wild, Growlithe can be commonly found in grassy plains
name: Growlithe

text: Growlithe also has a powerful olfactory sense
name: Growlithe

text: If it detects an unknown smell in its territory, it roars to flush out the intruder
name: Growlithe

text: It can smell the emotions of others, and never forgets a scent
name: Growlithe

text: However, strong, unpleasant smells can disable Growlithe's sense of smell for short periods, as seen in the anime
name: Growlithe

text: In Hisui, Growlithe's fur is dark orange-red, while its mane and tail are light gray, and its muzzle is a light tan
name: Growlithe

text: The fur is made out of igneous rock components
name: Growlithe

text: Its mane covers its eyes and extends below its head, ending with three curls
name: Growlithe

text: Its ears are round and square with light orange-red interiors
name: Growlithe

text: It has a small horn in its head and its tail is curly
name: Growlithe

text: Hisuian Growlithe's soft and insulated fur allows it to survive the cold weather of Hisui
name: Growlithe

text: Growlithe rarely uses its horn unless needed due to it being easily broken
name: Growlithe

text: A pair of Hisuian Growlithe are known to be vigilant when guarding territory
name: Growlithe

text: Hisuian Growlithe take much longer to bond with humans because they have lived apart from humans for many years
name: Growlithe

text: 1 Growlithe's Hisuian form is the result of it being exposed to volcanic activity in the habitat it lives in during Hisui's ancient times
name: Growlithe

text: Arcanine is a large, bulky canine Pokémon that also possesses traits of tigers and lions
name: Arcanine

text: It has a distinct long dog-like muzzle with a large round black nose
name: Arcanine

text: Its eyes are triangular in shape, with black pupils
name: Arcanine

text: It has short diamond-shaped orange ears with cream colored insides
name: Arcanine

text: The majority of Arcanine's body is covered with bright orange fur with jagged black stripes, resembling the fur of a tiger
name: Arcanine

text: Its most of its head and face, and its chest, legs, are covered in light cream colored fluffy tufts of fur
name: Arcanine

text: It has a long puffy cream-colored tail
name: Arcanine

text: In the Hisuian region, Arcanine's appearance is drastically different compared to the Kantonian variant due to the volcanic areas it lives in
name: Arcanine

text: Hisuian Arcanine has a more reddish-orange fur while its muzzle, mane, tail, and fur tufts covering both its ankles and elbows are dark grey
name: Arcanine

text: Its mane has orange streaks while its head now has three horns protruding out of it (the middle horn is taller)
name: Arcanine

text: Arcanine are proud and regal, with a heart full of loyalty and justice
name: Arcanine

text: One can simply conquer the hearts of humans and other Pokémon through a thunderous roar
name: Arcanine

text: They can occasionally be seen dashing across prairies in fact, this behavior is so well known that even in times past, people have recorded images of Arcanine's majestic sprint on various scrolls
name: Arcanine

text: In the anime, Arcanine has been shown to hide food in its mane and bring the hidden stash to their young
name: Arcanine

text: Scorched plains, prairies and active volcanoes are usually their habitats
name: Arcanine

text: Because of its regal appearance and loyal temperament, Arcanine was known by many legends to help war commanders conquer countries long ago
name: Arcanine

text: They consume a significant amount of stone and soil following volcanic eruptions in order to maintain these parts of their bodies
name: Arcanine

text: These imposing Pokémon are surprisingly agile for their size and weight
name: Arcanine

text: They prance around foes in combat to mislead them into awkward positions while lunging at them with fiery teeth to further startle them
name: Arcanine

text: Then, once opponents overcommit, they lunge to finish them off with well-placed Fire Fangs
name: Arcanine

text: Hisuian Arcanine seem to enjoy these battle dances and will rarely go for direct hits even when they are available
name: Arcanine

text: Both sexes participate in an elaborate mating ritual that involves running in circles, leaping, and releasing flames in time with one another
name: Arcanine

text: Mates judge their compatibility with one another based on how well they can stay in sync during these dances
name: Arcanine

text: A popular Hisuian dance in fact was inspired by Hisuian Arcanine, and the tradition survives in some part of the region to this day
name: Arcanine

text: Volcanoes and surrounding lowlands, as well as mountains, are where this regional form prefers to reside in
name: Arcanine

text: Arcanine's internal flame is the fuel for its amazing speed
name: Arcanine

text: They are one of the fastest Pokémon in the world, and it is said that it can travel up to 6200 miles in one day and night
name: Arcanine

text: Arcanine can also carry their trainers on their backs and scout the seven-seas in less than 3 days
name: Arcanine

text: Hisuian Arcanine are said to have fangs that are cloaked in blazing flames for them to snap their foes
name: Arcanine

text: Despite being a bit bulky in both size and weight, Hisuian Arcanine are surprisingly agile and quick footed they use these traits to lure away opponents
name: Arcanine

text: Arcanine is the evolved form of Growlithe
name: Arcanine
