text: It is evolved with the use of a Fire Stone
name: Arcanine

text: Arcanine is a quadrupedal, canine Pokémon with an orange pelt marked by jagged black stripes
name: Arcanine

text: It has diamond-shaped ears with beige insides, black eyes, a round, black nose, and two pointed teeth protruding from its upper jaw
name: Arcanine

text: Its head, muzzle, and chest are covered in shaggy, beige fur, except for two oval sections around each eye and ear
name: Arcanine

text: Long tufts of fur grow behind its elbows and around its ankles
name: Arcanine

text: Its underside is black, and it has a billowing, beige tail that is bent in the middle
name: Arcanine

text: Each paw has three toes and a round, pink pad
name: Arcanine

text: Arcanine is a fiercely brave and loyal Pokémon
name: Arcanine

text: It is capable of running 6,200 miles in 24 hours with a speed and grace reminiscent of flight
name: Arcanine

text: In Generation II, Extreme Speed was its signature move
name: Arcanine

text: Arcanine has long been admired for its beauty and speed, and anyone who hears its bark will grovel before it
name: Arcanine

text: The source of its power is a flame blazing wildly inside its body
name: Arcanine

text: Being the result of an evolution via Evolution stone, Arcanine is rarely found in the wild, but when found, it is usually seen living in prairies, and Pokémon Snap has also shown it living in active volcanoes
name: Arcanine

text: In the anime, it was shown that it stashes food in its mane and carries it to its nest for its young
name: Arcanine

text: In Hisui, Arcanine has a slightly different look due to the volcanic activity of the environment it lives in
name: Arcanine

text: Its body fur is red-orange while its muzzle, mane, tail, eyebrows, and tufts of fur behind its elbows and around its ankles are gray, and the insides of its ears are light gray
name: Arcanine

text: The gray fur is made out of igneous rock components
name: Arcanine

text: Its cheek mane, ankle fur, and tail form into curls
name: Arcanine

text: Its elbow fur resemble wings
name: Arcanine

text: It has a large horn in the center of its head and three small horns between its head and ears
name: Arcanine

text: Its mane form into curled clumps at the back of its neck and large rectangular clumps on the sides and bottom of its neck
name: Arcanine

text: The rectangular clumps have light red-orange markings on them
name: Arcanine

text: Hisuian Arcanine uses its fangs while engulfed in flames to snap at foes
name: Arcanine

text: Despite how deceivingly bulky Hisuian Arcanine is, it moves around nimbly like a dancer
name: Arcanine

text: This allows it to lead opponents in a merry chase while avoiding them at the same time
name: Arcanine

text: A special Hisuian Arcanine is worshipped by the Hisui people due to it being one of the 10 ancient Pokémon who received a blessing from Arceus
name: Arcanine

text: It is one of the Noble Pokémon who resides in Cobalt Coastlands watched by a Warden
name: Arcanine

text: It is so soft its organs are actually visible
name: Poliwag

text: It also has trouble walking on its feet due to its lack of arms which causes it to be unbalanced
name: Poliwag

text: The swirl on its belly is its internal organs showing through
name: Poliwag

text: If the swirl is tinged, that means it's affected by some disease
name: Poliwag

text: Poliwag will have one of two abilities either Damp where the foe is unable to use Self-Destruct or Explosion, or Water Absorb where Water attacks heal 1/4 of Poliwag's health
name: Poliwag

text: With its light blue tail, it can swim very fast
name: Poliwag

text: It learns attacks such Bubble and Bubble Beam, and that was presumably why it has a small mouth
name: Poliwag

text: The mouth actually acts like a Suction cup to cling onto rocks with fats flowing water, much like the Lileep line's roots
name: Poliwag

text: Poliwag evolves into Poliwhirl at level 25, which can then either evolve into Poliwrath by Water Stone, or Politoed by trade while holding a King's Rock
name: Poliwag

text: Poliwag is an amphibian Pokémon resembling a blue, spherical tadpole
name: Poliwag

text: It has large eyes and pink lips that can also act as suction cups for rocks
name: Poliwag

text: Its skin is very thin, but flexible and difficult to puncture
name: Poliwag

text: There is a black and white swirl on its abdomen, which is actually its internal organs showing through its semitransparent skin
name: Poliwag

text: The swirl is clearer following a meal and will have a white tinge if the Pokémon is affected by disease
name: Poliwag

text: The direction of the belly spiral differs by area the equator is thought to have an effect on it
name: Poliwag

text: Poliwag has newly developed legs that are poor at walking and no arms
name: Poliwag

text: It has a long, thin tail surrounded by a light-blue, semitransparent fin
name: Poliwag

text: Its tail makes it a powerful swimmer
name: Poliwag

text: It loves to waddle on land despite the dangers
name: Poliwag

text: However, it will quickly return back into the water should it see danger
name: Poliwag

text: It cannot walk on land well unless trained everyday
name: Poliwag

text: Because of its ineptitude on land, Poliwag is more likely to be found swimming in small freshwater ponds and lakes
name: Poliwag

text: In the anime, Poliwag feeds on salveyo weed, which can only be found on clear lake bottoms
name: Poliwag

text: Poliwhirl is a large, blue amphibious froglet-like Pokémon
name: Poliwhirl

text: Poliwhirl has large hands and the hands appear to be like gloves
name: Poliwhirl

text: When a Poliwag evolves, the spiral on its belly reverses direction
name: Poliwhirl

text: Poliwhirl are amphibious
name: Poliwhirl

text: Though they are not nearly as clumsy on land as Poliwag, they still prefer to remain in the water, where they have fewer predators
name: Poliwhirl

text: Both Poliwhirl and Poliwag are mesmerized and drawn to the cries of Politoed, and will cease whatever they are doing to locate and congregate around the source of such noises
name: Poliwhirl

text: They have been shown to even respond to audio recordings rather than actual Politoed
name: Poliwhirl

text: Poliwhirl can have the abilities Damp and Water Absorb
name: Poliwhirl

text: Water Absorb allows Poliwhirl to recover 1/4 of the HP the attack would perform if the attack is a Water-type
name: Poliwhirl

text: Damp prevents opponents self-destruction
name: Poliwhirl

text: It is capable of living in or out of water in order to live out of water, it must sweat to keep itself slimy
name: Poliwhirl

text: It prefers to live underwater in ponds where there is less danger
name: Poliwhirl

text: In battle, it uses the spiral shape on its belly to put the foe to sleep
name: Poliwhirl

text: It does this by subtly undulating the spiral, causing drowsiness and eventually sleep
name: Poliwhirl

text: It is also capably of easily escaping the grasp of foes due to its greasy skin
name: Poliwhirl

text: Poliwhirl is the evolved form of Poliwag, as of level 25
name: Poliwhirl

text: Poliwhirl has two choices of evolution - it can evolve into a Poliwrath via a Water Stone, or it can be evolved into a Politoed by trading it with the King's Rock item attached
name: Poliwhirl

text: Poliwhirl is a blue, bipedal amphibian Pokémon with a spherical body
name: Poliwhirl

text: It has bulbous eyes that protrude from the top of its head
name: Poliwhirl

text: A black and white swirl covers its belly, which is actually its organs showing through its thin skin
name: Poliwhirl

text: It appears to have white gloves on its hands and rounded, digit-less feet
name: Poliwhirl

text: When out of water, it sweats to keep its skin moist and healthy
name: Poliwhirl

text: This keeps it covered in an oily fluid that allows it to slip away from enemies
name: Poliwhirl

text: All of its skin feels this way except where its swirl is, which is instead very smooth
name: Poliwhirl

text: The swirl on its belly undulates slowly and staring at it induces drowsiness
name: Poliwhirl

text: Even though Poliwhirl is capable of moving on land, it prefers to stay in freshwater ponds and lakes where it has fewer natural enemies
name: Poliwhirl

text: It feeds on both bug and fish Pokémon
name: Poliwhirl

text: While it will leave the water to capture bug Pokémon, it will return and consume them underwater in safety
name: Poliwhirl

text: Its swirl is used to make children fall asleep
name: Poliwhirl

text: Poliwhirl's sweat is filled with slimy mucus
name: Poliwhirl

text: When captured by an enemy, it either slithers to escape or use its swirl to put the enemy to sleep
name: Poliwhirl

text: Poliwrath appears to have a blue round shaped body with a white belly and a black spiral on it
name: Poliwrath

text: It also appears to have white fists and its pupil grow smaller than its pre-evolutions
name: Poliwrath

text: Poliwrath is an adept swimmer and can outspeed even the fastest of human swimmers
name: Poliwrath

text: However, it prefers to inhabit dry land rather than spending most of its life in aquatic habitats
name: Poliwrath

text: Its muscle development is incredibly strong that Poliwrath itself can swim the entire Pacific Ocean without resting
name: Poliwrath

text: In the Alolan Region, Poliwrath are well known as expert breast stroke swimmers
name: Poliwrath

text: Children often imitate how Poliwrath swims
name: Poliwrath

text: Poliwrath's body is all solid muscle
name: Poliwrath

text: It is able to swim through frigid waters and smash through ice floes with its powerful arms
name: Poliwrath

text: A skilled swimmer and martial artist, Poliwrath uses its strong arms to dish out powerful attacks
name: Poliwrath

text: Poliwrath may have the abilities Water Absorb or Damp or the hidden ability Swift Swim
name: Poliwrath

text: Water Absorb restores a little of Poliwrath's HP when hit by a Water-type move instead of taking damage
name: Poliwrath

text: While Damp prevents the use of Self-Destruct or Explosion
name: Poliwrath

text: Swift Swim raises Poliwrath's speed in the rain
name: Poliwrath

text: Poliwrath is the evolved form of Poliwhirl by use of a Water Stone
name: Poliwrath

text: It is one of the final evolved forms of Poliwag
name: Poliwrath

text: Poliwrath is a blue, bipedal amphibian Pokémon with a round body and muscular arms
name: Poliwrath

text: It has bulbous eyes that protrude from the top of its head and its belly is covered by a white and black swirl
name: Poliwrath

text: There appear to be white gloves on its hands, and it has rounded, digit-less feet
name: Poliwrath

text: Poliwrath's body is almost entirely muscle, and the muscles in its arms and legs never tire
name: Poliwrath

text: It also has zero percent body-fat
name: Poliwrath

text: When it swims, it uses all of the muscles in its body and is able to swim vast distances with minimal breathing
name: Poliwrath

text: It is even capable of briefly running on the water's surface
name: Poliwrath

text: It can also smash through ice and plow forward using its strong arms
name: Poliwrath

text: Poliwrath is capable of out-swimming even world-class swimmers
name: Poliwrath

text: Poliwrath is also skilled at martial arts
name: Poliwrath

text: It can launch powerful square punches capable of crushing boulders into dust
name: Poliwrath

text: Many children learn how to swim by replicating Poliwrath's movement
name: Poliwrath

text: It is one of the most gifted swimmers of all Water-type Pokémon
name: Poliwrath

text: Being the result of an evolution via Evolution stone, Poliwrath is rarely found in the wild
name: Poliwrath

text: When found, it is usually seen living on dry land near the water's edge, despite it being an excellent swimmer
name: Poliwrath

text: In Alola, Poliwrath found are strong enough to use the breaststroke while swimming
name: Poliwrath

text: Abra in the anime
name: Abra

text: Abra is a golden-brown, human-like fox Pokémon with three fingers and toes on both arms and legs
name: Abra

text: Its eyes are mostly closed because of its tendency to sleep a lot
name: Abra

text: The shoulders are brown
name: Abra

text: Abra has a long tail with one brown stripe
name: Abra

text: Feet have 3 sharp claws, 2 on the front and 1 on the heel
name: Abra

text: Abra stands 2'11 and has the same physical appearance, no matter what its gender is
name: Abra

text: It has slightly pointed ears and its body looks slightly like it has a type of body armour on its top half
name: Abra

text: Since Abra sleep so much, they expend very little energy and don’t eat much
name: Abra

text: They will teleport into treetops when awaken to easily pick Berries
name: Abra

text: Abra sleep through most of the day, but should not be awoken unless in immediate danger
name: Abra

text: It has been known to sleep 18 hours a day, as it needs its rest for its telekinetic abilities
name: Abra

text: Abra also can teleport away from danger by the means of using the move Teleport
name: Abra

text: It can even perform this technique while asleep
name: Abra

text: If it doesn't get enough sleep, its powers fade
name: Abra

text: Abra evolves into Kadabra at level 16 and then into Alakazam via trading
name: Abra

text: Abra is a bipedal mammalian Pokémon that is primarily yellow
name: Abra

text: Its face is kite-shaped with a small, pale yellow snout and two short, pointed ears with pale yellow interiors
name: Abra

text: Its wide eyes are normally closed
name: Abra

text: Abra's body is segmented with black skin is visible between its joints and along its neck
name: Abra

text: It has two brown, pauldron-shaped extensions on its shoulders, as well as a brown, fauld-like piece around its chest
name: Abra

text: It has three digits on each hand and foot, but its fingers considerably shorter than its toes
name: Abra

text: Two of its toes face forward and one faces backward
name: Abra

text: Its tail is thick and long, with a brown band located near the tip
name: Abra

text: Abra can sense danger through a telepathic radar
name: Abra

text: When it does, it teleports to a safe location
name: Abra

text: However, it sometimes becomes panicked if it wakes in an unknown location
name: Abra

text: By hypnotizing itself, Abra is able to teleport itself even while sleeping
name: Abra

text: It can use other extrasensory abilities while sleeping as well and can even teleport into the treetops to pick and eat berries
name: Abra

text: The deeper Abra sleeps, the farther it teleports
name: Abra

text: Due to the strain of its telepathic powers, however, Abra sleeps 18 hours each day
name: Abra

text: If it fails to rest long enough, it will become unable to use its powers
name: Abra

text: The contents in Abra's dream can affect its powers
name: Abra

text: Abra lives in urban areas, but has been observed to teleport to a different location once per hour
name: Abra

text: If it teleports randomly, it can create illusory copies
name: Abra

text: Kadabra has a similar anatomy to Abra however, there are some differences
name: Kadabra

text: Kadabra holds a metal spoon forged by its psychic powers
name: Kadabra

text: Also, Kadabra's tail is large and curly
name: Kadabra

text: It also has a mustache
name: Kadabra

text: The mustache is larger on male Kadabra's
name: Kadabra

text: Kadabra's stomach has three red stripes, while its forehead has a five-pointed red star
name: Kadabra

text: Kadabra remain floating while they sleep, using their flexible tails as pillows
name: Kadabra

text: a Kadabra in danger may be able to perform more powerful attacks than usual
name: Kadabra

text: Kadabra can have the ability Synchronize or the ability Inner Focus
name: Kadabra

text: It does not have a strong physical body but prefers to use its psychic powers
name: Kadabra

text: If this Pokémon is nearby, an eerie shadow appears on TV screens
name: Kadabra

text: Seeing the shadow is said to bring bad luck
name: Kadabra

text: It is also said that to control this Pokémon in the most beneficial way you should have psychic powers, like the trainer Sabrina
name: Kadabra

text: When Kadabra is around, its strong psychic powers can sometimes interfere with electronics like computer monitors or televisions
name: Kadabra

text: Kadabra is the evolved form of Abra as of level 16, and evolves into Alakazam when traded
name: Kadabra

text: Kadabra is a primarily yellow, slightly humanoid Pokémon with mammalian features
name: Kadabra

text: It has two long, pointed ears on top of its head, a red star on its forehead, narrow, deep-set eyes, and wide cheeks leading down to a thin snout
name: Kadabra

text: Extending from each side of its snout are two mustache-like tufts of fur a male will have a longer mustache than a female
name: Kadabra

text: Kadabra's torso is segmented with bulky shoulders, a thick, brown chest, and a small abdomen marked by three red, wavy lines
name: Kadabra

text: Attached to the Pokémon's abdomen is a large, thick tail encircled with a brown band near its base
name: Kadabra

text: Its arms are thin with brown elbows and end in three-fingered hands with white claws
name: Kadabra

text: Its legs have prominent knees and large, three-toed feet, also ending in white claws
name: Kadabra

text: Two of its toes face forward and one backward
name: Kadabra

text: Kadabra is always seen carrying a silver spoon, which amplifies its telekinetic powers
name: Kadabra

text: A gold spoon does not work as an amplifier and Kadabra is only half as strong without a spoon
name: Kadabra

text: Kadabra emits alpha waves strong enough to induce headaches, and can even cause clocks to run backwards, machines to malfunction, and delicate devices to cease functioning altogether
name: Kadabra

text: The waves increase further in strength the more danger Kadabra faces
name: Kadabra

text: By closing its eyes, it can double the number of alpha particles it emits
name: Kadabra

text: When it has a headache, the alpha waves become unusual
name: Kadabra

text: All of Kadabra's brain cells work in unison while it uses its powers
name: Kadabra

text: It sleeps while levitating, using its springy tail like a pillow
name: Kadabra

text: It can store up psychic energy inside its star in preparation for its evolution
name: Kadabra

text: There is a theory that Kadabra was born from a transformed human child who could not control his powers
name: Kadabra

text: Kadabra lives in urban areas
name: Kadabra

text: Kadabra and its evolved form, Alakazam, are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Kinesis
name: Kadabra

text: Alakazam is a human-like Pokémon
name: Alakazam

text: It is colored yellow and brown, and it has some fox-like features
name: Alakazam

text: It is also shown carrying two spoons, which it uses to fight with strong, telekinetic powers
name: Alakazam

text: Like Kadabra, Alakazam's gender can be identified by the length of its mustache
name: Alakazam

text: Alakazam are highly intelligent Pokémon they exude so much psychic energy from their brains that those nearby may develop headaches
name: Alakazam

text: Their spoons are thought to have been created purely of this energy, though this has not been proven
name: Alakazam

text: An Alakazam can recognize its own spoons from another's, leading some to believe each pair is completely unique
name: Alakazam

text: These Pokémon will gift one of their spoons as a sign of utmost affection, and according to folklore anything eaten with a gifted spoon will taste sublime
name: Alakazam

text: In battle, Alakazam use their intellects to their advantage
name: Alakazam

text: They quickly calculate variables like type advantages, chance of missing, and so on
name: Alakazam

text: These factors make Alakazam popular choices for Psychic-type Pokémon amongst trainers, using their great minds to strategize in battles
name: Alakazam

text: Alakazam will have the same ability it had when it was a Kadabra
name: Alakazam

text: Synchronize transfers a status effect to an opponent if Alakazam gets a status effect
name: Alakazam

text: Inner Focus prevents Alakazam from flinching
name: Alakazam

text: Alakazam is known as one of the smartest Pokémon
name: Alakazam

text: It has an IQ of 5,000 and has the brain of a supercomputer
name: Alakazam

text: It can remember every battle it has ever fought in
name: Alakazam

text: Alakazam is the final form of Abra
name: Alakazam

text: Kadabra only evolves into Alakazam through trade
name: Alakazam

text: Alakazam can further evolve into Mega Alakazam using its Alakazite
name: Alakazam

text: Alakazam is a slightly humanoid Pokémon with a large mustache
name: Alakazam

text: A female Alakazam has a significantly shorter mustache than a male
name: Alakazam

text: It has a long, thin snout, narrow eyes, ear-like spikes extending from the top of its head, and an additional spike protruding from each cheek
name: Alakazam

text: Covering its yellow, skeletal body are brown armor-like sections over its chest, shoulders, forearms, and knees
name: Alakazam

text: There are three toes on each foot, each of which has a white claw
name: Alakazam

text: Two of the toes face forward, while one faces backwards
name: Alakazam

text: It wields a silver spoon in each hand, which act as amplifiers for its psychic abilities
name: Alakazam

text: The spoons are created using its psychic powers and it may give one to someone it trusts
name: Alakazam

text: As Mega Alakazam, its mustache turns white and becomes longer and bushier
name: Alakazam

text: It also grows a long, white beard
name: Alakazam

text: The armor-like sections become bulkier, and its upper body section becomes slightly shorter to reveal its thin stomach
name: Alakazam

text: The ear-like spikes become slightly shorter and a larger spike forms on top of its head
name: Alakazam

text: Additionally, it gains an oval, red organ in the center of its forehead
name: Alakazam

text: The organ is said to emit psychic power
name: Alakazam

text: Its lower legs become longer and slimmer and its feet become skinnier and resemble talons
name: Alakazam

text: It gains three additional spoons, for a total of five that it levitates in the air
name: Alakazam

text: At the cost of its already-low muscular strength, Mega Alakazam's power is entirely converted to pure psychic energy
name: Alakazam

text: It can read the course of a person's entire life with a single glance
name: Alakazam

text: Alakazam is able to use all forms of psychic abilities
name: Alakazam

text: The overflow of its psychic powers can cause headaches to those nearby
name: Alakazam

text: These powers are used to move its body, as opposed to its weak muscles
name: Alakazam

text: It also uses its psychic powers to hold up its head, which is too heavy to be supported by its neck
name: Alakazam

text: Due to its continually growing brain, its head becomes larger with age
name: Alakazam

text: It is said to have an excellent memory and can remember everything that it has experienced since hatching as an Abra, to the time of its death, and has an IQ that exceeds 5,000
name: Alakazam

text: It is found in urban areas
name: Alakazam

text: Alakazam and its pre-evolved form, Kadabra, are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Kinesis
name: Alakazam

text: Machop is a bluish-gray Pokémon with large arm muscles
name: Machop

text: It has three brownridges on its head, rib-like protrusions on its sides, has a tail, and resembles a human child
name: Machop

text: Machop can have the abilities Guts and No Guard
name: Machop

text: Guts increases Machop's attack when it has a status effect
name: Machop

text: No Guard allows both the opponent's and Machop's attacks to hit more often
name: Machop

text: Machop is very strong and is capable of mastering many types of martial arts
name: Machop

text: Machop usually train in large, open mountains with boulders and trees as sources, they train to master any type of martial art, this makes them strong and powerful
name: Machop

text: Machop evolves into Machoke at level 28, and again into Machamp when traded
name: Machop

text: Machop is a humanoid, bipedal Pokémon that has blue-gray skin
name: Machop

text: It has three brown ridges on top of its head, large red eyes, and a relatively flat face
name: Machop

text: On either side of its chest are three, thin, rib-like stripes
name: Machop

text: Its feet appear to have no toes, while its hands have five fingers
name: Machop

text: Machop also has a short, stubby tail
name: Machop

text: Machop's entire body is covered with muscles that will never tire or cramp
name: Machop

text: With these muscles, it can lift many times its own body weight
name: Machop

text: Machop is capable of hurling up to 100 adults
name: Machop

text: It trains by lifting Graveler every day and becomes more dedicated the more its muscles grow
name: Machop

text: Machop's muscles can never get sore, no matter what training it does
name: Machop

text: It spends its time and energy practicing all different forms of martial arts and trying to improve its abilities
name: Machop

text: Once it feels confident, it challenges Makuhita to a battle
name: Machop

text: Machop lives in the mountains
name: Machop

text: In Generation II, Vital Throw was its signature move
name: Machop

text: Machoke is a very muscular Pokémon that is purplish-gray in color
name: Machoke

text: It has lost its tail and has become more human-like
name: Machoke

text: Its arms have exposed veins which express its phenomenal power, and it wears a belt to contain this power
name: Machoke

text: Machoke are really helpful, because they are usually willing to help when a family moves in or other things, they will help, even if demanded
name: Machoke

text: Machoke have incredible stamina like their pre-evolutions, not tiring even when doing the most strenuous of activities
name: Machoke

text: They are always focused in battle, trying to get the most out of their training sessions
name: Machoke

text: When their services are not required, they will return to the mountains to continue lifting and training themselves to become even stronger
name: Machoke

text: In contemporary sculpting, Machoke are also popular motifs and even models for sculpting classes
name: Machoke

text: Machoke boasts so much strength that it can be dangerous
name: Machoke

text: The belt it wears suppresses this energy
name: Machoke

text: Machoke is the evolved form of Machop as of level 28, and evolves into Machamp by trade
name: Machoke

text: Machoke is a bipedal, humanoid Pokémon covered in blue-gray skin
name: Machoke

text: It has a vaguely reptilian face with a short snout, narrow red eyes, and four pointed teeth visible inside its mouth
name: Machoke

text: Two of these teeth are in the upper jaw, while two are in the lower jaw
name: Machoke

text: On top of its head are three brown ridges
name: Machoke

text: Its arms are muscular with dark red, vertical stripes on them
name: Machoke

text: The lower part of its body has black markings that resemble briefs
name: Machoke

text: It is always seen wearing a black and gold power-save belt resembling a championship belt
name: Machoke

text: It possesses large pectoral muscles that protrude slightly over its belt
name: Machoke

text: Machoke is a Pokémon of immense strength
name: Machoke

text: Its muscles are as hard as steel, and it is capable of lifting extremely heavy objects with only one finger
name: Machoke

text: Machoke's body is powerful enough to never get tired
name: Machoke

text: Machoke is a popular Pokémon used as a motif for sculptures
name: Machoke

text: In spite of this, it is modest and often helps people with manual labor
name: Machoke

text: The belt it wears regulates its strength, but Machoke removes it when facing a truly powerful opponent
name: Machoke

text: It can be found in the mountains, where it trains daily
name: Machoke

text: In Generation II, Vital Throw was its signature move
name: Machoke

text: Machamp is a large, four-armed humanoid Pokémon
name: Machamp

text: Machamp's physical appearance is similar to Machoke's, except without the snout, red lines on its arms, and the belt
name: Machamp

text: It is bluish-gray in color unlike its pre-evolution, Machoke, which is purple in color
name: Machamp

text: Machamp are really fierce and strong, as they are able to knock a foe over the horizon, they can also throw over 1,000 punches in 2 seconds, so Machamp are really deadly
name: Machamp

text: Machamp love challenges, and will only fight harder when faced against strong opponents
name: Machamp

text: However, they are terrible at delicate, precise work their arms get jumbled together when attempting to manage fine details, and they will often end up destroying whatever they were trying to work with in the first place
name: Machamp

text: Using its heavy muscles, it is capable of punching its opponent clear over the horizon
name: Machamp

text: One arm alone is said to be able to move mountains, Using all four arms it releases powerful punches
name: Machamp

text: It swings its arms to rock the opponent with punches and chops from all angles
name: Machamp

text: It uses for arms to pin its opponent's limbs and tosses them
name: Machamp

text: If Machamp tries to do delicate work, its arms get tangled
name: Machamp

text: It tends to leap into action before thinking
name: Machamp

text: It is known to have mastered every possible form of Martial Arts
name: Machamp

text: It punches with its four arms then builds up speed within that it can launch 1,000 punches in two seconds
name: Machamp

text: Machoke evolves into Machamp when traded
name: Machamp

text: Machamp is a humanoid Pokémon with four well-muscled arms
name: Machamp

text: It has bluish-gray skin, red eyes, and pale yellow lips
name: Machamp

text: On its head, there are three brown ridges right above its eyes
name: Machamp

text: It has two arms on each side of its body: a pair located in the normal position, and another pair directly above that attaches on the top of the shoulders
name: Machamp

text: It has black markings that resemble briefs and wears a golden power-save belt that resembles a championship belt
name: Machamp

text: Its legs have considerable muscle tone, and its feet have two toes each
name: Machamp

text: Machamp are said to know every martial arts style in the world
name: Machamp

text: It punches extremely quickly, throwing five hundred punches a second
name: Machamp

text: With only one hand, it can move a mountain
name: Machamp

text: In Generation VII, Strength was its signature move
name: Machamp

text: Because of its four arms, it can hit from a multitude of angles and pin all of its foe's limbs down at once
name: Machamp

text: Its arms also allow it to attack and defend simultaneously
name: Machamp

text: The four arms react much faster than Machamp can think
name: Machamp

text: However, it has poor dexterity, and cannot handle delicate work without its arms becoming tangled
name: Machamp

text: The belt it wears restricts its muscle activity, but it can cause consequences if removed
name: Machamp

text: In Generation II, Vital Throw was its signature move
name: Machamp

text: Being the result of an evolution via trading, Machamp is rarely found in the wild, though they can be found in the mountains
name: Machamp

text: As Gigantamax Machamp, it swells to enormous proportions and acquires immeasurable strength
name: Machamp

text: Due to Gigantamaxing, its arms are filled with Gigantamax energy, making its punches as hard as bomb blasts
name: Machamp

text: Its bluish-gray skin becomes darker
name: Machamp

text: The ridges on its head are also darker, with the middle ridge becoming longer
name: Machamp

text: Its eyes become bright yellow
name: Machamp

text: The neck extends with black markings
name: Machamp

text: The four fists are now dark orange, with orange-yellow veins connecting to two orange spots on each arm
name: Machamp

text: The belt extends with several more notches
name: Machamp

text: The black markings now extend down the legs and stop above the ankles
name: Machamp

text: Three red clouds circle around its waist
name: Machamp

text: Gigantamax Machamp is the only known Pokémon capable of using the G-Max Move G-Max Chi Strike
name: Machamp

text: Bellsprout is a plant-like Pokémon resembling a pitcher plant
name: Bellsprout

text: The body is a thin brown root and stem system with secondary roots making up Bellsprout's legs
name: Bellsprout

text: It has two leaves on each side of its body
name: Bellsprout

text: Its head is yellow and shaped like a bulb while the tip of its mouth is colored pink, resembling lips
name: Bellsprout

text: All Bellsprout have the ability Chlorophyll, which increases Bellsprout's Speed when it is sunny
name: Bellsprout

text: It is said to ensnare its prey in its vines and devour it, and can also spit a highly corrosive fluid that can melt even iron
name: Bellsprout

text: This Pokémon prefers hot and humid environments, since it can absorb more moisture from the ground by planting its root-like feet
name: Bellsprout

text: In battle, Bellsprout can take advantage of its flexibility to bend and sway its way out of the range of its opponent's attacks, no matter how powerful they may be
name: Bellsprout

text: It is quick capturing its prey with its vines
name: Bellsprout

text: Bellsprout evolves into a Weepinbell at level 21
name: Bellsprout

text: It then evolves into Victreebel when a Leaf Stone is used on it
name: Bellsprout

text: Bellsprout is a plant-based Pokémon with a stem-like brown body
name: Bellsprout

text: There is a single green leaf on each side of its body
name: Bellsprout

text: It has a yellow bell-shaped head with what appear to be pink lips at the end and beady black eyes
name: Bellsprout

text: It is capable of spitting corrosive acid from its mouth
name: Bellsprout

text: Its stem is long, thin and very flexible, making it capable of swerving rapidly to avoid many attacks or moving with blinding speed to capture prey
name: Bellsprout

text: Its roots resemble feet, and it uses them as such
name: Bellsprout

text: It will plant its roots in the ground to replenish water, but it is unable to flee while it is rooted
name: Bellsprout

text: Bellsprout prefers hot and humid places, thus it lives in temperate forests and jungles
name: Bellsprout

text: Weepinbell is a plant Pokémon
name: Weepinbell

text: It lacks legs, so it hovers in the air
name: Weepinbell

text: The head of Weepinbell is yellow with three yellow-green spots on it
name: Weepinbell

text: On the top of its head is a vine
name: Weepinbell

text: It somewhat resembles a venus flytrap-like plant, just like Victreebel
name: Weepinbell

text: All Weepinbell have the ability Chlorophyll
name: Weepinbell

text: Chlorophyll increases Weepinbell's Speed when the sun is out
name: Weepinbell

text: This Pokémon captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder
name: Weepinbell

text: The hooked stem behind its head lets Weepinbell hang from a tree
name: Weepinbell

text: Sometimes it sleeps up there so in the middle of the night it might fall
name: Weepinbell

text: Weepinbell evolves from Bellsprout at level 21
name: Weepinbell

text: It can evolve into Victreebel with the use of a Leaf Stone
name: Weepinbell

text: Weepinbell is a pitcher plant Pokémon with a yellow, bell-shaped body
name: Weepinbell

text: Above Weepinbell's circular eyes are three small green spots and a small, brown hook-shaped stem
name: Weepinbell

text: It has wide, gaping mouth with pink lips
name: Weepinbell

text: On each side of its body is a large, green leaf
name: Weepinbell

text: Weepinbell camouflages itself as a plant in the forest whilst awaiting an unwary victim
name: Weepinbell

text: When its prey draws near it sprays poison powder to immobilize the target before melting it with its internal acids
name: Weepinbell

text: It oozes a neutralizing fluid that prevents these internal acids from melting its own body
name: Weepinbell

text: It will also slice its prey too large to consume into pieces with its razor-sharp leaves
name: Weepinbell

text: Weepinbell live in temperate forests and jungles where it hangs from tree branches by its stem to sleep
name: Weepinbell

text: If it moves around during sleep, Weepinbell may slip and awaken to find itself on the ground
name: Weepinbell

text: Victreebel's body greatly resembles its pre-evolution Weepinbell, having a yellow bulbous head with dark green spots
name: Victreebel

text: It also sports two eyes close to its large mouth, which has a pink tip that resembles lips
name: Victreebel

text: It has two green leaves at the sides of its body
name: Victreebel

text: Inside its mouth are two fangs
name: Victreebel

text: A brown vine is also connected to the back of its body which sports a yellow bulb on one end and a large leaf covering its mouth on the other
name: Victreebel

text: All Victreebel have the ability Chlorophyll
name: Victreebel

text: Chlorophyll increases Victreebel's Speed when the sun is out
name: Victreebel

text: Victreebel lure their prey in by emitting a sweet scent
name: Victreebel

text: When the Pokémon goes inside Victreebel's mouth, it is swallowed whole
name: Victreebel

text: Victreebel is the evolved form of Weepinbell, and is the final evolutionary form of Bellsprout
name: Victreebel

text: Weepinbell evolves into Victreebel at any given level, by use of a Leaf Stone
name: Victreebel

text: Victreebel is a pitcher plant Pokémon with a bell-shaped body
name: Victreebel

text: It has a gaping mouth with pink lips and two sharp teeth
name: Victreebel

text: Its semicircular eyes appear directly under its mouth and it has several dark green spots on its body
name: Victreebel

text: On either side of its body is a large green leaf
name: Victreebel

text: Covering Victreebel's mouth is a leaf with a long, brown, yellow-tipped vine growing out of it
name: Victreebel

text: The vine is flicked to mimic an animal in order to attract prey
name: Victreebel

text: Victreebel also produces a sweet scent to further aid in luring its victims
name: Victreebel

text: Acid that has dissolved numerous prey animals becomes sweeter and even more effective at attracting prey
name: Victreebel

text: It can be found in small groups and is territorial
name: Victreebel

text: In the manga, Victreebel hoards food, usually small birds and rodents, and collects Leaf Stones to perform evolution rituals at night to help Weepinbell become more Victreebel
name: Victreebel

text: Being the result of an evolution via Evolution stone, Victreebel is rarely found in the wild, though they can be found in temperate forests and jungles
name: Victreebel

text: Tentacool is an aquatic Pokémon based on the box jellyfish
name: Tentacool

text: Tentacool have two long tentacles that extend from the base of its large, blue head
name: Tentacool

text: There are three red gems on this Pokémon's head: two on the sides of its head and one on its forehead
name: Tentacool

text: It drifts aimlessly wherever the ocean currents take it, sometimes ending up in shallow waters where it may be accidentally caught in fishing lines
name: Tentacool

text: Tentacool may also end up stuck on beaches when low tide comes since its body is largely composed of water, it will shrivel up, risking death from dehydration if it stays out of the sea for too long
name: Tentacool

text: Tentacool has two main weapons
name: Tentacool

text: At the tips of its tentacles are toxic feelers, which it uses to stab anything it touches with stinging acid
name: Tentacool

text: Due to its excellent camouflage in the water, Tentacool can often remain undetected by swimmers right up to the moment it stings them
name: Tentacool

text: Tentacool's gelatinous, watery body can also absorb sunlight and refract it within, producing beam energy it shoots from its crystal-like eyes
name: Tentacool

text: Tentacool can have the ability Clear Body or the ability Liquid Ooze
name: Tentacool

text: Clear Body prevents the opponent from lowering Tentacool's stats
name: Tentacool

text: Liquid Ooze damages any opponent who attempts to drain Tentacool's HP
name: Tentacool

text: Its body is composed almost entirely of water
name: Tentacool

text: It also shoots strange beams from its crystals on its head
name: Tentacool

text: Tentacool evolves into Tentacruel at level 30
name: Tentacool

text: Tentacool is a small, cnidarian Pokémon
name: Tentacool

text: It has a light blue, clear body with two large, transparent, red crystals on each side of its body and one small one in the middle
name: Tentacool

text: Near the base of its body is a pointed, beak-like projection and two eyes with small pupils
name: Tentacool

text: There are two grayish tentacles extending from beneath its round lower body, which has a cape-like formation on the back
name: Tentacool

text: Tentacool's entire body is made of 99% water, and the remaining 1% contains the organ that produces its poison
name: Tentacool

text: It absorbs sunlight and refracts it using the water inside its body to convert it into beam energy
name: Tentacool

text: Its tentacles are laced with stinging cells and, as seen in the anime, it can control Pokémon it touches with its tentacles
name: Tentacool

text: The tentacles break off occasionally, but they can regenerate
name: Tentacool

text: The poison from its tentacles is so potent, that someone would need to be immediately rushed to the hospital
name: Tentacool

text: Tentacool is not a very strong swimmer, traveling throughout the world using ocean currents
name: Tentacool

text: Tentacool searches for food while drifting on the surface of shallow seas
name: Tentacool

text: Tentacool can blend in the water, making it very difficult to spot
name: Tentacool

text: It will sometimes wash ashore and shrivel up due to dehydration, though it remains equally as dangerous
name: Tentacool

text: Tentacool may be revived if thrown back into the sea
name: Tentacool

text: Tentacool is mistakenly believed to be a species relative of Toedscool in actuality, the two Pokémon are biologically unrelated
name: Tentacool

text: Tentacruel has only a few differences from its pre-evolved form
name: Tentacruel

text: It now has 14 long tentacles
name: Tentacruel

text: It also has a beak the mouthparts are on the front and back of Tentacruel's head, resembling blue pincers
name: Tentacruel

text: Also, as seen in the image above, Tentacruel has two huge eyes below its head
name: Tentacruel

text: Tentacruel can have the ability Clear Body or the ability Liquid Ooze
name: Tentacruel

text: Clear Body prevents the opponent from lowering any of Tentacruel's stats
name: Tentacruel

text: Liquid Ooze damages any opponent that tries to drain Tentacruel's HP
name: Tentacruel

text: With 80 tentacles for ensnaring victims, it prevents escape until the prey is weakened by poison
name: Tentacruel

text: Tentacruel evolves from Tentacool at level 30
name: Tentacruel

text: Tentacruel is a large, cnidarian Pokémon
name: Tentacruel

text: It has a clear, light blue body that has two large, red orbs on either side and smaller orb in the center
name: Tentacruel

text: Its eyes are visible in its round lower body, which is black
name: Tentacruel

text: Extending from its lower body are two blue, beak-like appendages and numerous grayish tentacles
name: Tentacruel

text: Its red orbs glow whenever it is excited or agitated, communicating with its own kind, and it may alert others to danger by stridently flashing them
name: Tentacruel

text: They are also capable of refracting sunlight, storing energy, and firing ultrasonic waves
name: Tentacruel

text: Tentacruel's primarily light blue body helps it camouflage in the water
name: Tentacruel

text: It has a total of 80 tentacles, which it can readily extend during hunts to ensnare its prey in a net-like shape before immobilizing it with poison
name: Tentacruel

text: The tentacles can grow or shrink with ease
name: Tentacruel

text: Its tentacles can absorb water to stretch even further
name: Tentacruel

text: Most of these tentacles are hidden and kept short, leaving up to 14 exposed
name: Tentacruel

text: However, it tends to lose tentacles as it ages
name: Tentacruel

text: While Tentacruel are rarely seen, they can gather in large groups which scares away any nearby fish Pokémon
name: Tentacruel

text: Tentacruel lives in underwater rock formations and can be found throughout the ocean
name: Tentacruel

text: Although Toedscruel bears a strong resemblance to Tentacruel, the two species are biologically unrelated
name: Tentacruel

text: Geodude has a rock for a head, no nose, and two long arms that start with a bulging muscle and end with rock hands resembling a human's
name: Geodude

text: Alolan Geodude are slate gray with black eyebrows and three-fingered hands (the middle, ring and pinky fingers are now one)
name: Geodude

text: Geodude most frequently are found in fields and on mountains
name: Geodude

text: People step or trip on them from time to time, mistaking them for rocks
name: Geodude

text: Its arms are so strong that it can use them to climb mountains
name: Geodude

text: Rhyperior sometimes accidentally shoot Geodude from their cannon-like arms, mistaken them as normal rocks
name: Geodude

text: The entire body of an Alolan Geodude is electrical and magnetic
name: Geodude

text: Anyone who steps on a Geodude will feel a slight snap followed by a nasty jolt of electricity
name: Geodude

text: Alolan Geodudes often compete in headbutting battles the one with the strongest magnetic force will attract more iron sand
name: Geodude

text: Geodude can have the ability Rock Head or the ability Sturdy
name: Geodude

text: Rock Head prevents Geodude from suffering recoil damage from using moves like Double-Edge
name: Geodude

text: Sturdy causes all one-hit knockout moves to be negated
name: Geodude

text: Geodude evolves into Graveler at level 25
name: Geodude

text: Graveler further evolves into Golem by trading
name: Geodude

text: Geodude is a brownish-gray boulder Pokémon
name: Geodude

text: It has bulging, rocky eyebrows, trapezoidal, brown eyes, and a wide mouth
name: Geodude

text: Its arms are muscular with five-fingered hands
name: Geodude

text: Geodude uses its arms to climb steadily up steep mountain paths
name: Geodude

text: As a result of their physical appearance, Rhyperior sometimes mistake this Pokémon for actual boulders and fire them through their hands
name: Geodude

text: Geodude is proud of its sturdy body and will bash against others of its kind in a contest of sorts to prove whose body is harder
name: Geodude

text: It will even go as far as to compare itself with other species such as Roggenrola and Carbink
name: Geodude

text: The longer it lives, the more chipped and worn its body becomes
name: Geodude

text: Long-lived Geodude are completely smooth and round and they have a calm demeanor
name: Geodude

text: However, Geodude's heart remains rugged and tough, no matter what
name: Geodude

text: Geodude can be most often found on mountain trails and fields, with a scholar counting about 100 of them on just one route
name: Geodude

text: It will sit still in these areas, which is why it is often mistaken for a rock
name: Geodude

text: It is often stepped on and will sometimes swing its arms in anger when this occurs
name: Geodude

text: When Geodude sleeps deeply, it buries itself halfway into the ground
name: Geodude

text: Once buried, it will not awaken even if someone steps on it
name: Geodude

text: In the morning, Geodude rolls downhill in search of food
name: Geodude

text: In the Alola region, Geodude is made from a magnetic rock with a more silvery appearance
name: Geodude

text: There are areas on Alolan Geodude's body that are especially magnetic and attract iron sand, creating the appearance of black eyebrows and strands of short black hair
name: Geodude

text: Its fingers are fused together, leaving only the thumb and index finger free
name: Geodude

text: Stepping on Alolan Geodude results in an electrical shock and sometimes an angry headbutt
name: Geodude

text: Like regular Geodude, it competes with others by bashing their bodies together
name: Geodude

text: The iron sand sticks to the one with stronger magnetism
name: Geodude

text: The Alolan Golem will fire these Geodude if real rocks are absent
name: Geodude

text: Graveler has four arms which can curl up to its body to roll at any time
name: Graveler

text: Above its eyes is a wide rock crest
name: Graveler

text: Unlike its pre-evolved form, Graveler has feet
name: Graveler

text: Graveler live atop the mountains
name: Graveler

text: When they roll down, it is nearly impossible for it to be stopped
name: Graveler

text: Graveler is the evolved form of Geodude at level 25
name: Graveler

text: Graveler can evolve into Golem, at any given level, when traded
name: Graveler

text: Graveler is a bipedal, boulder Pokémon
name: Graveler

text: Its round body is covered with small bumps and it has a rocky crest above its small eyes and mouth
name: Graveler

text: It has four arms, each with a three-fingered hand
name: Graveler

text: Its second pair of arms is typically kept tucked against its chest
name: Graveler

text: It was shown in Pokémon Snap that, despite having legs, it can revert to a legless form
name: Graveler

text: This grants it the ability to float
name: Graveler

text: Graveler's preferred locomotion is rolling, specifically, because it is a slow walker
name: Graveler

text: It often rolls down mountain paths at high speeds exceeding 60 mph, crushing objects in the way and stopping by running into huge rocks should it build up too much speed
name: Graveler

text: However, it will explode if it rolls into a river instead
name: Graveler

text: Graveler are known to be generally free and uncaring, not minding if pieces of itself break off, as it has the ability to restore itself over time
name: Graveler

text: Graveler climbs a mountain from base to summit, feasting on rocks all the while
name: Graveler

text: Upon reaching the peak, it rolls down to the bottom
name: Graveler

text: Graveler live in horizontal holes that they gouge out in sheer cliff faces
name: Graveler

text: In the Alola region, Graveler looks similar to its regular counterpart, but with a silvery sheen
name: Graveler

text: It lacks defined digits on its upper limbs and has two toes on each foot rather than three
name: Graveler

text: There are several small, yellowish crystals scattered across its body and iron sand attracted by magnetism
name: Graveler

text: This black sand creates crystal-like formations above its eyes, across the tops of the upper pair of arms, and on the sides of its face
name: Graveler

text: Alolan Graveler feeds on dravite, which creates the yellow crystals on its body and grants it electrical abilities
name: Graveler

text: It often fights with others over food, and when two smash together, it creates a flash of light and a booming sound for this reason, people refer to it as the fireworks of the earth
name: Graveler

text: Similar to its Kantonian counterpart, Alolan Graveler also roll down mountain paths however, instead of flattening obstacles as it rolls, it sends them flying by zapping them with electricity
name: Graveler

text: Golem's body resembles a large boulder
name: Golem

text: It has claws on its hands and feet
name: Golem

text: An Alolan Golem is much different than its Kantonian counterpart
name: Golem

text: Two crystalline formations protrude from Golem's back while what appear to be a mustache and beard are actually iron filings
name: Golem

text: Golem's arms are much shorter as well
name: Golem

text: Golem shed their skins annually to grow larger their shells almost immediately crumble away into the soil, enriching it
name: Golem

text: Farmers strive to collect shed Golem pelts as a result
name: Golem

text: Their bodies are whitish and tender for a short period of time, but new shells will quickly harden upon contact with the air
name: Golem

text: However, Golem eventually stop shedding with age, and particularly old individuals may even start growing moss on their carapaces after some time
name: Golem

text: Earthquakes will sometimes send groups of Golem rolling down, endangering alpine homes
name: Golem

text: To protect these structures, grooves are often dug in the sides of mountains to redirect the paths of spooked Golem (and careless Graveler as well)
name: Golem

text: Though they do not have very good aim, their projectiles can easily electrify foes if they even so much as graze them, causing numbness or even fainting such projectiles will release a burst of electrical energy radiating form the point of impact
name: Golem

text: They may even grab Alolan Geodude as ammo if they are not paying attention
name: Golem

text: Though firing their pre-evolutions does not hurt them, their relatives are usually not at all happy about the arrangement
name: Golem

text: These Pokémon must find rocks to reload between each shot, making their attacks rather slow
name: Golem

text: If their opponents draw too near while they are reloading, they may try to electrocute them directly with their cannons
name: Golem

text: These irritable Pokémon can emit crackling electricity from the surface of their bodies when angered to 'growl' with the sound of an approaching thunderstorm
name: Golem

text: Golem can have the ability Rock Head or the ability Sturdy
name: Golem

text: Rock Head prevents Golem from recoiling
name: Golem

text: Sturdy prevents Golem from being KO-ed by 1 Hit KO moves starting with Gen V, Sturdy allows Golem to hang on with 1 HP after being hit by a single attack
name: Golem

text: Golem's Alolan variant gains two new abilities, which are Magnet Pull and Galvanize
name: Golem

text: Magnet Pull, which is shared with the Magnemite line and Nosepass line, prevent Steel-type Pokémon from escaping
name: Golem

text: Galvanize, which is unique among the Alolan Graveler evolution line, converts Normal-type moves into Electric-type moves
name: Golem

text: Golem's hide is so hard, that dynamite can't harm it
name: Golem

text: When they roll down the mountains they live on, they leave grooves
name: Golem

text: The Alolan variant of Golem generates magnetic energy to increase the speed of the electrically charged boulders it launches from the crystals on its back these boulders can paralyze and numb opponents at the slightest touch
name: Golem

text: However, if these boulders aren't available for use, Alolan Golem will use nearby Alolan Geodudes as spare ammunition
name: Golem

text: Unlike its Kantonian counterpart, Alolan Golem is much more stubborn and can discharge electricity when agitated as well as letting out a roar that mimics the sound of Thunder
name: Golem

text: Graveler evolves into Golem when traded
name: Golem

text: It is the final form of Geodude
name: Golem

text: Golem is a bipedal tortoise-like boulder Pokémon with a spherical body covered by a shell of plated, green rocks
name: Golem

text: Its body is so hard that even dynamite cannot scratch it
name: Golem

text: Its head protrudes from the center of the shell
name: Golem

text: The head has a flat snout with two pointed teeth in the lower jaw and red eyes
name: Golem

text: It has short arms that have three claws and two legs with feet that have four claws in front and one in back
name: Golem

text: The head and limbs are light brown in color
name: Golem

text: Golem grows bigger by shedding its skin once a year
name: Golem

text: The discarded shell immediately hardens when exposed to air, crumbling away and returning to the soil
name: Golem

text: However, it stops shedding with age and moss grows over its shell
name: Golem

text: As shown in the Pocket Monsters Carddass Trading Cards, Golem's shell is hollow
name: Golem

text: The anime has shown that Golem is able to withdraw its head and limbs into its shell and roll at high speeds
name: Golem

text: It is dangerous when doing this, as it is unable to see and may crash into or run over anything in its path
name: Golem

text: To prevent it from rolling into the homes of people downhill, grooves are dug into the sides of the mountains to divert the rolling Golem's course
name: Golem

text: It is seldom seen in the wild
name: Golem

text: However, it can be found living in mountainous regions
name: Golem

text: In the Alola region, Golem has much shorter forearms with two claws
name: Golem

text: The feet have only two claws as well
name: Golem

text: Its face attracts iron sand, creating the appearance of a mustache, eyebrows, and a large black beard
name: Golem

text: Jutting out of the top of its body are two large, black rocks with a smaller rock in-between, forming a shape of a cannon
name: Golem

text: On the inner edge of the larger rocks are three golden dots
name: Golem

text: The cannon prevents them from easily rolling into a ball like its Kantonian variant
name: Golem

text: Alolan Golem is capable of firing the small rock by using magnetism
name: Golem

text: The rock will be electrically charged, creating shocks across the whole area of impact
name: Golem

text: Numbness and fainting can occur with even a glancing blow
name: Golem

text: If rocks are not available, it will fire nearby Geodude instead
name: Golem

text: Ponyta is a horse Pokémon that has cream colored fur
name: Ponyta

text: Rather than having a fur mane, Ponyta has one made of fire, which burns when it is happy or excited
name: Ponyta

text: On its heels are streaks of fire
name: Ponyta

text: About an hour after birth, its fiery mane and tail grow out, giving it an impressive appearance
name: Ponyta

text: Galarian Ponyta is white and its mane resembles light blue and purple clouds
name: Ponyta

text: The fire on its legs are replaced with purple fluffy fur
name: Ponyta

text: While Kantonian Ponyta lack horns, Galarian Ponyta has a black horn with a single white stripe
name: Ponyta

text: It is said that they changed type and appearance over generations after being exposed to the energy in the Galarian forests
name: Ponyta

text: Ponyta is very weak at birth, so weak that it can barely stand up
name: Ponyta

text: This Pokémon however becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent
name: Ponyta

text: It is known to run fast and jump high
name: Ponyta

text: It allows humans to ride on its back occasionally
name: Ponyta

text: However, if angered, it may choose to burn its rider by igniting its back
name: Ponyta

text: Although its mane is made of flames, it will never burn a trainer it trusts
name: Ponyta

text: Galarian Ponyta has the ability to absorb life energy and store it in its mane, which causes it to glow
name: Ponyta

text: It never trusts wicked people, who it turns away and vanishes from, whenever it senses one with evil thoughts
name: Ponyta

text: If it accompanies with a Trainer, it means it knows the Trainer is a goodhearted person
name: Ponyta

text: In PJ055, despite that they also have a tendency to be very shy and don't make themselves known to people very much and when in distress or in need of help they send psychic visions to those they trust regardless of the distance
name: Ponyta

text: Ponyta has hooves which are harder than diamond and its legs are strong and durable able to absorb the shock from taking high jumps
name: Ponyta

text: Galarian Ponyta can heal poisoned allies with its psychic powers, and can easily heal wounds only with a gentle touch from its horn
name: Ponyta

text: It can detect a person's kindness with psychic as well, being to identify people who have good hearts
name: Ponyta

text: Ponyta evolves into Rapidash at level 40
name: Ponyta

text: Ponyta is an equine Pokémon with cream-colored fur
name: Ponyta

text: It has brown eyes and triangular ears with reddish interiors
name: Ponyta

text: Yellow and reddish-orange flames make up its mane and tail
name: Ponyta

text: The mane forms a short crest on top of its head and a short strip down its back to its tail
name: Ponyta

text: Additional flames are present behind its elbows and knees
name: Ponyta

text: The fire appears about an hour after hatching
name: Ponyta

text: It has four long legs, each ending in a single, gray hoof
name: Ponyta

text: These hooves are said to be ten times harder than diamonds and act as shock absorbers
name: Ponyta

text: Ponyta are relatively lightweight for their size, as they have extraordinary jumping abilities and are capable of leaping tall buildings in a single bound
name: Ponyta

text: However, a newborn Ponyta is a weak runner and is actually barely able to stand
name: Ponyta

text: It gradually strengthens its legs and becomes faster by chasing after its parents and jumping over grass that grows taller by the day
name: Ponyta

text: In the anime, it is shown that Ponyta can control its flames so that its rider is not burned by them, and Ponyta only does this for those that it has accepted
name: Ponyta

text: Ponyta herds tend to live in grasslands, plains, mountains, or anywhere that they can run freely
name: Ponyta

text: Ponyta has adapted in the forests of the Galar region, after generations of being exposed to the life energy found within
name: Ponyta

text: 1 Galarian Ponyta has chalk-white fur covering most of its body
name: Ponyta

text: Instead of flames, its mane, tail and fetlocks are covered in a long, purple-and-blue, fluffy fur
name: Ponyta

text: Its eyes are purple with light-blue irises, and it has a small purple-and-white horn on top of its forehead
name: Ponyta

text: Galarian Ponyta can absorb the life energy located in the atmosphere and store it in its mane, which will then become more colorful and potentially release a shining glow if there is a lot of energy to use
name: Ponyta

text: 1 Galarian Ponyta's horn has healing powers it can heal any slight wound with a few rubs from its horn
name: Ponyta

text: By looking into the eyes of a person, Galarian Ponyta can read the contents of their heart
name: Ponyta

text: Should it find any evil, it will promptly go into hiding
name: Ponyta

text: As shown in the anime, Galarian Ponyta can send pleas for help in the form of visions to people, even if they're from another region
name: Ponyta

text: Rapidash is a cream-colored, equine Pokémon with red eyes and a long horn atop its head, similar to a unicorn
name: Rapidash

text: Its mane and tail are comprised of red and yellow flames, while smaller embers trail from its fetlocks
name: Rapidash

text: Rapidash is rather competitive and tends to have a rash nature
name: Rapidash

text: The fastest Rapidash will be chosen as its herd's leader, which determines the direction the herd is heading and the speed its herd runs
name: Rapidash

text: Galarian Rapidash is intrepid and resolute, taking pride in its abilities on being able to dash across the forests with the psychic powers stored in the hair around its hooves
name: Rapidash

text: Rapidash can dash at a high speed across vast lands
name: Rapidash

text: It is also one of the fastest Pokémon, with a top speed of 150mph
name: Rapidash

text: Its flaming mane can burn glowingly under high speed boost
name: Rapidash

text: Galarian Rapidash can conjure psychic blades, projections and projectiles through its horn, which are destructive enough to create massive holes through solid metal
name: Rapidash

text: They are quite rare in the wild and can be found mostly in Kanto, although sightings in Sinnoh, Johto and Unova have occasionally been reported
name: Rapidash

text: Galarian Rapidash are reported to be sighted in woods and forests like Glimwood Tangle in Galar
name: Rapidash

text: Rapidash is the evolved form of Ponyta at level 40
name: Rapidash

text: Rapidash is an equine Pokémon with cream-colored fur and a pointed horn on its forehead
name: Rapidash

text: It has small, red eyes and triangular ears with reddish interiors
name: Rapidash

text: Yellow and reddish-orange flames stream from the back of its head to form a long, flowing mane
name: Rapidash

text: A short version of the mane trails down its back to its equally fiery tail
name: Rapidash

text: Flames are also present on its fetlocks
name: Rapidash

text: It has slender legs, each with a single black hoof
name: Rapidash

text: Rapidash is a very agile Pokémon
name: Rapidash

text: It runs at about 150 mph (240 km/h), chasing everything that moves in hopes of racing it
name: Rapidash

text: With incredible acceleration, it reaches its top speed in only ten steps
name: Rapidash

text: At full gallop, its hooves barely touch the ground
name: Rapidash

text: The faster Rapidash goes, the longer the swaying flames of its mane will become
name: Rapidash

text: At an all-out gallop, its blazing mane sparkles, a feature that is said to enhance its beautiful appearance
name: Rapidash

text: Rapidash is capable of traveling an entire region like Hisui within a day and a half
name: Rapidash

text: Rapidash lives in grasslands, but it can also be seen on mountains in Pokémon Snap
name: Rapidash

text: In Galar, Rapidash takes on a new form with a white coat, pale blue eyes, and a long, curly mane and tail colored in streaks of pastel cyan and pink
name: Rapidash

text: Its horn is much longer than that of Kantonian Rapidash, and is deep violet in color with a spiraling white line running its length
name: Rapidash

text: Its fetlocks are adorned with long pink fur that stores psychic energy, which gives it a swift, airy gait, and it has deep violet hooves
name: Rapidash

text: Galarian Rapidash is known for being brave and prideful
name: Rapidash

text: It can channel its psychic power into a powerful Psycho Cut from its horn that can pierce through sheet metal
name: Rapidash

text: It lives in forests
name: Rapidash

text: Slowpoke is a mostly pink Pokémon
name: Slowpoke

text: It stands on four legs, and has a long tail that is used like a fishing pole
name: Slowpoke

text: Its mouth is a pale brown color
name: Slowpoke

text: Galarian Slowpoke's appearance is a result of particles being built from eating Galarica seeds
name: Slowpoke

text: The main difference is that it has gained yellow markings on its forehead and tail
name: Slowpoke

text: Its limbs are more generally spread out while its tail remains closer to the ground rather than in a curved shape like Kantonian Slowpoke
name: Slowpoke

text: Although slow, Slowpoke is skilled at fishing with its tail, and it does not feel pain if its tail is bitten
name: Slowpoke

text: It is also implied that their tails can grow back if it is cut off or removed (either during battle, fishing, and/or occasionally by human's)
name: Slowpoke

text: Slowpoke's tails are also a delicacy and worth a lot of money
name: Slowpoke

text: Slowpoke is described as dopey and rarely moves
name: Slowpoke

text: It doesn't notice when the tail is bitten, cut off and even grown back
name: Slowpoke

text: It can take them over 5 seconds to react to pain
name: Slowpoke

text: To catch food, Slowpoke dangle their tails lazily from the shore into the sea
name: Slowpoke

text: They secrete a sweet substance that attracts fish
name: Slowpoke

text: However, due to their daftness, they sometimes forget why they were even near the water in the first place
name: Slowpoke

text: It can take them up to a day to process bites on their tails
name: Slowpoke

text: Galarian Slowpoke used to eat the seeds of a certain plant that grew in their habitat
name: Slowpoke

text: These seeds were in fact Galarica seeds, used to this day as an essential spice for cooking in the Galar region
name: Slowpoke

text: The Slowpoke in Galar built up particles of this spice in their bodies over several generations, eventually gaining the unique appearance and behavior they are known for today
name: Slowpoke

text: Galarian Slowpoke spend their days wallowing on seashores and riverbanks without thinking about anything in particular
name: Slowpoke

text: Occasionally, they might get a very sharp look in their eyes, but they will soon revert to their zoned-out expression
name: Slowpoke

text: It is thought that this behavior is caused by the accumulated Galarica particles stimulating Galarian Slowpoke's brain, resulting in it thinking of something tremendous—only for the Galarian Slowpoke to immediately forget what it had just thought of
name: Slowpoke

text: It is said that Galarian Slowpoke love Galarica Cuffs and Galarica Wreaths
name: Slowpoke

text: Slowpoke evolves into Slowbro at level 37, or into Slowking when traded while holding a King's Rock
name: Slowpoke

text: In the anime, Slowpoke's evolution is quite different
name: Slowpoke

text: To become Slowbro a Shellder must latch onto Slowpokes tail
name: Slowpoke

text: To become a Slowking, a Slowpoke must put on a King's Rock and have a Shellder clamp onto it
name: Slowpoke

text: Galarian Slowbro evolves into Galarian Slowbro by being given a Galarica Cuff, or Galarian Slowking by being given a Galarica Wreath
name: Slowpoke

text: Slowpoke is a pink Pokémon that resembles a cross between a salamander and a hippopotamus
name: Slowpoke

text: It has vacant eyes that never seem focused, curled ears, and a rounded, tan muzzle
name: Slowpoke

text: It has four legs, each of which ends in a single white claw
name: Slowpoke

text: Its long, tapering tail has a white tip
name: Slowpoke

text: This tail drips a sweet, sappy substance that is attractive to many species of fish
name: Slowpoke

text: Slowpoke uses the tail as a fishing lure
name: Slowpoke

text: The tail often breaks off, but it will grow back
name: Slowpoke

text: Slowpoke tails are considered a delicacy and commonly used as a cooking ingredient: in Alola, they are often dried and used in home-cooked stews, while in Galar, they are smoked and packaged as a curry ingredient
name: Slowpoke

text: Slowpoke is also known to dive underwater to hunt, but is often itself caught instead
name: Slowpoke

text: Slowpoke has a notoriously dim intellect and often forgets what it was doing
name: Slowpoke

text: It takes a long time to respond to outside stimuli
name: Slowpoke

text: For example, it can take up to five seconds to process pain and can take an entire day to notice when its tail has been bitten
name: Slowpoke

text: Slowpoke is commonly found at the water's edge
name: Slowpoke

text: In some places, it is believed that Slowpoke's yawn causes rain
name: Slowpoke

text: This Pokémon is worshiped in those areas
name: Slowpoke

text: Its vacant expression is said to help some people relax, whilst causing irritation to others
name: Slowpoke

text: It is posited that those who lead hectic lives are most likely to become relaxed
name: Slowpoke

text: Galarian Slowpoke's body is a slightly different shade of pink, and it has gained yellow colorations on its forehead and tail
name: Slowpoke

text: This tail is always down and said to have a spicy taste
name: Slowpoke

text: Much like its Kantonian counterpart, Galarian Slowpoke are known to relax on seashores and riverbanks without a care in the world
name: Slowpoke

text: However, sometimes it will get a very sharp look in its eyes as if it is about to think of something tremendous, although it will quickly forget and return to its normal expression afterward
name: Slowpoke

text: It is believed that this behavior, along with the spicy taste of its tail, is a result of Galarica particles built up from its diet of native Galarica seeds affecting its brain and body
name: Slowpoke

text: 1 This diet also affects Slowpoke's two different evolutions, including the Shellder that attaches to it, which is induced by either the Galarica Cuff or the Galarica Wreath
name: Slowpoke

text: Slowbro is a bipedal, pink Pokémon with a tan, striped belly and a tan muzzle
name: Slowbro

text: It has large, vacant eyes, curled ears, and two pointed teeth protruding from its upper jaw
name: Slowbro

text: On its hands, it has three clawed fingers, and two clawed toes on its feet
name: Slowbro

text: There is aShellderattached to its tail
name: Slowbro

text: This Shellder has a gray, spiraled shell with darker gray spots
name: Slowbro

text: There are several spikes across the surface of the Shellder, and it holds onto Slowbro with many sharp teeth
name: Slowbro

text: When Slowbro Mega Evolves into Mega Slowbro, it becomes engulfed by the Shellder to the point where only its head, arms and tail are visible
name: Slowbro

text: The spiral Shellder now has an opening at its tip, allowing the tail of Slowbro to stick out, which it balances on due to its legs being engulfed
name: Slowbro

text: The spikes on the Shellder are now reduced to four on the bottom section of its body, with the dark spots only visible on its middle section
name: Slowbro

text: The Galarian form of Slowbro has purple markings on its upper head and ears, tail, and arms
name: Slowbro

text: The Shellder that attaches to Kantonian Slowbro's tail is on Slowbro's left arm instead, being more similar to an arm cannon
name: Slowbro

text: The spikes on Shellder are larger and more conical
name: Slowbro

text: Kantonian Slowbro is typically rather lazy and unintelligent, but when the Shellder bites down on its tail (causing more venom to head to the brain), it becomes inspired for some reason
name: Slowbro

text: It is very peaceful and avoids confrontation most of the time
name: Slowbro

text: Slowbro are no longer able to fish with their tails and must, to their disdain, swim to catch food
name: Slowbro

text: Galarian Slowbro is more aggressive as the Shellder biting down on its arm causes it to Attack everything indiscriminately, While normally zoned out, it gets rather serious due to a stimulus jolt
name: Slowbro

text: The two organisms have some autonomy in controlling how Galarian Slowbro acts
name: Slowbro

text: By squeezing their Shellder's tongues, these Pokémon can cause them to shoot out a toxin liquid from the tips of their shells
name: Slowbro

text: However, the Shellder can also bite down when they sense danger, triggering their hosts to swing around the arms wildly while shooting toxins to both smash and poison indiscriminately
name: Slowbro

text: Because of this, these Pokémon can be quite dangerous to be around
name: Slowbro

text: By injecting venom into their bloodstreams (either by the parasite's or the host's volition), Galarian Slowbro can drastically sharpen their senses thanks to the venom's reaction with galaricin
name: Slowbro

text: This makes them incredibly quick on the draw, shooting enemies with great accuracy before they even prepare to attack
name: Slowbro

text: Kantonian Slowbro is implied to be able to use powerful psychic attacks it only uses when forced to
name: Slowbro

text: It is also somehow insensitive to pain due to Shellder biting on it, tying into its oblivious and own tempo abilities (which ignores infatuation and confusion)
name: Slowbro

text: It hidden ability, regenerator, heals its slightly when withdrawn from battle
name: Slowbro

text: Mega Slowbro's Shellder has become armor that is unscratchable, reflected in its Shell armor ability (which prevents critical hits on it), while it can move by jumping on its tail like a spring
name: Slowbro

text: The Slowpoke involved is virtually unchanged, aside from becoming stronger and more motivated
name: Slowbro

text: Galarian Slowbro are surprisingly fast, reflected in their signature Quick Draw ability (which gives it chance to strike first)
name: Slowbro

text: Their primary Attack method is shooting poison from its Shellder by pulling in the tongue of the latter
name: Slowbro

text: Slowbro evolves from Slowpoke starting at level 37
name: Slowbro

text: Since Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire, it can Mega Evolve into Mega Slowbro using its Mega Stone, Slowbronite
name: Slowbro

text: Galarian Slowpoke evolves into Galarian Slowbro using a Galarica Cuff
name: Slowbro

text: In the anime, Slowpoke evolves into Slowbro when a Shellder bites its tail
name: Slowbro

text: Slowking is an alternate evolution that happens when a Shellder clamps its head while wearing a King's Rock
name: Slowbro

text: Slowbro is a bipedal, pink Pokémon with a tan, striped belly and a rounded, tan muzzle
name: Slowbro

text: It has large, vacant eyes, curled ears, and two small pointed teeth protruding from its upper jaw
name: Slowbro

text: It has three clawed fingers on its hands and two clawed toes on its feet
name: Slowbro

text: There is a Shellder attached to its tail
name: Slowbro

text: This Shellder has a gray, spiral shell with darker gray spots and small, triangular eyes near the base
name: Slowbro

text: There are several spikes across the surface of the Shellder, and it holds onto Slowbro with many sharp teeth
name: Slowbro

text: Shellder developed its spiral form in an effort to suck more sweetness out of Slowbro's tail
name: Slowbro

text: If its tail or the Shellder attached to it is broken off, Slowbro will revert to its unevolved form, Slowpoke
name: Slowbro

text: Slowbro has lost the capability to feel pain due to the Shellder's poison
name: Slowbro

text: While typically lazy and unintelligent, Slowbro apparently becomes inspired when the Shellder bites down on its tail
name: Slowbro

text: While it is capable of unleashing powerful psychic attacks, Slowbro is typically rather peaceful and usually prefers not to fight
name: Slowbro

text: Because it can no longer fish using its tail, it instead swims to catch its prey and allows the Shellder to feed on its leftover scraps
name: Slowbro

text: Slowbro tends to live near ponds, lakes, and seashores
name: Slowbro

text: When Slowbro Mega Evolves, it becomes engulfed by the Shellder so that only its head, arms, and white-tipped tail are visible
name: Slowbro

text: Its head pokes out of the Shellder's mouth and is surrounded by the Shellder's enlarged teeth
name: Slowbro

text: The Shellder has holes on its sides and an opening at its tip, allowing Mega Slowbro's arms and tail to stick out
name: Slowbro

text: Mega Slowbro balances on its tail due to its legs being engulfed
name: Slowbro

text: It can move by bouncing, using its tail as a spring
name: Slowbro

text: The spikes on the Shellder are now reduced to four on the bottom section of its body and the dark spots only visible on its middle section
name: Slowbro

text: Mega Slowbro's energy has gathered into Shellder, which has increased its hardness
name: Slowbro

text: This allows it to act as armor so hard that nothing can scratch it
name: Slowbro

text: The Slowbro inside is virtually unchanged, but it gains some power and motivation from Shellder's digestive fluids
name: Slowbro

text: In Galar, Galarian Slowbro's appearance is due to Shellder biting Galarian Slowpoke's arm instead of its tail, causing a chemical reaction between the Shellder's poison and the consumed Galarica spices within the Slowpoke's body
name: Slowbro

text: 1 The Shellder attached to its arm resembles the Shellder tail of its Kantonian counterpart but smaller, with a purple tip shaped like a stinger
name: Slowbro

text: Galarian Slowbro itself has a slight color difference compared to its counterpart, with purple accents on its head, arms and tail
name: Slowbro

text: Galarian Slowbro are considered highly dangerous for its tendency to indiscriminately attack its surroundings, the reason for which is due to its Shellder sometimes unconsciously biting down hard on its arm
name: Slowbro
