text: While normally zoned out, when facing a strong opponent its body becomes stimulated, and it will sport a sharper expression
name: Slowbro

text: Galarian Slowbro attacks by grabbing at its Shellder's tongue, causing the Shellder to fire poisonous liquids from its tip
name: Slowbro

text: It attacks at speeds rivaling the quickest of known reflexes
name: Slowbro

text: Galarian Slowbro is the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Shell Side Arm
name: Slowbro

text: Magnemite has light bluish-gray steel body in the shape of a sphere which is kept bound together with the two screws and one large screw at the top of its head
name: Magnemite

text: It has one big eye that is as big as the magnets it uses which can launch electric attacks
name: Magnemite

text: On the side of its body are two horseshoe magnets which expel antigravity, allowing it to float in mid-air
name: Magnemite

text: Magnemite emit electromagnetic energy from its horseshoe magnets in order to keep afloat
name: Magnemite

text: It consumes electricity by attaching itself to power lines
name: Magnemite

text: During power outages, people would often find large groups of Magnemites congregating inside of circuit breakers
name: Magnemite

text: If a Magnemite runs low on its electrical energy supply, it would be rendered incapable of flight (but can be recharged by batteries)
name: Magnemite

text: It is normally pacifistic and would mostly only retaliate with non-damaging moves
name: Magnemite

text: Under the guidance of a Pokémon Trainer, they can become devoted fighters (though the bond needs to be strong enough first)
name: Magnemite

text: Magnemite dislikes some sort of signal that Power Stations use to repel them, and are sensitive to geomagnetic storms accodring to PJ093 that can induce them to gather together akin to Wishiwashi's Schooling ability
name: Magnemite

text: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne
name: Magnemite

text: It also feeds on electricity
name: Magnemite

text: Magnemite evolves into Magneton at level 30
name: Magnemite

text: Magnemite is a seemingly robotic Pokémon that has a gray, spherical metal body with blue-and-red tipped horseshoe magnets on each side and a single, large eye
name: Magnemite

text: It has three Phillips head screws on its body: two near the bottom of its body and the one on top of its head that looks similar to an antenna
name: Magnemite

text: The two bottom screws serve no noticeable purpose, although they may be its feet as the Pokédex identifies a footprint similar to that of the screw's head
name: Magnemite

text: Even though Magnemite and its evolved forms are mechanical creatures, the anime has shown that it has emotions and a way of reproducing
name: Magnemite

text: It has even exhibited the need to eat, although its main form of nutrients is electrical currents
name: Magnemite

text: It is commonly found in locations such as power plants or caves with a strong magnetic field
name: Magnemite

text: Despite its modern, artificial appearance, Magnemite has been depicted in carvings discovered at the Ruins of Alph
name: Magnemite

text: It has also been present in AZ's retelling of the Kalos war, indicating it has existed for at least 3,000 years
name: Magnemite

text: The magnetic units on Magnemite's body generate an electromagnetic field that allows it to defy gravity and can potentially disrupt electrical equipment
name: Magnemite

text: Magnemite is not known to be unnecessarily aggressive but they may approach Trainers with little notice
name: Magnemite

text: If a wild Magnemite is approached, it may simply flee on rare occasions, as Magnemite does not care for interaction
name: Magnemite

text: However, if attacked, it will retaliate with non-damaging moves
name: Magnemite

text: In the care of a Trainer, it can be a devoted fighter
name: Magnemite

text: However, it has been demonstrated that it may be deterred unless a strong bond is formed with its Trainer
name: Magnemite

text: Should it run out of electricity, Magnemite will fall to the ground
name: Magnemite

text: Usually, batteries can help recharge it in order for Magnemite to start moving again
name: Magnemite

text: Magnemite can be attracted to anything emitting electricity or a magnetic field, including gadgets such as a Pokétch
name: Magnemite

text: It has even been shown to be attracted to electric Pokémon producing such fields
name: Magnemite

text: With modern electrical lines buried underground, Magnemite attacks on power plants have increased
name: Magnemite

text: To prevent power outages, these power plants deliberately send out signals Magnemite cannot stand to ward them off
name: Magnemite

text: Magneton is simply the result of three Magnemite linked together through a strong, magnetic force
name: Magneton

text: The Magnemite that make up Magneton are usually linked together in a triangle formation (with two on the bottom and one on top)
name: Magneton

text: However, some 3-D games (usually the Stadium series) depict Magneton as three separate Magnemite
name: Magneton

text: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that holds it together
name: Magneton

text: Similar to its pre-evolved form, Magnemite, Magneton is able use electromagnetism to levitate and move around
name: Magneton

text: The electromagnetic energy that Magneton emits is so strong that any nearby electronic devices would be fatally damaged in fact, the strength of Magneton's electromagnetic powers are three times more stronger than Magnemite's
name: Magneton

text: Another dangerous side effect of Magneton's strong electromagnetic force is creating black outs in many cities because of this, many cities forbid any Trainer from letting Magneton out of its Poké Ball
name: Magneton

text: At high voltage, Magneton can release stronger waves of electromagnetic energy and radio waves that can increase temperatures up to 3
name: Magneton

text: 6 degrees Fahrenheit with a nearby 3,300-ft
name: Magneton

text: radius
name: Magneton

text: It is also able to cause earaches to anyone that gets too close to it
name: Magneton

text: Magneton usually appear frequently whenever sunspots flare up
name: Magneton

text: The abilities that Magneton can have are Sturdy or Magnet Pull
name: Magneton

text: Sturdy prevents any OHKO moves from hitting Magneton
name: Magneton

text: Magnet Pull prevents any Steel-type Pokémon from escaping battle
name: Magneton

text: Magneton, along with its evolution family, is the only Electric Pokémon that can learn Zap Cannon via leveling up
name: Magneton

text: Magneton is the evolved form of Magnemite
name: Magneton

text: It evolves into Magnezone by leveling up in a location with a special magnetic field (before Generation VIII) or being exposed to a Thunder Stone (Generation VIII)
name: Magneton

text: Magneton is a robot-like Pokémon, the result of three Magnemite becoming linked together by a strong magnetic force, although a single Magnemite can evolve by itself when no other Magnemite are in the vicinity
name: Magneton

text: Each individual Magnemite has a gray spherical body with a single eye, a gray and red-and-blue tipped horseshoe magnet on each side
name: Magneton

text: The topmost Magnemite has three Phillips head screws on its body, while the others appear to have only two
name: Magneton

text: The three Magnemite that Magneton consists of can be linked in several ways
name: Magneton

text: Magneton is most commonly seen as one Magnemite on top, and two Magnemite linked by the screws on the bottom, forming a triangle
name: Magneton

text: In some cases, commonly seen in 3D games such as Pokémon Snap, the Magnemite will not be connected at all, remain in a triangular formation at rest, and are able to freely move within each other's vicinity to form other patterns
name: Magneton

text: In this case, all three Magnemite have three screws
name: Magneton

text: The magnetic forces that hold the three Magnemite together are powerful enough to dry up all moisture and raise the temperature by 3
name: Magneton

text: 6°F (2°C) within a radius of 3,300 feet (1,000 meters)
name: Magneton

text: It can also be disruptive to electronic devices
name: Magneton

text: It uses powerful radio waves to help it study the surrounding area
name: Magneton

text: Being composed of three Magnemite, it is about three times as powerful electrically, though not three times as intelligent
name: Magneton

text: Even though Magneton is a mechanical creature, it still has the need to eat
name: Magneton

text: As seen in the anime, food for Magneton consists of electrical currents
name: Magneton

text: It is usually found in rough terrain, often near power plants
name: Magneton

text: When sunspots flare up, Magneton tends to appear more often, presumably due to the changes in the sun's magnetic field
name: Magneton

text: When rain clouds form, it also gathers in high areas prone to lightning strikes
name: Magneton

text: As seen in Pokémon Adventures, it possesses the ability to form its electricity into both platforms and barriers
name: Magneton

text: Despite its modern, artificial appearance, carvings depicting Magneton have been discovered at the Ruins of Alph, and one was shown in a flashback to the great war of Kalos, indicating it has existed for at least 3,000 years
name: Magneton

text: A Galarian Farfetch'd (left) and Kantonian Farfetch'd (right)
name: Farfetch'd

text: Farfetch'd is an avian Pokémon that bears a resemblance to a duck
name: Farfetch'd

text: It is brown in color contrasted with a yellow bill and white underbelly
name: Farfetch'd

text: The wings of a Farfetch'd show a dexterous quality, as they are equally adapted to manipulate objects much like hands in addition of being used for flight
name: Farfetch'd

text: Farfetch'd has webbed feet, a characteristic common with most ducks
name: Farfetch'd

text: Its face is adorned with a black V-shaped marking along with a trio of feathers that crown its head
name: Farfetch'd

text: It is also holding a leek stalk, which it brandishes as a weapon
name: Farfetch'd

text: Galarian Farfetch'd have darker brown feathers and carry a larger leek
name: Farfetch'd

text: It also has a more serious expression
name: Farfetch'd

text: They can't live without the leeks they hold and that's why they defend their leeks from attackers with their lives
name: Farfetch'd

text: They won't eat their leeks even in intense hunger, as seen by Goh's Farfetch'd
name: Farfetch'd

text: They protect the fields in which these plants grow with their dedication, and will often fight with each other for choice stalks
name: Farfetch'd

text: Their wings have adapted to be more finger-like to enable them to grasp leeks, though some prefer hold them in their beaks instead
name: Farfetch'd

text: Farfetch’d may actually eat their own leeks though
name: Farfetch'd

text: They will begin search endlessly for new ones immediately afterwards, however
name: Farfetch'd

text: Galarian Farfetch'd are rather strong, able to tug around much bigger leeks than their Kantonian Forms
name: Farfetch'd

text: They can be seen sparring with one another to practice their skills, and are particularly fond of one-on-one duels
name: Farfetch'd

text: Both forms of Farfetch'd can use their leeks as their melee weapon to defend themselves
name: Farfetch'd

text: Their stalks enable them to use slashing moves such as Night Slash, False Swipe, and Aerial Ace different fighting styles have been observed in different regions
name: Farfetch'd

text: Farfetch’d are also surprisingly adept in water, thanks to their webbed feet, and can sometimes be found swimming in ponds
name: Farfetch'd

text: Prior to Generation VIII, Farfetch'd did not evolve
name: Farfetch'd

text: It was (before the release of Sirfetch'd) the first Pokémon in the Pokédex that does not evolve into or evolve from anything
name: Farfetch'd

text: To evolve into Sirfetch'd, Galarian Farfetch'd must land 3 critical hits in the same battle
name: Farfetch'd

text: Farfetch'd is an avian Pokémon that resembles a light brown duck with a white underbelly
name: Farfetch'd

text: It has a flat, yellow beak, brown eyes, a V-shaped black marking on its forehead (similar to a unibrow), and a three-feather crest on top of its head
name: Farfetch'd

text: Its wings are as big as its body and appear to be prehensile enough to substitute for hands
name: Farfetch'd

text: It has yellow legs with webbed feet and a stubby tail
name: Farfetch'd

text: Farfetch'd is always seen carrying a leek stalk or spring onion
name: Farfetch'd

text: It carries this sprig in its wings, but sometimes chooses to hold it in its beak or feet instead
name: Farfetch'd

text: Unable to live without its stick, Farfetch'd will defend it with its life
name: Farfetch'd

text: Losing the stalk can leave Farfetch'd defenseless, and it will seek out a new one to replace it
name: Farfetch'd

text: Known uses for the stick include use as a weapon, nesting material, and emergency food source
name: Farfetch'd

text: When using the stalk to attack, Farfetch'd wields and uses it like a sword to cut through things
name: Farfetch'd

text: There are several different fighting styles involving Farfetch'd's leek
name: Farfetch'd

text: It is selective about which sticks it will use and has been known to fight over good ones
name: Farfetch'd

text: Farfetch'd is found in temperate grasslands where reedy plants grow, guarding the plants from anyone trying to disturb them
name: Farfetch'd

text: However, Farfetch'd is rarely seen, and thus it is thought that its numbers are decreasing, and that it is at risk of extinction
name: Farfetch'd

text: According to sources such as the anime and the Pocket Monsters Encyclopedia, its population decline is caused by humans who hunted it down for food one popular recipe suggested cooking it with its own leek
name: Farfetch'd

text: There have been attempts at breeding in order to increase the Farfetch'd population
name: Farfetch'd

text: In Galar, Farfetch'd has a slightly different look
name: Farfetch'd

text: Galarian Farfetch'd is a deeper shade of brown, with a more prominent black mark on its head
name: Farfetch'd

text: The leek it carries with its wings is much larger in Galar than the leeks that Farfetch'd use in other regions, although whether it is related to the Large Leek used as a curry ingredient is unknown
name: Farfetch'd

text: Galarian Farfetch'd's body has developed a much stronger frame that gives it the strength required to carry its leek
name: Farfetch'd

text: However, this sheer mass makes it hard for it to fly
name: Farfetch'd

text: It is renowned for its courage in battle and can use its leek like swords or javelins
name: Farfetch'd

text: As a result of surviving and experiencing many different battles, Galarian Farfetch'd develops the ability to evolve into Sirfetch'd
name: Farfetch'd

text: Farfetch'd and its Galarian evolved form are the only known Pokémon capable of using the Leek item
name: Farfetch'd

text: Doduo is a tall, bird Pokémon resembling an ostrich
name: Doduo

text: It has two heads that are exactly identical
name: Doduo

text: Doduo is covered in brown down and has large taloned feet
name: Doduo

text: The difference between a male and female Doduo is their necks
name: Doduo

text: Male Doduo have black necks while females have beige necks
name: Doduo

text: Doduo alternately bob their heads to keep balance while running
name: Doduo

text: Their two heads have identical brains (though a few with differing ones have been discovered on occasion) and can communicate ​with each other through telepathy in order to accomplish common goals
name: Doduo

text: The two heads take turns sleeping while one dozes off, the other keeps watch for any potential dangers approaching
name: Doduo

text: This team effort makes it difficult to catch Doduo off-guard
name: Doduo

text: To defend themselves, Doduo can attack with moves such as Double Hit and Drill Peck
name: Doduo

text: They are able to use both heads at once for some moves, effectively being able to target two enemies at the same time if necessary
name: Doduo

text: Doduo can run very fast however, they can't fly very well
name: Doduo

text: Doduo evolves into Dodrio at level 31
name: Doduo

text: Doduo is a two-headed, bipedal avian Pokémon
name: Doduo

text: Each head has a long sharp beak and two beady black eyes
name: Doduo

text: It has a bristly, down-like covering of brown feathers on its body and both heads
name: Doduo

text: A male has black flexible necks, whereas a female has brown necks both genders have brown legs
name: Doduo

text: Each foot has four digits ending in a sharp claw
name: Doduo

text: Both heads have an identical brain
name: Doduo

text: However, it is believed that on occasion they may possess different brains
name: Doduo

text: It is also theorized that the two heads communicate with some form of telepathy for coordination
name: Doduo

text: Even when sleeping or nourishing itself with food and water, one head is always awake and alert and keeps a keen eye out for enemies
name: Doduo

text: Due to its almost non-existent wings, it cannot fly very well
name: Doduo

text: However, it has developed legs that make it a powerful runner
name: Doduo

text: Reaching speeds of 60 mph (100 km/h), it energetically strides across the plains leaving large 4 inch (10 centimeter) deep footprints behind it
name: Doduo

text: By raising and lowering its two heads, it is better able to maintain balance while running
name: Doduo

text: Doduo lives in wide open plains, grasslands, and savannahs
name: Doduo

text: Dodrio is an ostrich-like Pokémon
name: Dodrio

text: It has three heads that each have a black V-shaped crest on top
name: Dodrio

text: Its body is nearly all covered in brown down
name: Dodrio

text: It has large clawed feet
name: Dodrio

text: Its tail is made up of large red feathers
name: Dodrio

text: Even though no wings are seen it is still part Flying type
name: Dodrio

text: Unlike its pre-evolved form named Doduo, the faces on Dodrio's faces look different, with each one representing an emotion: joy, sadness, and anger
name: Dodrio

text: Like Doduo, the males have black necks while the females have beige necks
name: Dodrio

text: Each head controls a different basic emotion one expresses joy, one sadness, and one anger
name: Dodrio

text: They can also use their three heads to conceive complex plans to search for food or defend themselves
name: Dodrio

text: However, they may occasionally over-exhaust themselves with this, and will remain motionless for extended periods of time while recovering
name: Dodrio

text: Their heads do argue sometimes, since the emotions they control tend to disagree
name: Dodrio

text: However, like many internal conflicts, these inner spats are usually solved with food
name: Dodrio

text: Since they share the same stomach, when one of the heads eats, the other two will be satisfied as well
name: Dodrio

text: Those who live near Dodrio may be woken up early in the morning by their raucous calls—they squawk at the same time every day without fail
name: Dodrio

text: Dodrio can have the ability Run Away or the ability Early Bird
name: Dodrio

text: Run Away lets Dodrio flee from any wild Pokémon
name: Dodrio

text: Early Bird allows Dodrio to wake up faster from the Sleep status
name: Dodrio

text: Each of its three heads represents an emotion
name: Dodrio

text: Dodrio's heads represent happiness, sadness, and anger
name: Dodrio

text: They are capable of running over 40 MPH
name: Dodrio

text: Dodrio is the evolved form of Doduo as of level 31
name: Dodrio

text: Dodrio is a large, wingless, three-headed avian Pokémon
name: Dodrio

text: Each head has a long, sharp beak and a black V-shaped, feather crest
name: Dodrio

text: It has bristly brown feathers covering its heads and upper body, while its lower half has a smooth layer of black feathers
name: Dodrio

text: Its tail consists of three pale red feathers with lighter tips
name: Dodrio

text: Its wingless body rests on two long and slender, but powerful legs with feet that have three clawed toes in front and one in back
name: Dodrio

text: A male has black necks, whereas a female has brown necks both genders have brown legs
name: Dodrio

text: Each head has its own working brain and distinct personality
name: Dodrio

text: Each head represents and expresses either sorrow, anger, or joy
name: Dodrio

text: Despite being separate, it has the innate ability to use all three of its brains to collect data, formulate, and then execute complex plans and strategies
name: Dodrio

text: However, on occasion it may overthink, which causes it to become immobilized and unable to carry out any action whatsoever
name: Dodrio

text: Being separate individuals on the same body, the three heads will continue to bicker until they, or at least one of them, gets to eat
name: Dodrio

text: This satisfies the other two heads, quelling them and temporarily ending their infighting
name: Dodrio

text: Another form of adaptation that it has acquired is the ability to have at least one head alert at all times
name: Dodrio

text: Extreme caution is advised when all three heads are facing separate directions
name: Dodrio

text: It is in this state that it is the most dangerous and going near it may result in a severe pecking
name: Dodrio

text: Along with its three heads, it has three sets of hearts and lungs as well
name: Dodrio

text: This allows it to efficiently oxygenate and pump blood throughout its body, thus giving it increased endurance to run vast distances without rest
name: Dodrio

text: It is especially prone to race vigorously across grassy plains, even in arid seasons with little rainfall
name: Dodrio

text: Seel is achubby pinnipedPokémon with a thick, fatty hide covered in bluish white fur
name: Seel

text: It has a pale tan maw with a large red tongue and a pair of tusks on its lower jaw
name: Seel

text: It has circular eyes and a black nose that is capable of closing when it swims
name: Seel

text: There is a small horn on its forehead, which it uses in combination with its tusks to bore through ice floes
name: Seel

text: It has two flippers on its chest, and two more on the end of its tail
name: Seel

text: When the tail is raised, it resembles a waterspout
name: Seel

text: Seel are vespertine Pokémon that are most active in the evening
name: Seel

text: Sometimes, one may see a Seel napping near the shoreline in the morning
name: Seel

text: When hunting, they dive underwater for extended periods of time
name: Seel

text: When they need to breathe, they surface and break through sea ice with their horns (and tusks if necessary)
name: Seel

text: When Seel swim, they close their nostrils tightly to block out water
name: Seel

text: They are highly social Pokémon, living in large, raucous groups on ice floes in the middle of the sea
name: Seel

text: Seel may play-fight with each other on these floes, sparring with their tusks and horns as well as Water-type and sometimes Ice-type attacks
name: Seel

text: This activity is important in teaching young Seel how to defend themselves against enemies
name: Seel

text: The horns atop their heads can break solid ice
name: Seel

text: They can survive sub-zero temperatures
name: Seel

text: Seel evolves into Dewgong at level 34
name: Seel

text: Seel is a pinniped Pokémon with a thick hide covered in bluish-white fur
name: Seel

text: It has a pale tan maw with a large red tongue and a pair of tusks on its lower jaw
name: Seel

text: It has circular eyes and a black nose that is capable of closing when it swims
name: Seel

text: There is a small horn on its forehead, which it uses in combination with its tusks to bore through ice floes
name: Seel

text: It has two flippers on its chest, and two more on the end of its tail
name: Seel

text: When the tail is raised, it resembles a waterspout
name: Seel

text: Seel lives on icebergs in frigid ocean waters
name: Seel

text: Its warm fur and thick hide allow it to swim in waters as cold as -40° Fahrenheit (-40° Celsius)
name: Seel

text: It thrives in these cold environments, becoming more active as the temperature drops and tires easily in warm waters
name: Seel

text: Preferring to sleep during the day, it hunts for prey under sheets of ice in the late day and evening hours
name: Seel

text: While it is a graceful swimmer, it is awkward and struggles to move on dry land
name: Seel

text: Dewgong is a long, somewhat plump, completely white Pokémon
name: Dewgong

text: It has billowing fins
name: Dewgong

text: There is also a horn on its head that is useful for bashing through thick ice
name: Dewgong

text: It is somewhat just a more elegant version of Seel
name: Dewgong

text: Like Seel, Dewgong prefer frigid waters
name: Dewgong

text: They can swim at a steady 8 knots, undeterred by the cooler temperatures around them
name: Dewgong

text: In fact, like their pre-evolutions, Dewgong become more active in colder waters
name: Dewgong

text: When resting, though they do still sometimes sleep on the ocean floor or shore like Seel, they now prefer to rest on ice floes
name: Dewgong

text: Recent studies show that they are in fact sunbathing while doing so, with the increased temperature aiding their digestion
name: Dewgong

text: There, their pristine white fur can camouflage them against predators
name: Dewgong

text: Dewgong no longer use their tusks and horns to play-fight, since they stop growing at this stage
name: Dewgong

text: However, they are still useful for poking breathing holes into ice floes while swimming under them to resurface for air
name: Dewgong

text: Dewgong are well-adapted to the frigid temperatures of their environment
name: Dewgong

text: Dewgong is the evolved form of Seel, as of level 34
name: Dewgong

text: Dewgong is a pinniped Pokémon with a snowy white, furry body
name: Dewgong

text: Its fur renders it virtually invisible in snowy conditions
name: Dewgong

text: Its face has two black eyes, a black nose, and two tusks extending from its upper jaw
name: Dewgong

text: It has a streamlined body with two front flippers and a long flowing tail
name: Dewgong

text: Even in extremely cold and ice-packed waters, its tail allows it to be a swift and agile swimmer at speeds of 8 knots
name: Dewgong

text: On top of its head is a sharp horn, which allows it to cut through the thickest ice floes
name: Dewgong

text: It lives on icebergs adrift in frigid ocean waters
name: Dewgong

text: It thrives in lower temperatures, becoming increasingly more active the colder the weather
name: Dewgong

text: By storing thermal energy within its body, it is completely unharmed by even the most intense freezing weather
name: Dewgong

text: During daylight hours, it sleeps on bitterly cold ice or under shallow water
name: Dewgong

text: However, at night when the temperature drops, it becomes a hunter and searches for prey such as Wishiwashi
name: Dewgong

text: Following a meal, it sunbathes on the beach
name: Dewgong

text: This raises its body temperature and aids in digestion
name: Dewgong

text: Grimer was created when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays
name: Grimer

text: It is composed primarily of putrid, hardened sludge and grime
name: Grimer

text: It smells incredibly foul, and can influence the abandonment of entire cities due to its polluting nature－even weeds don't grow where a Grimer has appeared
name: Grimer

text: Grimer thrives in filthy areas, such as factories, garbage dumps, sewers and polluted water systems
name: Grimer

text: It survives and matures by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories, adding toxic waste to its already toxic girth
name: Grimer

text: Alolan Grimer's body structure is largely the same as Kantonian Grimer, though its appearance is different
name: Grimer

text: It has a dark green body with a yellow streak across its lower lip that extends all around its head
name: Grimer

text: It also has black space around its eyes
name: Grimer

text: Inside its mouth is a blue tongue with two teeth, which are actually crystallized toxins that are highly dangerous to touch
name: Grimer

text: It enters sewers and other areas with great ease due to its rubbery, semi-viscous body for example, it can enter barred-off areas by slipping between the narrow bars
name: Grimer

text: If one stick his/her hand in a Grimer, it will be very hard to get it out
name: Grimer

text: An Alolan Grimer is brought to the Alolan region to deal with the increase of garbage, as well as keeping the Trubbish and Garbodor populations in check
name: Grimer

text: It has adapted into eating solid waste instead of liquid waste
name: Grimer

text: Grimer has a huge obsession of garbage, eating huge amounts at a fast pace eating garbage constantly has caused Grimer to form crystallized toxins in its mouth
name: Grimer

text: Grimer can have the ability Stench or the ability Sticky Hold
name: Grimer

text: Stench decreases the chances of encountering a wild Pokémon when Grimer is the first party Pokémon
name: Grimer

text: Sticky Hold prevents the theft of Grimer's held item
name: Grimer

text: Grimer evolves into Muk at level 38
name: Grimer

text: Grimer is a slimy, amorphous Pokémon, born from sludge in dirty streams or seabeds that are exposed to lunar radiation
name: Grimer

text: It has two large eyes with beady pupils and a gaping mouth with a gray tongue
name: Grimer

text: While it lacks any visible legs, it does have two arms with three digits on each hand
name: Grimer

text: Its purple sludge body contains a variety of pungent bacteria, which are so potent that it renders soil barren and incapable of supporting plant life
name: Grimer

text: It is constantly oozing a bacteria-rich fluid from all parts of its body
name: Grimer

text: Should it run out of internal germs, Grimer will die
name: Grimer

text: Pieces of it often break off during travel and go on to become new Grimer
name: Grimer

text: When combined with another Grimer, it produces new poisonous compounds
name: Grimer

text: Due to its lack of a solid form, Grimer is capable of squeezing into any space or crevices with relative ease
name: Grimer

text: It uses this to penetrate sewage pipes and feed off of the filthy wastewater inside
name: Grimer

text: Its population fluctuates based on the availability of waste, which is Grimer's main diet
name: Grimer

text: It can be found in polluted lakes and streams, as well as within cities and factories where trash and industrial waste can be found
name: Grimer

text: In recent years, thanks to efforts in environmental improvements and a decrease in their food source of waste, Grimer is now facing extinction
name: Grimer

text: Grimer was brought to Alola to deal with the excess waste generated by the region's increased population
name: Grimer

text: Alolan Grimer eats solid garbage instead of sludge this new diet has caused its body composition and form to change
name: Grimer

text: Alolan Grimer's body is green with a line of yellow sludge along its lower lip that extends around behind its head, a bright blue tongue, and small black crescent-shaped spaces behind its eyes
name: Grimer

text: It also has two blunt teeth in its upper jaw, which are actually crystallized toxins formed by its diet
name: Grimer

text: It is not known how to break down these toxic crystals, but direct contact with them is known to be dangerous
name: Grimer

text: Lethal poisons leak out of Alolan Grimer's body when these crystals fall out
name: Grimer

text: Because it produces and stores its toxins within its body, Alolan Grimer does not produce a foul stench like Kantonian Grimer
name: Grimer

text: There are usually about one hundred Alolan Grimer found living near waste-disposal sites in Alola, assisting people in dealing with garbage
name: Grimer

text: Alolan Grimer is perpetually hungry and must constantly eat trash
name: Grimer

text: If no trash is readily available, it will eat other manufactured products instead
name: Grimer

text: In addition to garbage, Alolan Grimer preys on Trubbish and Garbodor its introduction to Alola caused their populations to decrease in the region
name: Grimer

text: Muk is a large purple mass of sludge, toxic fluids, and other filthy materials
name: Muk

text: It has two large arms that capture the prey and its eyes are barely visible through the sludge
name: Muk

text: In Alola, Muk's appearance changes drastically
name: Muk

text: Rather than being just purple, Alolan Muk is a mixture of bright color tones that consist of pink, green, and yellow with dark blue streaks separating each color this gives Muk the appearance of an oil slick
name: Muk

text: In addition, crystals formed by solidified toxins cover most of Muk's mouth and hands that gives Muk the appearance of having claws and sharp teeth
name: Muk

text: In terms of both body size and weight, a Kantonian Muk is larger but lighter while an Alolan Muk is smaller but heavier
name: Muk

text: Muk's body contains highly noxious chemicals that can cause anyone nearby to faint
name: Muk

text: These chemicals also cause plant life to wither and die
name: Muk

text: Due to their ability to create pollution, Muk have been victims of extermination some theorized that because of this, Muk would become extinct in the near future
name: Muk

text: To counteract this problem, people create sludge pools for Muks to live in
name: Muk

text: Alolan Muk, unlike its Kantonian counterpart, produces no foul-smelling odors
name: Muk

text: Instead, all of the odors are stored within Muk's body and are in turn hardened into crystal-like structures covering its mouth and body the crystals will break apart and release dangerous toxins if removed
name: Muk

text: The reason why Alolan Muk gains its bright coloration is the large quantities of trash it consumes
name: Muk

text: Alolan Muk's body contains numerous types of poison
name: Muk

text: It also preys on Trubbish and Garbodor
name: Muk

text: Although usually friendly and laidback, an Alolan Muk would consume and destroy its trainer's household items if left unfed for a prolonged period of time
name: Muk

text: Muk can have the ability Stench or the ability Sticky Hold
name: Muk

text: Stench decreases the chances of encountering a wild Pokémon when Muk is the first party Pokémon
name: Muk

text: Sticky Hold prevents the theft of Muk's held item
name: Muk

text: Muk has one of the highest attack points of all Poison-type Pokémon, losing only to Toxicroak
name: Muk

text: Muk is the evolved form of Grimer, evolving at level 38
name: Muk

text: Muk is a large, sticky, amorphous Pokémon made of living purple sludge
name: Muk

text: It has two small eyes with beady black pupils
name: Muk

text: It also has an enormous mouth with a gray tongue and strands of ooze connecting its top and bottom jaws
name: Muk

text: While it has no visible legs, it does have two arms with three fingers on each hand
name: Muk

text: However, it typically keeps one hand tucked in while it extends the other hand
name: Muk

text: Muk is a living biohazard, leaking toxins that instantly kill all plant life it touches
name: Muk

text: Even it being in close proximity to plants will cause them to wilt and die
name: Muk

text: Extreme caution is advised in avoiding any contact with this Pokémon, as an accidental brush up can lead to severe sickness
name: Muk

text: The effects of this Pokémon can leave the landscape barren for three years
name: Muk

text: It will readily consume nearly any waste or refuse generated by people and Pokémon alike
name: Muk

text: Muk's body produces a powerful odor that can cause fainting
name: Muk

text: However, despite the risk Muk's stench contains, some fans of Muk believe its stench is a good thing
name: Muk

text: Muk can be found in heavily polluted bodies of water, factories and cities, where groups can gather to consume trash that people threw away into the streets
name: Muk

text: However, Muk's population has declined due to recent environmental improvements and extermination efforts
name: Muk

text: This has led some to believe that it will go extinct at some point sludge ponds are being built to prevent its extinction
name: Muk

text: Alolan Muk has a more vibrant coloration, consisting of green, pink, and yellow stripes with thin blue bands in-between
name: Muk

text: The green, yellow, and pink stripes are capable of shifting downwards while the blue stays in place
name: Muk

text: It has various white, crystallized poison shards protruding from parts of its body, especially from its mouth and fingers, giving the impression of claws and fangs
name: Muk

text: It has blue eyes with a black space behind them and a bright blue tongue
name: Muk

text: Its vivid coloration is a result of the garbage it eats, which causes chemical changes in its body
name: Muk

text: Its body contains over a hundred different kinds of poisons
name: Muk

text: Alolan Muk is unexpectedly quiet and friendly
name: Muk

text: However, if it is not fed trash for a while, its hunger will compel it to destroy its Trainer's furnishings for food
name: Muk

text: It is thought that it cannot maintain its energy without a constant source of toxins, which causes its voracious appetite
name: Muk

text: The crystals covering its body have a tendency to break off, which makes it extremely difficult to deal with due to the concentrated toxins contained within them
name: Muk

text: Unlike Kantonian Muk, Alolan Muk does not produce a foul stench due to its toxins being contained within its body
name: Muk

text: 1 Alolan Muk preys on Trubbish and Garbodor
name: Muk

text: Shellder is protected by its two large shells
name: Shellder

text: Its large tongue is always kept hanging out
name: Shellder

text: It has two large eyes inside the shell
name: Shellder

text: Shellder live on the sea floor, digging holes with their tongues and hiding in them with their tongues out to catch prey
name: Shellder

text: Their tongues are never withdrawn, even when sleeping
name: Shellder

text: Yanking on them will cause them to open up in shock
name: Shellder

text: Shellder can move surprisingly quickly by flapping their shells
name: Shellder

text: They can also lampoon prey with Icicle Spear
name: Shellder

text: Shellder enjoy eating Slowpoke tail secretions and will bite these tails on sight
name: Shellder

text: They then adopt a spiral shape and inject poison as the Slowpoke evolve into Slowbro
name: Shellder

text: They are also oddly attracted to King’s Rocks
name: Shellder

text: If a Slowpoke is wearing one, a Shellder may propel itself into the air to bite its head, triggering its evolution into a Slowking
name: Shellder

text: Shellder can have the ability Shell Armor or the ability Skill Link
name: Shellder

text: Shell Armor prevents Shellder's opponents from getting a Critical Hit on Shellder
name: Shellder

text: Skill Link increases the frequency of multi-hitting attacks
name: Shellder

text: As a last resort, Shellder clamps on to its opponents
name: Shellder

text: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells
name: Shellder

text: It is said (in the anime in-game Pokédex entries) that if a Shellder clamps onto a Slowpoke's tail, the Slowpoke will evolve into Slowbro (the Shellder changes shape with it)
name: Shellder

text: Also if a Shellder clamps on Slowpoke's head while wearing a King's Rock, the Slowpoke will evolve into a Slowking
name: Shellder

text: According to Slowking's Pokédex entries, when the Slowpoke's head is bitten, toxins enter the Slowpoke's head (and into its brain), unlocking extraordinary power and triggering evolution
name: Shellder

text: These same toxins also causes a Slowbro to no longer be able to feel pain
name: Shellder

text: According to Slowbro Slowking's Pokédex entries, the Shellder's produce toxins that affect either their victims brain (in Slowking's case) or their nervous system (in Slowbro's case)
name: Shellder

text: It is also said that if a Slowbro's or Slowking's Shellder is removed or detached it (Slowbro/Slowking) will revert (devolve) back to a regular Slowpoke
name: Shellder

text: Also, it is said that Shellder's tend to latch on to a Slowpoke if it is holding a King's Rock (a reference to Slowking's requirements for evolving)
name: Shellder

text: Upon the Slowpoke's evolution, the Shellder changes it form into either Slowbro's shell (attached to Slowbro's tail) or a Slowking's crown
name: Shellder

text: In its crown form, the Shellder eyes are located on it backside (which can be easily seen by the player character when a Slowking is used in battle), basically giving Slowking eyes in the back of its head
name: Shellder

text: Shellder are known to be prey for many Pokémon such as Kingler, which use their giant claws, Omastar, which use their fangs, Rufflet, which use their talons, and Bruxish, which use their teeth all to crack open its shell
name: Shellder

text: Shellder evolves into Cloyster by use of a Water Stone
name: Shellder

text: Shellder is a bivalve mollusk Pokémon encased within a spiky, blue-violet bivalve shell
name: Shellder

text: It has two round white eyes with tiny black pupils
name: Shellder

text: Its enormously long red tongue is used to burrow itself into the sand to sleep overnight and also to lure and capture prey
name: Shellder

text: The tongue protrudes even when its shell is closed and tugging it will cause the shell to pop open
name: Shellder

text: Its soft and tender body is well-protected by its extremely durable shell, which is purported to be harder than diamonds and has historically been used by people to make shields
name: Shellder

text: It can make pearls from accumulated sand, though it discards them as they are typically in its way
name: Shellder

text: Shellder has an unusually strong appetite for the tail of a Slowpoke and can develop a symbiotic relationship with the Dopey Pokémon
name: Shellder

text: After attaching itself to the Slowpoke's tail, the two undergo a metamorphosis and evolve into Slowbro together
name: Shellder

text: Alternatively, if it attaches to the head of a Slowpoke in possession of a King's Rock, the two will instead evolve into Slowking
name: Shellder

text: These relationships allow it to travel onto land and begin a new stage in its life cycle
name: Shellder

text: In Galar, Shellder attaches to the forearms and heads of Galarian Slowpoke wearing Galarica Cuffs or Galarica Wreaths, causing the evolution into Galarian Slowbro and Galarian Slowking, respectively
name: Shellder

text: Regardless of which form the two Pokémon evolve into, Shellder's shell transforms into a spiny, spiraled cone with several tiers
name: Shellder

text: Sharp teeth develop around the rim of the shell to anchor it securely to the evolved Slowpoke, and its eyes now peek out from the bottom rim of the shell
name: Shellder

text: In its crown form, Shellder will have a red jewel on its underside and a large horn on either side of its shell
name: Shellder

text: While in its crown form, Shellder will periodically release its venom into Slowking's brain
name: Shellder

text: This is actually beneficial to Slowking, as it causes the Regal Pokémon's intelligence to increase
name: Shellder

text: Higher quantities of venom intensify this effect, and Shellder is easily provoked into releasing more whenever Slowking yawns
name: Shellder

text: However, Shellder's poison makes Slowbro more sluggish as it continues to drain nutrients from its host's body
name: Shellder

text: Prior to Generation III, Clamp was its signature move
name: Shellder

text: In Generations III and IV, Icicle Spear was its signature move
name: Shellder

text: Despite its hard shell, clamping on to an opponent will reveal its vulnerable parts
name: Shellder

text: Because of this, it will only clamp itself to a foe as a last resort
name: Shellder

text: It swims around its seafloor home by rapidly opening and closing its shell while facing backward
name: Shellder

text: Prehistoric Shellder were apparently preyed upon by Omastar, whose powerful bites were capable of breaking through its shell
name: Shellder

text: Shellder and its evolved form, Cloyster, are related to Gastrodon
name: Shellder

text: Kingler, Rufflet, and Bruxish are modern predators of Shellder
name: Shellder

text: Cloyster is actually a black pearl within two shells
name: Cloyster

text: The first shell is purple and rugged, while the second shell is gray
name: Cloyster

text: When the second shell is opened, a spike is revealed
name: Cloyster

text: Its face has a cruel look upon it
name: Cloyster

text: To catch food, Cloyster wait on the ocean floor for prey swim by before shooting these spikes by using the move Spike Cannon
name: Cloyster

text: The harpooned prey then slowly float down to the waiting Cloyster
name: Cloyster

text: Like Shellder, Cloyster love Slowpoke tails, and may even venture onto land to seek them out
name: Cloyster

text: Cloyster are capable of swimming by swallowing water and jetting it out—this is the same process they use to shoot spikes
name: Cloyster

text: They can slam their shells shut with incredible force
name: Cloyster

text: Unlike Shellder, Cloyster can use clamping as a viable method of defense
name: Cloyster

text: Their insides are virtually untouchable while their shells are closed
name: Cloyster

text: Even the strongest forces cannot pry a clamped Cloyster apart consequently, no one knows exactly what lies within their shells
name: Cloyster

text: It has been recently discovered that Cloyster that live in stronger currents have larger spikes, though the reason behind this is unknown
name: Cloyster

text: A concurrent study found that when a Cloyster shell is damaged, a new spike grows in place of the damaged area instead of recovering the flat surface
name: Cloyster

text: Cloyster's shell is extremely solid
name: Cloyster

text: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection, and by shooting spikes to repel foes
name: Cloyster

text: Cloyster is the evolved form of Shellder by use of a Water Stone
name: Cloyster

text: Cloyster is a black bivalve mollusk Pokémon
name: Cloyster

text: It is encased inside a light-gray shell, which is surrounded by a second jagged, blue-violet outer shell casing
name: Cloyster

text: It has one barb-like spike protruding from above its head, and multiple conical horns on its outer shell
name: Cloyster

text: Its shell is harder than a diamond with spikes that are even harder harsh tidal currents will affect the size and sharpness of these spikes
name: Cloyster

text: On its pearl-like face, it has two white eyes and a mouth
name: Cloyster

text: Aside from its face and head, its internal anatomy has never been seen
name: Cloyster

text: Once it has shut itself in, it is impossible to open its shell from the outside
name: Cloyster

text: This impressive defense allows it to withstand anything from a bomb blast to even a missile strike
name: Cloyster

text: Cloyster typically only opens its shell to attack an opponent
name: Cloyster

text: However, it is fully capable of retaliating against any enemy with its shell tightly closed
name: Cloyster

text: With rapid succession, it launches its spikes at the foe, keeping them repelled
name: Cloyster

text: In Generation I, Clamp was its signature move
name: Cloyster

text: The same projectile system it uses to launch its spikes is also used for swimming
name: Cloyster

text: It swallows seawater and then ejects it towards the rear, pushing it through with siphon-jet propulsion
name: Cloyster

text: Being the result of Shellder evolving through an Evolution stone, Cloyster is rarely found in the wild, though they can be found on the sea floor, nestled among the rocks and coral however, it will actively hunt on land for Slowpoke tails
name: Cloyster

text: Cloyster and its pre-evolved form, Shellder, are relatives of Gastrodon
name: Cloyster

text: Kingler is a natural predator of Cloyster
name: Cloyster

text: Gastly's appearance consists of a dark sphere (its head) surrounded by light purple gas
name: Gastly

text: Gastly has large, white eyes and a large mouth with a small pair of fangs
name: Gastly

text: They capture prey by enveloping them in their poisonous gas, which can seep through skin and cause fainting
name: Gastly

text: They may also immobilize prey with the paralyzing move Lick
name: Gastly

text: Despite their poor reputation, though, Gastly are not blatantly malicious and do not “haunt” beings with the intent of harming them
name: Gastly

text: Instead, they are mischievous pranksters who enjoy startling others
name: Gastly

text: They rarely utilize their poisonous gases unless threatened, but are known to put victims to sleep with Hypnosis
name: Gastly

text: Their pranks can be annoying at times, so it should be noted that oscillating fans are very effective at warding Gastly away because the Pokémon steer clear of strong winds
name: Gastly

text: When Gastly are near, it is said the air will smell faintly sweet
name: Gastly

text: Due to having a body made of gas, Gastly can slip into any place it wants
name: Gastly

text: However, Gastly's body will dwindle away when exposed to a strong wind
name: Gastly

text: It can also render itself nearly invisible and approach enemies undetected, and can envelop said enemies, regardless of their size
name: Gastly

text: Due to the fact that Gastly's body can be blown away by strong wind, they gather under the eaves of houses in order to escape it
name: Gastly

text: Gastly has no true form, due to 95% of its body being poisonous gas, with the other 5% believed to be made up of the souls of those who died from the gas
name: Gastly

text: However, it consistently appears as a black, spherical Pokémon surrounded by a purple haze
name: Gastly

text: Gastly has a wide, pink mouth with two visible fangs
name: Gastly

text: Though its eyes seem to extend past its round body, visible eyelids surround them
name: Gastly

text: It produces a faint, sweet smell
name: Gastly

text: The toxic gas surrounding the main body can induce fainting and suffocation, and it is capable of enshrouding an enemy of any size
name: Gastly

text: Gastly's gaseous form makes it one of the lightest Pokémon in existence
name: Gastly

text: The anime suggests that Gastly has a playful personality, often frightening and playing pranks on people for fun
name: Gastly

text: However, it has shown a willingness to preserve or pass on the memories of departed humans
name: Gastly

text: It has further been shown changing form and creating illusions, and it is capable of phasing through solid objects and forming tangible hands out of its gasses
name: Gastly

text: Gastly can be found in caves, but the anime has shown it living in old, dilapidated buildings as well
name: Gastly

text: Its gaseous body will dwindle away when exposed to strong winds, so they huddle together in decent-sized groups under house eaves to avoid the wind
name: Gastly

text: It may also cause flickering lights in abandoned houses
name: Gastly

text: In Generation I, Night Shade was its signature move
name: Gastly

text: Haunter is a purple, spiky, floating figure with triangular eyes, tiny pupils, fangs and disembodied, three-fingered, clawed hands
name: Haunter

text: They feed on the life force of living things, waiting in the darkness for unwary prey to wander by
name: Haunter

text: Then, they sneak up on their victims and lick them
name: Haunter

text: This causes uncontrollable shuddering in their prey, who are slowly drained of life until they die
name: Haunter

text: Like Gastly, Haunter are also pranksters
name: Haunter

text: They may trip unwary travelers or place ghostly hands on their shoulders to scare them
name: Haunter

text: When a Haunter is around, those nearby feel paranoid, as if they are being watched (which they are)
name: Haunter

text: Haunter can also feed on fear
name: Haunter

text: Though research has shown that such a diet is not very energy-efficient, it is believed that some Haunter have learned to feed on these feelings because they are “sustainable ” by not killing victims, some Haunter have successfully used cities as “farms” of sorts, scaring people as necessary and feeding on their fright
name: Haunter

text: Many ghost “hot-spots” are in fact popular Haunter feeding grounds
name: Haunter

text: Since Haunter detest light, well-lit towns are usually devoid of them
name: Haunter

text: In some regions is said that Haunter come out on moonless nights looking for victims to lay curses on
name: Haunter

text: Haunter can pass through solid walls
name: Haunter

text: It is because of this that it is believed it is from another dimension
name: Haunter

text: It can also sap away the life force of a target by licking them with its tongue
name: Haunter

text: These licks will always cause constant convulsions to a licked being until it dies
name: Haunter

text: Haunter is a purple Pokémon with a gaseous body
name: Haunter

text: It has a round head flanked by three large, spiked protrusions on either side
name: Haunter

text: It has triangular eyes with small pupils and a mouth with a long, pink tongue
name: Haunter

text: The gases composing its head curve into its mouth to form several pointed teeth
name: Haunter

text: Disembodied hands with three clawed fingers each float in front of its body
name: Haunter

text: Its body tapers into a jagged tail
name: Haunter

text: Haunter's gaseous form makes it one of the lightest Pokémon in existence
name: Haunter

text: Haunter hides in very dark places, such as caves, and is afraid of light
name: Haunter

text: If a human or a Pokémon comes near Haunter, it will stalk the victim while floating and beckon it to come closer
name: Haunter

text: Once approached it will then lick the victim with its gaseous tongue, inflicting convulsions in the victim that last until death
name: Haunter

text: It can also float through walls
name: Haunter

text: It has been shown in the anime that it can control its hands from far away and can control any Pokémon that it touches with its hands
name: Haunter

text: Despite its predatory nature, it has been known to entertain and prank people in the anime
name: Haunter

text: Additionally, it has even been shown to feel intense loyalty to a deceased Trainer
name: Haunter

text: In Generation I, Night Shade was its signature move
name: Haunter

text: Gengar is a shadow-like, round-bodied Pokémon with two large, pointed ears and short spikes lining its back
name: Gengar

text: Gengar has two red eyes and a toothy, sinister smile
name: Gengar

text: It has claws on its hands
name: Gengar

text: Gengar stands on its two short legs, but it can Levitate as well
name: Gengar

text: In Mega Gengar, it has a hot pink smoke around it, and it has a 3rd yellow eye, its hands are buried in the ground, it also got more spikes in its back and tail
name: Gengar

text: In Gigantamax Gengar, it has grown much larger, its red eyes turned yellow with soulless white pupils, the body hasn't changed much, but there is no physical feet visible, its hands are detached and in the ground, its mouth also looks like some sort of room, with a long tongue inside
name: Gengar

text: Gengar are typically mean-spirited and enjoy tormenting people, hurting them and overtaking them
name: Gengar

text: They are most active during full moons, creeping out in the dead of night and disguising themselves as shadows they may even enters sleeping homes to lurk in the dark
name: Gengar

text: They will mimic every movement their targets make until they lower their guards
name: Gengar

text: Then, they strike, draining their victims' life force as sustenance
name: Gengar

text: Gengar are also said to attack those who are hopelessly lost and afraid in the mountains
name: Gengar

text: Many Gengar have learned to feed on fear, simply following victims in the shadows and mimicking them almost, but not quite perfectly
name: Gengar

text: This cultivates great paranoia in victims, which they can then feast on
name: Gengar

text: Other tricks Gengar have been known to use include: laughing maniacally in the shadows, lighting their red eyes in the darkness, and chanting mysteriously in the distance
name: Gengar

text: In some places, parents warn that Gengar appear at night in the bedrooms of naughty children
name: Gengar

text: A famous folk tale tells of a Gengar that once used to be human, attacking people so it could have a friend
name: Gengar

text: In spite of their infamous insidiousness and cruelty, domesticated Gengar that are being kindly looked after by their trainers are much friendlier, and their smiles appear to be less creepy
name: Gengar

text: This Pokémon hide in the shadows
name: Gengar

text: It is said that if a Gengar is hiding, it cools the area by nearly 10°F
name: Gengar

text: When there is a Full Moon, Gengar like to scare people by pretending to be their shadow, then laugh at their fear
name: Gengar

text: They can absorb any surrounding heat, leaving a sudden chill
name: Gengar

text: To steal the life of their targets, they slip into the prey's shadow and silently waits for an opportunity
name: Gengar

text: Gengar are also able to merge with and inhabit the shadow of another being
name: Gengar

text: Additionally, Gengar can cast curses on their victims, simply to immobilize them in extreme agony and pain as a means for Gengar themselves to strike easily
name: Gengar

text: Gengar is the evolved form of Haunter, by trade
name: Gengar

text: It can further evolve into Mega Gengar by using its Gengarite
name: Gengar

text: Gengar is a dark purple, bipedal Pokémon with a roundish body
name: Gengar

text: It has red eyes, a wide mouth that is usually curled into a sinister grin, and pointed ears
name: Gengar

text: On its back are numerous spikes and it has smaller spikes on top of its head similar to tufty fur
name: Gengar

text: Its arms and legs are short with three digits on both its hands and feet
name: Gengar

text: It also has a stubby tail
name: Gengar

text: Gengar has the ability to hide perfectly in the shadow of any object, granting it exceptional stealth
name: Gengar

text: However, Gengar's body acts as a heat sink
name: Gengar

text: Its presence cools the temperature of the surrounding area by nearly 10°F (5°C), because it absorbs the warmth
name: Gengar

text: The anime has shown that Gengar can fly, possess people and other Pokémon, and extend its tongue by several meters
name: Gengar

text: In Generation I, Night Shade was its signature move
name: Gengar

text: Gengar is very mischievous, and at times, malicious
name: Gengar

text: It enjoys playing practical jokes and casting curses, such as pretending to be one's shadow, then behaving erratically
name: Gengar

text: When the quarry notices, the Gengar takes delight in its victim's terror
name: Gengar

text: However, Gengar has been known to be loyal to a Trainer who treats it well
name: Gengar

text: Being the result of an evolution via trading, Gengar is rarely found in the wild, though they can be found in caves and dark places where shadows form
name: Gengar

text: It is especially fond of urban areas such as cities and back alleys, but only during the night
name: Gengar

text: As Mega Gengar, a portion of its body sinks into the ground and its arms and tail lengthen
name: Gengar

text: The lower portions turn a more reddish-purple, and a third eye appears on its forehead
name: Gengar

text: This new unblinking eye is oval, yellow, and allows it to see into other dimensions
name: Gengar

text: 1 The spikes on Mega Gengar's back are more numerous and pointed, and additional spikes appear on its hands and tail
name: Gengar

text: Its ears are now considerably longer and tilt backward
name: Gengar

text: Mega Gengar has the ability to access other dimensions and has a vicious nature
name: Gengar

text: Mega Gengar has no interest in opponents unless perceived as prey
name: Gengar

text: Its relationships are warped due to Mega Evolution
name: Gengar

text: It now desires to take and curse the life of anyone or anything in its path it may even curse its own Trainer
name: Gengar

text: Mega Gengar sinks into another dimension to wait for a chance to attack
name: Gengar

text: As Gigantamax Gengar, it becomes larger, with portions of its body sinking into the ground, and only the head, tail, and arms remain
name: Gengar

text: Its body changes from dark-purple to light-purple and its eyes become white with yellow sclera
name: Gengar

text: The inside of its mouth changes to resemble a tunnel with a long purple tongue sticking out
name: Gengar

text: Three red clouds surround the top of Gengar's head
name: Gengar

text: Gigantamax Gengar's mouth is rumored to not lead into its body
name: Gengar

text: Due to the cursed energy, it is believed to instead lead into the afterlife
name: Gengar

text: By laying a trap, it attempts to steal the lives of those it captures
name: Gengar

text: Should someone stand near its mouth, they can hear the voices of their loved ones calling out to them
name: Gengar

text: Gigantamax Gengar is the only known Pokémon capable of using the G-Max Move G-Max Terror
name: Gengar

text: Onix is a Rock Snake Pokémon
name: Onix

text: Its serpentine body is made up of large gray boulders and little pebbles
name: Onix

text: It has a long horn atop its head and small eyes
name: Onix

text: Onix spend most of their time burrowing through the earth, twisting and turning their massive bodies as they dig
name: Onix

text: They constantly eat while burrowing, consuming boulders, dirt, and whatever else they come across
name: Onix

text: These tunnels often later become homes and pathways for other subterranean Pokémon, such as Diglett and Druddigon
name: Onix

text: Onix can have the abilitiesRock Head or Sturdy
name: Onix

text: Rock Head prevents Onix from recoiling, while Sturdy gives Onix immunity to OHKO moves
name: Onix

text: When it is burrowing underground, it can cause rumbles and earthquakes
name: Onix

text: It can dig at speeds up to 50 MPH
name: Onix

text: It has a compass in its brain that can tell Onix what direction it is facing
name: Onix

text: Onix evolves into Steelix when traded while holding a Metal Coat
name: Onix

text: Onix is a Pokémon composed of a giant chain of gray boulders that become smaller towards the tail
name: Onix

text: Its length makes it the tallest Rock-type Pokémon
name: Onix

text: It has black eyes and a rounded snout
name: Onix

text: On top of its head is a rocky spine
name: Onix

text: As it grows older, it becomes more rounded and smoother, eventually becoming similar to black diamonds
name: Onix

text: Inside its brain is a magnet that serves as an internal compass, guiding Onix wherever they need to go and prevents them from getting lost while digging
name: Onix

text: Onix tunnels under the ground at over 50 miles (80 kilometers) per hour, which causes tremors and a terrifying roar that echoes a long way
name: Onix

text: Hard objects encountered while tunneling are absorbed into its body, which makes it very sturdy
name: Onix

text: It also consumes the boulders for food
name: Onix

text: The massive, winding tunnels it leaves behind are used as homes by Diglett
name: Onix

text: As seen in the Pokémon Stadium series, Onix is capable of rotating its head, or any part of its body, in a full 360 degrees
name: Onix

text: It is a very aggressive Pokémon that will constantly attack humans and other Pokémon when in pain, as seen in the anime
name: Onix

text: It is said that an Onix that lives for about 100 years will evolve into a Steelix after its composition becomes more diamond-like
name: Onix

text: It can be found in mountains and caves
name: Onix

text: Drowzee is a tapir-like Pokémon that is mostly yellow
name: Drowzee

text: The bottom half of its body is covered in mud, as if it was bathing in it
name: Drowzee

text: When Drowzee uses Hypnosis, its eyes glow a light blue
name: Drowzee

text: Drowzee consume dreams—especially those of young children and Pokémon, as they are said to be tastier than those of adults
name: Drowzee

text: For this reason, they can sometimes be found lurking outside daycares or kindergartens during naptime
name: Drowzee

text: There are many “signs” people believe Drowzee leave after eating dreams
name: Drowzee

text: For example, an itchy nose upon waking may mean one has sucked up a dream through your nostrils, or having a good dream but not remembering it means that it has been consumed
name: Drowzee

text: Drowzee (save for trained ones) rarely live near people, however, preferring to feed on the dreams of Pokémon in the grasslands that they call home
name: Drowzee

text: They get sick from bad dreams (which are said to taste sour), so they uses their noses to differentiate between good dreams and nightmares
name: Drowzee

text: Trained Drowzee can show people their dreams upon awakening
name: Drowzee

text: Drowzee can have the ability Forewarn or the ability Insomnia
name: Drowzee

text: Forewarn allows Drowzee to identify the opponent's strongest move
name: Drowzee

text: Insomnia gives Drowzee immunity to sleeping
name: Drowzee

text: It is skilled in hypnotism
name: Drowzee

text: After it makes a target asleep, it will eat their dreams
name: Drowzee

text: Fun dreams are Drowzee's favorite, while bad dreams can make Drowzee ill
name: Drowzee

text: Drowzee evolves into Hypno at level 26
name: Drowzee

text: Drowzee is a bipedal Pokémon that resembles a tapir
name: Drowzee

text: It has tired-looking eyes, a short trunk above its mouth, and triangular ears with brown interiors
name: Drowzee

text: The upper half of Drowzee's body is yellow and the lower half is brown
name: Drowzee

text: A wavy line separates the two halves
name: Drowzee

text: It has a round belly and short legs
name: Drowzee

text: Its feet are brown, except for its two toes, which are yellow
name: Drowzee

text: The bottom of each foot has a small, round, pink pad in the middle of it
name: Drowzee

text: There are three fingers on each of its hands
name: Drowzee

text: Drowzee is believed to have a common ancestor with Munna and Musharna
name: Drowzee

text: Drowzee is able to put people to sleep and can then sense the person's dreams
name: Drowzee

text: This is so it knows what kind of dream it would be eating
name: Drowzee

text: It has certain preferences for the dreams it eats, and it is known to love fun dreams and become ill from bad dreams
name: Drowzee

text: It will rarely eat the dreams of adults, as the dreams of children are seemingly tastier
name: Drowzee

text: Drowzee remembers every dream it has eaten and may show past meals to a person it trusts
name: Drowzee

text: It eats dreams through the victim's nose, so it is said that Drowzee is standing over a person's pillow if their nose itches while they are asleep
name: Drowzee

text: Drowzee lives in grasslands and savannas
name: Drowzee

text: Hypno is a human-like Pokémon with yellow skin
name: Hypno

text: On the top of its head are large, catlike ears
name: Hypno

text: Its eyes are usually squinted, and lower down
name: Hypno

text: It also has a large nose
name: Hypno

text: On its neck, Hypno has a large white mane, which stretches completely around
name: Hypno

text: Hypno also has human-like arms and hands, which both have five digits
name: Hypno

text: It is also always carrying a small pendulum, which it uses in most of its Psychic based attacks
name: Hypno

text: Female Hypno have longer collar-fur than the males
name: Hypno

text: Hypno only prey on dreams, so captives generally return physically unharmed
name: Hypno

text: Their swinging pendulums cause drowsiness even in onlookers that have just awoken
name: Hypno

text: The longer one stares at the mesmerizing oscillations, the longer the effect last
name: Hypno

text: Hypno polish their pendulums constantly with their manes
name: Hypno

text: trained Hypno are of great use to doctors to help treat insomnia in patients
name: Hypno

text: Oddly, in the Alola region, wild Hypno rarely attack humans because of the presence of the permanently-sleeping Komala as much easier targets
name: Hypno

text: Seeing its sweeping pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up
name: Hypno

text: Hypno have both the abilities Forewarn and Insomnia
name: Hypno

text: Insomnia will prevent the user from falling asleep while Forewarn will show the attack of an opponent with the highest attack power
name: Hypno

text: All Hypno also have the skills to cause anything to fall asleep, and also have a high amount of power in hypnotic abilities
name: Hypno

text: Hypno is the evolved form of Drowzee, as of level 26
name: Hypno

text: Hypno is a bipedal, slightly humanoid Pokémon that has yellow skin
name: Hypno

text: It has triangular ears with brown interiors, sleepy-looking eyes, and a large nose
name: Hypno

text: On its neck, it has a ruff of white fur, which is longer on the female
name: Hypno

text: Hypno has five fingers on each hand and holds a pendulum in its left
name: Hypno

text: The pendulum resembles a flat, silver ring and is used for hypnotism
name: Hypno

text: Hypno is never seen without it
name: Hypno

text: It has three toes on each foot, which also have a pink pad on the undersides
name: Hypno

text: Hypno is able to put people to sleep by swinging its pendulum
name: Hypno

text: It is known to reside away from humans and on less-traveled roads
name: Hypno

text: While it awaits its prey, it polishes its pendulum
name: Hypno

text: If anyone comes by, Hypno will hypnotize them and eat their dreams
name: Hypno

text: It carries away people having good dreams and is even known to have stolen a child at one point
name: Hypno

text: However, in the Alola region, it preys primarily on Komala, and cases of Hypno targeting humans are notably rare
name: Hypno

text: Some Hypno are even known to assist doctors in hospitals when their patients cannot sleep at night
name: Hypno

text: In the Trainers' School in Pokémon Ultra Sun and Ultra Moon, a Hypno is shown to be capable of creating illusions, namely by disguising itself as a human and causing illusory children to appear
name: Hypno

text: Krabby is a River Crab Pokémon
name: Krabby

text: It is red on top and mostly tan on the bottom
name: Krabby

text: Its signature feature are the two long pincers it has
name: Krabby

text: Krabby is an omnivore and a scavenger it rarely hunts for itself
name: Krabby

text: It can also act as a filter feeder by harmonizing bacteria in the sand, but this is rare
name: Krabby

text: It is territorial, and in beaches where there is little food, fights between Krabby are common
name: Krabby

text: Krabby also uses camouflage it can form mucus sacs around itself if threatened, making it seem larger or making it harder to spot against sea sand
name: Krabby

text: It is usually very small, but it makes up for this with its aggressiveness
name: Krabby

text: Krabby can have the ability Hyper Cutter or Shell Armor
name: Krabby

text: Hyper Cutter prevents Krabby's attack from decreasing
name: Krabby

text: Shell Armor prevents all critical hits towards Krabby
name: Krabby

text: If one of its arms break off, it can grow a new one back
name: Krabby

text: They are usually found under the sand in beaches
name: Krabby

text: Krabby evolves into Kingler at level 28
name: Krabby

text: Krabby is a crustacean Pokémon with a strong outer shell protecting its small body
name: Krabby

text: Its upper half is red and has its eyes and two small spikes on the top of its head
name: Krabby

text: Its light tan arms are also connected to its upper body
name: Krabby

text: Its lower body is light tan and doubles as its jaw with two fangs overlapping its upper body
name: Krabby

text: Its hips are visible on the lower front of its body connected to its four long, thin legs
name: Krabby

text: Each leg has a single, claw-like foot
name: Krabby

text: The main features of Krabby's body are the two large, red pincers at the end of its arms
name: Krabby

text: Krabby uses them as its main form of offense, and as a form of balance
name: Krabby

text: Sometimes, Krabby may lose a claw during battle or have a damaged claw forcibly removed
name: Krabby

text: However, the claw regenerates over a short period
name: Krabby

text: In the wild, Krabby lives near the edge of water in both fresh and salt water
name: Krabby

text: Krabby is most commonly found on beaches where it burrows in the sand
name: Krabby

text: In times of scarce food sources, it may eat sand to regain nutrients and will be very aggressive in defending its home
name: Krabby

text: Its main form of defense is creating foam to shroud its body, in order to confuse opponents into thinking that it is bigger than it actually is
name: Krabby

text: As seen in the anime, Krabby generally keeps to itself, but will quickly defend itself if provoked
name: Krabby

text: Prior to Generation III, Crabhammer was its signature move
name: Krabby

text: Kingler is a crab Pokémon
name: Kingler

text: It has a 5 spiked crest on top of its head and more teeth on its mandible than Krabby
name: Kingler

text: It has two pincers with different sizes
name: Kingler

text: When it Gigantamaxes, it gains a foam beard and its eyes turn red
name: Kingler

text: Its arms and legs become longer and spikier
name: Kingler

text: Like other Dynamax Pokémon, it gains three swirling red clouds around its head
name: Kingler

text: Kingler possess a large pincer that boasts huge amounts of strength equal to 10,000 horsepower of crushing force
name: Kingler

text: However, the pincer is quite heavy and is difficult to wield, leaving Kingler exhausted after being used
name: Kingler

text: Out of battle, these large claw aren't very efficient for most everyday tasks, so they tends to use their smaller ones instead
name: Kingler

text: When signaling to fellow Kingler or competing for dominance, however, they will wave their larger claws wildly in the air (a very tiring action for them)
name: Kingler

text: Gigantamax Kingler is capable of producing bubbles that are high in alkaline content
name: Kingler

text: Anyone who touches these bubbles will be melted down
name: Kingler

text: Kingler evolves from Krabby at level 28
name: Kingler

text: Kingler is a crustacean Pokémon resembling a crab
name: Kingler

text: Its strong shell covers the outside of its body, featuring a red upper half and a light tan lower half
name: Kingler

text: Its upper half is topped with six tall, thin spikes that resemble a crown
name: Kingler

text: Its light tan arms are also connected to its upper body
name: Kingler

text: Its lower half doubles as its jaw with six fangs overlapping its upper body
name: Kingler

text: Its two outer fangs are much larger than the inner four and are roughly half as tall as Kingler's entire body
name: Kingler

text: Its hips visibly protrude from its lower body and connect to its four long, thin legs
name: Kingler

text: Each leg has a single, claw-like foot
name: Kingler

text: Kingler's main features are its orange pincers
name: Kingler

text: Its left claw is roughly twice as large as the other and is as hard as steel
name: Kingler

text: Kingler is often found on the edges of water, usually the ocean
name: Kingler

text: Its powerful claws have 10,000 horsepower and are capable of prying open the shells of Shellder and Cloyster
name: Kingler

text: While Kingler's large, left claw is its main tool for offensive maneuvers, it is so large and heavy that Kingler can barely lift it
name: Kingler

text: It causes balancing problems and Kingler may quickly become fatigued from continuous use
name: Kingler

text: However, it has been shown to communicate with other Kingler by waving its pincers around
name: Kingler

text: Prior to Generation III, Crabhammer was its signature move
name: Kingler

text: As Gigantamax Kingler, it has gained a larger, spikier appearance
name: Kingler

text: Three red clouds float around the crown spikes on its head and the white sclera of its eyes are bright red
name: Kingler

text: It now has foaming bubbles around its mouth in the shape of a mustache and long beard
name: Kingler

text: The left pincer of Kingler has become much larger and its arms and legs have become longer as a result of Gigantamaxing
name: Kingler

text: There is white, striped armor similar to teeth inside the pincers
name: Kingler

text: The arms and legs both have several spikes
name: Kingler

text: Kingler's claw-like feet have become orange and straighter
name: Kingler

text: The left pincer of Gigantamax Kingler can destroy anything it hits
name: Kingler

text: The bubbles it releases are strongly alkaline
name: Kingler

text: Should any opponent be struck by the bubbles, their bodies will quickly melt away
name: Kingler

text: Gigantamax Kingler is the only known Pokémon capable of using the G-Max Move G-Max Foam Burst
name: Kingler

text: Voltorb is a Pokémon that looks like a large Poké Ball
name: Voltorb

text: Spherical in shape, Voltorb's top half is colored red while its bottom half is white
name: Voltorb

text: Voltorb does not have much else in features besides its eyes, which usually indicate that it is angry
name: Voltorb

text: Voltorb's Hisuian form instead resembles the ancient Pokeballs of the era, with a hole on top, akin to Wailord's spout
name: Voltorb

text: Their body surfaces' texture is akin to the one of wood-grain
name: Voltorb

text: Voltorb have very volatile temperaments that induce their explosions
name: Voltorb

text: They are generally found in power plants and other areas with electric fields where it feeds
name: Voltorb

text: The species was first discovered in the plant where modern Poké Balls were invented
name: Voltorb

text: Notably, Alpha Sapphire 's Pokédex entry for Voltorb contains a conspiracy theory about how it was a Poké Ball exposed to an energy pulse
name: Voltorb

text: Power plants, and areas with electrical activity are where they are commonly spotted
name: Voltorb

text: Its Hisuian form are friendlier and more excitable, tending to cluster around people and Pokémon, which prove a nuisance when they Discharge even out of a slight provocation
name: Voltorb

text: Therefore, people tend to temporarily plug the hole on Hisuian Voltorb's head and kicking it out of their settlements
name: Voltorb

text: Forests and fields are where Hisuian Voltorb reside in
name: Voltorb

text: This Pokémon looks just like a Poké Ball, but it is also dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch, to Voltorb's assailant after a contact move defeats it
name: Voltorb

text: Hisiuan Voltorb contain numerous seeds, though it is impossible to examine these seeds
name: Voltorb

text: They discharge stored electricity from the hole on top of their bodies
name: Voltorb

text: Voltorb evolves into Electrode at level 30
name: Voltorb

text: Voltorb is a spherical Pokémon that resembles a Poké Ball with eyes and minus the button
name: Voltorb

text: The top half is red, while the bottom half is white
name: Voltorb

text: Because of its resemblance to Poké Balls, it is thought that it was created when one was exposed to an energy pulse
name: Voltorb

text: This is supported by the fact that its components do not occur naturally
name: Voltorb

text: Voltorb is generally found in power plants and other areas with electric fields where it feeds
name: Voltorb
