text: It was first discovered in the plant where modern Poké Balls were invented
name: Voltorb

text: It has a volatile temperament and will explode if agitated or bumped by the slightest contact
name: Voltorb

text: Hisuian Voltorb, like their modern counterparts, resemble the Poké Balls of the time period (made from Apricorns), having the same wood grain pattern and a hole on top, from which it discharges all of its stored electricity while lacking the latch
name: Voltorb

text: On the inside, they contain numerous seeds, but it has been impossible to examine their interior due it being pitch-black
name: Voltorb

text: Hisuian Voltorb has a distinctive red wooden unibrow
name: Voltorb

text: Unlike Kantonian Voltorb, they have friendly and excitable temperaments, which leads them to cluster around people, causing them to be a nuisance when they discharge
name: Voltorb

text: It is known to let out a great, uproarious laugh whenever it discharges
name: Voltorb

text: Hisuian Voltorb can store electric currents in its belly
name: Voltorb

text: There are stories of people temporarily plugging the holes of Hisuian Voltorb to prevent them from discharging before removing them from their settlements
name: Voltorb

text: Electrode is a spherical Pokémon that bears a resemblance to an upside-down Poké Ball
name: Electrode

text: Its top half is white, and its bottom half is red
name: Electrode

text: Electrode has two small beady black eyes, large prominent eyebrows, and a wide mischievously grinning mouth
name: Electrode

text: Electrode also resembles the upside-down Poké Balls of the time period, with a wooden pattern on its top half
name: Electrode

text: Its eyes are large black holes inside a debossed pattern resembling an angry glare
name: Electrode

text: Its lower half is dark red with a constant frown
name: Electrode

text: Interestingly, its surface tissue is similar to that of an Apricorn
name: Electrode

text: Electrode is an unpredictable and volatile Pokémon that will explode with little or no stimuli or provocation
name: Electrode

text: It stores much electricity inside its spherical body, and often drifts on winds, full to bursting with stored electricity
name: Electrode

text: It is feared by many due to its explosive and unpredictable nature
name: Electrode

text: As shown in the fourth episode of Pokémon Generations, Electrode is capable of levitating
name: Electrode

text: These Pokémon convert solar energy into electricity and store it in their abdomens
name: Electrode

text: When angered, they release this energy into currents that arc in the surrounding air, said to be equal in strength to 20 lightning bolts
name: Electrode

text: After a Hisuian Electrode lets loose, the surrounding land is often totally scorched with the air still crackling, a telltale sign of its presence
name: Electrode

text: If their holes are plugged, they become unable to release this energy until it builds up enough to pop the plug free
name: Electrode

text: Hisuian Electrode, though not as irritable as their relatives, were still feared in Hisui due to their ability to destroy entire villages at once
name: Electrode

text: According to legend, one settlement grew so tired of these Pokémon that they shipped them far away to a distant region, where they could never return
name: Electrode

text: It is here that these Electrode grew bitter and temperamental, eventually becoming the Voltorb and Electrode common in other parts of the world
name: Electrode

text: Electrode is the evolved form of Voltorb, as of level 30
name: Electrode

text: Hisuian Electrode is evolved from a Hisuian Voltorb with a Leaf Stone
name: Electrode

text: Electrode is a round Pokémon resembling an upside-down Poké Ball with a mouth and eyes
name: Electrode

text: Its top half is white, while its lower half is red
name: Electrode

text: For this reason, many Trainers try to pick it up, mistaking it for an item
name: Electrode

text: The Pocket Monsters Carddass Trading Cards depict Electrode as hollow
name: Electrode

text: Many know it by the nickname Bomb Ball, due to its unpredictable and explosive nature
name: Electrode

text: Electrode tends to live in power plants where fresh electricity is being generated, which it consumes
name: Electrode

text: As a result, it often causes blackouts
name: Electrode

text: The more electric energy Electrode consumes, the faster it moves
name: Electrode

text: Electrode explodes in response to even the smallest stimulation, simply to entertain itself, or because it has taken in too much electricity
name: Electrode

text: But unlike Voltorb, Electrode can control its explosive ability at will
name: Electrode

text: When full of stored electricity, it has been known to drift with the wind
name: Electrode

text: In Hisui, Electrode also resembles the upside-down Poké Balls of the time period, with a wooden pattern on its top half
name: Electrode

text: Its eyes are large black holes inside a debossed pattern, resembling an angry glare
name: Electrode

text: Its lower half is dark red with a constant frown along with a hole in the bottom
name: Electrode

text: Interestingly, its surface texture is similar to that of an Apricorn
name: Electrode

text: When enraged, Hisuian Electrode can unleash an electric current equivalent to about 20 lightning bolts
name: Electrode

text: It can also absorb and store chlorophyll energy along with electricity
name: Electrode

text: It can also climb up trees
name: Electrode

text: A special Hisuian Electrode is worshipped by the Hisui people due to it being one of the ten ancient Pokémon who received a blessing from Arceus
name: Electrode

text: In particular, it is one of the Noble Pokémon who resides in Coronet Highlands, watched over by the Warden Melli
name: Electrode

text: Hisuian Electrode is the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Chloroblast
name: Electrode

text: Exeggcute resemble a set of six, separate eggs
name: Exeggcute

text: The eggs each have a face, and each has a series of cracks or even broken pieces on them
name: Exeggcute

text: Even though they appear as eggs, Exeggcute are closer to seeds, given their Grass-type status
name: Exeggcute

text: Exeggcute are actually more like seeds despite looking more like eggs
name: Exeggcute

text: They always must be in groups of 6 to maintain balance lone Exeggcute will quickly be joined by five others almost immediately
name: Exeggcute

text: They can communicate with each other telepathically
name: Exeggcute

text: If one member of a pack is threatened, the others will swarm the attacker to defend it
name: Exeggcute

text: Some of their shells may crack as they travel
name: Exeggcute

text: However, they are surprisingly durable Pokémon that can survive with cracked or broken shells with little problem
name: Exeggcute

text: In fact, as these Pokémon approach evolution, these cracks become more and more common
name: Exeggcute

text: These groups of a half-dozen each are considered one Pokémon—they all can be caught in one Poké Ball, count as one Pokémon in battle, and so forth, in part due to their “shared” minds
name: Exeggcute

text: Since they get distressed if they are unable to have six members, it is considered abuse to force Exeggcute in groups of more or less
name: Exeggcute

text: Exeggcute always gather in groups of six, so as to use their special type of telepathy
name: Exeggcute

text: Their Psychic-type status allows them to use a number of psychic abilities along with their Grass-type moves
name: Exeggcute

text: As seen in the anime, Exeggcute are quite proficient with the move Hypnosis
name: Exeggcute

text: Exeggcute is often a small prey item for certain Pokémon species such as Pidgeotto and Crabrawler
name: Exeggcute

text: Exeggcute evolves into Exeggutor by the use of a Leaf Stone
name: Exeggcute

text: Exeggcute is a Pokémon resembling a group of six light pink eggs, usually seen arranged with five heads huddled around a sixth
name: Exeggcute

text: Each head has a slightly different facial expression, but each face has triangular eyes with tiny black pupils and a small mouth
name: Exeggcute

text: Each shell has some cracks, and one member of the bundle usually has its yellow insides or brain exposed
name: Exeggcute

text: More numerous cracks are a sign that it is close to evolution
name: Exeggcute

text: Despite looking like eggs, Exeggcute is actually more closely related to plant seeds
name: Exeggcute

text: It is believed to carry genes of plants and other species
name: Exeggcute

text: Exeggcute gather in swarms of six
name: Exeggcute

text: The heads communicate with each other by using a form of telepathy that only they can understand
name: Exeggcute

text: Should the number of Exeggcute be reduced to less than six, the remaining Exeggcute will attempt to replace it with a similarly sized Pokémon as seen in the anime
name: Exeggcute

text: It needs six Exeggcute in order to stay balanced or else it becomes nervous and cowardly
name: Exeggcute

text: Pidgeotto and Crabrawler are its natural predators, which it chases off with psychokinesis
name: Exeggcute

text: Exeggcute inhabits jungles and forests
name: Exeggcute

text: Exeggcute in the Alola region tend to be heavier than those from elsewhere
name: Exeggcute

text: This is due to the shells being packed full
name: Exeggcute

text: Exeggcute and its evolved form, Exeggutor, are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Barrage
name: Exeggcute

text: Exeggutor is known as the Coconut Pokémon
name: Exeggutor

text: This Pokémon looks like a walking palm tree with three coconut-like heads
name: Exeggutor

text: Each of its head has its own will
name: Exeggutor

text: It has two stubby legs
name: Exeggutor

text: If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute
name: Exeggutor

text: They use Telepathy to discuss their plan before coming to a joint decision
name: Exeggutor

text: Alolan Exeggutor is much taller and slim than its Kantonian counterpart
name: Exeggutor

text: It has a tail with the end being a coconut with an additional face
name: Exeggutor

text: Kantonian Exeggutor live in herds and has been given the reputation as the Walking Jungledue to them migrating sometimes
name: Exeggutor

text: Tales have been told that one of Exeggutor's heads would fall off and form an Exeggcute,when this happens it will emit a telepathic call almost immediately to attract five other Exeggcute and become a group
name: Exeggutor

text: The three heads of an Exeggutor always think independently and rarely bicker with one another
name: Exeggutor

text: Exeggutor having a stout body is the result of cooler climates
name: Exeggutor

text: Their three heads each speak their minds all at once
name: Exeggutor

text: As a result, Exeggutor can be very noisy at times
name: Exeggutor

text: They use telepathy to plan amongst themselves before acting
name: Exeggutor

text: They are very friendly, both between their heads and to others, so it is rare for them to ever argue
name: Exeggutor

text: When they do, however, Exeggutor will become confused, especially if they try to move in different directions at once
name: Exeggutor

text: Though not aggressive, Exeggutor are capable of defending themselves when attacked with a variety of moves, including techniques such as Egg Bomb and the rare Barrage
name: Exeggutor

text: Focusing on the same target with all three ends results in a triple-strength attack
name: Exeggutor

text: They are rarely threatened, though, as their herds give them strength in numbers few ever want to anger entire “forests
name: Exeggutor

text: ” Exeggutor become quite sluggish when deprived of sunlight, and forests of them will quiet down on cloudy days
name: Exeggutor

text: Alolan Exeggutor thrives well in the Alola region
name: Exeggutor

text: The locals there often take pride in Exeggutor, stating that it was originally meant to look like the taller appearance it bears in Alola
name: Exeggutor

text: Exeggutors living in Alola have given up their psychic powers in exchange for draconic powers that have been long dormant for many years
name: Exeggutor

text: The main reason for Exeggutor gaining Dragon-type powers is the strong sunlight from Alola
name: Exeggutor

text: These heads help them spot opponents sneaking up from behind, though they can also attack as well if necessary
name: Exeggutor

text: Though most predators stay far away from these giant Pokémon, some have learned to take advantage of their height, zipping around their feet until they loose balance and keel over
name: Exeggutor

text: They attack foes by swinging around their heads like giant whips, though this action makes them dizzy as well
name: Exeggutor

text: Exeggutors have the ability Chlorophyll
name: Exeggutor

text: This causes Exeggutor's speed to rise when it is sunny
name: Exeggutor

text: Alolan Exeggutors have the ability Frisk which reveals the opponents' held items
name: Exeggutor

text: Both Exeggutor's hidden ability, Harvest, has the chance of using a consumed Berry again
name: Exeggutor

text: Exeggutor is the evolved form of Exeggcute by the use of a Leaf Stone
name: Exeggutor

text: Exeggutor is a tall, bipedal Pokémon that resembles a coconut tree or palm tree
name: Exeggutor

text: Its body and legs are light brown with thin black rings and its legs are thick with two-toed feet
name: Exeggutor

text: There is a light yellow paw pad on each foot's underside
name: Exeggutor

text: It has thin, green leaves sprouting from the top of its body
name: Exeggutor

text: Exeggutor has three round, light yellow heads that resemble coconuts, each with different facial expressions
name: Exeggutor

text: Exeggutor's heads think independently and don't appear interested in one another, so it makes a lot of noise as each head speaks its mind
name: Exeggutor

text: They still appear to get along, though, for they never squabble amongst themselves
name: Exeggutor

text: If all the heads want to go in a different direction, its body is unable to move
name: Exeggutor

text: They are able to communicate telepathically as well and sometimes use it to come to a joint decision
name: Exeggutor

text: It uses psychic powers to fight, and since all three heads are capable its power is tripled
name: Exeggutor

text: If one of these heads grows too large, it falls off and groups together with others to become an Exeggcute
name: Exeggutor

text: In the anime, Exeggutor also has been seen in groups of its own kind, meaning that it is not a solitary Pokémon
name: Exeggutor

text: Exeggutor has been referred to as The Walking Jungle
name: Exeggutor

text: It can be sluggish during cloudy days due to the lack of sunlight
name: Exeggutor

text: Being the result of an evolution via Evolution stone, Exeggutor is rarely found in the wild, though they can be found in forests and jungles
name: Exeggutor

text: Due to the abundance of sunlight in the Alola region, the Exeggutor that live there grow over five times taller than in other regions
name: Exeggutor

text: Alolan Exeggutor's neck is thinner and much longer, causing it to more closely resemble a coconut tree or tropical palm tree than its Kantonian counterpart, which resembles the shorter desert palm
name: Exeggutor

text: It has a long, tapering tail with two leaves, and a fourth light green head on the tip
name: Exeggutor

text: This extra head can also act on its own and defend the rear
name: Exeggutor

text: 1 The tail can use weak telepathy to scan the surrounding area
name: Exeggutor

text: Its long neck can be used as a whip to attack enemies with its hard head
name: Exeggutor

text: However, its neck can also be a weak point as it will become dizzy swinging it around
name: Exeggutor

text: Its increased height reduced its need for a psychic defense and has instead awakened its draconic powers, resulting in its psychic powers becoming weaker
name: Exeggutor

text: Ancient carvings and murals depict this Pokémon
name: Exeggutor

text: Its extra height makes it the tallest and heaviest Grass-type
name: Exeggutor

text: In Generation VII, Dragon Hammer was its signature move
name: Exeggutor

text: Exeggutor and its pre-evolved form, Exeggcute, are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Barrage
name: Exeggutor

text: Cubone, known as the Lonely Pokémon, appears to be a small, brown, dinosaur-like Pokémon that constantly wears its skull like helmet
name: Cubone

text: The skull masks its true face from view, which makes it a puzzlement for many Trainers and researchers
name: Cubone

text: Its cries echo within the skull and it comes out as a pained and sad melody
name: Cubone

text: On the night of a full moon, it cries, for it seems to recognize its mother's face in the moon
name: Cubone

text: Its tears create stains on the skull
name: Cubone

text: Cubone has a plump body with a paler-colored underbelly, with strong, clawed limbs to carry a bone as a weapon around wherever it goes
name: Cubone

text: Cubone has a single, nailed toe on each foot, with two spikes on its back
name: Cubone

text: A small tail is also present for balance, but it can be used for attacking
name: Cubone

text: Cubone's real face has never been seen before, thanks to its bone mask
name: Cubone

text: When it thinks of its dead mother, it cries
name: Cubone

text: Its crying makes the skull it wears rattle loudly
name: Cubone

text: Cubone evolves into Marowak at level 28
name: Cubone

text: In Alola, it evolves into Alolan Marowak at night starting at level 28
name: Cubone

text: Cubone is a small, bipedal, dinosaur-like reptilian Pokémon with a light brown hide that covers most of its body, except for its cream-colored belly
name: Cubone

text: Two small claws, one on each hand, serve as its thumbs, and one large nail on each foot make up its toes
name: Cubone

text: It has two small spikes on its back and a short tail
name: Cubone

text: On its head, Cubone wears the skull of its dead mother as a helmet
name: Cubone

text: Because of this, much of its actual face has never been seen, except for its triangular, black eyes and a small area surrounding them
name: Cubone

text: The skull has two rounded horns on the top of its head and a tooth-like point on the lower sides
name: Cubone

text: Under the skull, Cubone has a brown snout
name: Cubone

text: The small Cubone survives only through the immense skill it possesses in wielding the bone it carries as a weapon
name: Cubone

text: It is called the Lonely Pokémon because of its tendency to keep to itself and avoid social situations, due to the trauma caused by the death of its mother
name: Cubone

text: Cubone will often weep at night in mourning of its mother
name: Cubone

text: When Cubone cries, the skull that it wears on its head vibrates and emits a plaintive and mournful sound
name: Cubone

text: On the night of a full moon, the cries are said to be especially terrible
name: Cubone

text: Cubone seems to recognize its mother in the full moon, and so it howls with a particular sadness
name: Cubone

text: Its cries attract Mandibuzz, a natural predator
name: Cubone

text: It is said a Cubone will evolve into a Marowak once it comes terms with its mother's death
name: Cubone

text: The dreams Cubone have make it cry, but crying makes it stronger
name: Cubone

text: Cubone lives in rocky areas, usually on mountains or in caves
name: Cubone

text: It also once inhabited the Pokémon Tower in Lavender Town where deceased Pokémon were buried and mourned
name: Cubone

text: Cubone and its evolved form, Marowak, are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the moves Bone Club and Bonemerang
name: Cubone

text: Cubone and Marowak are also the only known Pokémon capable of using the Thick Club item
name: Cubone

text: In Generations II and III, Bone Rush was another one of their signature moves
name: Cubone

text: Marowak is a Pokémon that has a brown body with a sandy-colored underside
name: Marowak

text: It has a single claw on its hands and feet
name: Marowak

text: Its tail has a single protrusion near the end
name: Marowak

text: The Pokémon's head seems to be an exoskeleton helmet and wields a long bone
name: Marowak

text: Alolan Marowak has a black body
name: Marowak

text: Its arms are longer and lankier compared to a standard Marowak
name: Marowak

text: Its back has white skeletal marking
name: Marowak

text: The middle part of its skull has a pattern that resembles the appearance of an extruded high-cylinder cap
name: Marowak

text: Its bone has two light green flames constantly burning on both ends
name: Marowak

text: Marowak no longer grieve about abandonment instead, their traumatic pasts become fuel for ruthless combat
name: Marowak

text: They use bones to defeat foes with moves like Bone Club and Bonemerang
name: Marowak

text: Marowak possess homing instincts that lead them back to their mothers’ tribes
name: Marowak

text: They will join these tribes, never learning who their mothers truly were
name: Marowak

text: Their loneliness has hardened them towards all deep social connections
name: Marowak

text: Marowak will often fight one another in these tribes to the death for especially prized bones
name: Marowak

text: The loser's remains will supply tools for future Cubone
name: Marowak

text: The abandonment of young is a coming-of-age for Marowak
name: Marowak

text: Lone Cubone, though traumatized, return home as cold, ruthless fighters who have no qualms whatsoever about brutally beating or killing others
name: Marowak

text: Marowak hardly even communicate with each other, and even more rarely do so with speech
name: Marowak

text: They tap their bones on boulders in specific rhythms to send messages
name: Marowak

text: There are known to be over 50 of these unique rhythms
name: Marowak

text: These Pokémon despise Mandibuzz, who try to steal their prized bones, and will throw their bones at them to knock them out of the sky
name: Marowak

text: In popular folklore where Cubone are believed to be wearing the skulls of their mothers, Marowak are spurred on to defend their bones by their desire to avenge their deceased parent
name: Marowak

text: Such extreme pressure also favored individuals that worked together (in contrast to the distant relations of mainland Marowak)
name: Marowak

text: These Pokémon maintain the tradition of passing down the bones of loved ones rather than dueling over them, however, Alolan Marowak seem to choose 'heirs' that will have the honor of wielding their bones when they pass
name: Marowak

text: These Pokémon remain close with one another for their whole lives
name: Marowak

text: They hold elaborate mourning rituals involving their flaming bones for their fallen allies though their bones may be repurposed, Alolan Marowak will create dirt mound 'graves' along the sides of roads, fiercely attacking those who disturb them
name: Marowak

text: It is said that their undying loyalty for one another endures even through death, with their spirits protecting those wielding their bones and granting them 'sixth senses
name: Marowak

text: ' Alolan people refer to and fear these Pokémon as 'conjurers of the dead' for this reason
name: Marowak

text: Alolan Marowak strike their bones on the black patches on their heads to ignite them
name: Marowak

text: They spin their bones and perform intricate dances to perform both rituals and attacks
name: Marowak

text: They can release fireballs in this manner while not individually strong, their determination to land repeated blows can make them formidable foes
name: Marowak

text: It is said that a blaze caused by its ghostly fire cannot be quenched, no matter how much water is poured over it
name: Marowak

text: Their flames are said to scorch both the mind and body equally
name: Marowak

text: Marowak are usually seen living in caves and grasslands, though some might be living in deserts
name: Marowak

text: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones
name: Marowak

text: It is skilled at using them as weapons, throwing them with great skill like boomerangs to KO foes
name: Marowak

text: Its attack power doubles when wielding a club
name: Marowak

text: Alolan Marowak can rub their bones on their foreheads to create fireballs and spin their bones to throw the fireballs
name: Marowak

text: Marowak evolves from Cubone at level 28
name: Marowak

text: Alolan Marowak evolves from Cubone at night
name: Marowak

text: Marowak is a bipedal reptilian Pokémon with light brown skin and a cream-colored underside
name: Marowak

text: Two small claws, one on each hand, serve as its thumbs, and one large nail on each foot make up its toes
name: Marowak

text: It has a short tail with a small spike near the tip
name: Marowak

text: Marowak's head is composed of the skull it once wore as a mask
name: Marowak

text: It can no longer remove the skull, which has become part of its body
name: Marowak

text: The skull has two pointed spikes on the back similar to ears and tiny nostrils on the tip of the snout
name: Marowak

text: Marowak's triangular, brown eyes are also located in the skull
name: Marowak

text: Marowak is well known for ferocity with its bone club, which it is said to collect from a hidden graveyard
name: Marowak

text: Upon evolution, Marowak has overcome the grief of its mother's passing
name: Marowak

text: Now ferocious and violent, Marowak is an adept combatant that uses the bone it carries as a weapon and a boomerang
name: Marowak

text: Having evolved, it seeks vengeance on its natural enemy Mandibuzz, which prey on Cubone because of its naturally weak and timid demeanor
name: Marowak

text: Marowak has also been recorded pounding on boulders with the bone club it carries in order to tap out messages to others
name: Marowak

text: It lives in mountains to test its skills
name: Marowak

text: In the Alola region, Marowak was faced with an abundance of its natural enemies, Grass-type Pokémon
name: Marowak

text: This harsh environment led it to bond closely with its friends, which is said to have created a sort of sixth sense and caused it to take a new form
name: Marowak

text: Alolan Marowak's body is black and it has pale gray eyes
name: Marowak

text: There is a dark, flamelike mark on its skull between the eyes
name: Marowak

text: Compared to regular Marowak's squatter, thicker body, Alolan Marowak is relatively thin
name: Marowak

text: White markings resembling shoulder blades, vertebrae, and hip bones are visible on its back
name: Marowak

text: The bone Alolan Marowak uses is longer than the one regular Marowak uses
name: Marowak

text: It customarily mourns its companions by burying them and dance in mourning
name: Marowak

text: Alolan Marowak rubs the bone it wields against its forehead to light the ends in a green flame, and then twirls the flaming bone
name: Marowak

text: It specializes in an attack where it releases a weak ball of flame from its bone that will relentlessly pursue its foe
name: Marowak

text: Alolans would fear it for a conjurer, due to its rarity and the fearful sight of it dancing with its bone
name: Marowak

text: 1 The dance is also used as a way of mourning for its lost allies
name: Marowak

text: Once its flames have spread onto an opponent, they are impossible to put out with water
name: Marowak

text: The flames are known to cause both mental and physical pain
name: Marowak

text: Marowak and its pre-evolved form, Cubone, are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the moves Bone Club and Bonemerang
name: Marowak

text: Marowak and Cubone are also the only known Pokémon capable of using the Thick Club item
name: Marowak

text: In Generations II and III, Bone Rush was another one of their signature moves
name: Marowak

text: Alolan Marowak is the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Shadow Bone
name: Marowak

text: Hitmonlee is light brown in color with tape-like markings around its forearms and legs
name: Hitmonlee

text: While it looks like it has tape wrapped around its legs, the tape is actually its legs coiled like a spring which stretch to increase the distance of his kicks
name: Hitmonlee

text: Hitmonlee and their relatives Hitmonchan and Hitmontop are found in cites, training peacefully alongside humans
name: Hitmonlee

text: They also occasionally head to mountains to train, though they generally return to urban areas at night
name: Hitmonlee

text: After tough training sessions, Hitmonlee will often massage their legs to prevent fatigue
name: Hitmonlee

text: They can often be found in dojos, teaching people how to deliver devastating kicks as well as learning new, unorthodox techniques from them
name: Hitmonlee

text: Hitmonlee can effortlessly extend and stretch their legs as if they are springs, going twice beyond their initial length to knock out their foes in good balance
name: Hitmonlee

text: It should be noted that their legs can keep stretching further while they are constantly clobbering their opponents
name: Hitmonlee

text: Hitmonlee evolves from Tyrogue at level 20 if its Attack is higher than its Defense
name: Hitmonlee

text: Hitmonlee is a humanoid Pokémon with an ovoid body
name: Hitmonlee

text: Lacking a distinct neck and head, its upper torso has almond-shaped eyes with black space around them and appears to lack a nose and mouth
name: Hitmonlee

text: Primarily brown, it has cream-colored, segmented arms and legs
name: Hitmonlee

text: Each hand has three fingers and each foot has three clawed toes
name: Hitmonlee

text: The soles of its feet and its ankles have circular, yellow pads
name: Hitmonlee

text: Hitmonlee is an exclusively male species with no female counterpart
name: Hitmonlee

text: Hitmonlee's legs freely contract and stretch similar to a coiled spring
name: Hitmonlee

text: This flexibility allows Hitmonlee to run with lengthy strides and gives it greater reach for its kicks
name: Hitmonlee

text: Its excellent sense of balance enables it to kick in succession from any position
name: Hitmonlee

text: After battling, it rubs down its legs to relax the tight muscles
name: Hitmonlee

text: Rare in the wild, it is primarily found in urban areas
name: Hitmonlee

text: Hitmonchan's appearance is very similar to a human, when compared to other Pokémon
name: Hitmonchan

text: Its skin is a light brown color
name: Hitmonchan

text: Its appears to be wearing a purple, skirt-like attire and bright red boxing gloves
name: Hitmonchan

text: Its feet are also a purple color, giving it the appearance that he is wearing shoes
name: Hitmonchan

text: Its enlarged shoulders appear as large shoulder pads
name: Hitmonchan

text: The very top of its head is separated into five sections, and its face has visible eyes and a mouth but no nose
name: Hitmonchan

text: Hitmonchan is an extremely resilient Pokémon who won't give up in the face of challenges
name: Hitmonchan

text: Any Hitmonchan may appear to be standing idly when in fact launching volleys of punches faster than bullet trains into thin air as practice
name: Hitmonchan

text: However, these punches do tire them out—after three minutes of intense work, they need to take light rests
name: Hitmonchan

text: Regardless of the setbacks they face, Hitmonchan are determined, having the spirit of champion boxers
name: Hitmonchan

text: Even during these breaks, Hitmonchan will often move around or jog quickly in place
name: Hitmonchan

text: They are also skilled in sparring with light punches, allowing them to act as a sparring partners to fellow Hitmonchan or to aspiring human boxers (the latter of which who almost always lose, but learn from fights nonetheless)
name: Hitmonchan

text: Like Hitmonlee, Hitmonchan can be found training in dojos, but can also sometimes be seen punching away at boulders in mountains
name: Hitmonchan

text: Hitmonchan utilize their punching moves to the fullest, far more than any other Pokémon
name: Hitmonchan

text: Their punches can be so quick that it is possible that they are not able to be seen
name: Hitmonchan

text: Hitmonchan can learn all three elemental punches which are strong against elemental Pokémon that are weak against them
name: Hitmonchan

text: They can also punch so much that their punches slice through the air, but at the expense of their stamina
name: Hitmonchan

text: Even a slight graze will cause a burn, and can demolish concrete (which a Conkeldurr wields)
name: Hitmonchan

text: Hitmonchan evolves from Tyrogue at level 20 only when its Attack stat is lower than his Defense stat
name: Hitmonchan

text: Hitmonchan is a tan, humanoid Pokémon that is exclusively male and has no female counterpart
name: Hitmonchan

text: There are five blunt protrusions on top of its head, and it has structures resembling pads over its shoulders
name: Hitmonchan

text: It appears to be wearing a light purple tunic and kilt, as well as red boxing gloves and light purple boxing shoes
name: Hitmonchan

text: In-between the tunic and kilt is a small, black area
name: Hitmonchan

text: As its appearance suggests, Hitmonchan specializes in punching
name: Hitmonchan

text: It is able to throw punches that are too quick to be seen with the naked eye
name: Hitmonchan

text: Its punches are said to be as fast as a bullet train
name: Hitmonchan

text: By punching with a corkscrew motion, it is even capable of drilling through concrete
name: Hitmonchan

text: Even a light gaze from its punches will result in a burn
name: Hitmonchan

text: However, Hitmonchan requires a break every three minutes while fighting
name: Hitmonchan

text: Despite the need for frequent breaks, it has an unwavering spirit and will never give up in a difficult situation
name: Hitmonchan

text: Usually found in urban areas, it is rarely seen in the wild
name: Hitmonchan

text: In Generation II, Mach Punch was its signature move
name: Hitmonchan

text: Lickitung is a pink, reptilian Pokémon with some white designs on its stomach, legs, and hands
name: Lickitung

text: It has a bulky body with a long tail and most importantly, a long tongue
name: Lickitung

text: Their tongues are actually the most receptive part of their bodies, even more sensitive than their hands
name: Lickitung

text: When they come across unfamiliar objects, they will lick them, as they associate things by texture and taste
name: Lickitung

text: Lickitung do not enjoy sourness, however, and will avoid things that are tart
name: Lickitung

text: Though Lickitung often chase down people and Pokémon, they are not aggressive
name: Lickitung

text: In addition to using their tongues to feel new things, they also use them to detect food particles on others and lick them off to clean them, though this always leaves a rather unpleasant odor behind
name: Lickitung

text: Lickitung has a tongue which is twice its body length
name: Lickitung

text: It uses it for a variety of tasks such as catching its prey, cleaning itself, or attacking enemies, with licks usually causing paralysis when they hit an opponent
name: Lickitung

text: Lickitung's saliva on its tongue can easily grip anything, and can also cause a long-lasting itch to its foes
name: Lickitung

text: It preys on Bug-type Pokémon with its long and extensive tongue
name: Lickitung

text: From Generation IV onwards, Lickitung evolves into Lickilicky when leveled up while knowing the move Rollout
name: Lickitung

text: Lickitung is a bipedal amphibian Pokémon with a round body and a thick, powerful tail
name: Lickitung

text: It has soft, pink skin with curved yellow lines on its belly and a yellow ring marking on each knee
name: Lickitung

text: It has a thumb-like claw on each hand and a single large nail on each foot
name: Lickitung

text: There is a yellow spot on its palms and the soles of its feet
name: Lickitung

text: It has beady eyes and a long, prehensile tongue
name: Lickitung

text: The tongue is likely connected to its tail, which twitches when the tongue is pulled
name: Lickitung

text: At over 6 feet 6 inches (2 meters), Lickitung's tongue is twice as long as its body
name: Lickitung

text: Sticky, smelly saliva coats its tongue, which causes a tingling sensation when touched and can cause rashes if not cleaned off
name: Lickitung

text: It is used for capturing prey, exploring its environment, and cleaning
name: Lickitung

text: However, it is questionable if its saliva is clean in the first place as whatever it cleans has a lingering smell
name: Lickitung

text: Lickitung's salvia can be used as a strong adhesive after cooking it
name: Lickitung

text: Lickitung remembers things by their texture and taste, although it apparently dislikes sour things
name: Lickitung

text: The tongue is both dexterous and powerful enough to lift people, as seen in the anime
name: Lickitung

text: Lickitung preys on Bug-type Pokémon
name: Lickitung

text: It prefers swallowing its prey whole after paralyzing them with its tongue
name: Lickitung

text: Lickitung can be found in grassy plains and meadows
name: Lickitung

text: Koffing is a Poison Gas Pokémon
name: Koffing

text: Its body is purple and spherical with a skull and crossbones on the lower parts of its body
name: Koffing

text: It has openings that allow gases to escape
name: Koffing

text: A Koffing will spew a harmless gas if its happy, and a poisonous gas if it's angry
name: Koffing

text: Koffing mainly eats rotten kitchen garbage
name: Koffing

text: Koffing have the ability Levitate
name: Koffing

text: Levitate causes all Ground-type moves to miss Koffing
name: Koffing

text: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft
name: Koffing

text: The gases not only smell, they are also explosive
name: Koffing

text: Koffing's signature attack is Poison Gas
name: Koffing

text: Koffing evolves into Weezing at Level 35
name: Koffing

text: Koffing is a spherical Pokémon filled with toxic gases
name: Koffing

text: It has vacant eyes and a wide mouth that usually has two pointed teeth in the upper jaw
name: Koffing

text: However, a full set of teeth has been seen in the anime
name: Koffing

text: Below its face is a cream-colored skull-and-crossbones marking
name: Koffing

text: Several geyser-like protrusions, which usually release a mustard-colored gas, cover this Pokémon's body
name: Koffing

text: Koffing's purple skin is very thin, and over-inflation can cause it to explode
name: Koffing

text: Koffing creates gases within its body by mixing toxins with garbage, and produces more gas in higher temperatures
name: Koffing

text: These gases are malodorous and cause sniffles, coughs, and teary eyes to those around them
name: Koffing

text: The gases are also lighter than air, allowing Koffing to hover
name: Koffing

text: When agitated, it creates a more toxic gas and expels it through the holes in its body
name: Koffing

text: As shown in the anime, Koffing's gas can be ignited by fire or electricity
name: Koffing

text: It feeds on the fumes of raw, rotting trash found in gas dumps and polluted air
name: Koffing

text: Koffing at one point was plentiful in Galar due to factories
name: Koffing

text: Koffing is most often found in urban areas
name: Koffing

text: Weezing is a much more bulky and large version of its pre-evolved form Koffing
name: Weezing

text: After evolving from Koffing, Weezing gains a secondary (although smaller) head
name: Weezing

text: The larger primary head has two fang-like teeth protruding from its lower mouth and two flat teeth protruding from its upper mouth, as well as a skull and crossbones marking
name: Weezing

text: The smaller head has a simple frown and a circular marking
name: Weezing

text: Weezing also has multiple pores surrounding its body that releases poisonous gases
name: Weezing

text: A Galarian Weezing is much different than a Kantonian Weezing
name: Weezing

text: It has a gray body with green smog clouds radiating from its mouth, which gives it the appearance of facial hair the larger head has a mustache while the smaller head has a beard and eyebrows
name: Weezing

text: It also has a tall smoke stack on both heads, which resembles a top hat, with light-gray smoke clouds
name: Weezing

text: The skull and crossbones on the larger head now has a golden tint, which is also applied to the circular marking on the smaller head
name: Weezing

text: Unlike its Kantonian counterpart, both heads of a Galarian Weezing have their mouths open
name: Weezing

text: Weezing is formed from a fusion of toxic gases and two Koffings for many years
name: Weezing

text: Because of the constant mixtures of poison gases within its body, Weezing always emit foul-smelling odors
name: Weezing

text: Just like its pre-evolved form, Weezing is able to hover in the air
name: Weezing

text: Despite smelling horrible, the gases that Weezing creates have been used for perfumes
name: Weezing

text: Weezing is fond of garbage and other sources of pollution it is mainly nocturnal, always looking for trash from a human's house
name: Weezing

text: The gases produced from a Kantonian Weezing is much more potent than the gases from a Galarian Weezing
name: Weezing

text: Galarian Weezing relies on poisonous gases to sustain itself
name: Weezing

text: Unlike its Kantonian counterpart, Galarian Weezing emits clean purified air rather than pollution
name: Weezing

text: This process is done through the absorption of lingering air pollutants
name: Weezing

text: The toxins Galarian Weezing stores inside its body are released into the air as concentrated poisonous gas, which is so lethal that a mere whiff will immobilize anyone caught in its vicinity
name: Weezing

text: This toxic gas is apparently Galarian Weezing's best weapon to use in battle
name: Weezing

text: Long ago, when the Galar region was filled with toxic pollution emitted from groups of factories, Galarian Weezing mysteriously changed form
name: Weezing

text: Weezing is the evolved form of Koffing as of level 35
name: Weezing

text: Weezing is a purple Pokémon consisting of two spherical heads connected by a thin tube with another sphere in the center
name: Weezing

text: The heads have different sizes and features
name: Weezing

text: The left head is larger and has prominent eyebrows, pointed teeth protruding from its lower jaw, and two flat teeth in its upper jaw
name: Weezing

text: The smaller, right head simply has two pointed teeth, one at each corner of its mouth
name: Weezing

text: The larger head has a cream-colored skull-and-crossbones marking below its face, while the smaller head has a ring marking instead
name: Weezing

text: It is covered with many geyser-like protrusions, which usually expel mustard-colored gases
name: Weezing

text: Weezing is said to form when poisonous gases pool and two Koffing fuse over many years
name: Weezing

text: Very rarely, two Koffing can become a Weezing in a short time span because of a sudden mutation
name: Weezing

text: Triplet Weezing have been discovered, although they are extremely rare
name: Weezing

text: Each of Weezing's heads contains a different toxin
name: Weezing

text: It mixes its gases by inflating one head and deflating the other
name: Weezing

text: When its gases mix, Weezing becomes more toxic and putrid
name: Weezing

text: Weezing can hover in midair, presumably due to gases lighter than air, as is the case for Koffing
name: Weezing

text: Despite their stench and poison, Weezing's gases can be used to make top-grade perfume by diluting them to the highest level
name: Weezing

text: Weezing lives in urban areas
name: Weezing

text: It seeks a dirty, unkempt house and nests there
name: Weezing

text: At night, when the people in the house are asleep, it will go through the trash
name: Weezing

text: Weezing feeds on the dust, microorganisms, and especially gases emitted by garbage and toxic waste
name: Weezing

text: Weezing's body expands and smells worse upon inhaling poisonous gases
name: Weezing

text: The Kantonian Weezing used to be common in Galar and created more potent toxins than their Galarian relatives
name: Weezing

text: In the Galar region, its appearance has changed due to absorbing polluted air from factories
name: Weezing

text: It has a gray body with the skull, crossbones, and ring patterns changed to the color yellow
name: Weezing

text: Both heads have a hat-like tube located on top of them that constantly releases purified air
name: Weezing

text: Five puffs of green poison gas clouds can be seen floating around it
name: Weezing

text: The gas clouds also partly cover its faces: the larger head has a mustache-like cloud on its upper lip, while the smaller head has clouds on its face in the shape of eyebrows and a beard
name: Weezing

text: Galarian Weezing consumes particles from polluted air, and expels clean air instead of droppings
name: Weezing

text: The toxins within Galarian Weezing's body are accumulated into poison gas clouds that leaks and drifts around it
name: Weezing

text: The gas is its best weapon in battle, being potent enough to stun and immobilize an opponent with just a whiff
name: Weezing

text: 1 Galarian Weezing preys on Trubbish for the fumes it produces
name: Weezing

text: Galarian Weezing is the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Strange Steam
name: Weezing

text: Rhyhorn is a gray rhinoceros-like Pokémon that has rock hard skin and armor covering its body
name: Rhyhorn

text: It has spikes on top of it to protect itself from its foes
name: Rhyhorn

text: It walks on four legs and has a horn that can be used as a drill
name: Rhyhorn

text: And it has two toes on each foot and two sharp teeth sticking out of its mouth
name: Rhyhorn

text: The male's nose horn is longer than the female's
name: Rhyhorn

text: Rhyhorn can have the ability Rock Head or the ability Lightningrod
name: Rhyhorn

text: Rock Head prevents Rhyhorn from sustaining recoil damage
name: Rhyhorn

text: Lightning Rod directs all Electric-type attacks to Rhyhorn
name: Rhyhorn

text: Its body is clad in a thick hide, and its tackles topple buildings
name: Rhyhorn

text: Unfortunately, it is not very clever, and can only run in straight lines
name: Rhyhorn

text: It is very difficult to catch in Safari Zone due to missing with Safari Balls
name: Rhyhorn

text: While powerful, Rhyhorn are not the smartest Pokémon in the world
name: Rhyhorn

text: they are said to only be able to remember one thing at a time
name: Rhyhorn

text: While that is not true, they are still rather dense Pokémon
name: Rhyhorn

text: They will often charge at something but forget why they began charging in the first place mid-run they will not stop running until they tire out and collapse from exhaustion, however
name: Rhyhorn

text: Sometimes, destroying things help Rhyhorn remember why they began running
name: Rhyhorn

text: Rhyhorn can be very friendly and playful but if approached from behind they may get startled and run as they have a blind spot directly behind them, like horses do
name: Rhyhorn

text: They will gladly allow their trainers to ride on their backs in some regions, Rhyhorn racing is a popular sport
name: Rhyhorn

text: Rhyhorn evolves into Rhydon at level 42
name: Rhyhorn

text: Rhyhorn is a rhinoceros-like Pokémon with a body covered in gray, rocky plates
name: Rhyhorn

text: Its underside and rear are smooth, and it has four short legs with two claws on each foot
name: Rhyhorn

text: It has a triangular head with narrow, red eyes, two fangs protruding from its upper jaw, small, triangular openings on the upper sides, and a short horn on the tip of its snout
name: Rhyhorn

text: A female will have a shorter horn than a male
name: Rhyhorn

text: A spiked ridge runs along its back
name: Rhyhorn

text: In addition to its rocky hide, its bones are a thousand times harder than human bones
name: Rhyhorn

text: Rhyhorn's brain is very small, giving it a one-track mind
name: Rhyhorn

text: When it runs, it forgets why it started and continues until it falls asleep
name: Rhyhorn

text: However, it may recall the reason upon demolishing something
name: Rhyhorn

text: Due to its short legs, it is inept at turning and can only run in straight lines
name: Rhyhorn

text: It does not care if obstacles get in the way, merely smashing through them or sending them flying
name: Rhyhorn

text: However, it may feel pain the day after a collision
name: Rhyhorn

text: Rhyhorn lives in rough terrain
name: Rhyhorn

text: Rhyhorn is powerful enough to shatter skyscraper or mountains instantly after charging forward with head tackles
name: Rhyhorn

text: It is a gray rock-hard Pokémon that developed a long tail and learned to stand bipedally, meaning on two legs
name: Rhydon

text: It is a rhinoceros-like creature that can crush rocks and has a long drill that can drill through rocks
name: Rhydon

text: A female Rhydon is similar in appearance to a male Rhydon
name: Rhydon

text: However, her horn is shorter than that of a male Rhydon's
name: Rhydon

text: This Pokémon's brain developed after it stood up on its hind legs
name: Rhydon

text: Its drill horn bores tunnels through solid rock, even diamonds
name: Rhydon

text: Records show it as being able to topple buildings with a sweeping blow of its tail
name: Rhydon

text: Its hide is so thick and protective that Rhydon can thrive in very hot places, as well as being almost impossible to hurt in battle, at the cost being unable to sense its surroundings
name: Rhydon

text: Rhydon is the evolved form of Rhyhorn at level 42
name: Rhydon

text: Rhydon evolves into the Generation IV Pokémon, Rhyperior, when traded while holding the Protector
name: Rhydon

text: Rhydon is a large, gray, bipedal Pokémon with features similar to both dinosaurs and rhinoceroses
name: Rhydon

text: It has narrow, red eyes and two fangs in its upper jaw
name: Rhydon

text: On the tip of Rhydon's snout is a cream-colored horn, which is smaller on a female than a male
name: Rhydon

text: There are several other spikes and projections on its head: on top is a spike that curves forward, two triangular points resembling ears on the sides, a wide, wavy crest under each ear, and spiky ridges on each cheek
name: Rhydon

text: It has a cream-colored abdomen divided into strips by thin divots
name: Rhydon

text: A rocky plate on its chest slightly overlaps its abdomen
name: Rhydon

text: There is a row of spikes down its back and they have a long tail with thin, black stripes
name: Rhydon

text: Rhydon is a physically powerful Pokémon
name: Rhydon

text: It is recorded as being able to topple buildings with a sweeping blow of its tail, and its horn is able to bore through solid rock and shatter diamonds
name: Rhydon

text: Its armor-like hide protects it from heat and physical blows
name: Rhydon

text: It is stated to be capable of passing unscathed through streams of magma and withstanding a direct blow from a cannonball without being harmed
name: Rhydon

text: However, because of this tough hide, it is insensitive
name: Rhydon

text: Despite its well-developed brain, it can be forgetful
name: Rhydon

text: Rhydon lives in rough terrain
name: Rhydon

text: Chansey is a round, pink Pokémon
name: Chansey

text: It has stubby arms and legs with no visible digits
name: Chansey

text: It has small black eyes and a mouth with no visible nose
name: Chansey

text: It has three long frills on each side of its head
name: Chansey

text: It also has a short tail and a pouch with a white egg
name: Chansey

text: Its feet, pouch, and the ends of its frills are a darker shade of pink
name: Chansey

text: Chansey is an extremely brave and kind Pokémon and it always smiles, regardless of its mood
name: Chansey

text: It is known to bring anyone happiness
name: Chansey

text: Chansey can either have the ability Natural Cure or the ability Serene Grace
name: Chansey

text: Natural Cure causes all of Chansey's status effects to be cured when Chansey is switched out
name: Chansey

text: Serene Grace doubles the chances that secondary effects happen
name: Chansey

text: Chansey are supposed to bring happiness and are seen carrying a stone shaped egg and shares her with injured Pokémon
name: Chansey

text: The Chansey line happens to have more items associated with it than any other Pokémon: the Lucky Punch, the Lucky Incense, the Lucky Egg, and the aforementioned Oval Stone
name: Chansey

text: Chansey is the evolved form of Happiny, by leveling up Happiny when holding an Oval Stone during the day
name: Chansey

text: Chansey evolves into Blissey when leveled up with max Friendship
name: Chansey

text: Chansey is a pink, ovoid Pokémon with stubby arms and dark pink feet
name: Chansey

text: It has tiny eyes and three hair-like growths on each side of its head
name: Chansey

text: The tufts of hair have dark pink tips
name: Chansey

text: On the center of its belly is a dark pink pouch that contains a single white egg
name: Chansey

text: The egg is said to be very nutritious and it lays several new ones every day
name: Chansey

text: Finally, it has a short tail
name: Chansey

text: Chansey is a female-only species with no male counterpart
name: Chansey

text: A kindhearted Pokémon, Chansey will share its eggs with injured people and Pokémon
name: Chansey

text: However, Chansey will never share its egg to those with evil hearts
name: Chansey

text: The eggs become more delicious if Chansey is raised with love and care
name: Chansey

text: Chansey's egg is used as a high-class cooking ingredient due to the nutrition it has
name: Chansey

text: As a result, Chansey have been referred to as doctors' doubles because of its eggs
name: Chansey

text: Due to its egg being over-harvested, Chansey is extremely rare in the wild and is said to bring good luck and happiness to those who manage to catch it
name: Chansey

text: Fleeing from those seeking its egg has made this once-slow species much quicker on its feet than in the past
name: Chansey

text: It is more commonly found in urban settings
name: Chansey

text: Chansey is the only known Pokémon capable of using the Lucky Punch item
name: Chansey

text: In Pokémon Legends: Arceus, if the player is injured, any nearby Chansey will come to help heal them, and then flee when they're fully healed
name: Chansey

text: Chansey and its evolutionary relatives are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Soft-Boiled by leveling up
name: Chansey

text: Tangela is a Vine Pokémon
name: Tangela

text: Its body is covered with blue vines covered with tiny hairs that grow to give the impression that Tangela is circular in shape
name: Tangela

text: Two big eyes are all people see inside the vines and there are no visible arms
name: Tangela

text: It also has two red feet that poke out of the vines
name: Tangela

text: A Tangela's vines never stop moving
name: Tangela

text: Though they are genetically closely related to seaweed, they do not require any more water than the average plant
name: Tangela

text: Their vines never stop growing and can regenerate
name: Tangela

text: This allows Tangela to snap off vines painlessly to distract predators and regrow them later as soon as the next day
name: Tangela

text: Their vines have a distinctive scent and are used as an herb in some parts of Galar
name: Tangela

text: The swaying of their vines can be mysteriously unnerving to onlookers
name: Tangela

text: Their vines are covered in fine hairs that tickle those caught within and also allow Tangela to use their vines as arms the hairs can “feel” objects when brushed against them and detect ​changes in air pressure and humidity
name: Tangela

text: Their vines latch onto anything that moves
name: Tangela

text: If Tangela grab foes that turn out to be too strong, their vines will break off and allow them to escape
name: Tangela

text: Since Tangela are shrouded in blue vines, no one has seen their face hidden behind this growth of vines
name: Tangela

text: However, these vines impart a refreshing sensation when chewed, so they are useful as spices
name: Tangela

text: Tangela evolves into Tangrowth when leveled up while knowing the move Ancient Power
name: Tangela

text: Tangela is a plant Pokémon covered by blue, seaweed-like vines that obscure its face
name: Tangela

text: There is a small opening in the vines that reveals its eyes surrounded by a black space
name: Tangela

text: The vines give Tangela a round shape, but it is unknown what it looks like without them
name: Tangela

text: Its vines are covered in fine hair and are always growing
name: Tangela

text: If damaged or lost, replacements are grown
name: Tangela

text: There is a pair of red boot-like feet poking out from under the vines, but no visible arms
name: Tangela

text: Tangela can ensnare and entangle anything that moves too close to it with its vines
name: Tangela

text: The vines constantly jiggle and sway, unnerving enemies and causing a tickling sensation if ensnared
name: Tangela

text: Tangela's vines will snap off easily and painlessly if the target pulls on them, so it can quickly escape
name: Tangela

text: The vines of Tangela are said to have a distinct scent
name: Tangela

text: In Galar, its vines are used as herbs
name: Tangela

text: Tangela can usually be found in temperate grasslands
name: Tangela

text: Kangaskhan is known as a Parent Pokémon
name: Kangaskhan

text: She resembles a large dinosaur with elements of a kangaroo
name: Kangaskhan

text: Her baby is often seen in her pouch
name: Kangaskhan

text: When Mega Evolution is activated, the adult remains unchanged physically, while the juvenile emerges from the pouch and increases in size and power
name: Kangaskhan

text: Kangaskhan is a caring and devoted Pokémon, with strong maternal instincts
name: Kangaskhan

text: A mother will carry her young in the marsupial-like pouch on her stomach, and rarely lets her out of her sight
name: Kangaskhan

text: When she feels safe, the parent will let the baby out to play
name: Kangaskhan

text: Young Kangaskhan are obedient and loyal to their parents and do their best to help fight off enemies during battle
name: Kangaskhan

text: This Pokémon is known for the fact that she has a baby in her pouch in front of her
name: Kangaskhan

text: If she feels that either of them (that being the baby and her) is being harmed, she will attack
name: Kangaskhan

text: Kangaskhancan evolve into her mega form in Pokémon X/Y, during battle
name: Kangaskhan

text: Kangaskhan is a large, bipedal marsupial Pokémon that vaguely resembles a kangaroo
name: Kangaskhan

text: It has a brown hide with several raised patches and a cream-colored belly
name: Kangaskhan

text: It has large, cream-colored ears, narrow, red eyes, and a short, rounded snout with two fangs in the back of its upper jaw
name: Kangaskhan

text: On top of its head is a thick, black plate
name: Kangaskhan

text: There are epaulette-like growths over its shoulders and a row of spikes down its back
name: Kangaskhan

text: It has three clawed digits on each hand and foot and a thick tail
name: Kangaskhan

text: On its belly is a pouch that contains a baby Kangaskhan
name: Kangaskhan

text: Unlike its parent, the baby is light purple and has smooth skin
name: Kangaskhan

text: Kangaskhan is a female-only species with no male counterpart
name: Kangaskhan

text: As Mega Kangaskhan, the mother Kangaskhan appears unchanged
name: Kangaskhan

text: However, the baby temporarily grows and gains some new features
name: Kangaskhan

text: There are now raised patches on its knees similar to those seen on its mother
name: Kangaskhan

text: These patches also appear aligned horizontally along its waist with a larger patch on its belly
name: Kangaskhan

text: Small, spiked growths appear underneath its ears
name: Kangaskhan

text: The child is feisty, hates to lose and will boldly challenge its opponents to protect its mother
name: Kangaskhan

text: 1 The mother's happiness over its child's growth is the source of its additional strength
name: Kangaskhan

text: However, it feels uneasy about the child's future, as it is only skilled at fighting and nothing else
name: Kangaskhan

text: It is also saddened by the reminder that its child will one day leave
name: Kangaskhan

text: Kangaskhan is a nurturing Pokémon that protects its young at all costs
name: Kangaskhan

text: It can move really fast, even with the baby in its pouch
name: Kangaskhan

text: The baby leaves the pouch only rarely until it is three years old
name: Kangaskhan

text: In order to avoid crushing the baby, Kangaskhan sleeps standing up
name: Kangaskhan

text: If the mother feels the environment is safe, it will allow its young out to play
name: Kangaskhan

text: However, it will violently attack anything that it sees as a threat to its young
name: Kangaskhan

text: They are known to raise other species of Pokémon alongside their own children, and records exist which describe a childless Kangaskhan raising a lost human child
name: Kangaskhan

text: Regardless of how badly injured it becomes, the mother will not cease fighting until its young is safe
name: Kangaskhan

text: It uses quick jabs to intimidate its enemies
name: Kangaskhan

text: Although it was nearly hunted to extinction, Kangaskhan can be found in savannahs and other grasslands
name: Kangaskhan

text: Prior to Generation III, Dizzy Punch was its signature move
name: Kangaskhan

text: Horsea is a Water-type Pokémon that resembles a seahorse
name: Horsea

text: It is a small, light blue seahorse with tiny scales
name: Horsea

text: Its belly and fin are cream colored
name: Horsea

text: Its tail is always curled up tightly, and it has a single fin on its back that is used for locomotion in the water
name: Horsea

text: If they sense trouble, they spit ink towards the instigator
name: Horsea

text: If the enemy is too strong, it quickly swims to safety
name: Horsea

text: When they are a safe location, they can be seen playfully tangling their tails together
name: Horsea

text: Horsea do like swimming around, making them adept in using their fin
name: Horsea

text: If the ocean current turns fast, however, Horsea will anchor itself by wrapping its tail around rocks or coral to prevent being washed away
name: Horsea

text: It also has the ability to spit ink to escape any potential danger, because of this it can learn moves such as Smokescreen
name: Horsea

text: They have been known to make their nests in the shades of corals
name: Horsea

text: Horsea can have the ability Swift Swim or the ability Sniper
name: Horsea

text: Swift Swim increases Horsea's Speed when it is raining
name: Horsea

text: Sniper powers up critical hits
name: Horsea

text: They are known to be very accurate in shooting water
name: Horsea

text: Horsea evolves into Seadra at level 32, which evolves into Kingdra when traded with a Dragon Scale
name: Horsea

text: Horsea is a light blue, piscine Pokémon that is similar to a seahorse
name: Horsea

text: It has red eyes, a long, tubular mouth, and three spike-like fins on either side of its head
name: Horsea

text: Its ridged belly and single dorsal fin are cream-colored
name: Horsea

text: Highly adept in the water, it uses its dorsal fin to swim in any direction while facing forward
name: Horsea

text: It has a tightly curled tail that it can use as both a balance and an anchor when caught in a strong current
name: Horsea

text: In safer environments, it uses its tail to play with other members of its species
name: Horsea

text: Horsea feeds on insects and moss gathered from rocks
name: Horsea

text: If Horsea senses danger, it sprays water or dense black ink from its mouth at its attacker
name: Horsea

text: It can shoot more precisely at insects flying above the surface of the water
name: Horsea

text: Horsea nests in coral reefs and islands throughout oceans with gentle currents
name: Horsea

text: Many Eggs are laid every year, and the young are raised by the male Horsea rather than the female
name: Horsea

text: Horsea swims with dance-like motions, creating whirlpools in the process
name: Horsea

text: It tends to compete with each other to see who can create the biggest whirlpool
name: Horsea

text: It has a long snout and a number of spikes on its head, to the sides and on the top, and a pair of pectoral fins on the sides of its head
name: Seadra

text: Its torso is covered with rough, cream-colored scales
name: Seadra

text: Seadra's dorsal fins have sharp, pointed, cream-colored tips from which it exudes venom
name: Seadra

text: Seadra also has a large tail which is generally coiled up
name: Seadra

text: Seadra's quills can render its victim unconscious
name: Seadra

text: Seadra have a violent temper
name: Seadra

text: They hook their tail onto rocks or coral branches to rest, preventing them from being swept away
name: Seadra

text: Seadra can also use their fins and tails to swim backwards
name: Seadra

text: When hunting, Seadra create whirlpools to trap and disorient prey
name: Seadra

text: Whirlpools from larger Seadra can be powerful enough to capsize fishing boats
name: Seadra

text: They swallow ​food whole using their long snouts, and can even suck in prey larger than these openings with great force
name: Seadra

text: After the female Seadra gives birth, the male Seadra will take care of the young and its nest
name: Seadra

text: It will attack those who venture too near to its children
name: Seadra

text: Seadra's spines provide protection for their bodies, and their fins and bones are prized as traditional medicine ingredients
name: Seadra

text: They are also extremely accurate in shooting water from their mouths
name: Seadra

text: Seadra evolves from Horsea at level 32
name: Seadra

text: Seadra evolves into Kingdra, when traded while holding the Dragon Scale
name: Seadra

text: Seadra is a light blue, piscine Pokémon that is similar to a seahorse with a cream-colored belly covered in rough scales
name: Seadra

text: It has a long, tubular mouth, narrow, black eyes, a fin-like ridge above each eye, and spiny pectoral fins
name: Seadra

text: It also has a large, coiled tail
name: Seadra

text: It has a pair of dorsal fins with sharp, cream-colored tips that exude venom
name: Seadra

text: Seadra's venom is toxic enough to induce numbness and even fainting in humans, but it is still prized among practitioners of traditional medicine
name: Seadra

text: Seadra can swim in any direction while facing forward by rapidly flapping its fins and tail
name: Seadra

text: It catches its prey by spinning its body to create large whirlpools
name: Seadra

text: When its prey is exhausted, Seadra swallows it whole using its long snout
name: Seadra

text: Seadra makes its nest by either wriggling between or anchoring itself to branches of coral under the ocean
name: Seadra

text: After a female Seadra gives birth, the male Seadra will take care of the young
name: Seadra

text: It is markedly vicious and will mercilessly attack those who venture near its nest
name: Seadra

text: During this time, the male's venom also becomes thicker and stronger than usual
name: Seadra

text: Goldeen is a fish-like Pokémon, with long, billowing fins
name: Goldeen

text: It is colored orange and white
name: Goldeen

text: Goldeen also has a horn on its forehead which it uses to attack foes
name: Goldeen

text: The male's horn is longer than the female's
name: Goldeen

text: Goldeen can have the ability Swift Swim or the ability Water Veil
name: Goldeen

text: Swift Swim increases Goldeen's Speed when it is raining
name: Goldeen

text: Water Veil prevents Goldeen from getting Burned
name: Goldeen

text: Despite its looks, its horn is extremely powerful
name: Goldeen

text: Goldeen evolves into Seaking at level 33
name: Goldeen

text: Goldeen is a white piscine Pokémon with orange markings
name: Goldeen

text: It has circular blue eyes with orange lids and prominent pink lips
name: Goldeen

text: On its forehead is a large horn, which is larger on a male than on a female
name: Goldeen

text: It has a small, wavy dorsal fin surrounded by an orange patch and long pectoral fins with orange markings at the bases
name: Goldeen

text: Goldeen's billowing tail fin is orange around the base and turns white toward the edges
name: Goldeen

text: Its tail is admired by many for its beauty and similarity to a ballroom dress
name: Goldeen

text: Goldeen has a wild temperament and will use its horn to smash its way to freedom if kept in an aquarium
name: Goldeen

text: It competes with others of its kind to determine which has the strongest, thickest horn
name: Goldeen

text: Humans swimming near it must exercise caution lest Goldeen rams them
name: Goldeen

text: Goldeen is a very common sight in any body of fresh water, including ponds, lakes, and rivers
name: Goldeen

text: It can be seen swimming upstream in large schools during the breeding season in spring
name: Goldeen

text: Its strong fins allow it to maintain a steady speed of five knots while swimming upstream
name: Goldeen

text: It is known as the Water Dancer due to its elegant movements in the water
name: Goldeen

text: In Generation I, Waterfall was its signature move
name: Goldeen

text: Seaking is a primarily orange and white, fish-like Pokémon
name: Seaking

text: It has round, dark eyes, prominent pink lips, two small fangs, and a cream-colored horn in the center of its forehead
name: Seaking

text: A female will have a smaller horn than a male
name: Seaking

text: Most of its body is orange with a patch of white under its mouth and along its underside
name: Seaking

text: There are several black markings on its body: two thick lines under each eye, a large wavy patch on its back, and several speckles near its tail
name: Seaking

text: It has billowingpectoral finsand a pair of tail fins shaped like butterfly wings, all of which are white specked with black
name: Seaking

text: However, itsdorsal finis pure white and rigid
name: Seaking

text: The female Seaking has a smaller horn
name: Seaking

text: These Pokémon live in fresh water, often sheltering in hollow boulders at the bottom of rivers or streams
name: Seaking

text: Seaking can have the ability Swift Swim or the ability Water Veil
name: Seaking

text: Swift Swim increases Seaking's Speed when it is raining
name: Seaking

text: Water Veil causes Seaking to be immune to burns
name: Seaking

text: Its horn can function like a drill and it is known to be very territorial
name: Seaking

text: Seaking evolves from Goldeen at level 33
name: Seaking

text: Seaking is a primarily orange-and-white, piscine Pokémon
name: Seaking

text: It has round, dark eyes, prominent pink lips, two small fangs, and a cream-colored horn in the center of its forehead
name: Seaking

text: A female will have a smaller horn than a male
name: Seaking

text: Most of its body is orange with a patch of white under its mouth and along its underside
name: Seaking

text: There are several black markings on its body: two thick lines under each eye, a large wavy patch on its back, and several speckles near its tail
name: Seaking

text: It has billowing pectoral fins and a pair of tail fins shaped like butterfly wings, all of which are white speckled with black
name: Seaking

text: However, its dorsal fin is pure white and rigid
name: Seaking

text: Seaking is a very powerful swimmer that is found in rivers and streams
name: Seaking

text: It can swim not only against a river's current, but up waterfalls as well
name: Seaking

text: In the autumn spawning season, it grows fatter and more vibrant
name: Seaking

text: It travels upriver where male Seaking engage in elaborate dances to court females
name: Seaking

text: The female would go for the Seaking with the most graceful dance
name: Seaking

text: Seaking uses its powerful horn to bore holes in riverbed boulders in order to shelter its Eggs from water currents
name: Seaking

text: A mated pair take turns patrolling around their new nest for roughly a month and defend it with their lives
name: Seaking

text: There are two different groups of Trainers who are obsessed with Seaking's horns or dorsal fins
name: Seaking

text: However, the groups cannot get along with each other
name: Seaking

text: In Generation I, Waterfall was its signature move
name: Seaking

text: Staryu is a star shaped Pokémon
name: Staryu

text: Its arms are brown
name: Staryu

text: It seems to have some kind of crystal or gem for a core
name: Staryu

text: The core is surrounded by a yellow or gold barrier
name: Staryu

text: Staryu are mysterious Pokémon that lie on the seabed during the day and float up to the surface at night
name: Staryu

text: For this reason, Pokémon like Lumineon often nibble on them as a reliable source of food
name: Staryu

text: Even a Staryu cut into pieces can regenerate as long as its core is intact
name: Staryu

text: Their centers are vital to their survival and are irreplaceable
name: Staryu

text: These cores glow brightly at night when Staryu are active, whereas the cores of sick Staryu glow faintly and flicker
name: Staryu

text: Staryu mostly live by the seashore in large numbers
name: Staryu

text: Groups of Staryu, referred to as constellations, rise to the surface each night, cores aglow
name: Staryu

text: They seem to float aimlessly (though they are actually filter-feeding), gazing at the stars
name: Staryu

text: Their cores mysteriously pulse at the same rate as a human's resting heartbeat
name: Staryu

text: From above, oceans with large numbers of Staryu seem to mimic and align with the twinkling skies above
name: Staryu

text: However, Staryu only become active if the stars are visible if clouds obscure the night sky, they will stay on the sea floor and their cores will not light up
name: Staryu

text: Staryu have the unique ability to regenerate their bodies if they are torn apart
name: Staryu

text: As long as the core remains, they can regenerate
name: Staryu

text: At the night, the red stone at the center of Staryu twinkle up like stars in the sky
name: Staryu

text: Staryu is a golden-brown, echinoderm Pokémon with five appendages
name: Staryu

text: These appendages surround an exterior organ called the core
name: Staryu

text: The core resembles a golden metal casing with a red gem in the center, which is held in place by a golden ring looped around Staryu's lower left point
name: Staryu

text: If any of Staryu's appendages are lost or eaten by predators like Lumineon, it is unharmed and can grow them back with ease provided the core is still intact
name: Staryu

text: When the sun goes down, the core glows its brightest
name: Staryu

text: Many Staryu will float from the seafloor to the surface and align themselves with stars of the night sky as their core flickers, displaying a connection with the celestial bodies of space
name: Staryu

text: The anime has shown that if Staryu becomes weak, its core will grow faint and flash slowly
name: Staryu

text: During the ends of summer, groups of Staryu tend to gather while lighting up in a steady rhythm
name: Staryu

text: Staryu can be found at the very bottom of the ocean on the seafloors
name: Staryu

text: There are times, however, when Staryu finds itself in rivers that lead into the ocean as seen in Pokémon Snap
name: Staryu

text: In Generation III, Camouflage was its signature move
name: Staryu

text: In the Pocket Monsters Encyclopedia, and the original Japanese version of the anime episode The Water Flowers of Cerulean City, Staryu is classified as hermaphroditic
name: Staryu

text: Starmie is a purple starfish-like Pokémon with a red core environed by a golden formation
name: Starmie

text: It appears to have more than five appendages
name: Starmie

text: Interestingly Starmie's back-half has been depicted several different ways
name: Starmie

text: In the anime Starmie has the appearance of two starfish fused together while in more modern games the back-half has been shown to spin wildly completely independent of the front-half of the Pokémon
name: Starmie

text: Many fans tend to think of the anime's depiction as the more realistic of the two, considering the rapid spinning would obviously get in the way of any trainer trying to surf on this particular Pokémon
name: Starmie

text: Starmie's core shines in a rainbow of seven colors, some people value this core as a type of jewelry
name: Starmie

text: They can flash their gems in a single color, alternating between different shades as if sending coded messages
name: Starmie

text: Starmie swim by spinning themselves like propellers through the water, filter-feeding as they go
name: Starmie

text: Starmie are able to emit peculiar signal waves from the gem-like core attached to the center of their bodies
name: Starmie

text: These waves are said to cause headaches to those who get near Starmie (according to the Pokémon Sun Pokédex entry)
name: Starmie

text: The core radiate the seven colors of the rainbow, earning them the nickname gem of the sea
name: Starmie

text: Starmie is a echinoderm Pokémon that resembles two violet starfish with five appendages each
name: Starmie

text: The front starfish has a golden formation in the center
name: Starmie

text: In the center of the golden casing is its red jewel core, which can glow in seven colors and has developed to resemble a cut precious stone
name: Starmie

text: The second starfish is semi-attached to the back of the first and can spin 360 degrees
name: Starmie

text: This rotational action is how Starmie swims through the ocean
name: Starmie

text: It can also launch itself out of the water and fly through the air for short periods, as seen in Pokémon Snap
name: Starmie

text: From its core, Starmie can emit electrical waves that are powerful enough to reach the furthest parts of the universe
name: Starmie

text: The multi-color glowing of its core is also believed to be a method of communication with other members of its species
name: Starmie

text: As seen in the anime, the core will go dark if Starmie is knocked unconscious and will sometimes flicker if Starmie is low on health
name: Starmie

text: Because of its body shape and habit of sending transmissions skyward, some people believe this Pokémon to be extraterrestrial
name: Starmie

text: It is rarely seen in the wild since it requires a rare Evolution stone to evolve, but it can be found in the deepest parts of the ocean
name: Starmie

text: It feeds by absorbing tiny plankton into its body while swimming, and it is preyed on by Lumineon
name: Starmie

text: Mr
name: Mr. Mime

text: Mime is a bipedal, humanoid Pokémon
name: Mr. Mime

text: Blue growths resembling clown hair extend from the sides of its pale pink head, and there is a magenta circle on each cheek
name: Mr. Mime

text: Its jaw is curved inward, resembling the mouth of a wooden dummy
name: Mr. Mime

text: It has a round, white body with a magenta spot in the middle, light pink arms and legs that connect to its body via magenta spheres, and small white coverings over its knees
name: Mr. Mime

text: Its white hands resemble gloves with magenta pads on the tips of its white fingers and its dark blue feet curl upward at the tips
name: Mr. Mime

text: Galarian Mr
name: Mr. Mime

text: Mime are mostly blue and white
name: Mr. Mime

text: Much like other Mr
name: Mr. Mime

text: Mime they also have blue growths resembling clown hair, however, these also extend and cover its cheeks
name: Mr. Mime

text: They have wider-shaped eyes and a blue nose
name: Mr. Mime

text: They have suit-like bodies comprising a white top, blue shoulder spheres, blue bottom trousers, and a diamond-shaped crystal that resembles a tie
name: Mr. Mime
