text: Ditto's appearance is very plain
name: Ditto

text: It is a simple, pinkish-purple, amorphous blob, with two small dots as eyes and a long, curved mouth
name: Ditto

text: Shiny Ditto have a light-blueish appearance
name: Ditto

text: Ditto will transform into anything it sees, even inanimate objects
name: Ditto

text: When it sees an enemy, it will change its DNA code to match theirs
name: Ditto

text: It avoids being attacked while sleeping by changing its appearance to look like a rock
name: Ditto

text: While trying to transform into something from memory, it will get details wrong
name: Ditto

text: They will try to befriend other Pokémon by transforming into one of their kind
name: Ditto

text: However, they are hostile to each other
name: Ditto

text: Ditto is capable of transforming itself into anything perfectly
name: Ditto

text: However, it only knows one move, Transform, and when battling, it will transform into the opponent's Pokémon
name: Ditto

text: In the anime and the movies, it has been shown that it will keep its face if it transforms into a human, and when it transforms into a large Pokémon, it will be smaller
name: Ditto

text: Its transformation will fail if it is made to laugh
name: Ditto

text: Some Ditto are better at transforming than others
name: Ditto

text: They are hermaphroditic and can breed with any breedable Pokémon
name: Ditto

text: Ditto does not evolve
name: Ditto

text: In its natural state, Ditto is a light-purple or pink blob-like Pokémon with vestigial facial features
name: Ditto

text: The face consists of beady eyes and a simple mouth almost always pulled into a smile
name: Ditto

text: It is capable of transforming into an exact replica of any physical object or living creature, including its form and abilities
name: Ditto

text: Each Ditto has its own strengths and weaknesses when it comes to transforming being unable to remain transformed while laughing and getting details of its transformation wrong if based on memory being apparently universal
name: Ditto

text: The anime, TCG, and some spin-off games have shown that occasionally Ditto cannot change its face during transfomation a trait that has become synonymous with the species despite being incongruous with their depiction in core series games
name: Ditto

text: While its transformation ability allows it to get along with almost anything, it does not get along with its own kind, which it will quickly (and generally fruitlessly) attempt to transform into
name: Ditto

text: It transforms into a rock when sleeping to avoid attack
name: Ditto

text: Ditto is never far from civilization or people, and is the only Pokémon capable of using the Metal Powder and Quick Powder items
name: Ditto

text: Its variety of unusual and often entirely unique traits set it apart from every other Pokémon
name: Ditto

text: Eevee is a small, fox-like creature with brown fur
name: Eevee

text: Its muzzle is very catlike, with a small, black and triangular nose
name: Eevee

text: It has a fluffy, cream-colored ruff around its neck and a brown, bushy fox-like tail with a cream-colored tip
name: Eevee

text: Eevee has round, brown eyes, long rabbit-like ears, and pink paw pads on its feet
name: Eevee

text: Its paws are small with three toes and no visible claws
name: Eevee

text: A shiny Eevee has silver fur instead of brown, and its ruff and tail-tip are white instead of cream
name: Eevee

text: Eevee is said to have an irregularly-shaped genetic structure, enabling it to evolve into multiple Pokémon
name: Eevee

text: As Gigantamax Eevee, its body becomes larger
name: Eevee

text: Its ruff grows longer and fluffier with several triangular furs pointing straight up
name: Eevee

text: The right ear has three red clouds surrounding it in a circle
name: Eevee

text: As the fur becomes fluffier and more luxurious, any enemies caught in it will lose the will to fight due to being enamored by its presence
name: Eevee

text: Eevee's behavior also appears to be more playful and rambunctious when Gigantamaxing, desiring to play with its opponent and often unintentionally crushing them with its size
name: Eevee

text: As of Pokémon: Let's Go, Pikachu! and Let's Go, Eevee!, a male partner Eevee has a zigzag pattern at the tip of his tail, which was once for universal genders
name: Eevee

text: With a female partner Eevee, they now have a heart-shaped pattern at the tip of their tail
name: Eevee

text: These differences do not exist in non-partnered Eevees
name: Eevee

text: This was likely meant to correspond with Pikachu's gender differences
name: Eevee

text: In Pokémon Sword and Shield, these gender differences apply to all Eevee
name: Eevee

text: Eevee is a Pokémon found mainly in cities, although it is possible that they live anywhere because they evolve to suit their surroundings
name: Eevee

text: Eevee can mostly be found in Kanto but is also found in Johto, Sinnoh, Unova, Central Kalos, Alola and Galar
name: Eevee

text: Eevee are Pokémon with unstable genetic codes
name: Eevee

text: This gives them the ability to evolve into eight different evolutions triggered by the environment, time of day, friendship levels, or the usage of the evolutionary stones Water Stone, Thunderstone, Fire Stone, Leaf Stone (Generation VIII), and Ice Stone (Generation VIII)
name: Eevee

text: Partner Eevee is also capable to learning special moves: Bouncy Bubble, Buzzy Buzz, Sizzly Slide, Glitzy Glow, Baddy Bad, Sappy Seed, Freezy Frost, Sparkly Swirl, and the Partner Power, Veevee Volley
name: Eevee

text: Eevee is one of the few Pokémon in Sun and Moon which have a special Z-Move dedicated to them
name: Eevee

text: The Z-Move Extreme Evoboost is Eevee's signature move
name: Eevee

text: The move is activated by the Z-Crystal, Eevium Z
name: Eevee

text: Its base is Last Resort
name: Eevee

text: Extreme Evoboost can be learned only by an Eevee with Last Resort, and becomes unusable if Last Resort is forgotten or if the Eevee evolves into one of its evolution
name: Eevee

text: Eevee is one of the few Pokémon in Sword and Shield that can Gigantamax by having a special member from its species
name: Eevee

text: Gigantamax Eevee is the only known Pokémon capable of using the G-Max Move, G-Max Cuddle
name: Eevee

text: Eevee can evolve into one of eight different forms with different types
name: Eevee

text: Sylveon by knowing a Fairy-type move, while leveling up and playing with Eevee through Pokémon-Amie (Gen VI) or Pokémon Refresh (Gen VII) and earning at least two affection hearts
name: Eevee

text: Eevee is a small, mammalian, quadrupedal Pokémon with primarily brown fur
name: Eevee

text: The tip of its bushy tail and its large furry collar are cream-colored
name: Eevee

text: It has short, slender legs with three small toes and a pink paw pad on each foot
name: Eevee

text: Eevee has brown eyes, long pointed ears with dark brown interiors, and a small black nose
name: Eevee

text: In Pokémon: Let's Go, Eevee!, the player starts with a special Eevee known as the partner Eevee
name: Eevee

text: The partner Eevee has purple eyes and a lighter shade of fur
name: Eevee

text: These design elements were likely taken from the anime, which implemented similar traits starting in Pokémon the Series: Ruby and Sapphire
name: Eevee

text: The partner Eevee has higher base stats and access to moves that normal Eevee do not
name: Eevee

text: The marking on the tip of a female partner Eevee's tail is flower-shaped
name: Eevee

text: Before Pokémon Sword and Shield, this trait was unique and wasn't found on other female Eevee
name: Eevee

text: In Pokémon Sword and Shield and later Pokémon GO updates, the unique tail pattern is present on all female Eevee as a true gender difference
name: Eevee

text: Eevee is rarely found in the wild and is mostly only found in cities and towns
name: Eevee

text: However, it is said to have an irregularly shaped genetic structure that is easily influenced by its environment
name: Eevee

text: This allows it to adapt to a variety of habitats by evolving
name: Eevee

text: Eevee can potentially evolve into eight different evolutions
name: Eevee

text: Eevee can also adapt the face of the Trainer that owns it
name: Eevee

text: Eevee's genes are believed to have the key to solving the mysteries of Pokémon evolution
name: Eevee

text: As Gigantamax Eevee, it has become larger and more fluffy
name: Eevee

text: The fur collar becomes longer with several triangular furs pointing straight up
name: Eevee

text: The right ear has three red clouds circling it
name: Eevee

text: Due to the fur becoming fluffier and more luxurious, any enemies caught in it will become enamored and lose the will to fight
name: Eevee

text: Eevee becomes even more playful and rambunctious after Gigantamaxing, desiring to play with its opponent and often unintentionally crushing them with its size
name: Eevee

text: Eevee is the only known Pokémon capable of using the Z-Move Extreme Evoboost
name: Eevee

text: The partner Eevee is the only known Pokémon capable of learning the moves Bouncy Bubble, Buzzy Buzz, Sizzly Slide, Glitzy Glow, Baddy Bad, Sappy Seed, Freezy Frost, and Sparkly Swirl, as well as the partner power Veevee Volley
name: Eevee

text: Gigantamax Eevee is the only known Pokémon capable of using the G-Max Move G-Max Cuddle
name: Eevee

text: Vaporeon shares physical traits with aquatic animals and land creatures in appearance
name: Vaporeon

text: Its body is light-blue with a white ruff around its neck
name: Vaporeon

text: Vaporeon has cream-yellowish ears-like fins made of webbing on both sides of its head along with a third on the top
name: Vaporeon

text: Vaporeon has blue ridges that run down the length of its spine and on to its tail-fin
name: Vaporeon

text: The tail resembles that of a dolphin or whale
name: Vaporeon

text: A shiny Vaporeon is mostly pink in color while its ridges turn dark purple
name: Vaporeon

text: Its ear-like fins and ruff stay the same
name: Vaporeon

text: Vaporeon's molecular structure is close to water, and its body glitters when sunlight hits at certain angles because of it
name: Vaporeon

text: It has a graceful, slender body shape, further adapting it to aquatic regions so it could swim faster
name: Vaporeon

text: Its face is feline in structure, with a short muzzle and a small, triangular nose
name: Vaporeon

text: Vaporeon is the result of an Eevee's exposure to the radiation of a Water Stone
name: Vaporeon

text: Vaporeon prefer clean freshwater lakes
name: Vaporeon

text: They have developed gills to become better suited to an aquatic lifestyle, and their cell composition's similarity to water allows them to melt into the water
name: Vaporeon

text: This ability enables Vaporeon to remain camouflaged while swimming and ambush their prey: fish Pokémon
name: Vaporeon

text: Vaporeon are highly adapted to aquatic life
name: Vaporeon

text: Unlike their pre-evolution, they have the ability to breathe underwater
name: Vaporeon

text: Vaporeon have the power to melt into water and disappear, and are shown to be able to manipulate water molecules
name: Vaporeon

text: They can detect moisture and water with their light-blue fins
name: Vaporeon

text: If their fins jitter around, this indicates rain is coming
name: Vaporeon

text: Vaporeon is one of Eevee's evolutions that is caused by being exposed to a Water Stone
name: Vaporeon

text: Vaporeon is a Pokémon that shares physical traits with both aquatic and land animals
name: Vaporeon

text: Vaporeon's body is light blue with a dark blue marking around its head and a spiky ridge down its spine
name: Vaporeon

text: It has black eyes and a tiny black nose
name: Vaporeon

text: There a white fin encircling its neck and three fins with cream-colored webbing on its head
name: Vaporeon

text: Two of these fins are on either side of its head, similar to ears and one is directly on top of its head, resembling a dorsal fin
name: Vaporeon

text: Vaporeon is a quadruped with three small toes on each foot and dark blue paw pads on the hind feet
name: Vaporeon

text: Its split tail fin has been mistaken for a mermaid's in the past, and is believed to be the origin of mermaid folklore
name: Vaporeon

text: It can detect moisture with its fins, which vibrate when sensing incoming rain
name: Vaporeon

text: Vaporeon is mostly found in urban settings under the ownership of a Trainer
name: Vaporeon

text: It is rarely seen in the wild, but it prefers clean freshwater lakes and shores
name: Vaporeon

text: It has developed gills to become better suited to an aquatic lifestyle, and its cell composition's similarity to water allows it to melt into the water
name: Vaporeon

text: This ability enables Vaporeon to remain camouflaged while swimming, hiding itself from enemies and allowing it to ambush its prey: fish Pokémon
name: Vaporeon

text: Jolteon is a quadruped mammalian Pokémon, covered in spiny bright yellow fur
name: Jolteon

text: It has long ears resembling a rabbit, deep purple almond-shaped eyes, and a blunt catlike muzzle with a small black triangular nose
name: Jolteon

text: It has a spiky white mane encircling its neck
name: Jolteon

text: Its legs and paws are slender, with three toes on each and no visible claws
name: Jolteon

text: Jolteon has a spiny fringe of fur covering its backside, and it has a small short spike-like tail that is not often visible (but seen in games such as Pokémon Stadium)
name: Jolteon

text: Its back legs seems to be powerfully-built, allowing it to run at high speeds like a cheetah
name: Jolteon

text: When shiny, Jolteon's yellow fur is green
name: Jolteon

text: The rest of its body remains normal
name: Jolteon

text: Jolteon are very sensitive and temperamental, which causes them to constantly charge as they quickly change moods
name: Jolteon

text: This means novice trainers will find it difficult to tame them, until said trainers have earned their trust
name: Jolteon

text: Jolteon are able to gather negative ions from the atmosphere, using the resulting electricity to create lightning bolts of up to 10,000 volts
name: Jolteon

text: Their individual cells also create small electrical charges on their own, which combine with the static electricity caused by their bodies can result in powerful electric-type attacks
name: Jolteon

text: They can also make lightning and cause small thunderstorms
name: Jolteon

text: When threatened or angered, their fur stands on their ends and becomes sharp bristles, and they will fire these electrified needles from their bodies
name: Jolteon

text: When they exhale, little sparks form in their mouths due to their electricity
name: Jolteon

text: Jolteon is one of the evolutions of Eevee that is caused by being exposed to a Thunderstone
name: Jolteon

text: Jolteon is a quadrupedal, mammalian Pokémon
name: Jolteon

text: It is covered in yellow fur with a spiky fringe around its tail and a white ruff around its neck
name: Jolteon

text: Its ears are large and pointed with black interiors, and its eyes and small nose are black
name: Jolteon

text: It has slender legs and small paws, each with three toes and a pink paw-pad
name: Jolteon

text: Jolteon creates electricity using an organ in its lungs, which causes crackling noises as it exhales
name: Jolteon

text: It can also generate low-level electricity in its cells, which is amplified by the negative ions it gathers and generates in its fur, allowing it to discharge 10,000-volt lightning bolts
name: Jolteon

text: Jolteon's prickly fur is made of electrically charged needles, which create a sparking noise as it moves
name: Jolteon

text: It is capable of launching its fur at enemies when agitated or startled the charge is so powerful that it can remain on the shed fur for a long time
name: Jolteon

text: This Pokémon is most often found in cities and towns under the ownership of Trainers
name: Jolteon

text: However, its high-strung nature and tendency toward mood swings can make it difficult to train
name: Jolteon

text: Flareon is a quadruped mammalian Pokémon
name: Flareon

text: It has vivid flame-orange fur with a bushy yellow mane, a wide, fluffy flame-shaped long tail, and a tuft of yellow fur atop its head, in a fireball shape
name: Flareon

text: It has a short catlike muzzle, wide black almond-shaped eyes, and a small black triangular nose
name: Flareon

text: Its ears are long and rabbit-like, with flare-like tips
name: Flareon

text: It has large, bulky paws with no visible claws
name: Flareon

text: Its body is generally bulkier than most of the Eeveelutions
name: Flareon

text: Of all the Eeveelutions, Flareon resembles Eevee the most
name: Flareon

text: When shiny, Flareon's orange fur turns a much lighter orange
name: Flareon

text: Flareon is a shy Pokémon, as seen in Eevee and Friends
name: Flareon

text: It is very emotionally sensible and when it is nervous, it releases large amounts of heat through its fur
name: Flareon

text: Flareon can be very nervous when meeting new people
name: Flareon

text: It has a sweet and warm-hearted personality
name: Flareon

text: Usually Flareon doesn't like being the center of attention
name: Flareon

text: Flareon is also an altruistic and loyal being, as it would give its life just for its trainer
name: Flareon

text: Although Flareon has a warm-hearted and submissive personality, if it gets angry for an important reason, it can be real hot-head and explosive
name: Flareon

text: It has a flame sack in its body
name: Flareon

text: Its body temperature can reach up to 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit (898
name: Flareon

text: 88 degrees Celsius) before battle
name: Flareon

text: The fire that is expelled from its mouth is even hotter, and can reach 3092 degrees Fahrenheit (1700 degrees Celsius)
name: Flareon

text: Flareon's yellow fur has an important function: to release heat so that it does not suffocate
name: Flareon

text: Flareon is one of the evolutions of Eevee that is caused by being exposed to a Fire Stone
name: Flareon

text: Flareon is a mammalian, quadrupedal Pokémon covered in short, reddish-orange fur
name: Flareon

text: It has long ears with black interiors, dark eyes, and a small black nose
name: Flareon

text: There are three small toes and a yellow paw pad on each foot
name: Flareon

text: Fluffy yellow fur forms a small tuft on its head, as well as its bushy tail and a mane around its chest and neck
name: Flareon

text: Flareon's body temperature is caused by its internal flame sac, and rises when it is excited
name: Flareon

text: If its body gets too hot, it will fluff out the fur on its collar to cool down
name: Flareon

text: Flareon stores and heats inhaled air in its flame sac, and then exhales it as fire with temperatures of around 3,100°F (1,700°C)
name: Flareon

text: Flareon's average body temperature is around 1,300-1,500°F (700-800°C), but it can reach 1,700°F (900°C)
name: Flareon

text: It is an omnivore that roasts either Berries or prey before consumption
name: Flareon

text: Flareon has a curious personality, and is mostly found in populated areas, rarely seen in the wilderness
name: Flareon

text: Porygon is a virtual Pokémon
name: Porygon

text: It is based on early 3D animation models, and is thus created completely out of polygons
name: Porygon

text: It looks a little like a duck or some kind of bird
name: Porygon

text: The various parts of Porygon's body are colored pink, white, and blue
name: Porygon

text: Its eyes are in the shape of hexagons
name: Porygon

text: Porygon is the first artificial Pokémon, created by the scientists at the Silph Co
name: Porygon

text: company
name: Porygon

text: Porygon is able to evolve into Porygon2, though only through Trade while holding the Upgrade, and then into Porygon-Z by trading while holding the Dubious Disc
name: Porygon

text: Porygon is an artificial Pokémon made completely out of programming code
name: Porygon

text: It has a pink, polyhedral head that ends in a blue beak and has hexagonal eyes, and it has a pink polyhedral body with a blue front, blue triangular prism feet, and a blue rectangular prism tail
name: Porygon

text: In 3D games, such as Pokémon Stadium, it can open its beak and can detach its limbs and head from its torso
name: Porygon

text: According to its Pokédex entries, it has copy protection built into its code, preventing duplication through electronic means
name: Porygon

text: It was created in 1995,1 at the Pokémon Lab on Cinnabar Island using the state-of-the-art technology of its time
name: Porygon

text: Because it was created decades ago, many of its parts have since become obsolete
name: Porygon

text: It was the first artificial Pokémon to have ever been created through computer programming
name: Porygon

text: Due to its man-made origins, Porygon does not need to breathe or eat, though it can still accept food if given
name: Porygon

text: It has the ability to convert its body into digital data, allowing it to travel through cyberspace
name: Porygon

text: Recently, it has become more helpful inside cyberspace by searching for any suspicious data that exists
name: Porygon

text: Some believed Porygon has the power to potentially travel in space despite the species not displaying that ability yet
name: Porygon

text: Because it is man-made, it is generally found in computers or in labs and other buildings where people work
name: Porygon

text: Porygon and its evolved forms are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the moves Conversion and Conversion 2
name: Porygon

text: Prior to Generation V, Sharpen was also one of its signature moves
name: Porygon

text: It can use Conversion to change its appearance to mimic another Pokémon's, and has also demonstrated the ability to change color for camouflage
name: Porygon

text: Omanyte is a nautilus-like Pokémon that died out millions of years ago
name: Omanyte

text: Omanyte's sturdy shell protects it from enemy attacks
name: Omanyte

text: It has many tentacles, which it used to crawl along the muddy seafloor
name: Omanyte

text: It has two large eyes that just stick out under its curvy shell
name: Omanyte

text: Omanyte has the abilities Swift Swim and Shell Armor
name: Omanyte

text: Swift Swim allows Omanyte's speed to increase when in the rain while Shell Armor protects Omanyte against Critical Hits
name: Omanyte

text: Omanyte evolves into Omastar at level 40
name: Omanyte

text: Omanyte is a small extinct cephalopod mollusk Pokémon similar to an ammonite or nautilus
name: Omanyte

text: It has a sky blue body with ten tentacles and a pale yellow, helix-spiraled shell on its back
name: Omanyte

text: The shell's rim has two circular indents where Omanyte's large saucer-like eyes protrude
name: Omanyte

text: If attacked or threatened, it quickly withdraws into its hard shell
name: Omanyte

text: Omanyte is considered extinct, although it can be revived from Fossils
name: Omanyte

text: Its fossils have been excavated in areas that were once oceans long ago
name: Omanyte

text: Omanyte regulated its buoyancy by storing and releasing air within its shell and controlled direction by twisting its tentacles
name: Omanyte

text: While Omanyte fed on plankton, it was preyed on by Archeops and Carracosta
name: Omanyte

text: Omantye can now be found in the wild due to being released by people or escaping after being restored to life, causing this species to become a problem
name: Omanyte

text: Omastar looks a lot like an ammonite, a prehistoric cephalopod
name: Omastar

text: Omastar has a spiked spiral shell, which is heavy enough that it is hard for Omastar to swim
name: Omastar

text: It has eight blue tentacles all over its body
name: Omastar

text: Omastar also has a mouth that has two pairs of mandibles
name: Omastar

text: It has yellow eyes with a slight black split pupil
name: Omastar

text: Its face resembles that of a seastar, except for that the top of the star is cut off by the spiral shell
name: Omastar

text: Omastar can regulate the pressure within their shells to sink and rise to varying depths
name: Omastar

text: However, they generally only use this to travel from shallow reefs to deep sea floors, and vice versa they conserve energy by walking rather than swimming when hunting
name: Omastar

text: Unlike their pre-evolutions, however, Omastar are hunters, capturing prey such as the prehistoric ancestors of modern-day Shellder
name: Omastar

text: Once they latch onto their prey with their tentacles, they will never let go unless their arms are severed off
name: Omastar

text: They can regenerate their tentacles over the course of a few weeks
name: Omastar

text: Omastar crack open shells using ​their beak-like mouths, sucking out the innards of their prey
name: Omastar

text: Omastar can also launch the spikes on their shells at foes
name: Omastar

text: However, it can take weeks for these spikes to grow back, leaving vulnerable holes in the meantime
name: Omastar

text: It is believed that cooling oceans were the reason that Omastar became extinct Their prey began moving to warmer equatorial waters, but their own heavy shells prevented them from keeping up with their food supply
name: Omastar

text: Omastar is the evolved form of Omanyte as of level 40
name: Omastar

text: Omastar is a cephalopod mollusk Pokémon similar to an ammonite or nautilus
name: Omastar

text: Its sky blue body has several tentacles the tentacles toward the front are shorter and thicker than those in the back
name: Omastar

text: There is a pale yellow, helix spiraled shell on its back
name: Omastar

text: Several sharp spikes line the shell's midsection from the front to about halfway down its back
name: Omastar

text: The shell's rim has two circular indents where Omastar's eyes are visible
name: Omastar

text: Its eyes have yellow sclerae and vertically-slit pupils
name: Omastar

text: It has an oval mouth with a four-sectioned, fang-like beak
name: Omastar

text: It is believed that Omastar's extinction was a consequence of the increasingly heavy weight of its shell that affected its mobility, including its hunting
name: Omastar

text: Omastar swam the seas in search of prey, including prehistoric Shellder
name: Omastar

text: It attacks only when prey comes near its tentacles
name: Omastar

text: Omastar uses its tentacles to ensnare its prey before biting down with the deadly force of its beak
name: Omastar

text: Its fangs are powerful enough to crush through rocks
name: Omastar

text: With the shell broken, it would suck out the contents
name: Omastar

text: Omastar was in turn preyed upon by Carracosta
name: Omastar

text: Omastar is thought to be a distant ancestor to Octillery
name: Omastar

text: Kabuto is a flat Pokémon with a brown shell
name: Kabuto

text: It has two circular dents on its shell and its small, black eyes are visible from the top
name: Kabuto

text: Its underside is black with two red spots, which are its secondary eyes
name: Kabuto

text: It has four yellow, pointed legs
name: Kabuto

text: While concealed, Kabuto leaves exposed only its hard shell, which protects it from predators, while the small, black eyes on its back allow it to continue monitoring its surroundings
name: Kabuto

text: If it is flipped upside-down, it becomes helpless and defenseless as it is unable to flip over on its own
name: Kabuto

text: Kabuto evolves into Kabutops at level 40
name: Kabuto

text: Kabuto is a small arthropod Pokémon resembling a horseshoe crab
name: Kabuto

text: It is mostly flat with a protective, brown shell covering its body
name: Kabuto

text: There are two small, black eyes on top of its shell, which it uses for sight when it hides on the ocean floor
name: Kabuto

text: Underneath the shell is a black space that hides the structure of its main body
name: Kabuto

text: Only its four short, yellow legs and a second pair of luminescent red eyes are visible on its underside
name: Kabuto

text: In its original time, Kabuto was prominently found on beaches, likely aided by its fast and powerful swimming ability
name: Kabuto

text: While it is commonly believed to be extinct, isolated populations of Kabuto have been unchanged for 300 million years
name: Kabuto

text: Kabutops is a large, bipedal Pokémon
name: Kabutops

text: There are six hard spikes going down from the back of its neck, three on each side that lead down towards the beginning of its tail
name: Kabutops

text: Two long, sharp claws (or sickles) extend from Kabutops's exoskeleton and several plates close the opening that used to be there
name: Kabutops

text: Its head is covered in a rock-hard, semicircular-shaped armor
name: Kabutops

text: A tail protrudes from its back, bearing the same color as approximately seventy-five percent of its body
name: Kabutops

text: Kabutops was a predator that hunted in the water
name: Kabutops

text: They slash prey with their sharp, sickle-like arms and drain their body fluids
name: Kabutops

text: Their discarded husks become food for scavengers
name: Kabutops

text: Kabutops can also leave the water and walk on land for extended periods of time, up to 12 hours in humid environments
name: Kabutops

text: This allowed them to thrive as apex predators for a long time, as they could hunt both aquatic and terrestrial prey
name: Kabutops

text: However, their lungs are still not developed enough to allow them to stray far away from the water
name: Kabutops

text: Kabutops adapted the ability to walk on land
name: Kabutops

text: Upon evolution, Kabuto's four insect-like legs have vanished and two long feet stand in their place
name: Kabutops

text: Kabutops is the evolved form of Kabuto, as of level 40
name: Kabutops

text: Kabutops is a bipedal prehistoric arthropod Pokémon with a skeletal build
name: Kabutops

text: It has a flat, half-circular head with a point on each side and two small eyes on the front
name: Kabutops

text: It is mostly brown, except for its light gray chest and abdomen
name: Kabutops

text: There is a ridge down its back with three flat spines on either side and it has a flat, pointed tail
name: Kabutops

text: Instead of hands, its forearms have large, sharp, gray scythes
name: Kabutops

text: Its thin legs are brown lead to small feet with two large gray claws
name: Kabutops

text: Before it went extinct, Kabutops was in the process of evolving into a land dweller as evident by changes in its gills and legs
name: Kabutops

text: This change is thought to be due to its prey moving onto land as well
name: Kabutops

text: In its ocean home Kabutops could tuck up its limbs to help it swim extremely fast, up to roughly 29 knots
name: Kabutops

text: It used its sharp scythes to slice enemies and drink their internal fluids
name: Kabutops

text: Any leftovers left behind by Kabutops are consumed by other Pokémon
name: Kabutops

text: It is unknown what led to Kabutops's extinction
name: Kabutops

text: Aerodactyl is a pterosaur-like Pokémon
name: Aerodactyl

text: It has an arrowhead-shaped point at the tip of its tail, a cone-shaped spike on its back, purplish-gray skin, and a lower jaw full of sharp teeth
name: Aerodactyl

text: When it Mega Evolves, it gains black stone spike-like protrusions on it body five on each wing, five on its head, one one its back, and three on its tail
name: Aerodactyl

text: It also has smoother black protrusions one on its forehead and three on its chest
name: Aerodactyl

text: Aerodactyl has a vicious temperament and flies without fear through the sky
name: Aerodactyl

text: It is said that Aerodactyl ruled the skies in its ancient world
name: Aerodactyl

text: When incensed, it can use its extremely sharp and serrated saw blade-like teeth to attack
name: Aerodactyl

text: When Aerodactyl hunt, they aim for the throats of prey
name: Aerodactyl

text: They attack from above, tearing out the necks of victims with their teeth
name: Aerodactyl

text: Some research has shown that they may be loosely linked to modern-day Dragon-types
name: Aerodactyl

text: Though superb fliers, they were actually quite slow and clumsy on land
name: Aerodactyl

text: Surprisingly, Aerodactyl are omnivores, eating various fruits and Berries in addition to meat
name: Aerodactyl

text: They seem to especially enjoy Pamtre Berries, perhaps because these Berries are closely related to an ancient fruit they consumed long ago
name: Aerodactyl

text: Aerodactyl also love Aspear Berries, though no studies have linked them to any fruits from when Aerodactyl were alive
name: Aerodactyl

text: Aerodactyl is a reptilian, bipedal prehistoric Pokémon that resembles a pterosaur with several draconic features
name: Aerodactyl

text: It has small sharply pointed ears, narrow dark green eyes, a ridged snout, a gaping mouth, and a strong lower jaw full of serrated fangs
name: Aerodactyl

text: Its body is covered in light blue-gray skin and it has large, violet membranous wings
name: Aerodactyl

text: The clawed hands at the end of each wing allow it to grasp objects
name: Aerodactyl

text: There is a hump-like ridge with a spike on its back, and it has a strong tail with an arrow-shaped tip
name: Aerodactyl

text: Its talon-like feet have two toes in front and one in the back, and are capable of scooping up and tightly clutching its prey in flight
name: Aerodactyl

text: Aerodactyl's serrated saw-like fangs and ferocious attitude were very imposing in its time
name: Aerodactyl

text: Its fangs can rip out throats and tear through the skin of any Pokémon to pieces, even Steel-type Pokémon
name: Aerodactyl

text: By spreading its wings, Aerodactyl is believed to have flown by gliding through the skies, freely letting out its high-pitched cries
name: Aerodactyl

text: However, it is slow to walk on land
name: Aerodactyl

text: It liked to nest in the mountains, where it enjoyed both safety and seclusion
name: Aerodactyl

text: Aerodactyl lived in prehistoric times, and was theorized to become extinct thanks to a giant meteor impact
name: Aerodactyl

text: It was restored in modern times using genetic material extracted from amber some casualties occurred during these attempts
name: Aerodactyl

text: Even still, this restoration is not considered perfect
name: Aerodactyl

text: The power of Mega Evolution allows some of Aerodactyl's dormant genes to reawaken
name: Aerodactyl

text: As Mega Aerodactyl, its eyes turn bright green and parts of its body turn to stone, which some researchers believe to be its original appearance before fossilization
name: Aerodactyl

text: It grows larger and sprouts jagged black spiky rocks all over its body: five spikes at the wrist joint of each wing replacing its hands, three small spikes along its tail, one spike on each ear, and a long spike on its chin
name: Aerodactyl

text: The spike on its back and its rear talons have also become black and stony
name: Aerodactyl

text: Rocky plates cover its eyebrows and the corners of its jaw
name: Aerodactyl

text: Similar stone ornaments are present on its chest on its torso: two small ridges flanking a longer ridge
name: Aerodactyl

text: The rocks on Mega Aerodactyl's body are harder than diamond
name: Aerodactyl

text: Because of the burden of Mega Evolution, Mega Aerodactyl is fiercer and more irritable than before
name: Aerodactyl

text: As a result, Mega Aerodactyl attacks anything that moves
name: Aerodactyl

text: Snorlax is a very large and fat mammalian Pokémon that has grayish-blue fur and an apricot-color underbelly
name: Snorlax

text: Its eyes are always closed, making it look as if it is sleeping
name: Snorlax

text: It has two visible lower teeth that stick out of its mouth when closed
name: Snorlax

text: In its Gigantamax form, its belly forms a hill with plants and tree on top of it, causing Snorlax to lie on its back
name: Snorlax

text: Snorlax is known for its relaxed and somewhat-sluggish nature
name: Snorlax

text: It will sleep all day until it is hungry, when it will awake and forage for the 880 pounds (399 kilograms) of food it needs, afterwards falling back to sleep again
name: Snorlax

text: Because of its eating habits, it can interfere with human farming by destroying crops for food, but it is also believed to release a kind of energy to help new plants grow wherever it ate
name: Snorlax

text: In the wild, it will ignore most people and Pokémon while it is eating or sleeping, but tends to be very affectionate towards its Trainer after being caught
name: Snorlax

text: Waking up a sleeping Snorlax, however, will turn these normally docile Pokémon into aggressive attackers whether one is wild or domesticated
name: Snorlax

text: Snorlax is the evolved form of Munchlax by leveling it up at level 19 with high Happiness
name: Snorlax

text: Snorlax is a huge, bipedal, dark blue-green mammalian Pokémon with a cream-colored face, belly, and feet
name: Snorlax

text: Its body is composed of mostly its belly, as its limbs are comparatively small
name: Snorlax

text: Its head is large with small, pointed ears, and two pointed teeth protruding from its lower jaw
name: Snorlax

text: It has round feet, which both have three claws and a circular brown paw pad, and short arms with five claws on each hand
name: Snorlax

text: Snorlax's bulk makes it the heaviest Normal type
name: Snorlax

text: Snorlax is often found in mountains and forests
name: Snorlax

text: It wakes up only to eat, requiring 900lbs
name: Snorlax

text: (400kg) of food per day before returning to its slumber, although it can also eat while it is resting
name: Snorlax

text: It is not a picky eater, as its strong stomach allows it to eat even moldy food without feeling any ill effects
name: Snorlax

text: It can even handle thorny plants or Muk's poison
name: Snorlax

text: Snorlax is docile enough to let children and small Pokémon bounce on its large stomach
name: Snorlax

text: Despite its apparent laziness, however, Snorlax can exhibit tremendous power when prompted
name: Snorlax

text: Snorlax is known to appear without warning in villages and steal their food supplies, such as rice granaries, which has long been considered a disaster whenever it happens
name: Snorlax

text: As Gigantamax Snorlax, seeds and small pebbles that were tangled in its belly fur go through immense growth, causing patches of grass, bushes, rocks, and a large tree to sprout upon its belly
name: Snorlax

text: The tree has three red clouds circling it
name: Snorlax

text: Gigantamax Snorlax almost never moves even when in battle it only slightly lifts its body and attacks by flailing with its arms and legs
name: Snorlax

text: However, its attacks are very powerful — Gigantamax Snorlax is considered to be one of the strongest Dynamax Pokémon to have been discovered
name: Snorlax

text: Snorlax is the only known Pokémon capable of using the Z-Move Pulverizing Pancake
name: Snorlax

text: Gigantamax Snorlax is the only known Pokémon capable of using the G-Max Move G-Max Replenish
name: Snorlax

text: Articuno is a large bird with blue plumage resembling ice crystals
name: Articuno

text: Its coloring is darkest on its head crest and long, streaming tail
name: Articuno

text: Its body is colored sky blue while growing lighter on its front, and its chest is a lighter blue than its body
name: Articuno

text: Its most distinctive trait is its large wings, which are said to be made of ice
name: Articuno

text: Its eyes are a medium shade of red
name: Articuno

text: Galarian Articuno is a large bird with lavender plumage
name: Articuno

text: Its coloring is darkest on its head crest and long, streaming tail
name: Articuno

text: Its body is colored white, while growing lighter on its front, and its chest is a black
name: Articuno

text: Its most distinctive trait is its large wings with the edges having a border of white on the outer edge (which glow a light blue color any time it uses a move), on its forehead is a crest that consists of three, darker lavender rhombus-shaped feathers
name: Articuno

text: It has circular light blue eyes and black feathers surround both eyes, making it look like as if it wears a domino mask (which glow a light blue color any time it uses a move), a short lavender beak, and long, thin gray legs
name: Articuno

text: Each foot has three forward facing toes and one that faces backward
name: Articuno

text: On its chest is a mass of black downy feathers
name: Articuno

text: Each foot has three forward facing lavender toes and one that faces backward
name: Articuno

text: Its long, streamer-like tail is longer than its body and the same shade of lavender as its crest
name: Articuno

text: In terms of physical strength, Articuno is the strongest out of the three Legendary Birds as shown in the anime, Articuno is able to lift one of Team Rocket's mechas with its talons
name: Articuno

text: Galarian Articuno is a migratory Pokémon that appears in the Crown Tundra every several decades
name: Articuno

text: For a long time, it was thought to be the same Legendary Pokémon as the Articuno previously discovered in other regions
name: Articuno

text: Though cold and callous in personality, it moves in a highly refined manner
name: Articuno

text: Instead of flapping its wings, it keeps itself airborne through constant use of its psychic powers
name: Articuno

text: When Articuno flaps its wings, the air turns chilly
name: Articuno

text: Galarian Articuno battles using intense psychic powers that act directly on the cells of living beings
name: Articuno

text: The beams of psychic energy fired from its eyes have a particularly potent effect: the slightest touch of these beams leaves the victim totally immobilized as if they are frozen
name: Articuno

text: Articuno then finishes off the immobilized opponents using the condensed psychic power of its wings
name: Articuno

text: Articuno is a large avian Pokémon with predominantly sky blue plumage and wings said to be made of ice
name: Articuno

text: On its forehead is a crest that consists of three, darker blue rhombus-shaped feathers
name: Articuno

text: It has circular red eyes, a short gray beak, and long, thin gray legs
name: Articuno

text: Each foot has three forward-facing toes and one that faces backward
name: Articuno

text: On its chest is a mass of pale blue, downy feathers
name: Articuno

text: Its long, streamer-like tail is longer than its body and the same shade of blue as its crest
name: Articuno

text: Articuno has the power to control ice at will
name: Articuno

text: When Articuno flaps its wings, it can chill the moisture in the air around it, making snow fall
name: Articuno

text: It flies from icy mountain to icy mountain
name: Articuno

text: According to legend, it appears before doomed travelers lost in icy regions
name: Articuno

text: As seen in the anime, Articuno sometimes aids travelers and guides them to safety
name: Articuno

text: Articuno lives in cold, isolated locations such as snowy mountains filled with permafrost
name: Articuno

text: In Galar, Articuno has a distinct appearance
name: Articuno

text: Its main body has lavender coloration with a black marking covering its chest
name: Articuno

text: Its feet are black with lavender talons
name: Articuno

text: The three feathers of its crest, which are longer, fused, and folded to the back, have the same purple color as its beak and tail
name: Articuno

text: Its eyes glow light blue, appear to be mostly closed, and are surrounded by a black, mask-like facial disc
name: Articuno

text: When Articuno utilizes its psychic power, the entire mask glows the same color as its eyes, as do the white, feather-like blades of condensed psychic power at the edges of its wings
name: Articuno

text: Galarian Articuno keeps itself airborne with its psychic power, almost never having to use its wings for this purpose
name: Articuno

text: Instead, the blades on its wings can be used to slice through iron as easily as paper
name: Articuno

text: Its eyes can fire beams of psychic energy that leave its opponents stuck in place, as if frozen solid — this is what earns this Pokémon the name of its Kantonian counterpart
name: Articuno

text: It also has the ability to create mirages of itself in order to fool its opponent and escape
name: Articuno

text: Its elegant and refined movements belie a cold and callous personality
name: Articuno

text: It can be found in the Crown Tundra once every few decades congregating at the Dyna Tree Hill
name: Articuno

text: Galarian Articuno is the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Freezing Glare
name: Articuno

text: Zapdos is an avian Pokémon with predominantly yellow plumage
name: Zapdos

text: Black rings encircle its eyes, and it has a long, thin, light orange beak
name: Zapdos

text: Its wings and tail are a mass of spiky feathers, with black feathers covering the back of its wings and inner tail feathers
name: Zapdos

text: A large crest of spiked feathers surrounds its head
name: Zapdos

text: Its thighs are a khaki color, and it has anisodactyl feet ending in talons
name: Zapdos

text: Galarian Zapdos is an avian Pokémon with predominantly orange plumage
name: Zapdos

text: It has long legs, strong “zygodactyl” feet (possessing two toes in front and two toes in back), and a large dark bill
name: Zapdos

text: Its wings and tail are a mass of spiky feathers, with black feathers covering the back of its wings and inner tail feathers
name: Zapdos

text: A large crest of spiked feathers surrounds its head, its thighs are a black color
name: Zapdos

text: When Zapdos flaps its glittering wings, it releases electricity that can potentially cause thunderstorms
name: Zapdos

text: It produces massive crackling and snapping sounds when it flies these are attributed to the lightning bolts it sheds when airborne
name: Zapdos

text: When stricken by lightning, it gains power
name: Zapdos

text: Zapdos reportedly appears only during thunderstorms, and is said to live among thunderclouds
name: Zapdos

text: However, it is rarely seen
name: Zapdos

text: Once every several decades, this migratory Pokémon appears in the Crown Tundra
name: Zapdos

text: For a long time, it was thought to be the same Legendary Pokémon as the Zapdos previously discovered in other regions
name: Zapdos

text: This belligerent, battle-hungry Pokémon seems unable to resist challenging Pokémon it senses may be stronger than itself
name: Zapdos

text: This Pokémon can control storms and lightning at its own will, which can subsequently change the weather drastically
name: Zapdos

text: This causes people to worship it as the God of Thunder
name: Zapdos

text: In battle, this Pokémon overwhelms opponents with speedy movements and ferocious kicks using its naturally mighty legs
name: Zapdos

text: When it leaps down cliffs and rocky mountainsides in ultra-high-speed zigzag movements, it is said to resemble a bolt of lightning
name: Zapdos

text: However, its wings seem to have atrophied, and it appears to be a poor flier
name: Zapdos

text: Zapdos is a large, avian Pokémon with predominantly yellow plumage
name: Zapdos

text: It has small, triangular eyes with black around them and a long, thin, light orange beak
name: Zapdos

text: Its wings and tail are a mass of spiky feathers and there are black feathers covering the back of its wings and inner tail feathers
name: Zapdos

text: A large crest of spiked feathers surrounds its head
name: Zapdos

text: Its thighs are tan, and it has thin, light orange legs
name: Zapdos

text: It has feet with three forward-facing toes and one backward-facing toe each toe has a short talon
name: Zapdos

text: Galarian Zapdos about to deliver a powerful kick
name: Zapdos

text: When Zapdos flaps its glittering wings, it releases electricity that can potentially cause thunderstorms
name: Zapdos

text: It produces massive crackling and snapping sounds when it flies these are attributed to the lightning bolts it sheds when airborne
name: Zapdos

text: Zapdos reportedly appears only during thunderstorms and gains power when struck by lightning
name: Zapdos

text: It is said to live among thunderclouds, but it is rarely seen
name: Zapdos

text: In Galar, Zapdos has a different appearance
name: Zapdos

text: Its body is red-orange with black plumage
name: Zapdos

text: Its head features yellow eyes with more pronounced, mask-like black coloration around them, a shorter black beak, and a longer, more visible neck
name: Zapdos

text: Its legs are black, longer, and more muscular, its thigh feathers are also black, and its talons are yellow with red rings at their bases
name: Zapdos

text: Its red-orange wings are smaller, with small black markings that appear to be remnants of its Kantonian counterpart's black plumage
name: Zapdos

text: Finally, it has a row of spiky feathers along its chest, and a similar row of black feathers on its back
name: Zapdos

text: Belligerent by nature and ever thirsting for battle, Galarian Zapdos seeks out opponents stronger than itself so it could test its might
name: Zapdos

text: Its powerful legs allow it to perform devastating kicks capable of destroying a dump truck, and it can run across mountains at up to 180mph (300km/h)
name: Zapdos

text: Its wings have atrophied to the point that it can barely fly, but its movements are so swift that they have been compared to a lightning strike
name: Zapdos

text: This Pokémon earned the name of its Kantonian counterpart due to the electric-like crackling sounds that come from its feathers rubbing together
name: Zapdos

text: It is migratory and appears in the Crown Tundra once every few decades at Dyna Tree Hill
name: Zapdos

text: Galarian Zapdos is the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Thunderous Kick
name: Zapdos

text: Moltres is a large, avian Pokémon with golden plumage similar to that of the Phoenix

text: It has a long, flowing head crest and a billowing tail, both made of reddish-orange and yellow flames
name: Moltres

text: Additionally, its wings are also shrouded in fiery plumage
name: Moltres

text: It has a long, thin neck, a pointed, brown beak, and small, triangular eyes
name: Moltres

text: Its thin, brown legs have feet that have three forward facing toes and one backward facing toe
name: Moltres

text: It has short talons
name: Moltres

text: Galarian Moltres is a large, avian Pokémon with red and black plumage
name: Moltres

text: It has a long, flowing head crest and a billowing tail, both made of reddish-pink and yellow flames
name: Moltres

text: Additionally, its wings are also shrouded in fiery plumage
name: Moltres

text: It has a long, thin neck, a short, red beak, and small, blue triangular eyes
name: Moltres

text: Its thin, red legs have feet that have three forward facing toes and one backward facing toe
name: Moltres

text: It has short talons
name: Moltres

text: Moltres sheds embers with every flap of its wings, creating a brilliant flash of flames
name: Moltres

text: By dipping itself into the magma of an active volcano, this Pokémon can heal itself
name: Moltres

text: It migrates to the south with the coming of spring and is said to bring an early springtime to cold lands
name: Moltres

text: However, it is rarely seen in normal occasions
name: Moltres

text: Once every several decades, this migratory Pokémon appears in the Crown Tundra
name: Moltres

text: For a long time, it was thought to be the same Legendary Pokémon as the Moltres previously discovered in other regions
name: Moltres

text: It has a haughty personality and conducts itself calmly, according to its own whims
name: Moltres

text: It exudes the energy churning within its body as an aura akin to a column of raging fire, leaving ordinary Pokémon unable to even approach it
name: Moltres

text: It is especially skilled at attacking opponents' minds by spreading its wings wide and unleashing a wicked aura
name: Moltres

text: Opponents hit by such attacks are overcome with deep fatigue, as if all their energy has been burned away
name: Moltres

text: It can control fire at its own will
name: Moltres

text: It can spread its wicked powers to surround its territory so that enemies won't be able to approach it and cause them to experience excruciating fatigue
name: Moltres

text: Moltres is usually found near volcanoes or fiery highlands
name: Moltres

text: Moltres is a large, avian Pokémon with golden plumage
name: Moltres

text: It has a long, flowing head crest and a billowing tail, both made of reddish-orange and yellow flames
name: Moltres

text: Additionally, its wings are also shrouded in fiery plumage
name: Moltres

text: It has a long, thin neck, a pointed, brown beak, and small, triangular eyes
name: Moltres

text: Its thin, brown legs have feet that have three forward-facing toes and one backward-facing toe
name: Moltres

text: It has short talons
name: Moltres

text: Moltres sheds embers with every flap of its wings, creating a brilliant flash of flames
name: Moltres

text: By dipping itself into the magma of an active volcano, this Pokémon can heal itself
name: Moltres

text: It migrates from the south with the coming of spring, and is said to bring an early springtime to cold lands
name: Moltres

text: There have been stories of Moltres using its wings to assist those lost in the mountains
name: Moltres

text: Moltres is rarely seen
name: Moltres

text: In Generation II, Sky Attack was its signature move
name: Moltres

text: In Galar, Moltres has a similar build, but a drastically different color scheme
name: Moltres

text: Its body is primarily black with scarlet highlights and bright blue eyes
name: Moltres

text: Its scarlet beak is hooked at the tip and leads to markings that run down its front and behind its head
name: Moltres

text: Its feet are also scarlet with black talons
name: Moltres

text: Its wings, crest, and tail are mostly black, with the crest having an extra curl at the front and the tail being split in two, and all three of these features exude a magenta, flame-like energy that earns it the name of its Kantonian counterpart
name: Moltres

text: Its body apparently feels lukewarm to the touch
name: Moltres

text: The sinister energy that blazes from within its body is so oppressive that most Pokémon can't even approach it
name: Moltres

text: Galarian Moltres attacks by spreading its wings wide to unleash its energy in a powerful aura that attacks the minds of its foes, inflicting deep fatigue as it burns away their energy from within
name: Moltres

text: The aura has the power to consume the spirit of its victims, reducing them to burned-out shadows of themselves
name: Moltres

text: It is said to have a haughty personality and a calm demeanor

text: It appears in the Crown Tundra once every few decades to reach Dyna Tree Hill

text: It has a white, circular, gem-like object on its forehead, and its eyes are light purple
name: Dratini

text: It has two developing wings at the sides of its head, which grow to be enormous as it evolves
name: Dratini

text: It has a white belly, and is light blue the rest of the way
name: Dratini

text: Dratini looks like some sort of snake or sea monster
name: Dratini

text: Dratini are born large, and as they shed their skin, they grow larger
name: Dratini

text: They have a massive amount of energy rapidly increasing inside of their bodies, hence, they have great strength, which grows exponentially as they evolve
name: Dratini

text: The Shiny Pokémon version of Dratini has lavender-pink-colored skin on its upper body as opposed to light blue skin
name: Dratini

text: Dratini dwell at the bottoms of deep lakes, where they are difficult to find
name: Dratini

text: Young Dratini are rather large for newborns, with some having been reported be be as long as 6
name: Dratini

text: 5 feet (2 meters)
name: Dratini

text: As they age, they grow even larger, shedding their skins periodically (sometimes as often as every day)
name: Dratini

text: They are extremely vulnerable after shedding, so they will hide behind powerful waterfalls away from their colonies during these times
name: Dratini

text: Their bodies grow at an astounding rate, so they must shed often
name: Dratini

text: These skins were likely the source of myths regarding mysterious, lake-dwelling, serpentine creatures
name: Dratini

text: For a long time, people were convinced that the these skins were hoaxes
name: Dratini

text: It was not until scientists compared their DNA to that of actual Dratini was finally accepted that not only were the skins authentic, but that Dratini were real as well
name: Dratini

text: Today, shed Dratini skin are often treated to make luxury leather goods
name: Dratini

text: The small lumps on their heads, thought to be sources of good luck in some cultures, are actually immature horns
name: Dratini

text: When they shed their skins, their bodies give off a light blue aura
name: Dratini

text: Dratini evolves into Dragonair at level 30, who then evolves into Dragonite at level 55
name: Dratini

text: Dratini is a reptilian Pokémon with a blue serpentine body and a white underside
name: Dratini

text: It has white, three-pronged fins on the sides of its head and a white bump on its forehead, which is its horn growing
name: Dratini

text: Above its round, white snout are oval, purple eyes
name: Dratini

text: Dratini's life energy is constantly building so it is always growing, and can reach lengths of over six feet
name: Dratini

text: As it grows, it sheds its skin regularly and hides behind a rapid waterfall during the process
name: Dratini

text: The shed skin of Draitni can be used to create super luxury boots
name: Dratini

text: Dratini lives a quiet life underwater, eating any food that sinks down to the bottom
name: Dratini

text: Although this Pokémon was originally thought to be nothing more than a myth, a small colony has been found living underwater
name: Dratini

text: It was first discovered by a fisherman who spent 10 hours attempting to capture it
name: Dratini

text: It has been referred as the Mirage Pokémon
name: Dratini

text: In Generation II, Outrage was its signature move
name: Dratini

text: Dragonair's appearance are like sea serpents with long, sleek bodies
name: Dragonair

text: The upper part of their body is light blue while its underside is white
name: Dragonair

text: They have a small, white horn on the forehead and two wing-shaped protuberances on the sides of the head which are often said to be ears, but are in fact wings, as evidenced in the short film preceding Pokémon: The Movie 2000
name: Dragonair

text: They have a blue orb placed at the neck and another two near the tip of the tail
name: Dragonair

text: Along with Dratini, its mouth is rarely seen
name: Dragonair

text: The shiny Pokémon version of Dragonair has lavender-pink-colored skin on its upper body as opposed to light blue skin and its pearls are gold
name: Dragonair

text: Dragonair are wary Pokémon
name: Dragonair

text: They are quick to respond to perceived threats, and they tend to flee when they sense danger
name: Dragonair

text: Dragonair shed their skin periodically, but not as frequently as Dratini
name: Dragonair

text: These skins were at first mistaken for huge Dratini, and fetched hefty sums as collectors clamored over them
name: Dragonair

text: According to popular legend, seeing a Dragonair flying overhead at the start of a new year is a sign of good health for the rest of the year
name: Dragonair

text: Dragonair live in the bottoms of many lakes, but they usually never come to the surface
name: Dragonair

text: They can store an enormous amount of energy inside their bodies which seems to manifest itself in two distinct fashions
name: Dragonair

text: First, even though they lack large wings, Dragonair has been shown flying with and without the wings on the side of the head greatly enlarged
name: Dragonair

text: Dragonair can also discharge energy through the orbs to envelop itself in a gentle aura
name: Dragonair

text: This aura, which makes its body shine slightly and gives it a mystical appearance, and is said to enable the Dragonair to control the weather in the immediate area and change it in a matter of minutes
name: Dragonair

text: Dragonair evolves from Dratini at Level 30 and evolves into Dragonite at level 55
name: Dragonair

text: Dragonair is a long, serpentine reptilian Pokémon with sky blue scales and a white underside
name: Dragonair

text: It has a rounded snout, oval purple eyes, and a small, white horn on its forehead
name: Dragonair

text: On each side of its head is a small, stylized wing, which is white and curves into a swirl at the base
name: Dragonair

text: Three blue, crystal orbs adorn its body: one on its neck and two on its tail
name: Dragonair

text: Dragonair emits a gentle aura that gives it a mystical appearance
name: Dragonair

text: As seen in the anime, it can make its wings grow larger in order to fly, but otherwise moves through the air unaided
name: Dragonair

text: Dragonair hosts a large amount of energy within its body, which it can discharge through the crystals on its neck and tail
name: Dragonair

text: This causes its body to brighten and give off a different aura that changes the weather in its vicinity
name: Dragonair

text: As a result, Dragonair has been referred as a divine Pokémon since ancient times by agricultural people
name: Dragonair

text: Dragonair is a rare Pokémon that inhabits pristine seas and lakes
name: Dragonair

text: The lakes Dragonair lives in are usually filled with offerings from people in gratitude
name: Dragonair

text: It is said that a person who sees a Dragonair at the start of a year will be healthy for the whole year
name: Dragonair

text: In Generation II, Outrage was its signature move
name: Dragonair

text: Dragonite greatly differ from their sea serpent-like pre-evolved forms
name: Dragonite

text: Both Dratini and Dragonair had a blue coloring with no limbs or wings (excluding the wing-like ears of Dragonair)
name: Dragonite

text: Dragonite are large, orange, bipedal dragons with two turquoise wings on its back
name: Dragonite

text: Dragonite largely resembles a Charizard, as both have the same orange coloring, and the same blue underside of their wings, except for its lack of a flame on the end of their tails, and a somewhat rounder, and friendlier appearance
name: Dragonite

text: Shiny Dragonite's main color is green while the inside of its wings are purple
name: Dragonite

text: Dragonite resembles a proper looking European dragon, unlike its pre-evolved forms Dratini and Dragonair, which are more aligned towards Eastern ones
name: Dragonite

text: Most Dragonite are very friendly as well as selfless and will rescue anyone lost at sea
name: Dragonite

text: However, as shown in one episode, they will go on a rampage if their environment is harmed
name: Dragonite

text: They tend to battle Kingdra, their sworn rivals, in the wild
name: Dragonite

text: Dragonite are very swift and can circle the globe in just 16 hours
name: Dragonite

text: Dragonite are very rarely found near water bodies
name: Dragonite

text: Some claim that there is an island where only they live, which has only been seen only once
name: Dragonite

text: Dragonite evolves from Dragonair at level 55
name: Dragonite

text: It is the final form of Dratini
name: Dragonite

text: Dragonite is a draconic, bipedal reptilian Pokémon with light orange skin
name: Dragonite

text: It has large, grayish-green eyes and a round snout with small nostrils
name: Dragonite

text: A pair of long, thin antennae sprout from the top of its head with a small horn set between them
name: Dragonite

text: Its striated underbelly is cream-colored and extends from its neck to the tip of its long, tapering tail
name: Dragonite

text: It has thick arms and legs ending in three claws each
name: Dragonite

text: The leg joints are well defined, while its arms have a smooth, rounded appearance
name: Dragonite

text: Dragonite's wings are small relative to its body with teal wing membranes
name: Dragonite

text: Despite its bulky build, Dragonite is capable of flying faster than the speed of sound
name: Dragonite

text: It can circle the globe in sixteen hours, which would require traveling at a ground speed of roughly 1,556mph (2,505km/h) if done at the equator
name: Dragonite

text: A kindhearted Pokémon with human-like intelligence, Dragonite shows signs of altruism: it is said to save humans from drowning and lead lost or foundering ships to safety
name: Dragonite

text: As demonstrated in the anime, however, it will go on an uncontrollable, destructive rampage if its environment is threatened
name: Dragonite

text: Dragonite will usually calm down and be satisfied after smashing down anything that has angered it to smithereens
name: Dragonite

text: It is known to engage in fierce battles with Kingdra whenever they meet
name: Dragonite

text: Dragonite has been referred to as the sea guardian and the Sea Incarnate
name: Dragonite

text: Drayden has stated that Dragonite's power is capable of affecting the weather
name: Dragonite

text: There are many ships with figureheads decorated with Dragonite's look
name: Dragonite

text: Dragonite is very rare in the wild, typically living near the sea
name: Dragonite

text: Some claim that there is an island somewhere in the ocean that only Dragonite inhabit
name: Dragonite

text: In Generation II, Outrage was its signature move
name: Dragonite

text: Mewtwo is a bipedal feline-like Pokémon
name: Mewtwo

text: Its appearance is loosely based on Mew, with a more of a mutated humanoid look in addition to its feline traits
name: Mewtwo

text: Its body is purple and it has three fingers on each hand
name: Mewtwo

text: Mewtwo projects a faint purple aura when at full power
name: Mewtwo

text: Mewtwo has an Anime/Manga exclusive form named Armored Mewtwo in the anime, and M2 Bind in the Manga
name: Mewtwo

text: In the anime the form increases all of Mewtwo's Psychic abilities, and in the manga it allows Giovanni to control it
name: Mewtwo

text: Mewtwo also has another form exclusive to the Pocket Monsters manga, where it takes on the DNA of a Clefairy, becoming a shorter, fatter and much stronger version of itself
name: Mewtwo

text: Titling itself Mewthree, it started its quest of cooking the best bacon ever until Satoshi managed to calm it down with his bacon
name: Mewtwo

text: After going into a tantrum, screaming out This isn't even my final form!, Mewthree split back into Clefairy and Mewtwo
name: Mewtwo

text: Mewtwo is highly adept at utilizing its Psychic powers, displaying telekinesis and telepathy as well
name: Mewtwo

text: It utilizes its telepathy to communicate with humans and translate the Pokémon language
name: Mewtwo

text: It uses its telekinesis to fly, block special abilities, and expunge people's recollections as optically discerned in Mewtwo Strikes Back
name: Mewtwo

text: As evidence of its immense power, Mewtwo is by far one of the most domineering Pokémon in the series
name: Mewtwo

text: Its power is so great to the point where it can endure immense torture in Mewtwo Returns, and teleport a lake miles long underground
name: Mewtwo

text: Proven in the first Pokémon Movie, Mewtwo holds a large degree of pride in its personality
name: Mewtwo

text: In fact, its general nature is so complex that it borderlines that of human levels with itself capable of learning and evolving just to get the upper hand in battle
name: Mewtwo

text: Mewtwo is extremely arrogant, cold, and aggressive
name: Mewtwo

text: It is also anti social and does not speak or smile much, but it has been seen smirking
name: Mewtwo

text: Mewtwo cannot evolve
name: Mewtwo

text: However, it can Mega Evolve with the use of a Mewtwonite X or a Mewtwonite Y
name: Mewtwo

text: Mega Mewtwo X stretching its arm
name: Mewtwo

text: Mewtwo is an artificial Pokémon
name: Mewtwo

text: It is a bipedal, humanoid Pokémon with some feline features
name: Mewtwo

text: It is primarily gray with a long, purple tail
name: Mewtwo

text: On top of its head are two short, blunt horns, and it has purple eyes
name: Mewtwo

text: A tube extends from the back of its skull to the top of its spine, bypassing its neck
name: Mewtwo

text: It has a defined chest and shoulders, which resemble a breastplate
name: Mewtwo

text: The three digits on each hand and foot have spherical tips
name: Mewtwo

text: Its tail is thick at the base but thins before ending in a small bulb
name: Mewtwo

text: Mewtwo was created after years of horrific gene splicing and DNA engineering experiments based on Mew
name: Mewtwo

text: It is widely known as the most powerful Pokémon in existence and is said to have the most savage heart among all Pokémon, lacking compassion and striking fear into its enemy with cold, glowing eyes
name: Mewtwo

text: Because it was engineered to be the ultimate opponent in battle, it can only think of defeating its foes
name: Mewtwo

text: In the first movie, where it was shown to be capable of levitation, telepathy, mind control, and the ability to create powerful storms, Mewtwo exemplified these vicious characteristics
name: Mewtwo

text: However, it was later shown to be caring, protective, and even altruistic
name: Mewtwo

text: Another Mewtwo in the anime shared its aversion to contact with others but was much less belligerent
name: Mewtwo

text: Mewtwo conserves energy by remaining motionless in order to unleash its full power in battle
name: Mewtwo

text: Though rarely seen in the wild, it is said to be resting in a dark cave somewhere
name: Mewtwo

text: Mega Mewtwo X is larger and bulkier than its normal state
name: Mewtwo

text: The horns on its head are longer and extend from V-shaped ridges on its forehead
name: Mewtwo

text: Additionally, the horns are now pointed and curve upward
name: Mewtwo

text: It now has two tubes behind its neck, its eyes are light blue, and it has large, purple growths over its shoulders
name: Mewtwo

text: Its torso is smooth and small compared to its long, bulky limbs, and a Y-shaped line connects the collar and underbelly
name: Mewtwo

text: Its forearms and thighs each have two raised ridges and its digits are now longer and thinner
name: Mewtwo

text: Its tail is slightly shorter and stiffer than before and has a curled tip
name: Mewtwo

text: Its muscles are augmented with psychic power, giving it a grip strength of one ton and the ability to sprint 100 meters in two seconds
name: Mewtwo

text: When using moves in battle, it is shown to be able to stretch its arms and legs
name: Mewtwo

text: Mega Mewtwo Y is smaller and lighter, losing its long tail and the tube behind its neck
name: Mewtwo

text: However, it grows a long, purple appendage with a curled tip from the back of its head that is similar to its previous form's tail
name: Mewtwo

text: On its head, it has two pointed, backward-curving spikes and a half-ring structure connecting to the base of each and crossing over the top of its head
name: Mewtwo

text: Its eyes are now red and slightly larger
name: Mewtwo

text: The digits on its hands and feet are now purple and more bulbous and the middle toe is longer than the others
name: Mewtwo

text: A bumpy ridge similar to a sternum replaces the breastplate structure on its chest, but this form is still largely smoother than the other two
name: Mewtwo

text: Despite its decreased size, it has phenomenal mental power and is capable of smashing buildings with a mere thought
name: Mewtwo

text: Mewtwo is the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Psystrike
name: Mewtwo

text: According to the scientific logs found in the Pokémon Mansion of Cinnabar Island, Mewtwo was born from a pregnant Mew, found deep in the jungles of Guyana, whose embryo had been tampered with to alter its DNA
name: Mewtwo

text: It was held and studied in the mansion where a scientist performed horrific gene-splicing experiments that made it vicious and extremely powerful
name: Mewtwo

text: It eventually broke free of the Mansion, destroying it in the process, and fled
name: Mewtwo

text: It can be encountered in Cerulean Cave, accessible only after a Trainer has proven their skill at the Indigo Plateau
name: Mewtwo

text: Mew is a small, catlike Pokémon with small, pointed ears, blue eyes, a long, thin tail with a large bulge at the end, and large feet with three toes
name: Mew

text: It is covered with a layer of fine, pink hair, only visible with the aid of a microscope
name: Mew

text: It has extremely short arms with three fingers on each paw, and has small, orange paw pads on the undersides of its feet
name: Mew

text: Despite being one of the most powerful Pokemon in the world, Mew is very playful and childish
name: Mew

text: It can get along with pretty much anyone and will risk its life for its friends
name: Mew

text: However, Mew is very shy, and for good reasons
name: Mew

text: It is said that Mew's DNA possesses the genetic composition of every existing Pokémon species, thus allowing it to use all known Pokémon moves (and Pokémon's Exclusive Z-Moves, excluding Ultra Necrozma's Z-Move)
name: Mew

text: Its possession of every Pokémon's DNA also allows it to de-evolve Pokémon, as shown in the TCG through its moves Devolution Beam and Devo Crush
name: Mew

text: Mew is a pink, bipedal Pokémon with mammalian features
name: Mew

text: It has a rounded, wide snout triangular ears and large, blue eyes
name: Mew

text: It has short arms with three-fingered paws and large hind paws with oval markings on the soles
name: Mew

text: Its tail is long and thin with an ovoid tip
name: Mew

text: Its fur is so fine and thin, it can only be seen under a microscope
name: Mew

text: Mew is said to have the DNA of every single Pokémon contained within its body, allowing Mew to learn and use any attack
name: Mew

text: As demonstrated by its behavior in the first and eighth Pokémon movies, it shows signs of intelligence, curiosity, shyness, playfulness, and even selflessness
name: Mew

text: Mew is incredibly adaptable, able to travel freely in the air or underwater
name: Mew

text: As seen in Pokémon Snap and the Super Smash Bros
name: Mew

text: series, it can create a green, yellow, or pink orb of energy around itself for protection, although only the pink orb is seen in the latter
name: Mew

text: According to the radio drama, The Birth of Mewtwo, Mew was discovered by Jessie's mother, Miyamoto, who registered its cry in Guayana Forest 20 years before the events of Generation I
name: Mew

text: It was worshiped for its protection by indigenous people who created a folk song in its honor and believed it appeared once a year with the rising sun
name: Mew

text: It wasn't rediscovered until 18 years after Miyamoto met Mew by sunrise on the peak of the highest mountain in a South American mountain range and fell
name: Mew

text: Reports found in Cinnabar Island's Pokémon Mansion note scientific expeditions that have sighted Mew in Guyana, South America, the place where it was first discovered
name: Mew

text: Since Mew can make itself invisible at will, very few people have knowingly seen it, leading some scientists to declare it extinct and most to assume it to be a mirage
name: Mew

text: It will only show itself to a person who is pure of heart and has a strong desire to see it for themselves
name: Mew

text: Mew is the only known Pokémon capable of using the Z-Move Genesis Supernova
name: Mew
